Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rita C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boston Park Plaza hotel for 5 days! We found the room to be awesome and clean! We had 2 bathrooms in our room which was great! We would for sure stay there again! All the staff was friendly and very helpful! There are plenty of resturants around a easy to walk where ever you would like to go!

Reviews.Title: “gr8 location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: blarneymike
Reviews.Content: stayed 5 nites wit my g/f on 16th mar-21st 2012,arrived @ 3 pm,our room was ready which was gr8,we were checked in in 2 mins,there is a bit of work going on in the lobby but you cant see it,u might hear a bit of hammering or wat ever but its not disruptive or anything,we had a "wonderful" room,this was a good size,plenty of room ,not cramped at all,bathroom was spotless and also a good size,there was a huge tv in the room ,didn't have it on much but nice to have it,the bed was comfortable with plenty of pillows,also on the wednesday our flight to ireland was not until 7pm ,so i asked would it be possible to check out later rather than the usual noon time,the receptionist was lovely and allowed us a 3pm check out at no extra cost,also the hotel stored our luggage until it was time to leave,i know everyone has their own experiences and expectations of hotels,but ours on this occasion was a a gr8 stay and all in a lovely location

Reviews.Title: “$13 for internet?”
Reviews.Author: Elseewi
Reviews.Content: Expensive and dumpy. Nearly $200 a night and the still charge $12.50 for Internet. Go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “There was a MOUSE in our room!! Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: LR2828
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE!  We had a MOUSE in our room! We stayed here St Patricks Day weekend and we discovered a mouse moving up and down from our air conditioning unit. Frantically I called the front desk and they moved us to another room. (alot smaller than our original room). We went downstairs to speak with a manager about this issue and the receptionist gave us 2 free breakfast passes and a manager did not even come out to speak with us. Very poor customer service and they weren't the least bit concerned about the mouse, which shows that there is a problem with them. Im sure they cleaned the room and put another guest in there shortly after. We did not use the breakfast passes because we were completely disgusted and were not going to eat at a place where we know there are mice. This is my first review and I want everyone to know how disgusting this place is. Please do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Patrick C
Reviews.Content: Definitely NOT what I expected, rooms are small and cramped, Bathroom was not cleaned very well as there was some gross hair balls on floor and scum/filth on tile floor in bathroom. If you want WiFi for business forget it! unless you want to pay $12.50 per day to use something that should be a freeâ€¦.itâ€™s NOT the money but the principle of cheapness! Staff was actually very courteous and nice at the Bost Park Plaza and beds were comfortable and plush. I checked out and went to Seaport Hotel and I am so happy I switched. They had Very, clean rooms, incredibly comfortable beds, free WiFi, awesome location, and great atmosphere. If you actually read this take my word for it and pass on Boston Park Plaza unless your a history buff and want to stay just so you can say you stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Looks great from the outside, but not so good on the inside”
Reviews.Author: FrenchNina
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Boston Park Plaza this past weekend and I was not impressed. The front desk person that greeted us at first was very nice however, later the next morning when we had a problem with our direct bill the woman that answered the front desk phone was very rude, confrontational, and aggressive. Where is the customer service??? The rooms are very old looking and bathrooms even worse. The air conditioning was not working but the windows were hard to open and the heat kept coming on...even after it had been turned off. One of the most uncomfortable exchanges happened when we went to get our van from valet. The valet attendant was not happy with the $3 tip and kept knocking on our van door asking if this was the correct amount we wanted to leave. He knocked and approached our driver's side window 3 TIMES! Not Cool! We have children and this was very unsettling! Overall, I would not recommend this hotel. I will stick to a Marriott or Hilton thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best thing about this place”
Reviews.Author: Marnie72
Reviews.Content: I want to start by saying Daymeyn in concierge was awesome!! He was the only shining star in our stay. Other than Daymeyn don't expect any decent customer service. We had lost luggage, and informed every staff member we could find, and insisted it be added onto our notes. When it still had not turned up the next day, we asked that they call us when it did, and get a receipt for insurance. The staff were certainly unable to do this, and didn't even know the luggage had arrived when we enquired upon our return at the end of the day. With all the insurance calls required, and follow up to airlines and delivery services, I was disgusted to discover this hotel has removed all their public phones. All the Manager Polita had to say is that we had phones in the rooms - at a cost of $2.00 for a free call!! Disgraceful. Not everyone has cells that work in the US, and are willing to pay such ridiculous prices for free calls. PS people the Radisson 2 blocks away is the closest payphone, which staff were unable to tell me. Apart from our luggage experience I can say: If you need nothing from the staff, or don't need a public phone, the rooms are adequate, the beds are so comfortable, the location is fantastic, and may be worth the money. On the bright side, as the hotel is so old (Historical landmark) it has its own generator, so we were unaffected during the Boston blackout. If I had not had a negaticve experience with the staff then I may have enjoyed this hotel more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: bluejack45
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights in this hotel. Rooms are a bit small for the price. Nicely kept though, and the bed was very comfortable. Very busy in the lobby, but I guess that goes with a large grand hotel of this type. Handy to some good shopping and restaurants, and close to parks and walk/jog trails along the river. WiFi $12.50 for 24 hours. Nice fitness center. Room service was excellent (one of the best I've come across) - I recommend the New England Clam Chowder! I liked the place. Next time in Boston, I'll might look for something cheaper if I have time, but otherwise I'll come back.

Reviews.Title: “Realistic Expectations from a Loyal Guest”
Reviews.Author: Parker O
Reviews.Content: I have never quite understood some of the negative comments on this page. I have stayed at the Boston Park Plaza several times in the last several years, as recently as February. I felt it would be useful to highlight a couple of things for those interested in traveling and hopefully having a similar experience to the one I had. -HOTEL- The hotel was built many years ago. It is clearly historic and maintains an old fashioned grandeur that cannot be matched in the city of Boston. That said, it is not a modern or retro hotel. It is not supposed to be a modern or retro hotel. The Park Plaza offers a classic feel for those who enjoy it. -ROOMS-This hotel has many guest rooms, so to over generalize and say "one room is small" or "one room is run down" is to make a presumption about 1,000 guest rooms, which is just silly.If you were to over generalize, it would be more than fair to say most rooms are very nice. Every room is different, from large with 2 bathrooms to petite with one bathroom. Some rooms have views and some do not. ALL ROOMS, so far as I have stayed (and I have stayed many, many times) are spotlessly clean, have all of the amenities you could ask for, flat screen televisions and good lighting. This is not a 100 room, coolie cutter botique hotel, it is a 1,000 room historic property; every room is unique, and to fault the hotel for this is simply unfair. -SERVICE- The service at the Park Plaza has always stood out to me., The staff is attentive, proud of the character of the hotel and willing to do anything needed to make the stay better. The few issues I have had while staying were taken care of quickly and with kindness and class. If your room is too small, they will change it as best they can. If your room lacks something you wanted or had hoped for, they will attempt to get it done. Doormen are friendly and overly willing to assist, concierge is an endless resource for city facts and bellman are timely and efficient with luggage. Housekeeping friendly, always smiling, and hard working. -LOCATION- The location CANNOT, I repeat CANNOT be beaten. Steps away from everything in Boston: The Public Gardens, Newbury St., Boylston St., Copley Plaza, Beacon Hill, the Theatre District, and more-all within WALKING DISTANCE. The hotel has something to the effect of 3 restaurants within the hotel and dozens more directly outside its doors on all sides. -INTERNET- At the risk of starting to sound defensive, come on people! 12.50 for wireless internet! EVERY HOTEL, from luxury to mid range to low range, charges for the internet, most of them far more pricey than this. Those posting the hotel needs to "get into the 21st century" are unfair- IN THE 21ST CENTURY, ALL HOTELS CHARGE FOR WIRELESS INTERNET. Those who want what is usually a very reasonable room rate should not attack the hotel for instituting a fee for in room internet usage. I will continue to stay at this hotel for the foreseeable future. The location, the overall quality of the rooms, the staff, and the reasonable rates have me sold and unable to agree with most of the other negative comments here on this page. The Boston Park Plaza Hotel is Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Would rather sleep in the subway”
Reviews.Author: Everhopeful78
Reviews.Content: My partner booked us into this hotel at the last minute. A shocking place staffed by liars. Shabby and in dire need of refurbishment. On my return home I found out that when my visa was swiped they helped themselves to over Â£500 of my money!! They told me Â£100 was a hold, and another hold of Â£228!! Was obviosly not told this and the remainder they wont admit to so they are blaming my bank!!! Also full of drunks banging about till all hours. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I go there every year in the winter”
Reviews.Author: annaorysia
Reviews.Content: Unless you are upgraded the rooms are a bit tiny. Do not go President's day holiday as the place is overun with a convention of College kids. They do not tell you this when you book the hotel. Then they try to give you a room on the same floor with hundreds of college kids. They will updrade you if you complain. If they upgrade you there is a private lounge with free breakfast, lunch snack and dinner snack in the private bar.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: jakekw1978
Reviews.Content: last summer i stayed 2 nights at Boston Park Plaza!great service,friendly staff,nice and clean rooms and convinient location!i would visit this place again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Historic Property”
Reviews.Author: ALynnT
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying this past weekend at the Boston Park Plaza Hotel. Having friends who have stayed here before, I knew that the rooms wouldn't be the most modern...having said that, if that is what you are looking for, don't stay here. If in fact you are looking for a historic grand hotel with tons of character and charm, then definitely give this hotel some consideration! The room was decent-sized and well-appointed. We upgraded to a room with a king bed (In the towers, I believe). There was a large flat-screen TV which was a nice surprise. As many other reviewers have mentioned, the bathroom was smaller than expected. Again, if you are looking for sleek and modern, then look elsewhere- if you are looking for classic, clean and well maintained, look no further. (I did however find myself wondering why there was a bottle opener built into the back of the bathroom door!) The bed was very comfortable, and we had a nice view with a window that opened to let in some fresh air. One small gripe- when we called to order room service breakfast, I was told to look at the menu "in the brown book on the desk". Which we did, and upon making our selections from that menu, were told that that was an old menu. Not a huge deal, just a minor inconvenience. We enjoyed a nice room service breakfast on Saturday morning; I highly recommend the eggs benedict! We spent a leisurely couple of hours in the hotel bar early Saturday evening- lively yet not rowdy crowd, appeared to be a lot of conference attendees... our waiter was very friendly and attentive. I liked that we could walk literally around the corner and have dinner at the on-premise Irish bar/restaurant, MJ O'Connors.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RMPDDS
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently (2/20-23) 2012 at the Boston Park Plaza Hotel. Although an older property the furnishings in the room were new. Nice King Bed , new 37" lcd TV. The bathroom was older but clean and adequate. I did upgrade to a deluxe king room and would advise this. The room was very large with a full size sofa and 2 bathrooms. each with a full tub and shower. The elevators worked fine and quickly. The location of the hotel is wonderful. Right across the street from the T stop at Arlington. We took public transportation everywhere,it was very convenient and for $15 you can get an unlimited pass that is good for 7 days. The theatre district and china town are a few blocks away. There are at least 10 fine restaurants within 3 blocks of the hotel. There are 5 restaurants within the same building as the hotel. I would return for another stay at the Park Plaza when I return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, Ridiculous lack of amenities”
Reviews.Author: Fett42
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great classic vibe but they charge three times what you pay at a nice Hilton or Marriot. The bathrooms are tiny and the low pressure, archaic tub wouldn't drain. They charge $12.50 per day for wi-fi - it's 2012, McDonalds and Best Western hotels provide free wi-fi - it should not be considered a "special" service but rather a standard amenity, just as much as phone and TV serice. Residential internet costs $12.50 PER MONTH. How in the world do they justify this? Speaking of phones, they need to update those too, they look like they came from a Miami Vice set. The room had no comfortable chairs to sit in, only two rickety dining room chairs so old that there was no padding left in the seats. When I checked out, I had to wait in a 10 minute line at the desk where two atttendants tried to service 30 guests. This place obviously has the resources to update the furniture and fixtures, hire more desk help, and provide free internet. But the truth is, they're counting on guests to be so enamoured with the idea of staying at the "Historic Plaza Hotel" that they feel justified in the ridiculous room rates and embarrasing lack of comfort and tech amenities. Next time I'll go to a Double Tree for a third of the price, reasonable guest servies, and a friendlier staff. This place is overated to the extreme.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls!”
Reviews.Author: LovemyAB
Reviews.Content: Tower level rooms on the concierge level, the "nicest" level in the hotel, and I get to sit up til after midnight listening to my neighbors have a "conversation" then actually talk for another hour, as clearly as if they were in my room. I called the front desk and was put on hold for 5+ minutes, so I hung up and called back. Different person answered and knew exactly why I was calling. They offered to come upstairs and ask the neighbors to whisper or stop talking. Really?!?! I said no thanks. They offered to bring a fan up for "white noise". Laughable. Then they offered to move our room, though my six year old child was already sound asleep. No reparations The exclusive happy hour in the tower lounge consisted of cold cuts, veggies and dip and one kind of cookie. Again, really?! Oh, and the "marble" bathrooms advertised...plastic. Splitting, old plastic. Looks like luxury from here. And there, but once you're settled in, but if you can't sleep, what is luxury worth?

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: When I first entered the Boston Park Plaza Hotel and Tower, I was very excited to be staying here. The dÃ©cor was impressive and I had high hopes of an exceptional stay. It did not take long for that go downhill almost immediately. When I first got in line to check in, I was told there was another line â€“ although there were no signs to indicate as such, nor any clear delineation on how to â€œregisterâ€� with the registration desk being so long. Seems like a small irritant, so at the time I didnâ€™t think much of it. I registered and got my keys. I went up in the elevator and was excited to see my room; if the entrance was that plush, I was sure my room was going to be exceptional. Oh how I was so wrong. Oh how I was so disappointed. As I walked in, I was surprised at how small the room was. I thought to myself, â€œfor almost $300/night, I would have thought I would have had a lounge chair or a small couch â€“ some room to do some businessâ€�. As I walked in the room, I noted the wobbly â€œsewingâ€� chair for a desk chair, an unremarkable desk (stained I might add) with a partially functional light, and a wall that had cracked paint, chips, and even a long hole around the perimeter. As I was on business travel, the first thing I did was plug in my computer and access my webmail. Surprisingly, this hotel charges â€œextraâ€� for â€œfastâ€� internet (such as that which would utilize VPN). Again, as I was on business and needed VPN, I signed up for the more costly connection. If it is faster than the other one, I suspect the other one is using a 19.2k dial-up modem. I ran a speed test on the internet connection and it was rated BELOW 56k in speed. It was not even equivalent to todayâ€™s dial-up standards! Disgusted, I needed to use the wash room. Not even a light switch in the washroom; the light switch was on the outside. The dÃ©cor was circa 1950 and it was the smallest restroom I have been in in probably 20 years. Returning, I tried to call down to the front desk to see if there was something wrong with the internet connection â€“ but my phone did NOT work. Of course. So on my way out to my convention, I let the front desk know that both my internet and phone was not operational. I was told it would be taken care of before I returned. Upon my return, I checked the phone â€“ ahhhâ€¦a dial tone. But when I tried to use any of the quick programmed buttons (i.e., â€œConcierge, Guest Services, etc.) they were non-operational, so I was forced to dial 0 and be connected. I then tried to access the internet and was again disappointed to see a ridiculously slow connectivity. I had better speed on the Airtran flight that I took out here. Wanting to unwind, I tried to order a movie. The service was not operational. I once again called down and was told it was out of order and would not be available until sometime tomorrow. The Boston Park Plaza Hotel and Towers has made my first visit to Boston a very disappointing and unpleasurable experience! I do not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “A hit or miss experience- ours was a 'hit'”
Reviews.Author: kiki5206
Reviews.Content: First, I will get past my pique at being ripped off, which was my own fault. I purchased two one-night vouchers from a group buying site, at $139 each. When you subtract the $46 for the included valet parking, that comes out to $93 per night, which sounded great because it was labeled as "53% discount". But when I went to the hotel's site to book our room, I could have gotten the same room for $89, not including parking. Shame on me for not checking first. The buying site attributes full responsibility for the content on the "deal" to the establishment; this was, at best, blatantly misleading. I could not get any hotel person to tell me what rate the $93 was 53% lower than. Buyer beware and check out all the pricing options. Even $93 is a great price for the location. When we arrived to check in around 4 pm, the line for the front desk stretched all the way across the lobby, but it moved fairly quickly. Most people seemed to be speaking another language-- I heard Italian, German and French, so with the grandeur of the lobby you almost feel as though you are in a European hotel. From our experience plus the other reviews, I can only surmise that the experience at this hotel varies widely based on the room you get and who is staying nearby. We were in a King Standard room which was just fine-- a little cramped, but we were prepared for the tiny bathroom and pleasantly surprised by the shelving that had been installed above the pedestal sink and the toilet. Water pressure and temperature were fine, even on a high floor. The bed was quite comfortable, each of us having a regular pillow plus a body pillow, and the window opens! We were lucky not to have too much street noise, because the heating system is oblivious to the "set" temperature. We turned it down as low as it would go (64 degrees), but with the window shut the temperature just kept going higher. You can turn off the system completely, but then it gets stuffy. The solution was to leave the heat running and crack the window open (the ice tongs were great for this). We wanted to catch the update on Red Sox spring training, but NESN was not available. In fact, the channel lineup included in the hotel information binder was complete fiction; the "real" channel list is the one you get on-screen from the TV itself. My husband used the Wifi and didn't have any trouble getting and staying connected. We were on the side of the building facing the Expressway. While the fitness center is being renovated, the equipment has been moved to a large space off the lobby that clearly used to be a store. Lots of treadmills, ellipticals, bikes, a bench, balance balls, and free weights. Workouts were very pleasant. All in all, I would stay here again but would probably ask for the same room again so as not to take unnecessary chances. Pros: Comfortable bed Fitness center Shower Quiet other than plumbing sounds from next door Cons: Fewer TV channels than most hotels Expensive valet parking (nearby garages are cheaper) Crowds at check-in Expensive per-device Wifi charge

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lady fallen to neglect”
Reviews.Author: cherylina62
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Park Plaza with my daughter for a couple of days of Boston R&R. There was a deal at the park plaza, $89 per night. I thought I would swing out and we'd have some fun in town. The hotel staff was very nice, easy to work with. The price was right. The room itself (and I paid a little more to get a bigger bed) was dreary and old. Noisy, on the 11th floor! The drapes don't completely cover the windows edges so there was a lot of light around the edges of the window which kept me up all night. SO sorry to see a place with so much potential be neglected. Spend some money guys, a little paint and some color would go a long way. And please fix the drapes. For the price, this wouldn't be bad for a business stay. We were hoping for a bit more pampering. I suppose beggars can't be choosers. On the up side, you could include parking for nearly no money. This was a good perk. Bathroom was very small and old, but clean and the hotwater never runs out.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel,even better location.”
Reviews.Author: irisheyes67_11
Reviews.Content: Only stayed 1 night but the room was clean, beds were so comfy, staff was friendly. The location was central to all things to see and restaurants were abundant with fair prices. The only negatives were the fact that the bathroom was very dated and we couldn't get the heat low enough. A bit too warm for our liking. All in all I would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “"World Class Service"”
Reviews.Author: dawnlamothe
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked through the front door I knew I had made the right choice of hotels. I was greeted by 2 front desk agents, Lauren and Hannah were their names. Lauren and Hannah welcomed me to the hotel and made me feel at home. They were both extremely professional, courteous and as a guest you knew they truly wanted my stay to be memorable. I stay in a hotel about 180 nights a year and I must say the "SERVICE WAS SECOND TO NONE" My room was beautiful, clean and had all the amenities one could want. The location also doesn't get any better, you can walk all over Boston and find all you could want or need close by.I not only highly recommend the Boston Park Plaza but feel you are missing out if you have the opportunity to stay and don't.I can't wait to make my next reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Profshop
Reviews.Content: I booked a King Deluxe room and that was not what I got based on the description and pictures. I had to scoot sideways between the bed and dresser just to get thru. The hotel was overrun with foreign college students who were blocking the entrance with their smoking, who hijacked both the main elevators and service elevators, and who just made getting around difficult. As I was checking in and out, they would come right up to the reception desk, interrupt and demand service. Thank goodness the reception staff told them they were with a guest and to go get in line. My room was 90 degrees and the heat wasn't even on - I had to sleep with the window open because the hotel could do nothing about it and the A/C wasn't "in season." With the window open at night all I heard was the noise of sirens and screaming drunk people - needless to say I didn't really sleep for the 2 nights I was there. This was my second stay at the Park Plaza, and was the last. Even though it is convenient to activities in Boston, it's not worth the aggravation.

Reviews.Title: “It the job done, although staff did not go out of their way to help with anything.”
Reviews.Author: Hatt222
Reviews.Content: The hotel was worth the price we paid for our one night stay since we bid for it using hotwire and paid around $135 + tax for the night. But i would certainly pay no more for this hotel than that simply based on the quality of service! It all began when we called the Park Plaza's main number to inquire about what type of room we had be awarded via Hotwire. The first person told us she was only able to help if we were looking to make a reservation but could not view our current reservation. When we asked to be connected to someone that could view this info, she attempted to forward us but them came back to the line saying that nobody was available to help us and that they'd have to call us back. Surprise surprise, we never received a call back. Upon arrival, check in went relatively smoothly but then asked to leave our bags with the bellman who gave us a just as unfriendly attitude as the woman on the phone earlier had. It was as though we were being a terrible inconvenience to both of these staff members by simply asking them to do their job!! The rooms are small and old and the bathrooms aren't much to speak of! The two perks of this hotel were that the bed was quite comfortable and we had a delicious meal at one of the hotel's restaurants (Pairings).

Reviews.Title: “The Park Plaza Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JLR173
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we set up the luggage rack and found a dirty sock! The walls are paper thin and the light of day blinded us in the morning, they only have old-fashioned roller shades to cover the windows! This hotel is tired and in desperate need of a facelift. The pillows were either too hard or too soft and the bathroom was very tiny. Loved the location but we won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “20 years, always good.”
Reviews.Author: terryinthenorth
Reviews.Content: Have been a convention guest at the Park Plaza every winter for 20 some years. Walking into the lobby feels like coming home. From making the reservations to checking out at the end of the conference service is friendly and professional. The rooms are clean and well stocked. Tip: if you are rooming with a colleague ask for one of the "delux rooms". These rooms have two bathrooms and are great for co workers travelling together. I'm not a Keurig fan - I used to bring my own coffee to brew in the room. I suppose you could ask for a real coffee maker, I'm sure they have them. This year they had a little kiosk in lobby with Starbucks coffee and some pastries. That was handy. The banquet food is better than average at the hotel and there are many good restaurants within walking distance - Legal Seafood, Maggianos, Finale, McCormich & Schmidt were our choices. The Copley Plaza shopping Mall, Lord & Taylor, Saks and Newbury Street are all within walking distance, too. 20 years of great experiences at this hotel will prompt me to choose for leisure trips, too.

Reviews.Title: “nice historic hotel and polite staff”
Reviews.Author: PJ72783
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends was a amazing hotel for the price and value!. The hotel is in good conidtion and very classic. some of the reviewers need to lighten up on here. The reviews are about no free wi-fi are correct and it stinks... but for under $100 a night to stay in boston you need to expect to pay as you go (some hotels charge even more for internet). If you want free wi-fi in boston go to the $200+ a night hotels otherwise i dont know who is worse the hotel for charging for internet or the people who complain on here about it, yet want the cheapest hotel rate possible! learn the phrase "You get what you pay for!" if you want all the frills pay for them!! overall for the price we paid (around $100/night ) it was well worth it, i would enjoy staying here again. if you want a inexpensive place to stay this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Only have double beds but what a beautiful property!”
Reviews.Author: DavidPlate
Reviews.Content: Really nice staff, somewhat small rooms and double beds only but really nice. My room was perfectly updated and spotless. There were a ton of young European kids in the lobby but they were very quiet at night, and it was a wonderful stay. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “bad to worse”
Reviews.Author: PeturbedPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: We paid extra to be on the top floor. There were 2 barking dogs that the management refused to acknowledge. Finally, they told us they would talk to the owners so they could "talk to the dogs" to get them to be quiet. We then changed rooms. But, unknown to us, there was a confrence of 2000 college students who took over the hotel from Wednesday to Saturday. They occupied the lounge that we paid extra to use. They sat on the floor of the 15th floor having meetings. It was out of control. Even the elevators were hijacked. The express elevator was used by these students and every floor was punched in. We first complained to the maneger who offered us a free nite and room service breakfast. Afterwords, he balked and offered us no food and half price for the nite. We stood our ground and we won. The free internet service in the lounge on the 15th floor was down for 4 days. We'll never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend away”
Reviews.Author: Newyorkfan20
Reviews.Content: The hotel may be older,but it is beautiful. Great Location near the Public Garden,walking distance to many places and subway. Many good places to eat in building,great Irish Pub also

Reviews.Title: “Why be cheapskates on the Wifi?”
Reviews.Author: liz_croft
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a number of times. It is centrally located and rates can be very reasonable for a hotel of this class. Rooms are smallish but well-furnished and comfortable. So what's not to like? Well, the total absence of access to free WiFi. Before when I visited, although WiFi in the room was a steep $12.95, you could pick it up for free in the Business Lounge or the Statler Lounge or the restaurant. Not any longer - all are secured. And yet the Au Bon Pain next door (hardly a classy joint) has a free hotspot. I stayed in a Hampton Inn on the way up from New York - free WiFi (and breakfast). What are they thinking? Better to add a couple of dollars to everyone's bill and have free access. This will certainly affect my buying decision next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Despite showing its age, still a good option for Downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: BThomasC
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight and found it to be a perfectly acceptable. Some of the criticisms were valid, showing some age in common areas and bathrooms are small. But found it to be clean, well taken care of, and very good location that was close to T, Theater District, Common, and tons of good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Looking tired...and the pictures don't match the rooms”
Reviews.Author: C P
Reviews.Content: One can overlook the worn appearence of the hotel. It's supposed to be a Grande Dame of Boston. More about the history than about modern convienences. What I don't appreciate is the misrepresenation of the rooms. I booked a Junior Suite based upon the photos availble on the web site and din't get ANY of the "perks". The hotel boasts a higher level floor for suites...I was initially put on the 6th floor...THIS IS NOT TOWER LEVEL as indicated in the description. The room description indicated a comfortable sitting area accompanied by a photo of a nice sitting area, couch coffee table ...NOPE the room just 2 hard straight back chairs. Not a place to relax at all. When I checked in there was a knock at the door from housekeeping looking to take the chairs and bring in a roll away bed for the rest of the guests assigned to the room. WHAT? There was only one guest registered for the room, and I didn't plan on sharing. The upgraded bath, contained an industrial toilet that could be found in any public restroom. ick. A tub that had a weird mushy bottom. and NO SOAP...sigh...small detail that may not bother some travelers, but when it's 4:30 in the morning and have an 8am flight, it's really a sticking point. Then watching the valet bring my car around at 50 MPH down Stuart street sealed the deal. With so many great hotels in the city...this one is a pass!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: JenMcCarthy23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Park Plaza for two nights this February. We got the room at a 40% off rate from rooms.com and were delighted with our stay. The hotel is located just around the corner from the Arlington stop on the T (Green) line, and Boston Common. The Cheers restaraunt and bar are within walking distance. Our room had a king size bed and flat screen tv with a variety of channels. The bathroom decor didnt really match the rest of the room but the shower was good. The only thing missing was a wardrobe area/place to hang clothes. We had breakfast in the hotel on our last morning. It was a little pricey at $41 for two of us but the food was excellent and the restaraunt was lovely. I would recommend this hotel for its convenient location and nice decor, it has been well maintained since its foundation in 1927.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Bayboonk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Park Plaza for two nights while visiting family in Boston because we got a great online special. From our experience, however, we will not be returning. PROS: Great location. It is surrounded by great restaurants, theaters, shopping, Boston Commons and Boston Gardens. Comfortable beds and pillows, and good water pressure in the shower. Easy check in and out. CONS: The bathroom was very tiny and a shelf overhanging the sink made it impossible to bend over to wash your face without banging your head. There was no way to control the room temperature. Our room was so warm the first night it was impossible to sleep. The second night we figured out that we could open the windows, but the street noise was so loud that we had to close them again. The walls are paper thin. On our first night a party in a room down the hall ended at 3:00AM when it then spilled out into the hall waking everyone. The room itself was of adequate space, but the furniture was very worn and the radiator was falling apart, part of it hanging on the floor. Maybe that's why there was no temperature control! Two nights of no sleep and no free wifi left us with very negative feelings about this property.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Park Plaza Looking A Little Old”
Reviews.Author: Harvlis
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three days, during a business show. The location of the hotel is excellent, if you want to be surrounded by some very nice restaurants. It is about a $10 cab ride to the Boston Convention Center. The hotel offers parking packages so, make sure you get it included in your room fee. You then have to give your car to the valet, as they have to park the car for you, trust me. My room was clean but, the bathroom was tiny. The toilet was wedged in between the tub and the wall. It's a good thing I go to the gym. A large person has no shot so, make sure your room has a full size bathroom. My tub and shower curtain were from the 1950's. In addition, they charge for internet, which really bothers me. Why does a small hotel give you free internet and a fancy one charge you -- money grab. Heat in the room was fine and hot water was plentiful. All in all, a mixed bag.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lucy C
Reviews.Content: A group of 6 of us stayed here during January. We arrived a day after snow fell, coming from Australia it was like another world! We instantly fell in love with Boston. Our hotel, The Boston Park Plaza was cosy, warm and welcoming. The service was great, they got us all on the same floor, with beautiful views of the neighbouring building covered in white caps of snow. The rooms were big enough for our stay, the bathrooms were small and older than most hotels, but were immaculate and clean so the age just added to the historic feel which was lovely. Lack of free wifi was a let down. The gym was being renovated at the time but one can't judge a hotel on such things.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for visiting colleges in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Valmoisy
Reviews.Content: I got a great price that included valet parking with the drive in to Boston and save promotion. I was bringing 3 teenage girls to visit colleges in Boston and booked a deluxe room. The MBTA green line is almost right outside the hotel entrance and will quickly bring you to most of the colleges in Boston. The room was a good size and comfortable for the four of us. The bonus was that there were two bathrooms which was key to getting the girls out of the room in a reasonable amount of time. The beds (two doubles) were very comfortable and we were happy with the room. The water pressure in the shower could have been better and wifi cost over $12 per device per day, which I thought was a bit excessive so we chose not to use it. The staff were very accommodating and immediately resolved the minor problems we had. We ate dinner at The Melting Pot, located in the hotel, while it was pricey we had a lot of fun and really enjoyed it. I totally recommend this hotel as a great central location for college visits in the city of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Let down by small things”
Reviews.Author: money4nothing123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days on business. Room size was good as was room service. However let down by very slow WiFi (which you paid for), weak shower and room keys that twice I had to get replaced. Because of the WiFi (which I need for business) would not stay here again. Shame as hotel could potentially be very good

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but needs some work”
Reviews.Author: mmg488
Reviews.Content: classy hotel but the water pressure in my shower made it feel like I was taking a bird bath, but other than that had a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Pillows galore but someone please turn down the heat?”
Reviews.Author: CSSnowshoer
Reviews.Content: One night in the Boston Park Plaza. I should not complain- I had a great rate and my "Towers" room was clean. But really, despite the tiny size they filled it with so much fancy furniture that I could hardly turn around. Getting out of bed on either side meant ramming into either an armoire or a desk. Pick your bruises. And pillows- it was just me and I did not really need NINE pillows. The thermostat was only for show- the heat was 73 degrees when I went to sleep, finally dropping a couple by morning, but making for a difficult sleep under the big comforter. No free wifi anywhere, although in the breakfast lounge on the 15th floor (not open weekends) there was a computer with internet. Be aware its also a very big densely built building so your PDA, like mine, may not work in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a perfect hotel if it's 1954”
Reviews.Author: BKBA
Reviews.Content: 1. The location can't be beat. 2. The rooms are miniature, not even a space to put down your suitcase... and I was in the extra cost towers. 3. Must not have any international clientele, breakfast opens at 6:30 and NO COFFEE before that. 4. What makes the towers worth the extra cost? I can't imagine. 5. $12.50 a day for internet... ONE DEVICE ONLY, you have a smart phone pony-up another $12.50 6. Did I say the room is miniature yet? Others hotels have bathrooms as big. When asked the union concierge said I was upgraded, I can't imagine the other rooms. If I came back I would book the cheapest room available, I bet it would be the same thing as the 'special' tower room. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel but great location”
Reviews.Author: chostetler
Reviews.Content: My company booked me a room here for my week stay in Boston for work. I arrived at the hotel around 1pm and I was told my room would not be ready until after 3pm. (this was a little irritating because I was sick with a fever upon my arrival to Boston, but that was not the issue.) I waited in the lobby area for over 2 hours. I watched countless people arrive and check into their rooms. After 3 pm I went back to the front desk where a very rude woman informed me my room was still not ready. I waited for another hour in the lobby!! Finally around 4:15 my standard room was 'ready'. I checked into the room and was about there for an hour when the front desk called and said they had given me the wrong room and I HAD to change. I had to re-pack my things and move to another floor to a room that looked almost identical. The room itself was old and the bathroom was tiny! (not to mention the huge dust bunny i found next to the bed!)Every night the person in the room next to mine had somebody smoking, and the smoke filled in my room. I called the front desk, and they informed me that it was a smoked free hotel, but clearly my neighbor did not care. And no surprise when I checked my credit card when I got home they charged for 2 rooms the first day. They did take charge off when I called, but it only added to the miserable experience. I normally don't complain about a stay no matter the experience but this could not go unspoken. The staff was rude, the hotel was out-dated, but the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Adequate Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: PurpleSpoon
Reviews.Content: Great location just a block from the T stop and within walking distance to Public Garden, Boston Common, and plenty of restaurants. It is older, so we expected the rooms to be small. We were upgraded to a queen, but my brother and his wife (on the same reservation) were not, even when they mentioned we were. The bathroom was very small, but adequate. The room needed a little TLC and the walls are very thin. While the location was great, I don't know that we would stay here again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bdhirst1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Park Plaza four or five times usually when attending a conference held there. My rooms have always been fine. Not big but very adequate and looking out on the street. Once I was even upgraded without request to the floor which had continental breakfast. This past week, I stayed for two nights while attending a conference and was very disappointed for several reasons. The first, is that the room I was given was really cramped. There was not enough room to fit a table if I wanted to order room service meals. The shower stall was so small that I bumped the sides. There was a little appendage to the stall so that the shower curtain would prevent water from hitting the floor. The room looked out on the inside of the hotel and I knew that the hotel was far from full. The TV channel guide was inaccurate and the hotel no longer had pay for view movies. I tried to call room service and twice and got no answer. The directions for making a long distance call were inaccurate and when I finally got room service the directions that they gave were incorrect also. When I checked in I asked if there were any room discounts left for the conference and was told that I would have to call myself to ask. I wasn't really expecting one since I was asking so late but how hard was it for the desk person to call and ask? In the future I will find another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Wakez4
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean room, in a very well kept, traditional style hotel. Comfortable beds, in a surprisingly spacious room (we booked the petite). Good size bathroom, HD t.v. and good in room coffee making facilities. Good views of street from window. Literally steps from the 'T' stop, and in great walking proximity to Boston Common and lots of tourist attractions. Lots of shops are within a short walk/short subway ride away. Downsides were having to pay for Internet access, the Concierge was not particularly friendly or helpful. Breakfast was expensive but there is a nice 'Bon Au Pain' on the same block. I would use the hotel again, and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Daylove
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location with an helpful staff and decent dining choices, but it is very old and needs a renovation. The room I stayed in was on the small size with old furnishing and TV(very limited channels). I am not sure I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel in the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: Cruisers1985
Reviews.Content: Another Hotel from the American Historic Hotels chain. Well maintained, plaisant staff and wll located. We stayed there for 2 nights and really liked it. Close to a great selection of restaurant on the Theater district. Within walking distance to Beacon Hill, Boston common and all touristic attractions. No need to take a taxi. Boston is a great city for people who like to walk. Just a suggestion, have breakfast outside the hotel. The 25$ per person buffet breakfast is pricy...

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice rooms, decent price”
Reviews.Author: MikeMorton
Reviews.Content: Our room was a little small, but the price was good for Boston. Bed comfortable, reasonably quiet for the city. Good: All the staff were friendly and helpful. Bad: No free wifi, not even in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jaime w
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful. The location was very walkable to a lot of spots around Boston. The room was very tiny and a bit outdated. It was great for sleeping though! I had a room right by the elevator and I was worried it would be noisy but I couldn't hear a thing! It's about a $35 cab ride from the airport which I found out the hard way. I called to ask about a hotel shuttle and the woman on the phone told me it was only $15 by cab (this was around 8pm so no rush hour traffic), so I was a bit disappointed when I had to pay more than double.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Shanelle M
Reviews.Content: Prime location next to shopping, bars, clubs and restaurants. Across the street from the major park! Cute and clean rooms. I'll probably stay here again next time I'm in the Boston area!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again.. Suite was so run down..”
Reviews.Author: Trish J
Reviews.Content: I would never ever stay at this hotel again...Inside the hotel is run down and the lobby is nothing spectacular.. I know it is an old hotel but they really could modernize it.. I stayed here with my boyfriend for a concert.. (and believe me we are not picky.. we are only in our early 20's) and hated it.. we got a suite and there was only the bed, desk, and two chairs in the room.. it was just tons of empty space with no seating area.. and a really tiny bathroom.. our smoke detector was hanging out of the ceiling and all of the paint in the room was chipped.. The location is fantastic and the places to eat connected to the hotel are very good.. but the location itself does not make up for how awful the hotel is.. I thought for a city like Boston it would have some charm.. but nope.. stick to the Back Bay Hotel or the TAJ

Reviews.Title: “After 15 years, I still don't like this place...”
Reviews.Author: DeltaSkyKing
Reviews.Content: When I travel to Boston on business, the Park Plaza is the hotel my company puts me up in. As a result, I've stayed here several times a year for over 15 years. So I think I'm more than qualified to review this hotel. As much as I like older hotels, I really can't stand this place. Yes it's got a great location but aside from that there are so many negatives, that I never get a good nights sleep here. In fact, the only thing stopping me from giving this hotel the lowest possible rating is that I think you wouldn't believe me. So without dragging out the handwringing about writing a very negative review, let's get right to it: Pro: - Great location, just across the street from Boston Commons - Many wonderful restaurants nearby - New HD Flat Screen TV's Con: - It stinks. Literally, this place always smells. The lobby smells like a mixture of an old library and bus depot. Really. The hallways always smell musty and the heating and cooling units in these rooms don't bring in any outside air at all. The rooms smell of old carpeting which brings me to my next point... - It's old, and the rooms haven't been refurbished in over 15 years! The carpets are dirty, the walls are dinged up and need to be repainted, the furniture is old, broken and scratched, the windows won't open unless you happen to have a crowbar with you and the tiles in the bathrooms are cracked. In fact, I'd wager the bathroom floor tiles are the same ones installed in 1927 when the hotel was built! - The walls are paper thin. Noise is always an issue here. During my last stay, two women in the room next to mine were loud all night despite repeated reminders from security to keep the noise down. - Since it is a very old hotel, the roomsare an eclectic mixture of too little or too much room. Most rooms are so small you'd have to go outside to change your mind. Some rooms are large because they've taken 2 or 3 rooms and knocked the walls out to create a bigger space. - Heating and air conditioning is nearly uncontrollable. The rooms are always too hot, even in the winter. Several decades ago most hotels discovered individual in-room self-contained heating and A/C. Not here, the Park Plaza is still on the old central steam heating in the winter or cool water in the summer. The result is you're never comfortable. Let's say you have a early spring heat wave. Room too hot? Too bad. The hotel will still be on central steam heating and so no A/C. Opening the room window will do nothing other than to let in lots of noise courtesy of a nearby fire department that is always responding to emergencies with sirens blaring 24/7. On this stay, sure enough the room was too hot. First I couldn't get the window open. I finally was able to force it open just enough to let in the outside 15 F degree air, but it was so noisy outside, I was forced to get up and down all night opening and closing the window to moderate both the temperature and the noise. Hey, Park Plaza it's 2012! Time to get rid of your 18th century heating system! Don't even get me started about how hot the rooms are in the summer time. Since the water pipes just circulate cold water and a very week fan just blows across the pipes in your room, you'll never get the room cold enough to sleep comfortably. A very few rooms do have self-contained Heating and A/C units, but good luck trying to get them. Either they are always taken or the front desk staff doesn't understand what you're talking about. I've tried repeatedly to communicate to the front desk that I want a room with a independent AC unit, and each time I get the same old steam pipe rooms. - Because the location of the Park Plaza is so great, this place is always crowded with reunions, frat parties, conventions etc. As a result, there are always people noisily walking through the hall late at night into the early morning. And, because of the afore-mentioned paper thin walls and lousy doors, you're going to hear all of the sounds in the hall way. Combine that with a noisy neighbor and you've got a din of noise presented in full stereo. A couple of years ago, I was treated to a 4:30 am fire alarm evacuation. That was not fun. - Front desk staff is quite aloof and not very compassionate about your discomfort. This is a poor hotel, with poorly trained staff in a very old hotel trying to pass itself off as a upscale hotel. It is not. If the hotels location weren't so great, this hotel would have been shuttered long ago. It's living on past glories and an enviable real estate location. I really hate writing a review like this. But I'm not kidding when I say I find it difficult to find anything I like here. I have a love-hate relationship with Boston: I love Boston. I've had some wonderful times there. But, my visits are always tempered by my dislike for this hotel. I stay in a hotel over 200 nights a year. Many of them are terrific, the Boston Park Plaza is not one of them. If I were you, I'd go somewhere else. But, until I can convince my company not to put us up here anymore, I'll be trying to avoid coming to Boston and spending more restless nights in the Park Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Good option in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Lifes_Too_Good
Reviews.Content: Pros Good location Attached restaurants bars options Good dessert place open till late Cons Rooms could have bigger for the price Neutral Hotel seemed dated

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable older hotel”
Reviews.Author: christensen
Reviews.Content: We lived in Boston for a long time and when we go back to visit we always stay at the Park Plaza. You can get a really nice room for not a lot of money. My advice is- never book the cheapest room, upgrade just a little and it is a huge difference. The cheapest room is like being on a ship. Keep in mind, it is an older hotel but it is comfortable, has a lovely lobby and in my estimation is in the best part of the city- you can walk everywhere but it is quiet. 2nd piece of advice- do not use the valet parking at the hotel... way too expensive when there are several garages that are significantly more affordable and very close. Just do your homework on-line and find the garages before you go. Unload your bags at the hotel and then go park!

Reviews.Title: “Location is Great. Hotel just fine.”
Reviews.Author: guybeachbum
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel with a couple friends of ours. We did so not based on any recommendation, but through Hotwire (great deal). I have been to Boston before and the location of this hotel is fantastic. Walking distance to every attraction and/or neighbourhood worth visiting. Boston Common is a 3-4min walk from the front door. Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market is about 15 minute walk. Should shopping be your thing, Back Bay (Commonwealth Ave, Newbury Street) has a variety of fantastic retailers and is just a few minutes from the door. We walked to Fenway Park one day, for a tour, and it took us only 20-25min, and this was through the shopping district just mentioned. The rooms were a tad on the small side, and showed their age somewhat. But the beds were comfortable, and the hallways quiet. We really were only in the rooms to sleep, so it served its purpose. The rooms are not "modern" by any stretch, more on the traditional side. Staff were polite and willing to help when approached. My only grievance was no wake-up call when we requested one (this happened to our friends as well, on a different night - good thing we had a backup). All in all, location is great, and it was good value for the money spent. There are nicer hotels in the city for sure, but this one was just fine. I would recommend, if only you only get a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I thought it was going to be”
Reviews.Author: beckamoose
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but adequate for two adults. The hotel is beautiful. The only negatives were that the maids were rude and didn't every vacuum our room (even though we have crumbs all over the floor) and the bathroom was a little outdated. Other than that, we had no problems. Our room was ready right away and the hotel is close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby old rooms.”
Reviews.Author: I'mPedro
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was very nice and the location was perfect for me. Saying that the hotel is very old and the rooms feel it. The walls are also very thin but it probably didn't help that there were 6 Russian children running up and down the halls that didn't speak English and the parents had gone out for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Rodents”
Reviews.Author: Frites67
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel shortly after Christmas. I came in one evening and found a small rat (or very large mouse) in my room. They moved me to another room - and I found a large mousetrap under the bed, hugging the wall. (Nowadays, I always do a quick bedbug check whenever I check into a room, and as I was examining the mattress I pulled it away from the wall and saw the mousetrap). All hotels have issues with vermin, even new hotels, but this is the first time I have ever seen a rat / mouse in a room, at least in North America. The fact that the second room had a mousetrap under the bed (which I have also never seen) indicates to me that this is an ongoing problem at this hotel. Given the hotel's age and the fact that the rates were reasonable, I found the hotel was, for the most part, well maintained and comfortable. But as I said, the fact there was a mousetrap in the second room indicates to me that this is a problem which needs to be dealt with.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms feel a bit dated.”
Reviews.Author: northe99
Reviews.Content: The Park Plaza is a historic hotel in a great location. Lots of rooms means that it's usually on the cheaper end of the downtown hotels. Unfortunately the rooms could use a good overhaul. The bathrooms in the rooms that I've stayed in have been tiny and a little rough around the edges. Overall, I'll definitely stay here again, as the price is right, but I wouldn't recommend it someone without explaining the upsides and the downsides.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not bad of a stay”
Reviews.Author: SunWils
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband had stayed at this hotel to get away for the long weekend. We are from NH and are familiar with Boston. The location of the hotel was great, close to Newbury street, Boston Commons, Faneuil Hall and Downtown crossings (these are a bit of a walk, but great on a nice day and if you don't mind walking). I read the reviews before staying and a lot of them had complained about the small rooms. We had stayed in the King size bedroom, and it was fine. The bathrooms were small and cold and the toilet looked like a public toilet which was unattractive but we weren't in the room a lot, so it was ok for us to stay here. The walls are very thin, you can hear everything in the hallway, kids were running up and down, the maid you could hear talking. You can hear everything, however in the night it was quiet. We stayed on a Sunday -Monday, so maybe it was more quiet than usual. The service was great. We were able to check in early and check out late and the bellman held our bags after we checked out so we could go back into the city. We got the package where the valet parking was including-great deal and were able to leave our car there till 4pm the next day. I would recommend this hotel, it's a nice stay if you aren't going to be in the room a lot. You can hear everything that would be the only complaint, but the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Basic luxe and location”
Reviews.Author: Bzeau
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ideally located, and is historic and elegant. Our room was lovely but city-sized (small). It had the best, fluffy towels and a wonderful shower. The drawback came from desk clerks' attitude. When we reserved, the agent had raved about Towers rooms offering all sorts of extras including breakfast in the restaurant (not so) and evening cocktail hour in the lounge; we reserved that room with an extra fee to have parking (parking is very high in Boston; this extra is well worth it). When we arrived, our room was ready and on the top floor, but the check-in clerk was fairly curt and did not give us any info about the Towers lounge location, breakfast hours, "horsd'oeuvres/happy hour," etc. The directions she gave for the valet parking entrance were also entirely insufficient. When we went to the lounge for "happy hour," we found a package of Cracker Barrel cheese (still in the wrapper) open on the bar next to a bunch of used glasses. No bartender, no seltzer, no ice, nothing. When we called the desk to ask where the ice machines were (since no info was provided in the room), a different clerk not only did not acknowledge or seem concerned there was no "happy hour hors d'oeuvres," she gave incorrect directions to the ice machine -- it was not at all where she said it was. Breakfast was a slight improvement-- great coffee, very basic fruit/yogurt and pastry with some boxed cereal. We also saw the bellman refuse to let a guest take a cart upstairs to load bags himself, and was not very polite about it. Our room was clean and very quiet, bed comfortable, and amenities were fine. It was a good base, but do not expect gracious hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “It was a nice stay...could not control temperature in room though”
Reviews.Author: JonathanM315
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early December for business and had a good experience. I was upgraded to a suite upon checking in, but was surprised to see that the room was still quite small. Although Boston is generally chilly around this time of the year; it was abnormally hot. I had trouble controlling the temperature in my room thus I had to crack the window. The Wifi was adequate. I enjoyed the bar downstairs and the staff was friendly. The location is wonderful, close to everything downtown with plenty of food options. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointing”
Reviews.Author: AM-TOR
Reviews.Content: We were terribly disappointed by this hotel. During our first night we were awakened by screaming and pounding on the door of the room beside us by some man who was clearly intoxicated. This lasted for quite a while and was actually quite scary. However since it was NYE we hoped it wouldn't occur the next night. The next morning the room service dishes that were sitting outside that room since early the day before had still not been cleared. Far worse was what we saw running through our closet and then under our door into the hallway.....a mouse!! I was horrified. After calling down and explaining the girl said "gross" and promptly transferred me to someone who offered a room upgrade and to comp that night for us. The next room had a mouse trap under the bed (empty thankfully). Obviously this is an ongoing problem for the hotel which they have failed to adequately address over the years.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located in Boston - with lots to do a great, friendly and safe city”
Reviews.Author: GuillermoGloria
Reviews.Content: If you've ever considered a trip to Boston, this is an excellent choice in hotels. It is centrally located, near the subway, and a very nice old hotel. After taking the free shuttle bus from the airport to the subway, we found it easy to get to the hotel. We basically took the subway everywhere when we weren't walking around. We did the murder mystery harbour cruise the first night, which was good fun. The next day we took the red trolley tour and hopped on and off at many attractions, including Fenway Park, and a stop for lunch at the Barking Crab down on the wharf. The trolley tour included a ferry ride across the harbour which was very scenic, and offered good views of the city and the Boston Gardens from the water. There was a nice little street festival in the Italian neighbourhood to the north which was fun. That night we went to a Mexican restaurant/tequila bar called Masa, which was just across the bridge, and not too far to walk to. Afterwards we stopped in at the Sweetwater Tavern in the alley just down the street from the Park Plaza, beside the Vault. For breakfast, there is an Au Bon Pan restaurant beside the hotel, where you can find some really tasty fresh items made to order. Be sure to check out the market, of rent Segways to get around. And rake good walking shoes - there's a lot to see and do. A climb up Beacon Hill is worthwhile, as it is a nicer old area, with gas lamps and all. These are just some of the things to do - We walked many miles in Boston, and never felt unsafe day or night. We love this city, and had no complaints about The Boston Park Plaza Hotel & Towers.

Reviews.Title: “a student residence with a pretty faÃ§ade and 46$/day parking”
Reviews.Author: ira2010
Reviews.Content: We are a couple, so we booked a room with one bed, but got a room with 2 single beds, with no fridge, microwave, or even a hairdryer. The room was booked as for the participants of math conference, but there were no free WiFi, no notepads and pens in the room. The fan in the room was making loud yelling noises, so we asked management to fix it. They offered another room next day - and that room didn't even have a bathtub, just a little shower, and it didn't have an iron, (but it had an ironing board, and a little bag with the parts of a hairdryer, hanging on the back of the bathroom door). The shower in the bathroom was smaller than we saw in European hotels. It impressed me so much that I took pictures. There was a piece of some plumbing on the floor in the washroom when we entered, which was not picked up by the cleaning lady even next time when the room was serviced. Even student residences have free WiFi and an iron in the room, so we expected more from Bostonâ€™s hotel. The parking was 46$/day â€“ the price of our day stay in the hotel in Orlando 2 weeks ago - we wish we knew it before handing the keys!!! The entrance to the hotel is however impressive, well decorated.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a good nights sleep, this is not the place for you.”
Reviews.Author: Mcdonar
Reviews.Content: On the face of it, this hotel represents probably the best value that you will get from a hotel in Boston. Location is second to none, hotel appears to be in top notch condition. However, this hotel is a historically listed building - in other words, it's old!! The appearance would dictate otherwise. But what many, including ourselves, failed to realise is that such old buildings have paper thin walls. Which is why, at 3.30a.m (after being in bed for almost 2 hours), I am writing this review! You can hear kids crying next door, doors slamming, toilets flushing, full blown conversations, the windows don't close - the emergency services sirens throughout the city make for some additional distractions!!! In all honesty though, if you are drunk enough that you can fall asleep through all of that, you're laughing. If not, like most, avoid this place. The Radisson and numerous other hotels are on the same block. My advice, pay that little but extra. Trust me, you won't regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful centrally located hotel but skip the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Coilltebabe99
Reviews.Content: Stayed Sunday Jan 9th for one night with husband and two children, room was larger than expected. Valet parking at $49 was a little expensive but as Boston parking is mosty impossible we went with it. Concierge, bellhop & valet staff were all pleasant & well informed. Only downside was buffet breakfast in the morning, $25 a person and it was truly horrendous, overpriced I could probably hav dealt with but this was really quite terrible. Next time we'll just grab au Bon pain.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location! Perfectly satisfactory hotel.”
Reviews.Author: drmgeorge
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in the Boston Park Plaza over New Years weekend. First, Boston's First Night is a really great way to spend New Years Eve, afternoon and evening. The hotel is extremely convenient to those activities in particular. It is midway between Copley Square/Prudential Center and the Boston Common/Beacon Hill areas. The service was efficient and friendly, and the rooms comfortable and clean. The Expedia price was right (over $100 less than nearby comparable hotels). I'd stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat old & loud rooms and no free internet!!”
Reviews.Author: balt_more
Reviews.Content: I was not happy when I arrived and was told that the internet cost $12.50 (plus tax) in this hotel. I booked using hotels.com, and this wasn't clear from the description. The walls are paper-thin and so you hear a lot of noise at night and in the morning. I'm a heavy sleeper, but still this bothered me. The hotel is an old charming one, but the rooms are a bit stale. Given the high price, I'd expect better room condition and not charging for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Karo_Bart
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Boston so we were looking for a conveniently located hotel. We wanted to be within a walking distance to all major attractions. So, when we found a deal ($ 96.75 for a queen bed and valet parking) at this hotel we booked it, but not without a fear because of the mixed relieves of this place. We were only hoping for the best. We were not disappointed and to be honest the whole experience was much better than we expected. Upon entering the hotel we knew we made the right choice. The foyer is stunningly gorgeous with massive chandeliers. It is an old grand, historic hotel with an old fashioned dÃ©cor. It is not shabby in any way but well-kept indeed. We stayed in the queen room which was spacious enough, had the comfy bed and a nice view, and although the bathroom was small, it was adequate and looked like it had been recently remodeled. The location of this hotel is perfect. It is almost next to Public Garden/ Boston Common and 10 min. stroll either to Beacon Hill or Prudential Center. If you are not keen on walking there is a subway station (Arlington) approximately 150 feet away from the hotel. If I were to visit Boston again I would definitely stay in this hotel once more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: Amy737
Reviews.Content: Me and My boyfriend stayed at the Park Plaza for 2 nights. Arrived a little after 3 to check in and found quite a long line, but suprising was checked in within a couple minutes. Like some other reviewers stated, there didn't seem to be any bellman on duty, but I have no issues handling my own luggage. We went to our beautiful room on the 6th floor, which included a queen size bed, a large flatscreen tv, a Keurig coffee maker, and a nice desk. The room was pretty spacious, but the bathroom was a little small, but there were no issues. This may have been one of the cleanest hotels I've ever stayed at, since I'm a self proclaimed hotel germaphobe and can notice anything wrong with the room, lol, I saw nothing that irked me at all. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Boston, it may be a little pricey, but for the location, just blocks from shopping at Newberry and Boylston, and a couple blocks from the Freedom Trail and the cleanliness of this beautiful historic hotel, it is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lyn H
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the towers section in July 2011. The rooms were well appointed with robes, tolietries and a few extras. They were a bit small as to be expected in the city. The fitness area was functional and the staff was very helpful. It's a perfect location for walking around downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: Imajerseygirl3
Reviews.Content: We looked and looked for a king suite in Boston-found the plaza and they had a great deal going. Under $200 per night for a jr suite with king bed (plus sofa and chairs). This also included valet parking. Very specious room with corner location and fabulous large windows for a beautiful view. Couple things fell short-bathroom is small, no question. And except for the closet, there was no dresser to put clothes. Strange as there is a huge tv cabinet in the room but the new tv sits on top, not in it. Simple elegant decor...very old style which was fine with us. No in room fridge and we had to pay or wi-fi. So, not the perfect place for those wanting fancy upgrades. But, it was spotless and to have the space and the beautiful corner room at the price, it was well worth it or us. We would most definitely stay here again. A wonderful value!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Diane D
Reviews.Content: Please read this before you consider staying at the Boston Park Plaza Hotel. It takes a lot for me to sit down and spend time writing reviews, but this hotel was so horrendous that I actually took three hours out of my schedule to write this and create an account here so that I could hopefully save one person from booking a room at this joke of an historical hotel. My boyfriend had a meeting he had to attend in Boston, and had never stayed at this establishment. Not thinking to read the reviews, he booked the hotel for 5 nights. A little background about us: I am what I would consider an unconventional student. I attend a very prestigious school, and during my time off, I like to â€˜road tripâ€™ around the country, and do some storm chasing, which, more often than not, leads me into having to stay at roadside hotels and motels, from chains big and small. Iâ€™ve stayed in every type of establishment imaginable, from small mom and pop motels and Motel 6â€™s, to midgrade Hilton Garden Inns and Hampton Inns, all the way to five star hotels such as select Hyatt and Hilton-branded properties. My boyfriend is long finished with his education, and has traveled all over the world and also has quite a bit of experience with hotels. I think that we can both honestly say that this was, hands down, one of the worst, most tacky hotels weâ€™ve ever encountered, and definitely a poor value for the price. This hotel is sold as an â€œhistoric, 1920â€™s era hotelâ€�, and so of course, youâ€™re expecting the charm of the 1920â€™s days of excess combined with modern amenities. That is not the case. Itâ€™s as if this hotel strives to save as much money as possible while charging as much as possible to its customers. More on this below. My boyfriend and I arrived and checked into our room. It was a standard double room, with two beds (probably tmi but he moves around too much while heâ€™s asleep, so we often end up sleeping in separate beds). The first thing we noticed is that the 1920â€™s era door to the room would not close all of the way, and he literally had to run into it to get it to close. The next thing we noticed was the bathrooms. The toilets and tile appear to be original (there is no toilet tank, just a handle and a seat). The bathtubs are original but have had a recast put over them, so that the hotel could forego the cost of replacement, giving the bathrooms that â€˜mobile homeâ€™-esque quality that we all seek in these fine establishments. The next thing we noticed was that the wallpaper was peeling off next to the tub, and that the border tile was coming off as well. Next to the tub was an old radiator, and the dial had been replaced with a more modern thermostat. The wire leading from the thermostat to the radiator had been partially caulked into the edge between the shower tile and the thermostat, leaving about six inches of it exposed. Right on the edge of the bathtub. Let me explain two reasons why this is wrong. Depending on how the thermostat works, the wire either carries an electrical current, or is used more or less as a mobile â€˜pullâ€™ to adjust the temperature settings in the radiator (i.e., turning the dial one way or another tightens or loosens the wire, thereby changing the temperature of the radiator). So if this wire actually carries an electrical current, and is right on the edge of a bathtubâ€¦ obvious electrocution hazard. If this wire is used simply as a mechanical feature, well, half of it was caulked into the edge, leaving it immobilized and unable to properly function. Please correct me if Iâ€™m wrong with these assumptions. Moving on, I filled the tub, and apparently the secondary drain wasnâ€™t working, which led to the entire floor in the bathroom flooding with about a quarter inch of water. Nice for me, because my bag of clothing was on that floor, so now I would have to launder every piece of clothing I had. The bathroom sinks are pedestal sinks (as was common in the 1920â€™s), but were not original. There was virtually no counter space to set your toiletries, aside from a small area underneath the mirror. The toiletries provided by this hotel are from a â€˜concept brandâ€™ (i.e., more or less an off- brand in its marketing test phase) and really are not any good. For the price we were paying for the room, we were expecting to have somewhat recognizable brands; however, I brought my own toiletries so this was not a huge issue. The next thing we noticed was the furniture. Again, one of the hotelâ€™s selling points is that it is an historical, 1920â€™s era hotel. I understand that the furniture would probably not be original, but I was hoping at least that it would be somewhat of an imitation of 1920â€™s styled furniture. It was not. All of the furniture is this somewhat hideous, somewhat mismatched particle board disasterpiece, and none of it even closely resembles pre-depression styles. The overall layout of the room was unique, but it had its own problems as well. Trim and crown molding was coming off of the wall (and in some places, was entirely absent), and there were large chunks of paint cracking and peeling off of the wallâ€¦ Everywhere. The ceiling was also cracking. The walls were paper-thin (room service was ordered in the room next door, and we both kept checking our door because we thought we had heard a knock on ours), so we didnâ€™t sleep well at all.
