The wall art consisted of framed photographs (something Iâ€™m sure wasnâ€™t the decorating norm for the 1920â€™s), probably because itâ€™s cheaper to reproduce and frame photographs than to commission an artist to produce reproductions and place them in the rooms. Housekeeping wasnâ€™t â€˜terribleâ€™, but you canâ€™t really fairly judge the housekeeping when the hotel room youâ€™re paying a premium for in Boston would be better situated in a slum in Beirut. Itâ€™s kind of like finding the decomposing corpse of a prostitute in the forest, and complaining about how its eyeshadow looked. Honestly canâ€™t think of a better analogy. We found a pretzel underneath the set of dressers upon which the television was situated. There was hair in the bathtub and the shower. And the fees with this hotel, dear God the fees. They will charge you for ANYTHING and EVERYTHING. Want a minifridge? Expect to pay $25 for this, and expect it to not be delivered for over an hour, and expect the deliveryman to BEAT DOWN YOUR DOOR to get you to take it (donâ€™t worry though, the minifridge had plenty of its own beatings from the looks of it). Want internet service? $12.50 per device, per day. Have a computer and a phone you want to use wifi on? Doesnâ€™t matter. $12.50 each. As an aside, donâ€™t think about using your cell phone here, either- you will NOT get service, and you will have to use the roomâ€™s phone to make calls. Want to make a call? That will be $2.00 for each call, even toll-free calls, plus a premium for any minutes over 60 minutes. Want to print something downstairs in their complimentary business center? That will be an additional charge. Want to bring home a gift to the wife? How about a gift set consisting of a full-size bottle each of our off-brand shampoo and conditioner for $30 (they *actually* advertise this in the roomâ€¦ t.a.c.k.y.)? I appreciate how this hotel tries to bill itself as a high-class establishment, but then has the audacity to attempt to sell you full-size bottles of its off-brand shampoo and conditioner for $30.00. Want to relax while youâ€™re here and catch up on some TV? Donâ€™t expect to have many of the advertised premium channels. No channels after 39, even though they advertise somewhere around 50. Want to actually be productive while youâ€™re here? Donâ€™t. I guess this hotel figures that since they didnâ€™t have internet and fully functioning phone service in the 1920â€™s, thereâ€™s no need to offer it now. Thatâ€™s about the only thing this hotel keeps as a tribute to that era â€“ obsolete technology. The internet costs extra and was of poor quality. If you want to make calls, thatâ€™ll be an additional charge, and donâ€™t expect the phones to work either. The cordless phone was absolutely nonfunctioning, and the corded phone had a somewhat busted earpiece, so that I had to continuously ask the other party to repeat themselves. Overall, this establishment is pretty run-down, and will probably never realize its potential. Donâ€™t let the appearance of the lobby mislead you- the rooms are disastrous and in need of true rehabilitation. I felt embarrassed for the original proprietors of this hotel after I stayed here. I would be willing to stay again, only if the hotel was sold to new owners and actually, legitimately restored. Otherwise, I wouldnâ€™t stay here if I was paid to. Iâ€™d give this hotel negative stars, but you have to give at least one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, in the right place at the right price!”
Reviews.Author: TaurusSaurus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on Jan 2, 2012. I booked the hotel after much debate after reading mixed reviews on TripAdvisor, Google, and other travel sites. However, for a price of $102 for a Deluxe King Room, I couldn't argue. Our room was on a corner of the building and was sizeable. The linens were fresh, the bed seemed fairly new, the carpet was plush and everything was really clean. They even had a sizable LCD TV, with actual HDTV. Most places you go have the LCD TVs, but regular standard def. Anyway, the room was perfect for what we needed, a place to relax in the evening and get a nice night of sleep. I didn't encounter any issues with the thermostat, I simply lowered the temperature to 68 and it was perfect. I could even cut off the heating/cooling unit, had we gotten too hot or cold, so those complaints from other reviewers are unfounded. Complaints about the bathroom are valid, it was pretty small. Barely enough room for the shower, toilet and sink. However, being a guy I don't have an issue with it, as I shower, or use the sink and toilet and get out, and don't plan on spending hours at a time in front of a mirror. For that, it was adequate. Also you should remember that this hotel was built in the 1920s, so its historic and things may be small. In the end, this hotel is a great spot to spend a few nights. Its got a great location, its relatively cheap, and its easily a 4 star hotel. Is it 5 star? Definitely not on account of the bathroom. I feel like some people may be a bit picky on this site and expect a Ritz Carlton. The fact is, the price is much lower than many other hotels in the area, so any 'issues' you may run across are compensated for. Also, the complaints about $12.50/day for wifi are valid, BUT you have to remember EVERY other hotel in Boston, as well as most chains - Marriott, Hilton, Ritz Carlton, charge that amount or more for wi-fi. Its a way for hotels to make money. Back in the 80s-90s they made it off of phone calls, but now with cell phones they have to make up for it somewhere. If you don't like it, go to a Starbucks, McDonalds or get a smart phone like the rest of the country.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Rooms, Historic Charm is disastrous”
Reviews.Author: Rachelle G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Boston Park Plaza hotel this past weekend for two night, New Years Eve and the night after, 3 days, 2 nights. I will first say that we have stayed at other historical hotels in both Boston and Providence and have never had an experience like this. I will start with the Pros. Pros: The location. Cons: Everything Else. â€¢ The bedding â€“ there was a flat sheet, tucked around the mattress, disguised as a fitted sheet. Then another flat sheet. Then, a duvet with no duvet cover and another flat sheet laid on top of it. When you peel the bedding back, you essentially end up sleeping on an exposed duvet, thinking, who else has slept against this? â€¢ The historical charm â€“ while beautiful in the lobby, is disgusting in the room. â€œMaintenanceâ€� is considered piling layers of thick paint upon each other that chips, peels and ultimately looks like the paint job of a slum lord. The tiles in the bathroom are missing, and then the holes filled with gunk (which is a construction material filler). The crown moulding was butchered. They had chopped it in a variety of places and then either not seamed it together, or done it unevenly. Next time you do a historical restoration, hire a contractor who does historical restorations. â€¢ The HVAC â€“ Doesnâ€™t work. Not much else to say. Itâ€™s either off or on, but not really doing anything either way. It was comfortable during the day and sweltering hot at night. And you again begin thinking about that duvet as you sweat through the night. â€¢ The security â€“ is overbearing. It was New Years Eve. Room service closes at 11 PM. So we ordered a pizza after coming home from the fireworks. We were home before the bars closed and were comfortably changed into pajamas, makeup removed. Security refused to let the Dominoâ€™s pizza man come up to the room. I had to go down to the lobby (which was insanely busy at 1:30 AM) in sweats, with no makeup and face the world, becauseâ€¦the dominoâ€™s guy might have ulterior motives? He was in a full uniform, with pizza in hand. â€¢ TV â€“ There are only basic cable channels, which is fine, but no NESN, so no Bruins. And if was Sox season, no Sox. Youâ€™re in Boston, we like sports. And no pay channel to get a movie. Plus, we only had about 6 channels when we checked in and had to have someone come reset the TV. â€¢ Room Service â€“ All room service is overpriced, we all know this. But this hotel actually thinks itâ€™s ok to charge a separate admin fee and a separate service charge on top of that, without telling you, so that when you sign in haste at the door, the employee gets 40% for taking 40 minutes to bring you a few beers on ice. â€¢ Pairings â€“ The restaurant downstairs. We went for breakfast the last morning we were there. It was about half full give or take. We decided not to do the buffet, because why spend the extra money when we just want one plate of food. It took 40 minutes for each of us to get eggs. Which then came cold. And our server ignored us the whole time we were waiting. Luckily we had the coffee right behind us so we could self serve, but I was about to help myself to the buffet anyway after waiting so long. We spent $50 on a crappy breakfast. We stayed here because it was cheaper than anywhere else. I am someone who likes to get a deal and was excited at the idea of staying in a nice hotel for a good price. This was a weekend getaway for us and while we still had a great weekend, it was no thanks to this place. Spend the extra $30/40 per night and go someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lyn255060
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Boston in March - our first experience of Boston and what a great choice we made in finding this hotel. A very comfortable hotel, very friendly staff and very efficient.Nothing was too much trouble when we asked for recommendations for places to eat etc. Very reasonably priced and if we get the chance to go again I wouldn't even consider looking for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great location, OK accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Linda D
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay in October for a New Years weekend. My husband and I have spent New Years eve in Boston for many years and have stayed at several hotels. I chose this hotel because I was interested in something closer to Boston Common and after reading the reviews decided this was a good choice. I also decided to upgrade our room to a Tower queen which I must say was a mistake. The room and bathroom were extremely small which was very disappointing. Also the water temperature in the shower was tricky to regulate since the water knob would slip. So it was either on the cold side or very hot. My last complaint...a $12.50 per 24 hour WiFi fee!! Hotels of lesser quality offer free WiFi. On the plus side...I will say the staff were friendly and pleasant. I'm not one to complain but If I had this to do over I might have requested a room change. This was not what I imagined or expected.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: Brandon H
Reviews.Content: Pros -Great atmosphere, very festive yet controlled. -Polite workers, very helpful when I need information. -Statler lounge was excellent, had quite a few drinks there. Good food as well, I recommend anyone who stays here to try it out. -Floors were quiet. -Great view and location. Cons -One particular bartender at the lounge was very rude and quite nasty for no foreseeable reason. -The melting pot, an attached restaurant (managed separately from the hotel) gave away the table I had reserved for my friends and I. They apologized profusely and tried to set us up at another location, but we had to wait for over 30 minutes. Rather than wait we decided to leave and spend our money elsewhere. Given they share the same space I felt this reflected on the hotel, if only a little. -The cleaning crew keyed into my room with only a knock and 5 second wait.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Margaret K
Reviews.Content: Stayed for Boston's First Night celebration. The location and two First Night buttons that came with the package made for a great evening. Considering the Park Plaza was busy(fully booked), service at the front desk then at the hotel bar was quick and attentive. The King room was clean, comfortable and good-sized. We noticed the cable tv appeared a grainy standard definition in the room and at the bar. The bathrooms were small but the room had two which made life easier. We did turn the heat/fan off. Using the Valet Parking made sense for us considering the events going on. Not wanting to deal with traffic and having the car ready as we walked out the door the next day was worth it. Will stay again, the experience, overall value and location were excellent..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, an Old Standby”
Reviews.Author: travellerroct
Reviews.Content: We booked rooms at the Park Plaza during Christmas. Wonderful location, just minutes away from the T, Charles Street, Newbury St, the Boston Gardens, etc. And the price was great - a welcome relief from the high priced New York Hotel scene. I must say the heat in the rooms was unbearable. Thankfully, we could open our windows. Also, they charge for WiFi - unbelievable in this day. We went to Starbucks down the street to avoid paying $13 a day. As my husband commented, we did not pay a lot for the room, but it sure felt like the airlines at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “3.5 STARS - Generally a great weekend in Boston at this hotel... with some ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: ChalloLetsGo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Christmas weekend 2011. Overall, we were happy with our weekend. But there were some things that should be mentioned. PROS: -Great location. Short couple walk block to the Boston Commons park. Also could walk to Prudential Center (if it isn't too cold). Right in the same block are at least 3 restaurants, including McCormick's, and Au Bon Pain (which was open Christmas Day, much to our delight). Couple block walk to Arlington T-station. - We were upgraded to a Deluxe King after a tough night (see the first few CONS below) - There is a parking garage across the street, which I believe is $35 or so. They also have value which is $46 a day. There is street parking, but it's not readily available and also it's only 2 hour parking. They do give tickets. - Lobby is very nice and had a great Christmas tree inside. Also has some benches and couches to lounge on. Bar, Pairings Restaurant (which was nice), Business Center with internet, etc, and other standard hotel offerings. - Generally speaking, the rooms were clean and the staff was nice. The housekeeping was helpful in getting us what we needed. The bellhop was helpful and nice as were the doorkeepers and the front desk staff. CONS: - The first night was a bit tough. Though this isn't necessarily the fault of the hotel (perhaps the walls/doors are thin), there were some people talking loudly in the hallway in the early morning hours that woke us up. - The bathrooms in the Standard King room were not updated and not very appealing. - The cleaning staff came into our room before 8:30AM with very little warning. We didn't have a chance to say no, don't come in, and I believe that is too early for them to be coming in to clean the rooms. - I disputed a additional surcharge for parking on my bill that was to be included in my package based on what was told to me by the staff who booked my reservation initially. The manager who I was disputing with would not acknowledge the logic of what I was saying, namely, that there was no way for me to know that I would be charged for this, since it wasn't mentioned to me by the phone rep, nor was it included in my email confirmation. Additionally, he said that I was told by the parking attendant about this charge when I was never told about this charge at all. They need to get their employees in-sync (phone reps, parking, and front desk staff) and their patrons need to be aware of charges that would be charged.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: veffekt
Reviews.Content: Don't expect to check in early, but if you ask they will call your cell phone the minute the room is done so you can walk around the area. There are numerous restaurants in the vicinity including less expensive options for breakfast, etc. The hotel is large and somewhat old (the room door is vintage and is not that sound proof) but the hotel is very clean, comfortable, and I experienced no problems with service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: myyaya
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room with two double beds and were given a free upgrade which meant we had separate bathrooms! The beds were really comfortable and the heating/cooling system worked well (we find the systems in some places are quite bad). Breakfast buffet was expensive but there is a Bon au pain next door which is better value. This hotel was located at the bottom of Boston Common. It's about a 20 min walk to Quincy markets but was 2 mins from the Boston Common and Boston Park and is close to Cheers and shopping at Newbury St and Copley Square! This was great for us! Staff incorrectly tried to charge us for a breatfast but it was removed without question when we informed them of the error. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lisa G.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park plaza in room 511 on10-16 to 10-19. Being new to the city and curious to see what Boston had to offer. I made a request at the front desk for a chauffeur. The front desk personnel recomended VlanarTransportation, i agreed. Upon my first meeting with the driver Vladymir I knew i was in good hands, he was nice, knowledgeable, and he arrived 15 minutes early. He gave me a tour and told me more about Boston. Prior to my departure on the 19th of October i was interested in going on the freedom trail, i contacted the company for yet another excellent service. They sent me the same chauffeur, he was early again, flexible and assured me that the company was available 24 hours and i can contact VlanarTransportation anytime. The next time I am in Boston for business i will definitely be staying at Boston Park plaza and contact VlanarTransportation for there reliable service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms are hit or miss”
Reviews.Author: BriWas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in December for several nights as part of a large meeting group. As others have reported, the main lobby space is grand, although I wish it had more seating surfaces for waiting (just a few wing chairs scattered about in a large space). Check in and check out were fast and efficient, and staff was friendly. Overall it was an OK hotel, but nothing to get excited about (except for the location). I stayed in two different king-bed rooms, both of which were quite roomy and had good-sized bathrooms. However, I believe both rooms were handicap-accessible rooms, which may have had something to do with the size. Both were interior-view rooms, with only a view of the other side of the hotel. The rooms were decently appointed, although nothing special. I've had just as nice rooms in a Comfort Inn (maybe even nicer). The king-size bed was comfortable, though. The reason I switched rooms was because of the heating issue... despite turning the thermostat way down it was still almost 80 degrees in my first room. The second room wasn't much better, and I resorted to opening the windows to try and cool things down a bit (but which let in a lot of city noise). Because it's an old hotel the HVAC is either on cool or on heat, and once they turn it to one or the other depending on the season that's all you get in each room. I don't expect to have AC in December in Boston, but I do expect to be able to cool my room down from 78 degrees in order to sleep. I was disappointed by the inability of the front desk to answer their phones, too. Twice I called to try and get the heating system worked out, and both times I was dumped into voice mail while calling "Guest Services" from my room phone. In both instances I had to physically go down to the desk, only to see several staff standing there with no guests in line. I've never had such a problem reaching a live front-desk person. Finally, their conference service was OK, but not the on-the-ball, "how can I help" sort of service that I've experienced at other venues. The meeting room was not freshened-up all day, and empty water pitchers sat on all tables without being refilled (despite me asking a staff person to fill them up during a break). Wireless Internet was hit-or-miss and expensive in the rooms and meeting rooms. Cell phone service is also challenging in many interior locations, probably because of the age and construction of the building. Food during the breaks was pretty good, though.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, elegant and caution”
Reviews.Author: jayzeeDE
Reviews.Content: There is much to be said about this hotel that is great. The location is excellent - the lobby is old world style elegant and well-maintained. The front desk staff is very helpful and courteous -might be the fastest check-in service ever. We booked a standard king room, which turned out to be two small rooms that had been combined. Good size space in the room, and there were two bathrooms. Here's the caution - they were the tiniest bathrooms I've ever seen. On one side were the toilet and bathtub and no space in between. The sink was at the end of the bathtub. There is minimal counter space and most of it was taken up by the rack holding shampoo, soap, etc, plus a tissue box and cups. So just beware -- not all the bathrooms in this hotel are the same. Bed was very comfortable and there was a flat-screen tv in the room. The view was non-existent - both windows looked out on an air shaft and another building. There was no closet - only a free-standing wardrobe about 20" wide. (The bottom of this was very dusty, as I found out when a pair of dark slacks fell off a hanger.) One inexcusable oversight - I got out the extra blanket that had been neatly stored in a zippered bag in the wardrobe - hence the fallen pants - and when I opened it, discovered that it had multiple holes cut out of it. It looked like someone had tried to remove burn spots but only made it worse. I dropped it on the floor and it was left there the entire time of our visit. Kind of made me wonder if the room ever got vacuumed. I would stay here again because the price was right and location very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “A Boston Treasure!”
Reviews.Author: Haileelynn
Reviews.Content: I went for the Scott Brown Christmas party that I was volunteering at. I live in Salem Massachusetts but it was nice to stay in Boston for the night, I had never stayed in a Boston hotel before! Walking into the building my breath was taken away. It was beautiful. I couldn't believe it. I felt like I was in a movie! The ballroom was amazing and so large! My friend who was also volunteering shared a room, and the beds were excellent, and having separate bathrooms was a dream! Enjoyed myself and I would suggest it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: madskiing
Reviews.Content: Stayed one evening at this hotel. The location is excellent. You can venture off in any direction and do sight seeing, shopping, or dining. Even the hotel has excellent restaurants. Our standard room was roomy and very comfortable, with nice linens.

Reviews.Title: “Real hit or miss - but good location”
Reviews.Author: IJKMan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was built in 1927 and has elements of this everywhere. The room doors have huge bulges where a visitor could hang clothes, that could be taken out the corridor side for pressing by some 1930 servant. And this reflects in the hotel. The common areas have been recently been refurbished and are very nice. Corrridors are beautiful as are main conference areas. The rooms are another matter. - Firstly there is the size. I got a "queen" sized bed, which seem considerably smaller than other queens I have slept in, - But the mattress was newish ang good - The rooms vary hugely is size, see the enclosed floor plan pic from the back of the door. - Air con did not work, it made horrible noises and the maintenance team arrived to mend it and did this by turning it off. Luckily windows open. - The carpets, fittings and bathroom have not been touched in years. Watch out for static discharges from the carpets, it is monstrous. All in all mixed bag, if you get a decent sized room, on an upper floor you an open the window you can sleep without too much noise from the street. Other rooms

Reviews.Title: “Hit or Miss”
Reviews.Author: sgerlak
Reviews.Content: The Boston Park Plaza Hotel is in a terrific location and the lobby is beautiful. We booked a double well in advance of our visit. When we arrived, there were no doubles available, and we were offered a room with a queen size bed and a roll away bed. The room beautiful -- if dated -- but it was the exact size of a postage stamp and it looked out to a brick wall. The only place to put the roll away would block access to the bathroom. Back to the front desk we went where there was much lip biting and delay. After my demeanor shifted from understanding to assertive we were finally given a corner suite, which had an AMAZING view, huge living-sleeping area with fold-out couch, coffee table, three or four arm chairs, potted palms, fridge, king sized bed, bath with double sinks and separate toilet-bath area with giant square tub. All of the furnishings were somewhat dated, but we could have hosted a cocktail party with all the space. The bed comfort was fantastic. The fold out couch, not so much. TVs are old school console models. Parking is not provided by the hotel and is a to-be-expected high city rate ($35/day, no in and out). To be expected. We didn't dine at the hotel. Taxis are lined up outside and the T is nearby. So much is available within walking distance. Having seen two rooms, I was startled by the contrast. I would definitely stay there again but I would insist on a room on a higher floor that has a view. The small room would have been fine if it had the terrific view that the suite had and if we didn't need space for an extra person. Shop price as there was a huge variability between the hotel site and some of the travel sites. We got the best rate using hotels.com (at least $40 less than the others). This would probably not be a great place if you are travelling with children, but the "old world luxury" vibe made for a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.. Fair Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tracy613
Reviews.Content: A rehab and lovely keeping of original fixtures and styles in the grand open spaces. Only the small rooms are in need of actual updating not the facelift they are getting. Steps away from Boston Commons and within walking s=distance from Newbury St Shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Lovely Bed”
Reviews.Author: julie45
Reviews.Content: After reading some poor reviews I was inclined to change the reservation to another hotel. Im so glad I did'nt. The location really is great and you can walk everywhere. Our room was spacious and spotlessly clean with the most amazing shower. We did get ripped off by the taxi driver charging $45 dollars from the airport! I had done some research and said to the driver that seemed excessive to be told its a set flat rate! He also had'nt put is meter on like a fool I gave him a tip too. So be mindful it should only be about $20-$25 dollars. We ate in the irish bar and food was ok and the staff friendly. Hotel bar not has friendly and not particularlly welcoming. Plenty of nice bars and restaurants around. We particularly liked the restaurants around the prudential centre and the top of the hub bar with amazing views of the city. Overall loved it and would return

Reviews.Title: “Tired rooms in a good location”
Reviews.Author: griangraf2001
Reviews.Content: The Park Plaza was obviously very plush in it's day but is now showing major signs of tiredness. I was in a small room, just enough space for a double bed and a desk. My colleague, who paid exactly the same rate got a room double the size, so maybe I was just unlucky. Bed extremely comfortable, best I've slept in for ages. Internet is $13 a night and isn't good enough to hold a video skype conversation. No wireless so stuck to the desk. :( Dead handy for shopping, Chinatown and convention centres. Arlington T station right outside.

Reviews.Title: “Attended a meeting here. Left a bit to be desired.”
Reviews.Author: MdTravelerX2
Reviews.Content: Attended a 4-day meeting here. The conference staff seem to not know how to feed a crowd of 400 efficiently. The food was good but one had to stand in line and wait a long to be served from the buffet. Most of the breakout meeting rooms are long and skinny, making slides hard to read from the back. The Imperial Ballroom is gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Problems & advice”
Reviews.Author: Catherine M
Reviews.Content: I was placed at the property by a magazine I was shooting for and they pre-paid my room. When I got there they asked me for my credit card. I don't give hotels my credit card because I've had bad experiences with the situation. I told them I did not need charging privileges or they could use the c card already on the reservation. They said they couldn't do it and they could not check me in unless I give them a card. They finally agreed to let me leave $50 cash. Not sure what for. The room was small and there was no heat when I arrived. I finally found the thermostat behind the tv but you could not reach it or see it because the TV was bolted to the table. I attempted to call the front desk but when I picked up the phone it was so filthy I couldn't bear to put it up to my ear. The bathroom saw so small I couldn't turn around in it and the shower stall had insect holes with debris in the corner. I have to say our maid did do a good job of cleaning except for the phone which looked like it hadn't been used in 10 years. Parking there is a scam $46.00 a day. When the there is a garage right across the street on Saint Jame's Street for $14.00 on weekends or check with Bestparking Boston website for better rates. The St James Garage is great because you can go back to your car if you need to as it is self park but heated and you do not pay till you leave so it is more secure. Also, it was very noisy and as I put the key in my door two huge sounding dogs barked and scared the Bejezus out of me, but I didn't hear them the rest of the nights because the constant sirens drowned them out but I have NEVER heard of dogs being allowed in such a hotel. PS Maggiano's & Finale across the way are great!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Downtown Boston Room”
Reviews.Author: HoboHealth
Reviews.Content: 1 night stay for us after a concert - fun because we both attended college in Boston and never went into the Park Plaza. Room was clean but tiny and parking is either really expensive or a pain - we chose the latter by attempting to find street parking and drove around for an hour in rush hour traffic. It ended up working out for us though! Loved the hotel and all of its history.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and clean”
Reviews.Author: Calinva
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Boston before and I was travelling via train. This was a weekend getaway for my husband and I. First of all this is 3 blocks from the amtrak train station and very centrally located. The hotel was very clean. I stayed in a petite room, it was tight, but we were out and about all day long, so it was perfect for my hubby and me. The reception staff was very short w/ us, not very friendly, and I'm not one that needs to be pampered, but can I get a smile?? The concierge folks were friendly. Only thing was, as soon as we walked into our room, it felt like a sauna!! We turned down the heat, that didn't work, we opened the window, luckily the weather was incredible this weekend so opening the window was an option, I would have been miserable otherwise. Again, we contacted the front desk, nobody ever showed up, but we were never in the room, and the cracked window did the job. The hotel may seem outdated to some, but its a historical landmark, even with the new flatscreen TVs and new insert tub (kind of funny for place of this "caliber", but whatever....it was spotless!!), i think they want to keep the old world look, which is fine, very pretty decorated for Xmas by the way. This hotel is literally one block from Boston Common, main park and beginning of Freedom Trail. You are also 1 block away from the famous Newbury St and all of there high end shopping. Well we weren't there to shop, more to sight see. Theres an expensive, but super yummy dessert restaraunt on the first level, Finale. So overall it was a good experience. If you want a mix of the shopping and sightseeing, great location, plus again 3 blocks from the amtrak trains. And if you've never been, you can honestly walk anywhere, we made it from this hotel to Quincy Market in 20 minutes. All the maps I had made everything seem far, but if you have some good walking shoes, everything is right there.

Reviews.Title: “Call in the makeover team”
Reviews.Author: Bronxglenn
Reviews.Content: Obviously been a grand hotel in it's heyday, BUT, that was a long tome ago. The pictures are great but it's quite a bit shabbier in reality. Plus Point, the staff were really friendly and gave " GOOD OLD AMERICAN SERVICE ". I HAVE STAYED IN PLACES A LOT WORSE BUT I REALLY DID EXPECT BETTER IN AMERICA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: tbrad82
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend. The building itself is interesting and historic and had a certain charm. It is also in a great location, walkable distance to the Boston Common and there are plenty of restaurants around. The room was cozy but a bit old. The staff was very helpful to us and it's easy to grab a cab back to the airport. The temporary fitness room was pretty good: fairly spacious and with a several treadmills. The main drawback I found was that a felt I was being nickled and dimed. WIFI was availble for a cost of about 10$ a day. I"ve been to cheaper motels that offered such service for free to their guests. Also, the ATM on premises charge $4.00 per use. I fully expect to pay a fee when not using one of my own bank's ATM, but $4 seemed high. I've seen NYC convenience stores, not known for being customer conscious in terms of price, that charged a much lower rate. Not a big deal, but I think they could do better by their guests with that ATM. I'd consider staying here again, but I'd also look around, too.

Reviews.Title: “Grande Old Dame in want of a redo”
Reviews.Author: wombat1223
Reviews.Content: I remember having my high school prom at the Park Plaza and thinking it was the most elegant hotel ever. But now, 25 years later, the gilding is off the lily. It's still lovely but the rooms are very small and it's in need of some modernizing. The bathroom is tiny with only enough room for one person (which is fine since I am here visiting my mom on my own) and there is room for a double bed in the room. The closet is miniscule and the door to the bathroom does not open fully into the room with room to get around the desk. So it's a tight squeeze. Additionally, the heat could not be turned off so the room was literally 79Â° which is not quite comfy at night. But that said, there is a grand elegance to the golden swans on the curved elevator doors, the chandeliers in the lobby and the flower arrangements which harkens back to the age of elegance that the Park Plaza comes from. And no matter how cramped the room is, there is something nice about staying in an historic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A friend picked this place...”
Reviews.Author: Incognition
Reviews.Content: A friend picked this place as my house was under renovation during his visit. Awful service. Crummy rooms with dated interior. Valet service was truly awful - rude and condescending, while obviously being completely low class themselves! Better options in the back bay are The Taj or the Sheraton for about the same price point...

Reviews.Title: “Travel back in time....”
Reviews.Author: LawrieD
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel in the 1930's and 40's which has retained its class and elegance up to present day. Back then, it was a hotel built for the common man to enjoy a taste of the luxury of the upper classes and this spirit is still alive today. The foyer is stunningly beautiful with an enormous chandelier. Our room was a good size with an gigantic bed (standard double) that was comfortable and clean. The TV was big too. The bathroom had an old style to it which suited the building; it was not luxurious and a little unattractive. The walls were a little thin but noises next door did not disturb our good night's sleep. The location is perfect for anyone not on an expensive budget but who wants to be able to reach the city on foot and do it in style.

Reviews.Title: “Bad arrangement and bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Gavin L
Reviews.Content: My stay was supposed to paid by a company, but i found the hotel charged me to my account after I showing my credit while check-in. I arrived in the hotel at 11am and had to wait until 2pm to check in. I won't stay in the hotel next time, extemely bad experience and service.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Curiosity”
Reviews.Author: dweeb123
Reviews.Content: If you have never stayed in a pre-war hotel before (2nd WW!) then this is for you â€“ even if just for the one-time experience. Reminds me of the Abbey Victoria in NYC â€“ affectionately refered to as the â€˜Shabby Abbyâ€™ for a reason â€“ before they tore it down 20 years ago. What â€˜doâ€™ you do if you own a massive edifice in the center of Boston with wide corridors, double doors (for your suits to be placed in and pressed overnight) and bathrooms the same size as the walk in closets. (A 10 x 6 bathroom with less than 2 feet between bath/shower and wall for the small toilet yet wide entrance and huge amounts of wasted floor space.) Massive hotel entrance reception, expensive boutiques and restaurants, wide corridors. Too expensive to modernize the infrastructure â€“ so you emphasize the old world charm on the hotel video - and hope the AC works. Mine didnâ€™t. Would have been O.K. if the windows opened; as they had indicated on the reservation confirmation but they were blocked closed. No jumpers here. I suspect I know as to why this was dropped from the Starwood/Sheraton Hotel chain around May 2011. Perhaps a little too much of a curiosity for the modern world even with the Ethernet - which the receptionist denied was available (?), Keurig coffee maker and flat panel TV. But, the peeling ceiling in the corner, the water that was warm/never hot, the non-functioning AC and the double charge for the Internet made it less than a perfect experience - quaint or not. I was a tad surprised at the cost for such an experience and will not to stay here again. I guess thatâ€™s personal taste. Squeezing in between bathroom door and sink with huge expanse of entrance floor space behind me I realized I just prefer to live in the 21st Century and this was too much 30â€™s. If you like old chandeliers, brocade, ornate gold colored molding etc, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great era hotel”
Reviews.Author: dianeinhebron
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, marble lobby floors, areas to sit and play games or have a drink, great beds and very clean. Only negative was the restaurant. On weekends they only offerred continental ($15.00) or full ($25.00) buffet, no a la carte. There was a staff member selling fruit and bagels in the lobby. I recommend you walk across the street to the Raddison Hotel where you can eat their delicious full buffet for only $16.00, or order a la carte.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but only average hotel”
Reviews.Author: oks943idk4
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent but unfortunately the hotel itself is only average. Positives were: location, ok sized room, big bed, big tv, mostly clean Negatives were: noise from the street (despite having asked for a quiet room), small bathroom, no bottled water in the room, charge for internet, pretty decrepit curtains

Reviews.Title: “It was okay.”
Reviews.Author: noboston
Reviews.Content: i went with hundreds of people to Boston for a volleyball tournament end first long weekend of September, 2010. Not everyone stayed at this hotel though. Overall, the hotel was nice, spacious lobby, and it's a big hotel. We had four people in our room, and we had TWO washrooms, but each washroom was as small as your aparemtn closet. It felt it was made for children. I'm petite, 5'4, and I couldn't even comfortably move around in the shower, let alone majority of the people that are even silghtly bigger than I am. I'm sure these were not most of the rooms format, as the hotel picutres on the webiste looked totally different, and other team mates' bathrooms were a bit more spacious. Don't get me wrong either, the rooms were HUGE. There were no mini fridges either, so that was a downer. We didn't get a chance to use any of the amenities in the hotel, so I can't comment on it, but if you are considering this hotel, I would recommend it, just make sure if you are travelling with family members or a group, remember to ask the conceige to not put you in the rooms with the tiny washrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Safety Concerns”
Reviews.Author: Mmissyy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a business conference and was alarmed at the level of concern for safety at this hotel. Upon checking in at 11pm, I went to the room that they hotel staff had assigned me to. After entering the room, I noticed that there was a room service tray on the desk. I then looked at saw a roomkey holder on the bed. They had given me keys to someone else's room! When I went down to the registration desk to inform them of this, the staff member did not apologize but instead asked me if I was sure about what I had seen. Finally he gave me a key to another room that thankfully was unoccupied. Definitely make sure you lock both deadbolts if you stay in this hotel. This hotel is in a great location and has an amazingly beautiful lobby and ballroom space. While the room is in a great location, I was expecting a little more in the room based on the price we paid. I know this is a historic city, so the the size of the room did not bother me. However, I was amazed that my room did not look like it had been taken care of/updated in several years as the bathroom still had old tile, the floor boards were missing paint chips, etc.

Reviews.Title: “I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MRB22
Reviews.Content: I had read some bad reviews about this hotel but as I got a very good deal for one night I decided to take a chance as it was very conveniently located to where we needed to be in Boston. I needed a twin room but on check in i was allocated a room on the 6th floor which had a king size bed only. I called reception and they were very helpful and asked me to call back down for new key card for a twin room. The first room was an 'interior' room and was very modern and seemed to have been refurbished. (What I mean by interior is that the hotel is designed in a triangle shape so the window of this room faced into the windows of the other sides of the hotel). I would suggest this as a solution to the 'noise' factor mentioned in other reviews as I imagine that this room would be much quieter than a street facing room. The decor in the second room was more dated but it was spotless and other than a crack in the sink it was absolutely fine. The room was on floor 12 and we had a view of the city. Yes there was city noise at night but again I think this would be fairly normal to expect as it is located a busy intersection in the middle of a bustling city. I would ask for a higher floor or as previously stated an interior room which would help. I didnt have any great expectations but I was happy with the hotel and its central location to Boston Common more than compensates.

Reviews.Title: “Old, tired, noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChuckNYCUWS
Reviews.Content: Was here for business and stayed Friday and Saturday nights (November 4 and 5, 2011). Was in Room 708, I think. Had a king bed. Room was very warm. Kept the heater turned off. I am usually a very sound sleeper, but the noise from the hallway and the street were unbearable. The windows have absolutely no soundproofing from the outside noise. Every car, horn and person was heard at all hours of the night (and I live in NYC!!). On Saturday night, there was some party in the club on the ground floor. It was packed, and the loud rap music was blaring. I could hear the THUMP THUMP THUMP of the music. I called downstairs about 1 am and was practically laughed at when I requested if they could do something about the noise. The room itself was mediocre, at best. Small, outdated bathroom, with sporadic hot water. There were two phones in the room. Neither worked. Twice I stopped at the front desk asking them to be fixed. Good thing my iPhone has a built in alarm, as I could not request a wake up call. Skip this place. Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: Feej
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Boston Park Plaza over a couple of days in October and was pleasantly surprised after reading many reviews here previously. I'm sure my experience was enhanced by staying in a deluxe king room, which was quite large and featured an amazingly comfortable bed. After arriving very early in the morning (6am), after a total of 30 something hours of flying and lay-overs from Australia, I was hoping that something would be available, but alas, my room wasn't ready. The desk clerk did however, provide me with a key to the business lounge and a locked bathroom downstairs where I was able to freshen up somewhat at get changed. After somehow staying awake until around 4pm, I finally checked in, hit the shower in a very small, but serviceable bathroom and slept through to the next morning. I really only had a couple of issues with this hotel. One was them charging my CC a whole nights accommodation on booking (though I'm not 100% whether or not this was because I booked through AMEX travel), and the other was having to pay for wi-fi even in the foyer. I would think that a hotel this large and charging what they do could at least provide that. As I said before, the bed was super comfy, the rooms I stayed in were clean and the air-con did the job it was supposed to. All in all it was a great stay, and might I say that Boston was beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Gemma M
Reviews.Content: Stayed in before we flew out of Boston. Great location to explore the city if you only have one day. Lovely rooms and hotel. The staff were very helpful. Price was really good in comparison to other Boston hotels. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful historic hotel right near Theatre District, T, and Boston Common”
Reviews.Author: Genny164
Reviews.Content: An old time hotel in the heart of Boston. Expect that the hotel still strives to create the original hotel's elegance of days gone by. Beautiful chandeliers in the lobby tower over the carpets which need to be updated or cleaned. It's location far outweighs any issues of age or needing a facelift. Everything was very very clean. The hotel staff was very helpful. My housekeeper was great and did a great job. Although the room was small, the hotel was built at a time when this was the way things were done. In fact, each room having a bathroom was invented here. It was the most modern hotel around when it was built.The room I had was on the 14th floor with a nice city view. The heat was on and was stifling, but the window opens some. The maintainence personnel came in and took care of the issue right away. They still focus on service. The family next to me found the room too small with their baby and they were moved. Replacing them were some drunk tourists from another country who arrived back at 1am vomiting and talking loudly despite my yelling at them a couple of times. You can hear through the doors in the wall too clearly! So at 1:30am, I called the front desk so I could sleep. I was put on hold and once the history of the hotel started playing...I got out to the lobby in my pajamas to tell them I needed them to take care of the neighbors! The security personnel were immediately dispatched and since you could also hear them in the hallway, he was able to confirm my report. He took care of the situation and they quieted down. I did not eat any meals at the hotel. They have Keurig coffee machines in the room which was great. The flat screen tv should be mounted on the wall in front of the bed. Putting it to the right of the bed makes tv watching awkward. I wish my bed was a bit more comfortable. Perhaps the mattress needs to be replaced? While the bathroom is small, it is clean, the water is hot and most people don't spend the day in the room. The internet in your room is extra unless your wireless laptop is able to tap into another local signal. You can use the internet free in the lobby. I loved being one block from the Boston Common, the Theatre District, the T. This level of convenience far outweighed any of what I would consider small things that are reflective of a hotel 100 years ago. I was paying an off season rate. I might have been more fussy, if I was paying $400 a night. But for the $125 rate, I was really happy with my accommodations. There are also numerous restaurants in the area. Shopping on Newbury St. is a stone's throw away. If you are traveling with children, you may want to ask for a larger room. Since I travel alone often, I am basing my review on frequent travel experience. This hotel is a beautiful historic place and is across from the subway. If you are a tourist, you can get around very easily. I could hear traffic noise overnight even on the 14th floor. If you are concerned about noise, bring earplugs just in case. The baby next door did not bother my rest. Grown adults being idiots the next night did. The sirens of the apparently nearby fire station disturbed my sleep, the people leaving in the morning did not. These things can happen in any old hotel so I recommend that you give this hotel a try. Enjoy the history, location, and values available at certain times of year. I am not sure if dogs are allowed. I DID hear a dog barking down the hall near the elevators. There is a small gift and sundry shop in the lobby also a small museum, spa on site, exercise room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Superb Location & history all around”
Reviews.Author: Capeshmitty
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Boston Park Plaza after finding a great deal on Bookit.com. I was very thrilled with the great rate I got but was nervous... Would this be too good to be true? When I arrived it was fantastic! Lobby is beautiful and busy. Check in was a breeze. Rooms are small but the hotel was built in the 1920's and I didn't need much room. I wasn't there to stay in the room all day anyway. The location cannot be beat! Close to public garden, Newbury Street shops, the T train stop, tons of restaurants and the State house. Also the upgrade to the tower level is worth the extra $$$, Plus, I found great parking much cheaper than valet on Tremont next to PF Changs. $20 per night vs $44 from the hotel. 2 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, although the bar policy could be more friendly”
Reviews.Author: KathrinaO91
Reviews.Content: I love the location. The hotel is near a T station, the Boston Commons and within walking distance of at least 4 great dining options. My room was charming; the Park Plaza is an historic hotel. It is beautiful, gracious, well-outfitted (wireless, hot, steaming shower). The bed was comfortable, there were no hallway sounds. However. I was not permitted to take a glass of wine to my room. "No take out wine, ma'am; room service only". "Why?"... no one knows. I'm trapped in the worst hotel bar ever. OK, not the worse--the bartender tries to keep my entertained (why didn't I bring a book?????). Sigh. Without the restrictive (and no-fun) bar, this hotel would be a "5" in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good beds. That's about it.”
Reviews.Author: ccctravels
Reviews.Content: The hotel really needs an update! But if you want to be in a central location it will work. The problem is that there are so many other nice hotels in this area. The room is dated and the bathroom is old and tiny! So many little things that are a turn off..plastic cups like in a motel, plastic shower, the ac didn't work. The bar was so worn out and the closed at 11:30pm..even though it was packed.

Reviews.Title: “well located and full of history”
Reviews.Author: AoftheManor
Reviews.Content: An old hotel and full of character in such a good location. It is a little tired, but still retains its charm and is very spacious offering everything you need. Our room was fine and very clean. The restaurant attached was very good, and ideal as we had been out in the city all day, so it was nice not to have to go out again in the evening, but just enjoy a very good meal in a relaxed way. We picked up our hire car to continue touring the next day and it was just around the corner from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “10 years overdue for an update”
Reviews.Author: HalleAndTheWorld
Reviews.Content: The Boston Park Plaza has a beautiful shell, but the rooms are in desperate need of an update. The shower was straight from the 60s, with a temperature reader to boot. It took us 20 minutes to figure out how to use the old-fashion contraption, just to find brown water (which was apparently was fault of the city and not the hotel). I will say that the location is superb and the beds are super comfy.

Reviews.Title: “I was a total skeptic until I stayed here”
Reviews.Author: C H
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the negative reviews, I was less than thrilled when my boyfriend booked this hotel. I went in expecting the Bates Motel and found the exact opposite: Clean: Very. Service: Friendly check in staff at 1am. Hot water: Very hot. Heat: Worked. Room: Bigger than rooms in New York hotels. Bed: Super comfortable. Bathroom: Had a tub and shower. There's not enough room to do aerobics, but honestly if you're not an elephant I don't see what the problem is with the size of the bathroom. Flat-screen TV: Yes. Why this matters I don't know. Noise: Could hear hallway noise but it wasn't too loud. We had an end room (691) and so only shared a wall with one room. If you're expecting the Marriott then pay to stay at the Marriott. This is an old building on the East Coast which means the rooms are going to be smaller than rooms in a hotel in Vegas or on Oahu. With that said, our room was charming, comfortable and really great compared to the other places to stay in Boston for $99 and $129 a night. As for an earlier comment about wires sticking out of the walls...There was a tiny wire (thermocouple) connected to the radiator in the bathroom. It wasn't like electrical wires were sticking out of the walls. After staying in hotels all over the world I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: tripmember888
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a three night stay at a conference, was a bit worried given the negative reviews on this site, but I enjoyed my stay. It's clear that the rooms are different sizes, as might be expected in an older hotel, so this is worth keeping in mind. The Towers rooms were full when I checked in, so I stayed in a large double with two full baths (each with a tub). Room was clean, had an updated LCD TV with a good variety of channels. Bathrooms were small, but I think having two would be especially nice for families. A nice touch was a larger than average room safe that could easily accommodate my 15 inch laptop. My room faced other parts of the building--no view, but I think this helped decrease traffic noise, so I slept well. As mentioned elsewhere, the hotel is in a great location--right near the Boston Public Garden, walking distance to Newbury Street shopping, and is essentially across the street from the Arlington T stop. Valet parking is expensive ($44/day), and really you don't need a car in Boston since the T can get you everywhere. I also agree with other reviewers that the charge for Wifi in the rooms is pretty annoying in this day and age. But overall, I had a good stay. I paid a conference rate of $219 plus tax, which I thought was worth it, particularly given the amazing location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: yopi
Reviews.Content: I decided to attend a conference at a different hotel at the last minute, and this was the closest hotel that had a "decent" rate in the area. After reading the reviews in TripAdvisor, I booked and arrived with pretty low expectations, happy at least I would not be paying $300 a night as everything else available! My stay made me realize that more people tend to post negative reviews than positive ones!! I got to the hotel and was impressed by the lobby. It is an old grand hotel, and though it is not luxurious, it is pretty nice. It is an historic hotel, so the decor is old fashioned, but it is not at all shabby and is pretty well kept. The nice lady at the front desk offered me a free upgrade, and I was given an enormous room facing a little square. The room had two double beds, two bathrooms and a sofabed! (Ok, looked like two rooms without the dividing wall, but actually each one of those rooms would have been pretty decent!). When leaving, I asked for a later check out time, and after checking availability, it was cheerfully granted. I did not use most of the hotel facilities, as I was away all day at a conference, but the hotel occupies a complete block, has several restaurants, and people seemed happy. It was a good experience, and I recommend this hotel. It was an excellent value for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “A historic structure in a historical American city”
Reviews.Author: jjmat
Reviews.Content: The Boston park plaza boast of history. However the rooms and the foyers need need carpets and decor. Furniture too needs replacement. Bedding was comfortable and sleep quality is good. The room needs better sound insulation . restaurants on site are good.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: carolgb328
Reviews.Content: During a recent stay for a conference followed by a few days of leisure with my husband, I paid extra to stay in the towers with high expectations. I arrived expecting VIP treatment and was sorely disappointed with what was offered at the hotel. I was very thankful to be able to check in several hours ahead of schedule, but I was not given any help with my luggage or any information. They simply handed me a key and told me my room number. The website advertises the fact that you will be greeted by a towers concierge and I never saw this person in the 5 days I was there. I had to consult the hotel website to learn where the complimentary breakfast for towers guests was on weekends, because they did not tell me about this or give me the vouchers I didn't know I was supposed to get. It took multiple visits to the desk to get this resolved because I received conflicting information from the front desk staff and restaurant staff. On a positive note, the woman at the general concierge desk was extremely helpful to us. Some of the other conference attendees stayed in the regular rooms and reported that their rooms were tiny. My room was decent sized, but the bathroom was small. The noise from the street below made it difficult to sleep. We would have used our radio to drown it out, but that didn't work. The heat wouldn't shut off one of the nights even though we turned the thermostat down, so we barely slept that night. There were blood stains on one of my shades and the bedside lamp. The housekeeper failed to stock our room with toiletries and toilet paper on some of the days and we had to call for them. We expected better at the price we paid to stay there. The hotel is in a great location. We were able to walk to many popular attractions and restaurants. There is also great shopping within a short distance. The availability of restaurants on the ground floor was a nice touch. It was convenient to stay in the hotel for the conference, but I probably wouldn't choose to stay here for any other reason. If you choose to stay here, come with low expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: LLonTheGO
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel just a few days before arriving and read some negative reviews. Sometimes I think people want a Ritz Carleton experience when paying a fraction of the price. We had a fairly large room with 2 double beds, lovely amenities, good housekeeping. Yes, the bathroom was small, but this is an old hotel and unless they completely remodel and charge triple the price, you just deal with it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly Dirty - But Wait: there's more!”
Reviews.Author: ahegarty
Reviews.Content: It started with no heat in the room - literally - there was cold air coming from the radiators. The thermostat behind the TV didn't work. In the morning I make for the shower - shivering: no hot water. I ask them to come fix the heat and the water. I've got to go to work..... I come back, the heat is on but I notice that someone has moved the tissue box. Two sticky stains on the shelf. I'd also asked for a surge protector - only one unoccupied plug for electronics etc - not there. I call the manager. I go to the bathroom to make sure the water is now hot. It is. I notice 2 hairs in the tub - and since I had not yet had a chance to shower they were not mine - they all seemed quite relaxed about all this. I asked to have the bathroom cleaned. It was - eventually. Then there was the cold soup in the restaurant - we had to go because there was only one hour between meetings. The service was sullen. Cindy the manager offered a glass of wine. Apparently she did not hear we were still working.....we paid and left. Her best offer was to come back for a free glass of wine! The management seems neither surprised nor concerned about all this.....

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, needs refurbishing,bad service”
Reviews.Author: SenSen61
Reviews.Content: I am paying $$$ for a hotel room that does not have a Minibar or cable premium channels or On Demand. The price does not include internet and the speed reminds me of dial-up. The star rating is deceitful. I would give it 2 or 3 stars I would stay here again only if I were paying Holiday Inn Express prices Avoid it

Reviews.Title: “Creepy!!!”
Reviews.Author: NYC200999
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed here, because every other hotel was sold out or a small fortune. I tried to save my company a few bucks. I didn't love it last time, when the room I checked into wasn't clean and I didn't love it this time when the room I checked into had two bathrooms - super weird and creepy. I asked to change my room, the manager first told me to shut the second bathroom door, before accommodating my request. All this place needs is a few renovations, including new bathrooms and new room doors and maybe it wouldn't be half bad. And it might not have seemed as bad if I was traveling with somebody, but being a woman traveling alone, this place is two for two in terms of creeping me out. In the future, I'll definitely book in advance when I can and stay at the Westin or Back Bay Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not aging gracefully”
Reviews.Author: ADM_BayArea
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Boston Park Plaza was "ok"--not horrible but certainly not the standard I would expect for the star ratings and price found on most websites. The real downfall was in the guest bathrooms, they are REALLY showing their age. Beds were comfortable and clean, location is great with a T station nearby and lots of restaurants out of the back side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced hotel, but great location”
Reviews.Author: b_francoeur
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel during a trip in Boston. The room was spacious and clean, but a tiny old. The hall is very large, with several restaurants. There is no parking at this hotel, we use a public parking next to the hotel but it was very expensive (32$ / 24h). This hotel is very well located, you are a quick walk to the commons and to the subway. So I recommend this hotel, if you want to stay downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, not great service”
Reviews.Author: Maudies
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights, got a room upgrade which saw us in a huge room with two bathrooms. When we tried to check in while my husband parked, we were not allowed until he could be there and present photo id! This was ridiculous - I had my passport with the same surname and the credit card he had made the booking on. We had to wait in the lobby (big and v impersonal) for quite a long time until he managed to find a car park - the hotel doesn't have one. We were very tired and this was not a great welcome. Beyond that, the hotel was typical of a big city centre hotel, clean, large proportions and well positioned. Wifi not free.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced hotel, but great location.”
Reviews.Author: teachercat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights for $500. The room was nice size...2 queen. It was clean and comfortable, but tile in bathrooms were cracked, paint was peeling off boards. The room stayed warm and we could not get the air condition to work- room 1040. We ate the Sunday buffet for $25 a person. It was tasteless... I have had a better breakfast at Hampton Inn for free. The front desk was not friendly. I asked to speak to the concierge and the girl at the front desk did not know one existed! Ha!!! The one redeeming quality is that it is in a great location to sight seeing. I will look elsewhere for my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, lacking in personal touches.”
Reviews.Author: mlsrar
Reviews.Content: The Park Plaza Hotel & Towers is an amazing property if you account for its historical aspects, and fantastic location. Given the generally high cost of accommodations in Boston, the Park Plaza is usually priced towards the mid-tier properties. The location is mostly unbeatable. There is a McCormick & Schmick's attached to the property, in the lobby basically. You're a quick walk to the commons, and a short cab ride away from downtown Boston proper. The rooms, at least the selection I wound up with, were quite small. My room had a double bed, small desk/credenza with a 37" LCD, and a small armoire. There was room to maneuver around the bed and walk towards the bathroom. For the price, it seemed tiny. I also wound up with a view of the building across the street, so be friendly and be dressed! The bed was comfortable, and the room, in spite of being downtown, was quiet. The bathroom also lacked soap. I had to call down and wait almost 20 minutes for soap to be delivered, which made an already tight schedule even tighter. Thought the lack of soap was odd. Other than being older, the fixtures were functional, clean, and the property was being kept up. Parking is only available via Valet, $44 plus gratuity. The staff was ambivalent to us, and apparently only responded with a smile and friendliness if you greeted them with a tip. Poor taste IMHO. Overall, if you can find this property for the right price, and can tolerate the small rooms, the tradeoff is the fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting old school hotel”
Reviews.Author: Autumn814
Reviews.Content: This hotel has such a old feel. If you are into modern this hotel isn't for you.

Reviews.Title: “not good....do yourself a favor skip it..”
Reviews.Author: neostigmine
Reviews.Content: My stay was not a happy stay, room is ok, no thermostat, tiny washroom, hot water is on and off phenomenon,rude staff, stuffy room...way too expensive for this...

Reviews.Title: “Old, tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: joycedano1
Reviews.Content: On arrival I couldn't be checked in as there was only one name on the room list. It should have been two names. After showing the front desk lady my reference nr I was finally checked in. When a friend of mine staying at the same hotel tried to call my room nr I was not registered and after complaining, again they forgot to register me, as then my family tried to call me. The room was dirty, especially behind the tv set, it needed a good vacuum cleaning, walls paper thin and bathroom very small. No coffee machine and when asked for one it took a whole day. Very unprofessional staff at the desk. I give it a miss.

Reviews.Title: “had to change rooms 3 times during a 4 night stay”
Reviews.Author: selectivediner022
Reviews.Content: Beware- the walls are paper thin as other reviewers had reported. Breakfast buffet at Pairings was overpriced for mediocre food. Rooms need to be updated. Bathrooms are postage stamp size- door must be closed to sit on the commode. Staff was pleasant but cannot recommend this hotel. The beds & pillows were comfortable. Very little door staff/bellman- use the revolving door as the main doors are very heavy! Looks like most of the reviews are pretty unfavorable- find another place to stay! The pictures on the hotel website certainly make the hotel appear better than it is! Perhaps the Tower rooms are nice- never got to see them!

Reviews.Title: “Can barely describe how disappointing this hotel was!”
Reviews.Author: Steve K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent weeks trying to Priceline a hotel room for the 4 days we would be spending in Boston for a convention. We ended up winning the Park Plaza and were skeptical from the start. We immediately realized the only redeeming quality of this hotel was its location. That's it. You would think a hotel that purports to be higher quality would at the very least offer a complimentary shuttle service to and from the airport for guests. Not so here. Instead, they charge $17/person. Is this hotel so hard on times that the $400-500 it charges guests per night does cover such costs? Also, no complimentary wireless internet service. I've had better at lesser quality hotels. I realize there are some things the hotel can change and cannot. For instance, the hotel rooms were small to say the least. Ok, it's historic. But as long as you keep the rooms this size, at least install thicker walls. I heard every bodily noise/function of the guests next door. The guests on the other side were up partying till 3am. I think someone complained about the noise, and we even saw a hotel agent walk around our floor. Despite the noise, the agent declared "all clear". And the fitness facility was closed due to remodeling. Guess where the temporary facility was. A conference room of the hotel that was the size of a guest room. Imagine 2 treadmills, 2 eliptical machines and an exercise bike crammed into a small room with no ventilation. Thanks, but no thanks. Overall, the location was great, but for such a price, I was very very disappointed. The hotel could have done little things like even offer loaner umbrellas on a rainy day for its guests, which might have made the experience somewhat more palatable. Otherwise, if you have a choice, I would strongly suggest staying away or paying much less.

Reviews.Title: “A rip off”
Reviews.Author: GraftonLaurie
Reviews.Content: Imagine a bathroom so small that you can't grab a towel behind the door without stepping into the bathtub! I kid you not that there was one inch of room between the toilet and the tub and two inches on the other side. I have never been in such a small bathroom. Paint peeling on the ceiling, dingyy decor and a horrible commercial product stench topped with a view of a brick wall--all for $409 a night!! When I brought these issues to the attention of the front desk manager, he was completely unresponsive to my displeasure. This is a place that I would never recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing and overrated, but great location... Keurig was nice.”
Reviews.Author: eddie14418
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, but for the supposed quality and history of service the hotel advertises, we were very disappointed and discouraged from ever staying here again. First thing we noticed upon arriving is there are an unusual amount of hidden fees that are standard in most hotels of this supposed quality. Things such as shuttle : - service to and from the airport is $17 per person. - Internet connection is $11 per day to have in your room, and it is strictly from a ether port connection. NOT WIRELESS! iPads, blackberries, or any other modern Internet device is unable to be used. - If using the business center to access the Internet, you are charged $7.95 for 15 minutes and there were only 2 working older, computers that are on an unsecured connectiion. - Room service was adverstised as 24 hours but ends at 11pm. -Trying to reach the front desk or anyone else for that matter to address a concern was difficult. Phone would ring with no answer. - Alarm clock did not work, and was not replaced per our request. - No express checkout. Great location, historic, but does not keep in step with what the moderate traveler has come to expect from a hotel of the supposed caliber at this price point. Very expensive for such little amenities and low service. Would not recommend !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and faulty renovations”
Reviews.Author: Beth423
Reviews.Content: Just checked out and decided to write my first review. For $493 dollars, I would expect a bath tub, free wi- fi walls thick walls enough to hide the sounds of our neighbor crying all night, and no bare wires near the toilet. I gather they have "modernized" the bathroom heat by running a thin, bare wire from the radiator in the bathroom to a manual control switch. A piece of plastic edging type material covers the wire halfway. Hope your rear end is not wet should you brush against it while taking care of business. Parents please watch your kids!!!

Reviews.Title: “Where's the hot water?”
Reviews.Author: rporter8555
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston for a couple days of business and stayed at the Park Plaza because I got a great rate and was curious about the old Statler hotel. I arrived and checked in without incident, but was put into a twin when I had reserved a queen (yes, they moved me down the hall to a queen room). I had hoped to get a quick hot shower after a long day at work followed by a long flight, but the hot water was only slightly warmer than the cold. I did not call the front desk about that, since something like that must impact the entire hotel and not just my room, and there must be many complaints already, and so I waited until morning when yes, the water was hot again. Various items... The internet was via ethernet cable, 10mb speed, at $10.45 per day. Big flat screen TV but with no in-room movies and limited channels. The large room safe was free and big enough for my big laptop. Nice single-cup Keurig coffee maker (could use real creamer, not the powdered stuff). The bed was great, but the room had a slight insecticide odor. The bathroom had hairs all over the sink, and there was a sound of water dripping above the bathroom ceiling. Nice twin Speakman shower heads with great water pressure. Curved shower rod was not installed correctly, was loose and sagged. The room air conditioner must be as old as the hotel itself, some kind of high pressure "induction air" unit that literally howls when the air valve opens every time the thermostat kicks on, and continues to roar like a jet engine all night long. Finally, this morning, up at 4am to catch the early flight home, and... you guessed it... no hot water again. No time to waste with a call to the front desk, there would be nothing they could do anyway, so a cold shower, cold shave, and off to the airport. If they would raise the rent another $5 they would still be half of what the Marriott Copley rents for, but would that help pay for fixing their hot water heater and upgrading the a/c ?... or is this some kind of planet-saving energy conservation strategy by management? Don't know, but they need to get their act together. Otherwise, this beautiful old hotel has great character and needs some help to keep her alive another hundred years.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but............”
Reviews.Author: gloriajean61
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Park Plaza, but it ended on a sour note. My husband had removed his wedding band to wash his hands and left it on the bathroom shelf. We called security about it, but the housekeeping staff denied finding it. It was his fault for leaving it there, but an honest housekeeper would have turned it in. Other than that we were pleased with the room and staff.

Reviews.Title: “A comfotable stay”
Reviews.Author: Barlers
Reviews.Content: I routed through Boston on my way west and just needed a place for the night, so I chose the smallest/cheapest room. I would have been happy to stay longer as the room was small, but had all I needed - and the batroom was excellent. Arriving in the evening and leaving at 06.30, I didn't get a chance to look around much but it seemed to be a nice older-style hotel. Certainly no problems with check-in etc. and all staff very helpful. This was my first time in Boston so I used the airport shuttle at $18 each way. I had more time on my return trip (at another hotel) and got a chance to explore - on future visits I would use the T (the subway train system) - it runs to the airport, is less hassle and a lot cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing spectacular, but enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: sylvia01
Reviews.Content: Likes: The king room we had was nice- good decor, comfortable, clean, big T.V. Good location- we were able to get to The Common fast and thought walking to attractions and back to our hotel was easy. Decent restaurant nearby. Good bar, great bartender. Dislikes: The room was tiny!- I refered to it as our shoebox. Bathroom was really dated- cracked tiles, squeaky faucets, and overall blah. Bottom Line: We'd stay there again because, overall, it was a nice hotel and it was the least expensive when compared to other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Pick another hotel”
Reviews.Author: NINA B
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place just to drop your bags, fine. If you are looking for good service and quality for your money, move on. Said they would call us when room was ready, did not. Tried to get our bags, three people got theirs behide us when I asked was told to follow him and identify my bags in a room full of bags,then would not let me use cart, told me to wait there he had to use the cart at valet,I did not. Very small room, poor aircondition.Ask twice for wash clothes, in four days did not get them,had to use hand towels. Our room keys did not work, let us in after 20min, repair man said we would have to go back down stairs and see what they could do. Dirty dishes outside our room from 6pm until sometime after 7am. What got me really angry was when I ask if I could see the famous ballroom they advertise, "no it's just for those who are renting it for events" Best thing I can say it is in central location. We really loved Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Pat H
Reviews.Content: Hotel is deceiving on first blush!
