Large, opulent, historic lobby...tiny, less than well appointed rooms, paper thin walls, NO WiFi/internet w/out ridiculous fees (what century are we in?), difficult to find/reach plugs in the room (many did not work) and staff who are not uniformly knowledgeable or helpful. So many little things added up to one major (and expensive!) disappointment, and I would not recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: RelenaShi
Reviews.Content: old fashioned hotel, but very classic. i like the style. the two queen beds in the tower is very spacious. and have access to breakfast for tower customers, with great atmosphere, altho the food was not that outstanding. location is fantastic. min's walk to boston common.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: travellodging
Reviews.Content: The Boston Park Plaza is a large hotel with very small rooms. The air conditioner was loud and did little. Service was the largest disappointment as the hotel seems to be understaffed. Its time to get over their aging reputation as one of the leading hotels in Boston and start making changes. Try one of the many hotel alternatives in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, stuffy, mediocre service and teeny, tiny rooms!”
Reviews.Author: truthbetold_10
Reviews.Content: Based on the reco of a fellow Trip Advisor reviewer, I booked our room in the Towers section of the hotel. The first 2 nights we had a King bed on the 15th floor with access to the "lounge" (which, by the way, has very limited hours - and NO weekend hours at all! What is THAT about?!). This room was so small that my husband and I were literally tripping over each other. To open the closet, the dresser drawers had to be closed! We did call up for a refrigerator and they brought it relatively promptly, thought. On the third night we switched to a double-bedded room, also on the 15th floor- which was MUCH bigger. The parking is $44 a night. We parked across the street for 2 of 3 nights and paid $20 for 12 hours. The concierge only works until 7:30PM on a Saturday night - strange considering this is in the heart of Back Bay. And charging $11 for Internet is beyond ridiculous. Unlike most, we had no problem with the HVAC, but I'm not at all sure the Towers Level was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible/Bypass this place”
Reviews.Author: jeff c
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review from their hotel. This hotel is outdated and I have received better service at McDonalds. On a 75 degree day i called about the air conditioner not working and they said its late in the season and the heat is on. The wall paper is falling off the walls and the bathroom door handles have no screws in them so you get locked in if not diligent in your efforts They advertised free wifi in the lobby which was a selling point to me as I was here on buisness/pleasure trip. When I went to the lobby i asked is their a pass code for the free wifi The staff advised oh that changed 3 days ago. The manager advised that I could walk to Starbucks or pay the 13 dollar charge.. When we first got the room u could tell it was not cleaned after the last guest left ( I will not get into details). To top it off the maid service even put the sheets on backwords. so the sheet was on top of the comforter, a five year old knows better. If your business is fronting the bill it is acceptable but fronting the 350 dollars a night for this is a joke. The location is good, which is its only real salvation. Pay the extra 20 bucks and stay at the "W" two blocks down...

Reviews.Title: “Ruined the whole Boston experience”
Reviews.Author: NEScenicTraveler
Reviews.Content: The initial impression of this hotel was fantastic. Gorgeous lobby, location centered exactly between the two planned activities over the weekend, and a unique room set up. Two bathrooms was a plesant bonus. HOWEVER.... The air conditioner/heat didn't work and soaked the floor. Housekeeping didn't thoroughly clean the room. The Keurig had two used pods in it. The garbage had someone else's smelly socks in it. Don't want to think of what else might not have been cleaned. The staff was less than helpful and didn't apologize when issues were brought to their attention. No one offered assistance with the luggage. Valet told me it would be ten minutes to get my car. I gave them more than twenty and they still hadn't gotten my car. Overall the location of this hotel should place it in high demand but the staff, cleanliness, and overall experience are disappointing. The only low point to my entire trip to Boston was this hotel. Didn't bother to try for any amenities as they were ridiculously overpriced. Also if you'll notice management's responses to all the complaints on this site are the same. They aren't focused on the actual complaints. They are a copy and paste job. I've emailed the hotel directly with my complaints. We'll see what they say.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was disappointing and needs to be updated”
Reviews.Author: travel v
Reviews.Content: We went in and one of the staff members told us that the hotel had been bought by a motel company and that this was there first hotel so they DO NOT know how to run it and are very cheap. They told us that 200 people were fired. This hotel was not clean and had fire hazards because the doors didn't open well. We were in a suite and it was not nice and smelled like dog shampoo on the couch. We asked for a rollaway since it was false advertisement and instead of a king they gave us a full and it looked like a hospital bed. The mattress' were so hard and it was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Lesley30a
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Boston Park Plaza Hotel in December 2010 for 3 nights. The decor in the lobby was lovely as it was just after Christmas so it had a lovely atmosphere! The location was perfect and we were able to walk to the park and surrounding areas with ease. The room we had was a good size, clean and comfortable. We spent a couple of evenings in the cocktail bar and, although expensive, the cocktails and the barman were great! I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms need updating & bathrooms are TINY!”
Reviews.Author: amendoz1
Reviews.Content: We had 2 queen rooms and stayed for 2 nights in early Sept 2011. The hotel is very large and has several nice restaurants inside it. It's also located by the T station which we used ($9 for an all day pass per person). The rooms each had 2 bathrooms however they were TINY. I cannot emphasize how tiny! The toilet was wedged between the bathtub and the wall - there was literally no room between the toilet and tub - as a woman is was not comfortable. The room needed updating - walls, paint, bathroom fixtures, etc. The bed was comfortable. Parking was very expensive - $44 per night. The front desk was very friendly and helped guide us. Overall, this hotel has the location going for it. Unless the price is around $100 per night (reg price was $180) I'd recommend staying somewhere else (more modern) downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine for a quick visit.”
Reviews.Author: snowchild3
Reviews.Content: I was with my boyfriend and friend...we were only in town for two days. We booked the 'double-double' room which was great. Two double beds and two separate bathrooms. The rooms were clean and quiet. No problems arose, service was friendly. The hotel is in a great location, close to all. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: anijean
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights in September 2011 because I didn't want to rent a car and wanted a place in downtown Boston close to food, shopping and the Commons. I reserved a double bed room which was small but in a charming, cozy sort of way and I was barely in it anyways. My flight arrived at 7:30 am and I went straight to the hotel hoping to just drop my bags and explore the city before check in and was some how able to check in by 8:30am which was AMAZINGLY appreciated, but not something I'd ever presume to expect in the future. The bed was very comfortable and felt larger than a double bed. Housekeeping was extremely quick--I ran down to Au Bon Pain which is right below the hotel and by the time I got back up with my coffee, my bed was made, new towels were in place and the trash was taken out. The view from my room was a building but again, my room was inexpensive and I was there to explore the city, not the inside of a hotel room. I wouldn't stay here expecting state of the art appliances and electronics and if you need to be somewhere chic and modern, this probably isn't the hotel for you. For someone just interested in exploring the city and comfortable walking around, this was a great spot. I enjoyed my time and hope to go back in a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal through Travelocity”
Reviews.Author: Journey80003
Reviews.Content: For the price I paid and the time in the room, it was fine. For the location of the hotel, you wouldn't want to stay in the room for any length of time ( wonderful location) the common areas are nice to stretch out in. My issue was the heat in the room. The hotel services the airline industry and luckily a pilot explained that I needed to request a portable heater for my room. The staff was very accomodating - I asked to switch rooms the second day and had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Modern amenities with old Boston charm.”
Reviews.Author: KsLori
Reviews.Content: What a great staff and location! We were very pleased with our room and the friendliness of the staff. We were upgraded our second night (because we decided to stay another night) to a king suite. It had amazing views and was spacious. Kelly & Carlos were terrific! Would highly recommend to anyone who appreciates colonial charm rather than a "cookie cutter" hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “SO SO”
Reviews.Author: chosun_trader
Reviews.Content: heat was central and was not on initially. Build in 1925 and looks it . LOTS OF MOLD AROUND FLOOR. Good central location. enroute to hospitals. Constant ambulance sirens all night long

Reviews.Title: “Good deal.”
Reviews.Author: RI_Jehanne
Reviews.Content: Got a great price for a room here. It was a small room with a double bed, but for the price & location it couldn't be beat. I did have a problem with the door - I think it was swollen due to humidity and even the bellman couldn't open it at first. Also, TV didn't work in the morning, but as soon as I stepped out of the room it became apparent that all TV's were being replaced. A notice about possible interruption of service would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, underserved, out of date”
Reviews.Author: KWCRB
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite expensive ($400+ per night) and yet fails to deliver on the minimum you'd expect from luxury pricing. The hotel room was fine, spacious even, but the carpet seemed dirty, and my room faced inward, which meant plain viewing into other guest rooms (and vice versa). Oddly there were two bathrooms, but each one tiny, dated and hard to navigate (no surface areas for your things, little room to turn around). Basics were out of place - the room didn't have a do not disturb sign and the power outlets seemed ancient and risky when I plugged in my laptop. Also, at that price point, does charging $12-15/day for internet access really make sense? The biggest frustration came the evening before my departure when I went downstairs to print my boarding pass. They have a dedicated computer and printer for that, which was nice, but the printer was not working. I asked the front desk person for help, and she pointed me upstairs to the business center (as opposed to offering to do it herself). So I went upstairs to try again on printing my boarding pass, only to see that all of the printers in the business center were also out of service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kenzymo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Boston to celebrate out 2nd anniversary, and booked a room for two nights at the boston park plaza hotel. When we arrived they said the room was ready, but when my husban dropped off our luggage in the room it was filled with towels everywhere. We informed the front desk but received the brush off. So after returning to the room that night the towels had been removed so we didn't think anymore about it. Now the next day we started to feel poorly but went out any ways. After we returned we noticed the room was different from the day previous. But we were feeling too sick to make a complaint right away. The next morning we were scheduled to check out and I had developed several rashes and my husband was very sick with an infection in his lungs. So we went to the front desk to file a report. We were given the brush off, but we insisted to speak with somebody. So after about an hour of waiting the head of security came and we filed a report with him. They told us they would be intouch the same afternoon. But we didn't recieve a call for several days. We spoke to one person who told us that he would call back and we have yet to receive his call back. I have tried to call and each time I get a voicemail or brush off. So to say the least we are very upset with the whole experience. :( We do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very shabby and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TheresaJA
Reviews.Content: I'm convinced I was in the wrong hotel as the reviews on here are OK in comparison to what we experienced - however they had my reservation at the front desk so I guess this is it. Very shabby and poor. Felt more like a cheap furnished bedsit in the outer areas of London than a hotel. Smells funny and is all around extremely disappointing. Certainly not worth the price. I asked for a room upgrade and was told I'd already had a complementary upgrade!! The room was a queen about you could only just walk around the bed, the TV prevented you from opening the door all the way and the bathroom was boarding school quality. To be fair on the front desk they very politely upgraded me again to a disabled access queen which meant it was at least a normal size (after mentioning that the hotel was 'historic'). It also didn't smell which was a huge improvement. At $250 a night it's a real rip off, I know it was a last minute booking but come on! My partner and I travel quite a bit and we have stayed in some very nice hotels in New York, Paris, South Africa and various other areas of Europe for less than that. To try and leverage it's 'historic' status as a reason for it smelling bad and been in fairly run down condition? Well that's really just bull.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: BMLNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Got a very good rate through Tripadvisor, stayed in the Towers level, spacious room and comfy bed, though the bathroom was a little small. The safe did not work and the bath drain was very slow - they fixed the drain, and didn't seem to bother about the safe. Because we stayed in the Towers level, continental breakfast was included. The cocktail hour was adequate (wine was expensive) though only cheese, fruit and huts were provided. When we booked this hotel, internet was provided at no charge, but when we checked in, we were told the policy had changed and it would cost $10 a day. We complained and to their credit, it was deducted from our bill. Housekeeping staff were very friendly and cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “What A Dump”
Reviews.Author: 1209surf
Reviews.Content: I spent last night in a Plaza Petit room at this hotel. Besides being ridiculously small and cramped, the room backed up to the elevator bank on my floor. It literally sounded as if a subway train was passing through every few minutes. For $450 (including tax), I expected more. A bathroom that was literally 4'x6. Check. A shower stall that was 2' wide. Check. A view of a brick wall. Check. No cell phone signal. Check. A standard def television that was 10 years old. Check. Did I mention that this match box cost $450 with tax. I've stayed in Hampton Inns that made this place look pathetic. Spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very dignified historic property”
Reviews.Author: Tagger87
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here on the Tower level. They provide a no-host cocktail hour with appetizers each evening and a continental breakfast each morning on this floor. My room was very spacious, although it lacked a proper seating area (two hard-backed chairs, no sofa, although there was plenty of space). Like many historic properties, I suspect that no two rooms are the exact same. The guest services guide stated that Wifi access was included on the Tower floor, but this was not the case, which I confirmed with the front desk. They should correct that in the guide. The closets (two) were very nice sized and well appreciated! Due to some unusual circumstances, I was unable to partake of the Tower floor breakfast, or try any of the hotel's many restaurant choices. When I left the hotel at 4 am to go to the emergency room (due to a mild infection), I was surprised that after telling the doorman that I needed a taxi to take me to the emergency room, all he did was point outside and say that there is a taxi stand to the right... A little concern or assistance would have been appreciated. The location of this hotel was good, close to Newbury Street and not too far from Boston Commons and very close to a T station (subway). The king-sized bed was very comfortable! My room was very quiet, which was nice for a big city, although it did not offer a view. The bathroom was good sized and had some very nice amenities in it. I appreciate that the housekeeper replenished the soaps when cleaning the room.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelLoveMe
Reviews.Content: The location is good, the price is good if you book this hotel earlier. The double room is a bit small but good quality. The staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: Neil00
Reviews.Content: For a medium budget city centre hotel the Plaza is pretty much exactly what you'd expect. The big plus is the location. Convenient for the subway and also for walking into the city centre. We had no need to contact the staff beyond checking in and out, the room was fine and we had no problems. We didn't eat in the hotel, so I can't comment on that. Overall it was, as I say, exactly what I expected from a slightly tired, large city centre hotel. I've stayed in many similar hotels in similar cities and would do so again.

Reviews.Title: “THe best decision we made”
Reviews.Author: Mallard58
Reviews.Content: My wife an I spent ten days in Boston in August. We had upgraded to the Towers floor and were more than delighted with the choice. The hotel has a magnificent lobby and the staff are friendly and helpful without being "in your face". The room was airy and light with superb views over the city . The bathroom, although bijou, was clean with both bath and shower (the latter being one of the most efficient showers I have had in a hotel). Bathrobes and slippers were also provided and there was the added benefit of a fridge in the room. There was also a safe in the wardrobe. Being on the Towers floor we had access to the lounge with complimentary continental breakfast and canapes in the evening from 5pm. Complimentary broadband internet is also available in the lounge. All in all a very enjoyable experience, despite Hurricane Irene!!

Reviews.Title: “I would be upset if I paid full price for this room”
Reviews.Author: Merasheen
Reviews.Content: An unexpected trip to Boston required us to find a room for the night. Trough trip advisor we got a room at the Park Plaza for $240. When I asked if we could reserve the same room for the next night, the rate would be $575! When we arrived at the hotel, we were upgraded to the tower level. When we arrived, the room looked as if it had been used for a meeting in the afternoon (room service trays outside the door and notes on the desk). Other than that the room was very clean. The bed was very comfortable -- but we could not control the room temperature -- even pushing the temp control down to 64, the room never went below 75. As a business traveller, I have a personal beef with high price hotels that charge for internet. We were only in the room for 10 hours, I did not want to pay $10.25 to send out two e-mails. Usually, there is a common area where internet is available. Such was not the case at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable in Boston”
Reviews.Author: JJo-Everett
Reviews.Content: I prefer a warm atmosphere to some of today's modern, almost sterile hotels with their bright, unnatural color schemes and staged-looking decoration. The Boston Plaza is "old world" and "charming" with lots of warmth and character. I loved our room, a Petite Suite--clean, comfy, and cozy. We did not have a view and frankly didn't really miss it for the great price we were able to get. Parked right across the street, on the street, at no cost. The staff were very friendly and offered excellent recommendations. The food in the hotel restaurants was a little pricey for our group, but certainly not out of line with the area. I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel rooms could use a facelift”
Reviews.Author: beachtravelerrrr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a quick weekend trip to the city. From the photos and description on the website it seemed like it would be a really classy hotel. We arrived and found what we expected until we got to our floor. The rooms seriously need a face lift. The bathrooms are old, the TVs are tube style from the 90's and it just felt dated. Our rooms were not ready until 5p after being told numerous times before our arrival that they would be ready by 3p. Once we finally got settled the location of the hotel was found to be great but the breakfast options at the hotel the next morning were limited and expensive - do yourself a favor go to Au Bon Pain. Maybe they'll update the rooms in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Andy B
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here. Having driven from NYC to Boston as a result of H. Irene and the cancellation of our flight, we were hoping this hotel was worth the travelling. We were proved right! Airy, light, very clean and welcoming, and the front of house staff were more than happy to assist us with enquiries during our brief stay. The rooms were larger than expected, the surroundings quieter than we were led to believe. Overall, a very pleasant stay. A true 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well-situated business and tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grassland88
Reviews.Content: This is a well-known old hotel in downtown Boston close to many tourist attractions and easy walking distance to Newbury Street. The hotel is right by the Arlington T station on the Green Line, so very convenient for getting around - just two stops direct to the Prudential Center, for example. It seems to have a typical big city mixed clientelle of tourists, conventioneers and other business types. The entrance lobby is large and quite grand - very similar in many ways to that of the Roosevelt Hotel in New York. The room I had was fairly small and not very light, but was perfectly clean with all the necessary amenities. Unfortunately the hotel does not have free wi fi in the rooms - there is wi-fi in the lobby and you can pay for internet access in your room. The best thing about the hotel was the attached restaurant which had really superb Virginia oysters for a dollar each at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Quality”
Reviews.Author: Creative_Not_Cheap
Reviews.Content: Truly a traditional hotel. Please Please read the history on this hotel. WOW what a story. The rooms are clean, quaint but really nice with old school charm. Do not expect roomy but just what you need. A nice lounge, friendly, professional staff even at 6 am when trying to get a cab for the airport. Thanks guys for the ride $30 for three.. That's a bargain. We just had to ask.... It is a city hotel but at the bargain price of $119 a night through Hotels.com. We loved that it was within walking distance of the market, park and all the shops (if you get tired a cab was only $6 dollars to get back) Sooo worth it!!!. We loved the beauty of the hotel and were very lucky to come across a wonderful restaurant Rustic Kitchen just down the block....What a great restaurant and we felt lucky to be in Boston and coming across a gourmet restaurant which provided a spirit of uptown but with a warmth that the people and food made possible. Yummm please go and say Meda sent you to the owner Jim. Enjoy the Hotel and the restaurant..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Logan6
Reviews.Content: This location can't be beat. Newbury Street shopping, the Public Garden, Du Midi Cafe, Kartell Store, Finale (desserts), metro stop, all within a block. What else could you ask for?.... oh, the Irish pub down the street. The hotel is old which means the lobby is grand and the elevators are many. The hallways are enormous, beautifully decorated and well lit. The elevators run smoothly and often, hardly a wait. My enthusiasm runs out when it comes to describing the rooms. They have not been renovated and you feel as if you are in a 1940's movie, not so bad. Sparsely decorated but the beds are comfortable. The bathroom is very small as is the toilet! But I have stayed here twice and will stay again because it just feels good and everything is at your fingertips. Lots of helpful service. Good room service. Lots of places to eat inside and out of the hotel. And the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “A Mouse in the house!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ttkeith
Reviews.Content: I am so terribly sad for this glorious old hotel! The property has a rich history and is located in the heart of beautiful Boston. Unfortunately, the hotel has not been maintained and was a terrible dissapointment. I arrived late in the evening and was promptly greeted in the nicely appointed front desk and lobby. The bell hop took my luggage as I checked in and he escorted me to my room. The hotel looked lovely, with an old world charm including wide hallways. So far, so good. The first room I was assigned was obviously two rooms that had been converted into one. The room was awkwardly set up and had two bathrooms. Both bathrooms were very small and only had showers, no tubs. The showers were tiny, dirty, and dingy...with tile that desperately needed cleaning. There was even a dirty wash cloth on the floor! But wait...there's more. As I settled in for the evening, I noticed something moving....a mouse! No kidding. I immediately called the front desk to inform them of the critter and requested to be moved. The first person I spoke to didn't seem at all concerned that there was a mouse in my room. The second person screamed "Oh My God"....yeah, pretty much what I thought. Anyway, after two more phone calls they finally moved me to another room and comped my room service charge (kind of lost my appitite!) The second room was marginally better....Again, the odd layout with two bathrooms...however, this time I had two tubs instead of postage stamp sized showers. The room wasn't much cleaner and the bathrooms were both in need of a serious scrub. In addition, the toilets didn't flush very well.... Overall, it was pretty gross. There are so many great hotels in Boston....don't waste your time or money here.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: smilie62
Reviews.Content: This neat hotel is rich with history and in a great location next to the public gardens. The bed was a fluffy dream, though the walls were a bit thin. I'd definitely stay in this grand hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “How'd I end up here?”
Reviews.Author: samabadoll
Reviews.Content: We booked the night before and day of, because we made no prior arrangements for shelter. This happened to be one of the cheapest and convienent places we could find. We reserved online through their site bc it was the lowest price with a AAA discount. The person who check us in, bumped us up to an unused living room suite when I asked for a higher floor. Merry Christmas!! The room was huge and the nicest place I've stayed in yet. It's an old hotel with renovations done within in the last 5-7 years it seems. Elegant but used. The second night we stayed (two days later) the room was absolutley tiny with an old fashioned tiny bathroom and a light switch in an akward place. But that's okay! It was cheap (for Boston), last minute and perfectly comfortable. We laughed at the spoiled kid in the elevator complaining that this Park Plaza didn't have a pool or a weight room (which was under construction). Maybe some people are used to the high life and have extreme expectations. For us it was wonderful. Didn't get to see much of the hotel, or eat at any of the (chain) restaurants because we were busy enjoying our vacation. We could hear people talking in the hall (don't you know we're sleeping!) but not anyone next door, above or below us. Rooms were decently clean but not as immacculate as you'd think, but also very sanitary. Location is pretty awesome. The staff was great except a grumpy lady when I called on the phone who never brought my comforter and shower cap. Oh well. Check out was fast, lots of conventions/weddings, elevators moderately quick. We also left our bags with the bag handler for several hours as we toured before picking them up and heading to the airport. When asked how long he could hold them for he responded "Till next year if you'd like." Sweet!

Reviews.Title: “Needs updates and renovation”
Reviews.Author: butterfly63
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel with charm but the room we stayed in needed updates and a thorough clean! The best thing about our room on the 8th floor were the comfortable beds (2 doubles even though we requested a king) and the fact that there were 2 bathrooms. I also appreciated the black out blinds and the Keurig coffee maker. The cons.. peeling paper in both bathrooms and sockets that did not work. A noticeable accumulation of dust/dirt around the edges of the bathroom. Fixtures were clean but dated and/ or damaged (mirror was watermarked? bathroom socket was hidden behind a tissue box and didn't work). I tried to plug the hairdryer into 2 different sockets that didn't work and one of these was coming away from the wall. We arrived late on the Friday night and there were no rooms left with king beds.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel in prime location”
Reviews.Author: jwb-oregon
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights, as a stopover on way to a wedding in New Hampshire. The floor we were on had been updated, and the paint was fresh. If you want lots of room, go find a suites hotel out by the airport -- with the Park Plaza, you get classic old style, and a location across from the Public Garden and Boston Commons. The room and common areas were clean. Still needs some more updating (e.g., could use a flat screen TV instead of old CRT), but we enjoyed our visit.

Reviews.Title: “"I'm still SICK to my stomach"”
Reviews.Author: itsmeke
Reviews.Content: A/C-heat does not work, however Staff did supply a tiny "space heater" 9-8-11' Toilet flushes slowly and 9-10-11, upon flushing, it EXPELLED the entire bowl of human (my) waste onto the bathroom floor. - Staff (M) offered me a "free breakfast" when I reported the disgusting situation and threaten to have Security remove me from the Hotel when I declined the breakfast offer and pressed the Desk Manager for the Hotel Manager's name and telephone contact information. The Manager's name was given as Rob --, but he couldn't be contacted on a weekend. I had obviously pre-paid or Security might have been needed. I WOULD NOT GO NEAR THIS HOTEL AGAIN EVEN IF SOMEONE HAD ME AT GUN POINT !!! (One of the two "Desk Managers (C. S.) did agree to and accompanied me at my request to the room to witness the disgusting mess in person)

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't expecting a mouse.”
Reviews.Author: Jaime L
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Boston Park Plaza on a Wednesday night because I had a late event and an early train, and the Park Plaza is very close to Back Bay Station. The staff checked me in quickly, despite the late hour, but I was NOT expecting to find a mouse running around the 12th floor when I got up to my room! I reported the mouse to the front desk and they appeared concerned, although I have no way of knowing how they handled the issue. I barricaded myself in my room and was thrilled to be checking out very early the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs, dirty, soggy carpet, and a/c didn't work”
Reviews.Author: Joe G
Reviews.Content: Our one night here was a huge disappointment. There were dead bugs all over the floor, the room was dirty, the carpet was soggy and smelled of cleaner, and the a/c did not work. We complained and they offered us a free breakfast. Wow, what a deal. We declined and they reduced the room rate, but we still paid way too much. This place is a dump and I would never recommend that anyone stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: alwayslove2travel77
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise! We were flying into town at the beginning of Hurricane Irene and had just stayed the previous night at Embassy Suites and needed another place to stay for the second night. We had to find another hotel at the last minute and after quickly looking online at Trip Advisor, found this hotel. The price was so much better than Embassy Suites and it was well worth it. This hotel has a beautiful lobby and was filled with tourists from all over the world and you could hear many different languages being spoken. The room was a little small but very beautiful and had a sparkling clean bathroom!! The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. The only cons would be the view, (it was of the back of the building,) and the concierge. When we asked her about open restaurants (most were closed due to the hurricane and the transit being closed down) she told us there were only 2 open. In fact, when we walked around, we found several open. She obviously hadn't done her job and she was very cool and appeared uncaring to many people who were at her mercy for information due to the hurricane. The bellman, however, was very courteous and helpful! Overall though, a wonderful, beautiful hotel! P.S. The parking fee was outrageous!

Reviews.Title: “Too many negatives though location is great.”
Reviews.Author: csgc
Reviews.Content: The location is outstanding. Not much else is good about this place. The rooms are refurbished historical but still very tired looking. Most importantly, the walls are paper thin! We had to listen to every conversation and every amorous adventure of the neighbors on both sides of our room. Really! I do NOT recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and value”
Reviews.Author: Hotunderthecollar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night. Clean remodeled room. Super comfy bed, keurig coffee maker, hair dryer. The staff was very nice and helpful. We had a room that appeared to be part of a suite. It was set back a little. This provided a little buffer zone, so the room was quiet. The location is fabulous, near the public park and boston commons. We walked our entire time there. We would definitely stay here again the next time we are in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and great location, will be back”
Reviews.Author: runoutofscreenname
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 7 nights (aug. 20th - 27th), we arrived late on Sat. night, and was offered a free upgrade to a junior suite, this is a very pleasant surprise. The location of the hotel is great, 1/2 block to the T, and walking distance to many places, china town, Beacon Hill, the Shell, etc. very convenient, and the fact that the Public Garden park and Commons are just around the corner is great. I understand what other reviewer mentioned about the bath room is being small, but that didn't bother me too much, after all I don't plan to spend too much time in the bath room. In regards to another reviewer mentioned about the paint on the ceiling crack, yp, I did notice that, again, that didn't bother me because the room we were in, the crack is small, I didn't even notice that for until I remember the review and look up :-) The front desk and the house keeping were friendly too. We will definitely be back, and just hope we won't run into the problems other reviewer has :-)

Reviews.Title: “Towers Reservation not Honored ! Beware”
Reviews.Author: alanmtg
Reviews.Content: I made reservations in June for a room in the Towers, which are recently renovated, have a private elevator, complimentary Breakfast and evening snacks in the private lounge. Free WiFi, complimentary water bottle daily.....well, FORGET about all of that. I checked in late afternoon and while I was waiting to be taken care of I overheard the gentleman next to me being told his Tower's Reservation was not available. Here is a discount on a smaller room, and some tickets for breakfast.....and oh, we always over book those rooms, sorry.... Well my story was the same, not sure how they overbook an entire floor. I had little choice at 5 pm to scour the internet for other options as I was moving my daughter into school, with boxes and bags galore. This is a bait and switch promotion, I feel they constantly over book these rooms so take that chance on your own if you book it. I got $40 off a night, and if the truth was told that is the normal room rate for what I got. The room I was placed in was large, and not terrible if you like "fraternity couch" furniture. I will consider staying there again but not with any upgrades in rooms, they are not honorable to these reservations, so take that risk if you wish.

Reviews.Title: “Good location/Hotel adequate”
Reviews.Author: Swennie
Reviews.Content: The Park Plaza was recommended by friends who grew up in Boston. While the location is great - the hotel itself was a bit disappointing for the price. We were initially put in a handicap accessible room - they did switch us - to a room with a bathroom that was very small, I was constantly putting the toilet seat down because I was afraid my toiletries would fall in the toilet- the only space to put things was a small ledge above the sink and toilet. I do understand this is an old hotel with size restrictions. We did not watch much TV since we were out and about, but was surprised by the old TV with a poor quality picture. The bellmen and valet people were nice and friendly, but the Concierge desk was another story. I was waiting to ask for a map, when they finished helping the person in front of me they proceeded to criticize and belittle that person, while I was in earshot - not very professional and actually immature.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back!”
Reviews.Author: Car174
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were told we could not have our original 2 bedroom suite as there was a "maintenance issue" from the previous evening, they offered us a different suite with a discount. Ok, fair enough. After long flight from UK we went to the suite, it is in serious need of refurbishment, old furniture, old bathroom etc, very tired. As were we. We settled fr the evening when at 5am our 2 children who were in sleeping in the living room came to tell me there was a grey thing on their lego toys....it was a MOUSE! Yes you read right! We trapped the nouse. We called recexption, they sent a bellhop to say we could change rooms. He didnt even know the reason we were moving. We were incensed! No apology...eventually a manager came up about 1.5 hours later. we were all sat in the bedroom awake with the kids during this time. The manager came with secuirty, she screamed. We moved room with no help, repacked, wheeled our suitcases to another suite. During the weekend there was no acknowledgment of this incredible episode! Of course it spoiled my stay as worried about other rodents. On checkout we mentioned this episode to a 3rd person as no one had acknolwedged this. We were offered the first night free......well make your mind up about that! We late stayed at the Sheraton in Boston and that was fantastic and we wished we stayed there initailly!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Riding2Win
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Expedia 3 months in advance and pre-paid. We chose the Towers level in order to take advantage of the continental breakfast offerings and evening hor d'oeuvres and FREE wifi. Plus, on the 15th floor, we knew we should have a decent view. Check in was easy and uncomplicated. When we got to the room, evening hor d'oeuvres were being offered, but as we arrived late, the selection was severely limited to just a few pieces remaining. In my experience, the food is replenished frequently to allow all guests this service. They told us they would do the breakfast in the club lounge on the weekends and gave us passes to use in the restaurant, Pairings, on the ground level. That was acceptable. But, then we found out they didn't offer hor d'oeuvres on Saturdays and Sundays, and our stay was Friday evening through Monday morning! They didn't mention this on the website!! Our trip also fell over Labor Day, we were only given breakfast passes for Sat/Sun and Monday morning when we went to the lounge for breakfast it was CLOSED! REALLY?! So, we paid extra for the concierge level and only got 3 cookies and two breakfasts over a period when we expecting this service a total of 6 times!! THEN, when we arrived on Friday, I went to log onto the internet and it made me pay $10.45 per 24 hour period. The hotel service book in the room, stated that wifi in the Towers level was COMPLIMENTARY! I called guest services and their answer was, "well, internet used to be complimentary, but it isn't anymore." What the heck?! So, basically, we paid a ton of extra money for a room with a view of south Boston, nothing special and barely any other extras. If you are staying over a weekend, I WOULD NOT stay in the Towers, it's a huge waste of money! Also, the walls are pretty thin in this historic hotel. Our last night, we got to hear our next door hotel guests partaking in nocturnal activities. After quite a few minutes, I banged on the wall, and fortunately the noises subsided. On the positive side, the hotel is beautiful and the room had a comfy bed. Bathroom was small, with little counter space. I would stay here again, but only for a regular level room and for a really good price. There was also very convenient subway access practically right out the front door. Also, within walking distance of the Freedom Trail starting point at Boston Common.

Reviews.Title: “Nine great nights in the Garden Suite!”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiians3
Reviews.Content: Aloha! I stayed for nine nights (August 27 - September 5, 2011) in the Garden Suite (423) with my parents, two kids and my daughter's roommate. The suite was absolutely gorgeous, clean, comfortable and the hotel has a central location. We all found the front line employees to be friendly and accommodating. Breakfast was served on the 15th floor in the Towers Lounge and on weekends in their lobby restaurant. Our suite had two bedrooms, kitchen, three big screen TVs, a living room and a terrific outdoor garden area that served as my remote office while checking email and answering voicemail. This was our favorite suite in all of Boston and we have stayed at some pretty nice hotels in this city. Mahalo to the staff at the Boston Park Plaza Hotel. We at planning our next visit again soon!

Reviews.Title: “You Can Do Better”
Reviews.Author: NickAndKaren
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were only in town for one night. I decided to cancel our reservation at the Nine Zero and book here to save a little money. Huge mistake. I get the hotel is old, I expected that and it is charming in that way. What I didn't expect was 10 year old televisions and no free internet. The location is good and for business I could see the draw (except for the no internet). I think for the price you can find better at a place nearby. The check in and check out process was quick and painless. The beds were decent but the bathrooms showed their age and the floors are very slippery when wet, even with a towel down. Beware of the concierge, they seemed to be pushy when it came to getting a cab or taking the hotel truck, although either will set you back about $30 to Logan.

Reviews.Title: “Historic elegance meets friendly hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Towers King room and were very pleased with the cleanliness and decor of the room. I travel quite a bit for business and I usually have a hard time sleeping at night. But not here... the bed was awesome! I really appreciated the replenished water bottles each day in my room. Loved the dual shower heads. Best part of our trip was being able to easily walk anywhere downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: Alessandromilano_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Boston theree nights. The hotel was clean and calm even if crowded. The people were not really kind. Internet is free only in the lobby and it's not possible to print out your documents. The valet parking system was awful and expensive. I prefered to do by myself and I saved 20 dollars per night.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you are on a package holiday!”
Reviews.Author: eddygraham
Reviews.Content: Great location and a lovely facade. What a shame that the staff are so ignorant, to the point of rudeness with the concierge staff. Held door open for business men/women in front of us but then pointedly let it shut on us. We weren't in suits and skirts so I guess that made us not worthy! Totally unhelpful with advice on running routes near to the hotel and the availability of hotel services and amenities. Reception staff made a point of ignoring us standing at the desk to the point where we had to wave one of them down by reaching across the desk. The cleaners were the only staff who spoke to us during our 3 day stay here. Would not go back if you paid us!

Reviews.Title: “Very, very disappointing except for the service”
Reviews.Author: Bernie49
Reviews.Content: We were there for a meeting. Our room was tired and grubby. We upped the reservation to have a larger room with a seating area but they simply added regular chairs and a small table. Certainly there was no crisp bed linen, which made me wonder... The air conditioner was extremely noisy. It is difficult to assess the hotel food since we don't know what was selected by the meeting organizers: The food that we were served was cafeteria level quality (e.g., pressed turkey, yuk), though they did have Starbucks coffee which was the high point of most meals. Strangely, the service was very good and everybody was friendly. Fortunately the meeting was cut short by Hurricane Irene and we only had to stay one night. We would never, ever organize a meeting at this hotel and we would never recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Its a strange hotel”
Reviews.Author: sidney_jec
Reviews.Content: I had a mixed feeling about this hotel. My parents stayed there for a day after their flight got cancelled due to hurricane irene. As far as the standard features go it was ok to say the most. its one of the old hotels of Boston but neither it gives an old world charm nor it is a contemporary hotel. and for the price we paid for the night it was definitely not worth it. But not that its all bad. The location is supreme. The rooms were clean. Staff was friendly. Though there was a confusion regarding the breakfast being included in the reservation itself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location...Older Facility”
Reviews.Author: civil23
Reviews.Content: This hotel couldn't be beat for it's proximity to many of Boston's attractions. We were able to ride the blue and then green lines in from the airport, and get off at Arlington, less than a block from the entrance. The public gardens and start of the Freedom Trail are very close. As expected in the middle of an older city, the building itself was not new. Our room was very small, and the bathroom even tighter. Most of the rooms' views were other wings of the hotel. The outlet in the bathroom did not work the first morning. The first maintenance responder checked it out, then had someone else come. The whole process took about 45 minutes, but in the end he got it working. In general the staff was helpful, although the consierge was impatient with even basic questions. The internet is not free. While nowhere near the best hotel I've stayed in, the location did a lot to make up for the other.

Reviews.Title: “A Strange Weekend”
Reviews.Author: ERBfd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a weekend wedding. We when checked in (handing the desk our reservation confirmation) we were told that we had a â€œsuite.â€� My wife questioned whether this was accurate since we had the hotelâ€™s wedding rate. Told it was, off we went to the suite that was two unconnected rooms next to each other, one with a conference table and a murphy bed. A little later my nephew, the groom, called to let me know that we were given his suite by mistake. The hotel gave us a room in the Tower floor to make up for the problem. The Tower room had more light and a far better view then the suite. And, unlike the suite, it had a refrigerator. The Tower floor has a small lounge where you could get a light (no hot food) free breakfast and Internet access on the one computer. The lounge is only open for a few hours in the morning and again in the evening. To use the hotelâ€™s business center for Internet access costs $7 for 15 minutes or $28 an hour. As I did not bring my laptop, I did not ask about Wifi or LAN access. The next day the roomâ€™s card key lock broke and we had to get dressed for the wedding with the door open while the lock was, efficiently, replaced. When we got back home, I discovered that they charged my nephewâ€™s suite to my credit card as well as the room we stayed in. The hotel said they would remove the charge if my nephew would call them to give his credit card information (which they should have had on file when he made the reservation). I said it had to be removed because it was their error. I was able to contact my nephew before he left for his honeymoon. The hotel also added $200 to the â€œpendingâ€� credit card charge for our room for â€œextras,â€� which I took to mean damage (there was no mini bar). We were not informed about this strange policy at check in or check out and would have wanted to see any claimed damage before leaving the hotel. When the charge finally went through the $200 was removed and days later the charge for my nephewâ€™s room was reversed. So why not a lower rating? It is because as annoying as everything was, it was all resolved relatively quickly. But I do wonder what would have happened if I hadnâ€™t reached my nephew.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Step Back in Time”
Reviews.Author: sgbslo
Reviews.Content: We got a very good rate oniine here for the last night of our New England trip. The hotel has a grand lobby that makes you feel like you're somewhere really special. Our room was not large but was plenty big enough and was clean and nicely furnished. The bathroom was old fashioned but was also clean and had the neccessary amenities. We actually enjoyed the old fashioned feel of the place and preferred it over more generic hotels. But the best thing about the Park Plaza is its location. You can walk to so many of the most interesting spots in Boston from the hotel. And to walk anywhere via the Public Garden and Boston Common is a real treat. We're looking forward to another Boston visit in the near future and hope we'll be able to get another good deal at the Park Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Worst night's sleep ever”
Reviews.Author: ellenmac
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice, clean and very well situated in the city. However, all that is completely ruined by the fact that the walls are paper thin and you can hear everything from neighboring rooms. I had the absolute worst 2 nights' sleep in my life there. The first night, I could hear my neighbor's TV as if it were taped to my head. The second night was a miserable reenactment of "Animal House" in which a group of young men drank, yelled, cursed, blasted TV, and threw furniture (maybe not, but it sure sounded like it) from 7:30-9PM, 11-11:45PM, and 2-4AM when they were back from partying. While the partying wasn't the hotel's fault, its lack of strong response to my complaints was egregious. I called security FIVE times and they only asked the guys to be quiet twice. The other times they ignored my requests. Security's two admonishments were so gentle that the partying continued to rage. Finally at 3:30, the guys were out in the hall yelling at a room service woman about their order when I opened my door and yelled at them for all I was worth. They actually shut up soon after that, no thanks to the hotel security. If getting a good night's sleep is important to you, don't stay here. I will never make this mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “In general it's a good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jllantin
Reviews.Content: I've stayed for 8 days but the last two days my electronic key was disabled and it was a long time waiting to fix it. One of their emplyees said that the system system is old and need to be replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel... a classy piece of Boston...”
Reviews.Author: momzpony
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston for an overnight adventure... booze cruise, dinner in the North End, & bar-hopping. We made reservations at the Sheraton... upon arrival, we were notified that they had over-booked and they were wondering if we'd consider a bump to another hotel. They offered us something across the river in Cambridge... we declined because that would screw with our bar-hopping plans. She then offered us the Park Plaza... I knew it was an old hotel... hell, it was old when my grandmother took me there for tea MANY years ago... but the offer included a full refund of our room charge at the Sheraton ($300) and they would pick up the room at the Plaza. Anywhoo - we took the bump. It was a good choice... even though it's an older hotel, it has so much charm and class. The lobby is something out of a Audrey Hepburn film... beautiful marble and gold-leaf. The staff was very friendly. We stayed on the 14th floor... apparently with a large group of hippies... the hallway smelled very "herbal". ;) The room was very clean and had a nice view. Never turned on the TV, but it was a bit of a relic. Not a fan of the air conditioner... it sounded like a plane taking off every time it came on. Good shower... liked the water pressure. And lastly, make sure you go have breakfast somewhere else... the food was good, but not good enough for the price... I'm not Rachel Ray, but I make just as good a breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “There's better out there”
Reviews.Author: TheWeatherheads
Reviews.Content: End of a wonderful trip saw us land here. In a nutshell - rude bell staff (note I will not tip poor service and bad attitudes just because you expect it), rude front desk staff and staff who had to be kept out of the room - you may have been desperate to clean it but check out is 12 (and no later). This hotel has the smallest hotel room I have ever seen in the USA. Poor beyond words. Great location but that's all it's got going for it (don't be hopeful from the grand entrance and internet pictures!)

Reviews.Title: “Old room, good value.”
Reviews.Author: Steve E
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on a Sunday night in July. We got a junior suite (essentially two small rooms connected with french doors, one a bedroom, the other a living room) at a very good rate. The room was rather old and had exposed bulbs with no fixtures in one of the bathrooms. But the extra space in the suite was nice; a single room would have been very small even for a couple. Given the rate we paid, the condition of the room was tolerable. It was clean, but rundown. Next time I would splurge for the Towers Level, I think. Service was friendly (by Boston standards) and efficient given the size of the hotel. The location was fine, Boston is small enough that you can really get anywhere from the Park Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “I Have Had Good Luck At This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JRWB1960
Reviews.Content: I see this hotel has mixed reviews and is classed as at 3.5 star, but the last two times I have stayed here, I enjoyed it. The price/value is what drove my choice. A suite here was the same price as a standard room in neighboring hotels ($279/nt) and I was staying with family members, so I booked it. The suite was on the 14th floor and consisted of two rooms. One was a bedroom and the other was a living room/dining room. Combined, the two rooms were maybe 700 sq ft which was good. The living room had a couch, chairs, dining room table and a murphy bed (which was comfortable). Each room had a full bathroom. Views were good...of the public garden and the swan boats. Staff was pleasant. Hallways very nice. Lobby a little faded but not terribly so. They need brighter light bulbs though. The location is great. Steps from everything. Overall a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and pretty room”
Reviews.Author: dilanste
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location to visit Boston by walk or to bring the subway at the Arlington stop. The room (1422) was big and clean. Personel at the front desk is cordial and the towel of the bathroom are changed every days. Unfortunately the wifi in the room is not free and if you want to use internet you have to go in the lobby to have it free.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel rooms need to be updated”
Reviews.Author: vickieyero
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a conference. I was amazed to know all of the history behind it. However, it has not been updated. The bathrooms are awfully small and out dated. Beware! The elevators ate scary.

Reviews.Title: “Would avoid if possible. Quite old with very small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Stephen G
Reviews.Content: Rarely ever speak poorly about a hotel, however I would recommend staying elsewhere if availability exists. The rooms was exceptionally small, as was the bathroom (where only one person could actually stand in). You could not fit a desk in the room even if you wanted to (let alone a chair) and I found myself using the old radiator as a 'desk' for my laptop. I received a charge on my credit card 2 months after my stay. After calling multiple times to the front desk, they were not able to identify the charge. I have since had to contact my credit card company to determine what it is for (still pending). All and all, you can find better in boston for the same or lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel...I would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: honeyb888
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to do a 1 day getaway trip to boston and book a room here the same day. The location of this hotel is very convenient, its short walk to Boston Common and Public Garden which is a must see when you are in Boston. As a tourist, our main concern is transportation, since parking is very expensive, the location of this hotel is perfect because is a short walk from the MTA station and if you purchase a trolley tour (which is awesome) , one of the pick up station is only a few steps away from this hotel. We got a room at the 15th floor which gives us a nice nice view and the room was clean complete with basic amenities such as bottle water and coffee maker. We were also given a free continental breakfast which is set up nicely in the 15 floor lounge. The Hotel Manager is very knowledgeable however I wasnt impressed with the lady concierge, she wasnt enthusiastic enough to help and just gave us a map when I ask her whats the best thing to do in Boston. In my opinion, she could have upsell the hotel and give us more information about the city. Another important fact to know is that, the rooms have thin walls so you'll definitely hear sounds from the other room other than that, its a good hotel and worth it of its rate.I will recommend it to first timers like us!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kenshaw
Reviews.Content: Accomodation was very clean with the staff being very helpfull. It is located within walking distance of all the major, shopping areas, tourest attractions and Theatres. There are two restaurants opposite which are a must on any visit Legal Sea food and Magianos neither cheap but great service and value for money. Be careful of the taxies $25 from the Airport to the Hotel 3 miles away single person and the Taxi arranged by the Hotel to the Airport $60 for 4 people plus luggage luckily we had kept back spare Dollars Just. When compared to Â£42 for 30 miles from Heathrow to home a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Location”
Reviews.Author: PapaMike3950
Reviews.Content: Great location near the Boston Common. Lots of restaurants and shops on location and nearby. Some of the rooms are a very small, esp. the bathrooms. There's a fire station just down the street so you may get woken up from time to time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the grand tradition”
Reviews.Author: CaribMonkey
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for our 21st time over the last 25 years. In spite of the volume of visitors this place hasthe management is able to maintain the elegance and soul evocative of the grand hotels of the past. Service is typically excellent. This time, upon arrival, we were checked in and unpacking our backs within 10 minutes. We found our newly redecorated room was spotlessly clean, well appointed and very, very quiet. If this isn't enough you simply cannot overlook the fact that this hotel is in an outstanding location for someone wanting to explore the city. It's just a few steps away from the subway (the T), one block from the Public Gardens and two blocks from some great shopping and dining on Boylston and Newbury streets. This place has had it's ups and downs over the last 20 years but it's certainly on the upswing now.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected.”
Reviews.Author: ChiFT
Reviews.Content: I was really expecting an old and tired hotel but it wasnt that - besides the bathroom. The hotel is very well located. Newbury Street, Trinity Church, Prudential Centre, Boston Common and all within a couple of minutes walk away. Beacon Hill is also within walking distance. I am not sure I like the lobby - a bit too dark for my liking, but thats personal opinion. The staff at the reception are friendly and helpful, and check-in and check-out were fast. Judging from the floor plan at the back of the room door, there are many inside facing rooms. So be sure to ask for an outside facing room. The room is fine and I think it has been re-decorated not too long ago. The bathroom however, is tiny, and the decor doesnt quite match the rest of the room. The room has wired internet access which is both fast and reliable, didnt perceive any slowing down at peak time or any time. There are plenty of restaurants nearby, so dont try room service. In fact, I tried to try room service but I rang 4 or 5 times, and each time put on-hold for at least 4 or 5 minutes, and in the end I gave up. Buffet breakfast was fine, but for $25, I find it expansive for what it offered. On the whole, very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Historic old hotel”
Reviews.Author: lotiss
Reviews.Content: wonderful old hotel, but needs updating! Room was clean, would stay again for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location, Maybe a little overrated?”
Reviews.Author: ksherm5
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here on a quick getaway to do my own historical walking tour. The hotel touts its own history and though nice, I was not particularly impressed overall. The Park Plaza seemed almost as though it was trying to be too many things to too many people...more than one wedding booked (large lighted ,glossy photos and names of couples in lobby detracting from the historic decor), lots of high maintenance vacationers, European travelers, even airline flight crews. Amid the shuffle, I felt a bit overlooked as a lone traveler. At one point, I waited in a long line for the Concierge to ask for a walkable map of the historic African-American sites trail, only to be told hurriedly that they didn't have any but "the trail starts on the other side of the park". The group in front of me in line however, booked a boat tour, made dinner reservations for a family of 4, and got directions from the Concierge. All I wanted was a map. Maybe it would have been better had I not been traveling in the middle of the summer? In any case, the rooms have a nice historic flair (skeleton key doors) and are small but perfectly acceptable. The room was clean but my bed sheet was stained, which was pretty unexpected considering the caliber of the hotel. Overall, I could not have asked for a better location and for the seasoned traveler who needs little direction or attention, it was a reasonable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: trippish
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel that shows its age. My confirmed reservation was not honored. They downgraded my room. Yukky tiny bathroom hadn't been upgraded in decades. I would advise anyone considering this hotel to think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service at the Park Plaza”
Reviews.Author: F16Pilot
Reviews.Content: Normally the Park Plaza is relatively consistent and you can't beat its historic charm, but today they committed a foul. Their gym is closed due to water damage and they offered ZERO discounted alternatives with over half a dozen local gyms nearby? In this day and age, many of us live for our workout on the road. Paying $20 drop in fee because my hotel's gym is out of service didn't sit well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot for Boston Marathon Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Caitsgrden
Reviews.Content: Loved the location for a trip to Boston! All around great experience. Comfortable room, nice people. Asked and received a Microwave/ Fridge. Easy ride from Airport, easy 'T' ride to Fenway. Perfect spot for Boston Marathon participants. Quick Walk to Expo, Very Quick Walk to Busses, Quick ( But slow :P !!) walk back from Finish. If we Ever qualify again- staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: brwnIgrl021
Reviews.Content: We were apprehensive because the hotel was old. We ended up pleasantly surprised because our room was old but clean. The hotel had a nice feel to it. It was in a great location near the Arlington T station, Boston Commons and close enough to Fenway to walk home after the game. The staff were helpful and friendly. Overall, we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: quidditchfan186624
Reviews.Content: This is my first ever posting on Trip Advisor despite having viewed it many times. I've just returned from a month long trip to the States and thought our experiences may help others. We were two couples in our 50's travelling together for the duration but with two cars. Initially I found it difficult to get any sort of reasonably priced hotel in Boston so went with Hotwire on one of their unnamed hotels - we were not disappointed on any front especially the price. We were absolutely thrilled with the location of the Park Plaza right near Boston Common. Coming in on the T line from the airport we got off at Arlington and discovered the hotel there in front of us. What a convenience. For those visiting Boston for the first time we I would recommend the weekly ticket on the T which cost us $15. We only stayed 4 days but still got our moneys worth with the added convenience of not needing to buy a ticket every trip. On our first night we wandered down Charles St. which was almost diagonally opposite us just between the Common and the Gardens. What a street- filled with lovely neighbourhood restaurants which we frequented on our trip. I particularly recommend the Paramount for breakfast. The hotel was spotlessly clean and had great character. The rooms were not generic and ours was a bit bigger than our friends but both were more than adequate for our needs. Free Internet access was available in the lobby. We asked for a fridge for our room and were told that they were only for those needing to store medication but they'd see what they could do. On our return to the hotel we discovered a fridge set up for us at no extra charge. I would love to visit again. From here we moved on to Stowe in Vermont and I will post on that separately if you want to keep up with me.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful service and room”
Reviews.Author: uschi05
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights in a room on the 15th floor ( concierge floor). The room was beautiful and very spacious and the service wonderful. The concierge organized a transfer for me to go to a smaller town in MA, so i would not have to use an expensive cab.. the next dau they organized a duck tour for me.. love the little snacks in the evening and for breakfast.. would definitely recommend.. best location ever..Arlington station is just across the street ..

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room, but close to everything...”
Reviews.Author: Ilovetraveling19
Reviews.Content: We chose the Boston Park Plaza for my 30th birthday trip. We booked the hotel and got a really cheap rate, only to realize why the rate was so good when we arrived: small room. The hotel is a little older, but the charm is still there. The view from the window was of the other towers, but beyond that you could see a bit of the skyline. I didn't mind the small room so much, seeing as how we weren't travelling with children, but keep that in mind if you book for a family trip. I'm sure there are other rooms that a larger, so don't be afraid to ask for one of those. The hotel is just a block away from the train station (Arlington station), and beyond that you are practically on the Boston Common. Also, a few blocks away from shopping, the Prudential, and restaraunts. We ordered room service our first night because we arrived so late, and it was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in boston”
Reviews.Author: khonkaen
Reviews.Content: Amazing location and a very cool classic hotel. Walking into this lobby quickly reminds you how hotels use to be. Staff is friendly and took care of any requests I had. Since I am a low maintenance person I didnt have significant interaction with staff. Check in and out staff friendly ad were the door men. Rooms very comfortable and the bed is amazing to sleep in. Pillows were perfect and the a/c worked like a champ. Rooms were clean and quiet. All in all a great place to stay and good value

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Angelaugh
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel and it was definitely worth it. It was very close to the subway, hop-on hop-off trolley stops and not far at all from the Boston Common & Public Gardens. Its a beautiful historical building and has tons of restaurants around it. The room was small and basic but thats all we needed. We got upgraded to a King bed which was very comfy. A few small things took away from it however. There was free wifi in the lobby but there is no wifi in the rooms which was a bit frustrating - only internet available was by cable and costs $/day. The sound proofing of the rooms wasn't perfect and you need to bring your own conditioner as they only have shampoo (luckily I'd been warned on here to bring some!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: edes63
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location in the center. Old fashion and charming atmosphere. Excellent service at the front desk. Large rooms and bathroom well equipped, clean. WiFi with charges in the room, free in the lobby. Car parking in Boston is difficult. A must in Boston...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious room, hotel needs a little TLC”
Reviews.Author: abcdk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boston Park Plaza Hotel during a busy weekend in July of 2011. Although our room was clean and spacious, we did find it a tad dated. The carpet was worn down to the carpet tacks at the threshold to the bathroom, with the five tacks pointing up drawing blood from my foot before we covered it with a towel for the rest of our stay. Bathroom lighting (and related switches) was dated and oddly located. Jacuzzi tub and shower, though large, needs a handle bar to assist with deeper step down in tub departure. (one family member mis-judged distance and resulted in a bruised backside!) Check-in was delayed as our room was not ready. Elevator door almost crushed another member of family and required full adult force to push doors back to allow safe exit. (could have seriously injured small child!) Hotel clearly sees quite a bit of traffic and needs TLC. All that said, the location is perfect, convenient to Boston Common, beginning of Freedom Trail, restaurants, the T, etc. Room was large, spacious and clean, with a great view. Room was quiet, comfy, and we slept well. We would recommend the hotel and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “99% postive, just wish the AC worked”
Reviews.Author: MFBowers
Reviews.Content: I booked a junior suite at the Park Plaza for our family vacation. Upon check in, there were no junior suites, so we were upgraded to some fabulous 2-room suite on the 15th floor of the Towers. It was lovely and the 15th floor suites include complimentary evening appetizers and morning breakfast. The 2-room suite accomodated us nicely and we were very gracious for the upgrade. However, the airconditioning would not go below 77-degrees (It was set to be 64-degrees when we arrived)!. Granted, on day one, Boston got hit by the near 100-degree heat wave. On day 2, i made 3 requests between 9 am and 10:45 pm for the AC to be looked at and i also requested a portable fan for the room. Sleeping night number one was miserable, difficult and hot! Anyhow, after my 3rd request for assistance, and it was now 11:15 PM and I needed to go to bed, so i walked down to the front desk and nicely explained my unhappiness and discomfort. The desk clerk appologized profusely and gave me her portable box fan from behind the counter. I was happy to have a fan at last, but displeased that my 3 earlier requests were disregarded. On day number 3 the room temp with AC would still only go down to 77, although the weather out was pleasant and mildat 78-degrees. We opened our windows and slept with them open because it was cooler out than in. All other aspects of the hotel were grand. The location right by a T station and 1 block from the Boston Public Garden can't be beat. The hotel is not cheap to stay at, and we were still paying a good chunk of change to stay there regardless of recieving an upgrade, so it is not accecptable to disregard a guests request for room comfort. Still, despite the AC situation, I would recommend this hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a cool historic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chardeesdream
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice; before and after a cruise. First visit we stayed on the 9th floor in a "traditional queen room" that was great. We had two full baths (about the size of those on a cruise ship) so no fighting about shower time and the bed was extremely comfy. No room safe but coffee maker, hair dryer, iron and board. Evening room service was very prompt. Second stay we were in a 15th floor (Tower) room that had a king bed and modern bath, room safe, hair dryer, iron and board. Again very comfy. 15th floor includes comp continental breakfast (nice variety and pleasant lounge staff), free computer in lounge, daily paper, evening goodies and cash bar as well as a nice place to relax. We had a super excellent dinner in Pairings, one of the best on our entire trip. And, talk about location...one block to Public Gardens, Boston Commons and on to the Freedom Trail and other sites. Dedicated free computer in lobby for airline reservations and printing boarding passes as well as monitor showing daily flight departures. No hotel specific hotel shuttle to airport but shuttle service, town cars and many taxis quite available. In additional to Pairings, other very nice dining options available including a crazy cheap ($2.95 for burger and fries!!!) late night bar menu at McCormicks. When in Boston, will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Melivard
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Boston Park Plaza for 2 weeks for a summer residency for school. 2 weeks is a long time to really discover the good and bad of a place and I have to say the Boston Park Plaza was excellent. I stayed in the Towers so for the extra money it is really worth it. Free Wi-Fi, breakfast and evening snacks. The room was fantastic! The best part in my book was the level of service. The people working at the Boston Park Plaza really went out of their way to make me feel at home. As you can tell I cannot say enough positive things. It is in the heart of everything too. Loved it and I would 100% stay here and recommend...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Kellia
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel and booked it immediately, after seeing the price. The cleaning staff was so incredibly friendly, as were most of the employees. They never failed to greet us and were always hard at work. The location is hard to beat, since it is so close to the beautiful Boston Public Gardens and the Arlington T-stop. The room was clean, but we could hear our neighbors' conversations through the paper- thin walls. If we were to visit Boston in e future, we would seriously consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SCHerrington
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 5 nights and really enjoyed the location. It was near the start of the Freedom Trail and only 2 blocks from a Trolly Stop. The room was average, but the bathroom was beyond small. It ws TINY. Location made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with great staff!”
Reviews.Author: richievac
Reviews.Content: Love, Love, Love this place!! Friendly Staff, Grand lobby, Clean rooms with excellent beds, historic beauty and charm of yesteryear. Subway T-stop station 1 block away---go anywhere in the city for $2.00 Celebrated our anniversary with long weekend--so glad we chose the Park Plaza! Excellent restaurants right in the hotel. Get a Lobster roll at McCormick & Schmicks. Francisco upgraded us to Tower level room on 15th floor. Spotless large room, city view, love the double shower heads!! Complimentary breakfast, full cash bar 5-7PM in cozy lounge area with big screen TV's and free internet for all Tower guests. Nikki, the hotel concierge, scored us (2) Red Sox tickets 2 hours prior to game time. I don't understand the negative reviews I've read. We experienced none of that. Everything was outstanding. They made our anniversary very special. Wouldn't stay anywhere else on our next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, and for a good price”
Reviews.Author: travel_guru_916
