Reviews.Content: This hotel is very reasonably priced and located right across the street from a T stop (subway). the lobby is very impressive, but it is an older hotel so the rooms are a bit dated. a tip would be to ask for a room close to the elevators because the hotel is very big, so our room was a hike from the elevator. will def be back to this hotel when i return to boston. trying to get someone on the phone at this hotel, as in a staff member, was nearly impossible. we were put on hold for over half and hr when we finally gave up.

Reviews.Title: “The place is run down”
Reviews.Author: Rose720
Reviews.Content: From the outside, the place looked marvelous.But, it was a different story when we headed to our room. Our bathroom didn't lock, the drain in the tub didn't drain...etc..The concierge was nice enough to get into a vacant room, which was a mirror image of the previous room. Thank Goodness we weren't there to just hang out in the room, but only used our hotel room as a base camp as we traveled other surrounding states.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: sweetpea92
Reviews.Content: Met a friend from out of town. Neither of us had vehicles, so this was a perfect spot to stay and within walking distance of Everything! Room was small....and a view of a brick building next door. Coffee maker in room, but no mini fridge (as I was told it would have one)

Reviews.Title: “Still the best!”
Reviews.Author: tsfl61
Reviews.Content: I brought my elderly parents from rural Minnesota and my son and his family from the Cape together at the Park Plaza. We spent the day at the Boston Common and Boston Gardens, which are steps from the hotel. That evening, we walked to Fenway for the Sox game. As a frequent guest, we were upgraded to the Towers level, with complimentary breakfast, afternoon snacks, and upgraded rooms. We felt like royalty. The rooms are gorgeous, the views of the city amazing. My only regret is that this beautiful hotel is no longer part of the Starwood portfolio :(

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: GLOBETROTTYYZ
Reviews.Content: Great location, but there is room for improvement in terms of the hotel interior/appearance. I've read a couple of reviews stating that you should expect a little quirkiness with an older hotel. This is true, but the problems appear to be deeper. While the room I had was fitted well (in terms of bedding/furniture), the washroom was a shamble. Beyond the mix-match of tiles (which i can live with), it appeared that the ceiling was going to cave in over the tub. Water from above must have seaped down below. There was a big bubble above the tub where the plaster appeared ready to burst. It appeared as though the water caused the wallpaper to peel off and that sombody quickly put it together in a sloppy fashion. Now I thought it was just my room.... but when the cleaners were in the room across from me, I took a quick peak and the same problem was present. The hotel is pretty good - just think it needs a little TLC and door staff need to be a bit more polished.

Reviews.Title: “It's the little touches that make you feel nickel-and-dimed.”
Reviews.Author: lengelcj
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a number of times on business, and every time I remember why I prefer other hotels in the area (our corporate rate is better at the Park Plaza--that's the only reason I keep coming back). I can't remember a recent stay at any other hotel in this price range where the bathroom amenities included shampoo but no conditioner. And I'm really irked by hotels that still charge for wireless. $12.95 a day--really? So if you're looking for a really special experience, or even a hotel that doesn't make you say "They don't even give you *that*?"--then look elsewhere. (On my last stay, someone had set the in-room clock alarm to go off at 2:30 and 6:30 a.m., which of course I didn't notice until it interrupted my sleep twice. I don't blame the hotel for this, but jeez, people, have a heart!)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: mstav77
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 15th floor in the Towers. The price was very reasonable for a major city hotel ($130/night) and if you get a room on the 15th floor, you have access to a private elevator, free wifi, a private lounge with free continental breakfast and afternoon hors-d'oeuvres. The room was very clean and comfortable. The location is fantastic - a block away from the Gardens/Boston Common, two blocks from the shops in Back Bay, close to the beginning of the Freedom Trail. We caught a Red Sox game and actually were able to walk all the way to Fenway Park without much problem (took us about 40 minutes). You can also walk to the South End where there are some great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Needs TLC”
Reviews.Author: ramblin1
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny, tiny, tiny. There is no comfortable reading chair in the room. If you want a mini-frig, it costs $25/day. Lobby furniture smells bad, old, musty. Concierge staff need lessons in friendliness to those asking questions; also they need to learn directions so they can tell people the correct ways. This was a common complaint with numerous guests.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: sojourner1245
Reviews.Content: At $505 for three nites we didn't expect much - but a clogged tub, one bar of soap for the entire visit, no tooth paste or shampoo and a maid service that could only say they did have along with a filthy room and some strange substance on the bed side table and only one straight chair coupled with a rude staff - well that says it all. Oh, expect long waits for the lift!

Reviews.Title: “Maybe once it was great...no longer”
Reviews.Author: alexiusp
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights (ouch!) because my conference was held here. If it were not for the discounted conference room rate, I would not have chosen to stay here, due to the mostly negative reviews. And unfortunately, most complaints against this hotel are valid. This hotel has only 1 thing going for it...it is smack in the middle of Boston, maybe 30 paces from Arlington underground station. Other than that...it was a let down. The hotel was massive. I would guess that my room at the "back" of the hotel was probably 500metres from the lift lobby...the room was EXTREMELY small, and did not even have a wardrobe, nor hangars. The bath was OK sized, but you could tell it was aged. Overall, the room was clean. Here is a video i took of the room http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I2ZNr_FhruE However, the biggest problems with this hotel have to be with the front/back office. I don't know why, but for some reason, upon arrival, they charge the entire cost of stay PLUS a deposit of US$100 per night, which given 6 nights was a huge sum of money. They claimed that this would be "released" upon departure, and the final bill settled...well, I have to check carefully when my credit card bill comes. However, i don't like this practice. I never see it done anywhere else... Also, they got my bookings wrong, and thought i was going to check out after 2 nights. After a lot of time spent hassling with the front office, they managed to sort it out BUT ONLY after they had charged me for 2 nights at the non-conference (higher) rates. Well, guess what? They couldn't refund that amound immediately, and would have to let accounting refund that amound LATER. Again, I have to check my credit card bill to see if that is eventually done... The front office staff, while trying to be nice, are essentially clueless. Assuming there wasn't a conference discounted rate for the room, i cannot imagine anyone wanting to pay the published rate and to get such small rooms and bad service. Not even for a historic hotel in the middle of town. Really not worth the suffering.

Reviews.Title: “Overall positive, keeping in mind it's historic”
Reviews.Author: SunnyInCleveland
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location: next to Public Garden and Boston Common, in the complex is Ben & Jerry's, Melting Pot, McCormick & Schmick's, across the street is Legal Seafood (recommended) and more. Easy walking distance to Trinity Church, Public Library, Duck Tours and so forth. Walk across Public Garden to visit the Cheers bar. Service: unobstrusive, check-in was smooth, never had a problem. Good staff. Meeting rooms: the ballroom and other rooms are just gorgeous. I enjoyed the meeting space. As a business attendee, I didn't have any problems with the facilities. I can't speak from the perspective of a meeting organizer. Food: I'm not sure if the hotel doesn't offer much by way of catering options or if my meeting planners picked uninspired choices. Lunch was very similar to a prior night's dinner. They love their fingerling potatoes. That said, boxed lunches were surprisingly yummy. Room service was above average. Breakfast was tasty. Rooms: the sleeping space was fine. No one likes a box TV these days but honestly it functioned just fine. My window overlooked an inner alley. Eh. My bathroom was TINY. Like, can't sit on the toilet and shut/open the door. Can't sit on the toilet without elbowing the sink. Can't flush toilet without putting down the seat cover. Given it was built in 1920s, it's understandable. I do, however, think they should get rid of the industrial style toilet and find someone newer. Room tips: Ask for a king with a walk-in shower. My friend had this style room and the bathroom was much larger and had been recently (well, you know) renovated. Perhaps ask for a room with an outer view while you're at it. Would I stay here again? Probably not simply because variety is the spice of life and Boston is a big city. Would I recommend it for a business meeting or first time tourist? Sure! Would I select it for a meeting I might organize? Yes. I would be very careful to maximize variety of food offerings to my participants, however.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: innominate
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in this delightful, historic hotel earlier this month, and couldn't have been more satisfied. The front staff was welcoming, the room (just a standard double) was spacious, clean, and extremely quiet, the bedding inviting and comfortable. We travel with a high-powered wifi adapter, so even on the 9th floor had no trouble picking up the the lobby internet (which is free). The bathroom was kind of cramped, but I'm a large guy and had no trouble moving around in it. It was spotlessly clean, though I suppose someone could mistake the wear on the beautiful tile bathroom floor as dirt. My only complaint is with their choice of hotel restaurants; Finale charged us $8 for two mediocre (watery) espressos. You choose a hotel like the Park Plaza for the history and the character; this sometimes comes with oddly-shaped rooms or slightly dated fitments. For those who want a cookie-cutter hotel which gets refurbished every two years in some ephemeral new style, there are plenty of other choices. Sheesh.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Bed and Upgraded”
Reviews.Author: Pgh22SCM
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel this past weekend and had a great time. The location is very convienent, less than a block from a subway station and a few blocks from Newburry St, the mall and Boston Public Garden/Boston Common. The hotel staff was always helpful and accommodating. Upon checking in we were told that we were being upgraded to the Towers level. The room and especially the bathroom were a bit smaller than we were used to, but that is to be expected for a historic hotel. The bed was very comfortable and I really liked the variety of pillows available. Many of the hotels I have stayed in only have feather pillows but this one had "regular" pillows as well, which I prefer. My only real complaints about the room were that the TV was a bit large for the size of the room, made it difficult to sleep while my wife was still awake watching it, and the air conditioner made a hissing noise everytime it turned on.

Reviews.Title: “Central Boston? Bargain”
Reviews.Author: jrobinsuk
Reviews.Content: I had a look at plenty of hotels to book for Boston, and this was the only central one that was within my (admittedly fairly meagre) budget. Given that, it could have been a total dump. In plenty of cities the cheap, central hotels are: they can afford to be, you pay for the location. But it wasn't. The check-in was fast and efficient, the lobby was nice, the room was clean and spacious, it had two bathrooms and was nicely decorated. And yes, had I wanted luxury I'd have been dissapointed, but I didn't pay for luxury. Generally with hotels you get what you pay for, and considering I didn't pay much on balance I'd say this hotel is much better than most. Infact, I think it's fast approaching bargain territory.

Reviews.Title: “Where Do I Start??? One problem after another...”
Reviews.Author: DomsWeddingGuest
Reviews.Content: My son got married last weekend, we reserved a block of rooms for ourselves, and out of town family. Stayed a night last summer to check the hotel out, all was very good for that visit. Since then, something has happened. At check in, we were told that the suite we reserved wasn't available. We wanted to suite, so we would have room to visit with family mambers. Pushed the issue, and the manager was able to give us the suite. These suites have two doors. After three attempts, and two visits from maintenance, they never could give us a key for the second door, only a master key could work. Several rooms had no AC, best they could do is offer a fan for the room. Several rooms had AC the worked, but only marginally. It's not like it was 100 degrees outside, it was only in the 80's. One guest found a roach in the bathroom. They wre moved to another room, and told that they would be comp'ed for the room that night. Until they went to check out, and had to fight for quite some time to get the room charge deleted. Billing for garage parking was fouled up, they tried to charge guests with no car for parking. Several rooms wern't ready for 3:00 PM check in, causing a scramble to get dressed for 4:00 wedding rehearsal. The staff seemed to be trying to do thier best, but the systems and infrastructure are a mess.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: outlier0901
Reviews.Content: I was initially fairly apprehensive about the hotel, as I read all these reviews about the small bathrooms. The bathrooms are fairly small, but they are enough. We paid a little extra and took the Deluxe room with two bathrooms, and it worked perfectly. The rooms were spacious, and our kids even enjoyed jumping from bed to bed. The location is awesome. The T station is just downstairs. There are many dining options available, not to mention the Au Bon Pain downstairs. I will definitely stay here again when I visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: kuklainunionville
Reviews.Content: I have no idea what the other guests are tallking about! We stayed two nights. I usually do not use room service for a short stay. I make my own bed and get my own clean towels from the hotel and whatever else I need. That is me I do not trust ANY hotel. You have valuables use the safe! For two adults and two kids under age 12 the room was spacious enough in the standard. I was on the fifth floor. The hotel is beauiful and is designed to have that "dated" look that is what the story of this hotel is about. The price? I only paid $126.00 per night and that is a good deal for such a nice hotel and location. CAA rate btw. Location is a good central location. We did not use the parking there. Since we did not drive around we used the lot across which was $36 per day or maybe less and our vehicle was safe. Trolly service was good but the metro is cheaper too. The trolly has 14 stops so keep that in mind. The Duck tour was worth it ! Boston is a very safe city. The only issue I have is the BS union rule! I could not use the luggage trolly, only the staff could use it. Why? Boston is law suit happy! When you go to Fenway park please bring your ID, no ID no beer! Another rule due to lawsuits! Also if you go on the harbour cruise, bring your ID again or you can not go on their famous USS Constition tour why? No one can answer that question! Wifi was free main lobby area. If you want really nice go to The Fairmont but its very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: ripken923
Reviews.Content: I had the "pleasure" of staying here for a conference and was extremely disappointed. The hotel had a nice feel to it once I arrived but that quickly disappeared after I was locked in my bathroom for about an hour. After trying to break down the door screaming for help and making as much noise as humanly possible finally someone heard me and came to my rescue, upon which a security guard stopped by to give a half -- apology and to admit that "this happens more than I'd think." How, in the sake of hospitality, can a hotel accept this standard of locking guests in their own bathrooms and thinking this is somewhat acceptable? Answer: It isn't! Even if they offered to comp my room (which they didn't) or provide some free amenities for my somewhat traumatizing stay at their hotel (which they didn't), this still wouldn't be acceptable. Had they offered me a free stay in the future at their hotel (which they didn't), I would not accept. I will never return to this hotel. Oh and one more thing- not only do you have to pay for internet ($12 a day), but it is WIRED. And the connection sucked! Welcome to the 21st century Boston Park Plaza, time for an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: amandadavies43
Reviews.Content: I found my room to be somewhat dark and gloomy but I suppose that relates in part to the age and historic ambiance of the hotel.The garage parking was expensive,$44 per day.Also they charge for internet access and local calls.The staff however were helpful,especiaaly the concierge Frank Gallagher.He recommended Old Town Trolley Tours who were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experiance”
Reviews.Author: Bugsy42
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights on the tower level (15th floor) with larger room and continental breakfast. Nice room, quiet, with good A/C. No bedbugs. Wife and daughter loved it. Thought it was a good value, even with the valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Everybody wants a tip!"”
Reviews.Author: sheyo
Reviews.Content: As other reviews suggest, great location, older hotel, decent rooms, etc. I am a very frequent travel and was stuck by how aggressive the bell men and valet were in making sure they got their tip. When I arrived late, sleeping child in arms, the bell man at the door expained that they would have to call the valet over from another location and made it seem like a "big deal" to do so. Then, the valet came around and explained to me that he would take my car, but it would be somebody else that would be bringing it back to me in the morning - again...hint hint. Same deal in the morning when we checked out and left our baggage with the bell man - he made sure to tell me that a "different person" would be on duty when we came back to get our things in the afternoon. It was LOUD AND CLEAR that they expected a tip at both ends of any transaction. And I'm all for tipping, but they were so aggressive - it was very off-putting.

Reviews.Title: “Old, Outdated, Expensive”
Reviews.Author: pburgwingnut
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is it's location. The prices of rooms and restaurant are outrageous for the poor quality and lack of service here. Smallest bathrooms ever, Toilets touching bathtubs, requiring anyone who needs to sit down to do so sideways. Very outdated rooms, but some "new" system (we were later told) requiring room keys to be left in slots to keep air/lights working while out. Small, old TV's in room that go fuzzy every few minutes. $25 for breakfast buffet that is very minimal and food not very good, along with nearly worst service in restaurant we've ever had. Most staff very indifferent, not helpful. 2 dishes of ice cream via room service =$25! Not only do you not receive a newspaper, but then the gift shop ran out of Boston papers 2 days in a row. Won't be back, too many other great hotels in same price range here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfortable. Beds”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshirecats
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights the staff were pleasant and friendly. We dint eat in the hotel or breakfast having decided to eat out and find a diner for breakfast. The room we stayed in was on the fith floor, away from the lifts. The room was clean and a good size we are English so are used to small rooms. The bed was a queen sieve and very comfortable my wife and I have bad backs. The bath room had a bath, with shower over. The noise levels were not bad, you can here noise from other rooms but it's very muffled. It's a good place to stay and was 2 minutes from the T and 5 minutes from the start of the freedom trail. I would say it's reasonable value for money. The main sown side is that there is no wifi in the rooms on floor 5, but it is free in the lobby were ther is plenty of seating to sit and access your email or look up were your going to eat next

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel096
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Boston Park Plaza Hotel. We were able to get a special rate on the Internet if we stayed three nights, so the price was great too. The hotel is within walking distance of the Boston Commons and the subway. Actually, we walked everywhere we went, including the Freedom Trail. We found the people in Boston to be very friendly. If we were stopped on the street looking at a map, someone would come up to us and ask if they could help.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: heshok123
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel 20 years ago and thought it was wonderful, but after reading the reviews, I wasn't sure. Now I am wondering who wrote the negative ones. Were they the rich who only stay in the best place for $400 a night? The bed was the best I have ever slept on (king). The room was very clean and nicely decorated, keeping with the period in which it was built. Yes, there was no flat-screen TV, but I didn't go to Boston to watch TV. Yes, the air conditioner was a bit noisy, but not disturbing. The bathroom was nice, but yes, a bit small, but again, who cares. The hotel was elegant and warm and everyone who worked there went out of their way to be nice and helpful. It is still the best steal in Boston. The original owner built it for the "common man" who he believed had been forgotten. He wanted this to be an elegant hotel for the average person. It still succeeds. I would stay here again as my first choice. And the location cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: hotelmanagementstude
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at this hotel as part of a road trip with friends. I had my own room which suited me well. THe bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean even if the toilet paper was far from the toilet. I ordered room service twice. The first time I ordered wine and the person, who was just filling in for someone, was very nice and helpful. I also ordered breakfast which kind of dissapointed me for the price I paid. The worst part of my stay was definetly the valet parking. I have an old car which has an issue with the handle on the drivers' side. It someone gets stuck so the door doesnt latch. I forgot to mention it to the valet and the light inside the car comes on if the door is open but apparently has he was backing it up the door swung open and hit another car. I got a call in my room and went downstairs. When I got there, the valet was pissed off at me and blaming ME for the damage to the other car. He even said that it had damaged a NEW car in a tone that was like they're better than you. My car had some damage as well even if it isn't new. I can understand being told you should have mentionned it or something but not taking the blame for the whole thing. Being a student in this domain and working in the F and B department of a hotel that has valet parking, I felt like the incident should have been handled with more professionalism instead of pointing fingers at me. Even, the supervisor said, at one time, that it was my fault in front of the person who's car they it. At least they didn't charge me for the parking. I'm not sure if I'll stay there in the future or recommended it to anyone just because of a small incident that was handled badly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but lacking in other areas”
Reviews.Author: DGNYC78
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this hotel's location. Very central to the top attractions/restaurants/things to do in Boston. However, it is a VERY large hotel, so if you're not lucky, you may end up needing a lot of time to check in. Also, their room service is not the greatest. It took forever for them to deliver fresh towels to our room (~50 minutes from the first call). I stayed at the Towers level, and it was great to have breakfast and the space, but the staff in the lounge isn't the friendliest. The hotel/rooms are also a bit outdated, though, if you look at the pictures before you book (on TripAdvisor), then you shouldn't be in for any surprises. I'm undecided on whether or not I'd stay here again. It is SUPER convenient in terms of location, and if I was able to book a room at a good price, then maybe. Otherwise, I'd think about some of the other hotels in the vicinity that are on par or nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best stay, but staff was nice”
Reviews.Author: 3GirlsandaBoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night last week before an early morning flight. I had booked one of the "plaza petite" rooms since I was traveling alone, and didn't need much room. These rooms are TINY, but it was very cute, had an older charm, and seemed clean. I have never seen a shower as small as the one in this room. It was literally 18" wide, but I managed. The real problem started when I tried to sleep. At first, I thought there were airplanes flying over the building. The noise was loud, and I soon realized it was far too frequent to be airplanes. The elevators were directly on the other side of the wall, and the noise was coming from them constantly going up and down. I tried to sleep through it, but it was just too loud. Just before midnight, I called down to the front desk and asked for a room change. The woman who answered was extremely nice, and was aware that the elevators often caused this problem. She quickly assigned a new room, and had someone deliver the new key to me. While I was waiting for the new key, a manager did come up to check on the situation, and she too was extremely friendly. The new room was much bigger, had a normal sized shower, and was really very nice. I was able to sleep a bit easier. I'm not sure if I'd ever stay here again, but if I did, I would have to insist on a room away from the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: brandychocolate
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty, elegant and very well located. A good venue to host meetings and conferences. The hotel staff are extremely helpful. If you would like some privacy I would check that your room does not have a side door linking to another room as this can be noisy. If wireless is important check which floors have free wireless available. The business center pcs are not always running but help is available 24 h. Overall a nice comfortable hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible, but would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: pearlgirl22
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying that I have submitted reviews for hotels on here for several different cities among varied hotel classes. This is the first hotel that I will not recommend. I try to keep in mind the star level and amentities expected at each level when reviewing. Given the quality of the hotel and that Priceline called this a 3.5 out of 4 star hotel, I cannot recommend it. I would have been furious had we paid the full asking price for a night at this hotel. Thankfully, we did stay here for $160 a night, which is good considering the location. Negatives - This hotel uses it's history to highlight their style of decor and room size, but in my opinion, this place is not showing it's age well. It is simply out-dated and not up to the standards that it should be considering what their full price cost is per night. We arrived to our room, which was very small, and we quickly noticed that the bathroom was the worst part. The tile grout was moldy and dirty. The bathroom door could not be shut without trying four times to hook the latch fully. The toilet was dirty (not from lacking cleaning but with stains that were clearly from age) and it was commercial style - the flushing lever was like one that you'd see in a movie theater. Not acceptable for "fine" hotel decor. The sink had a very awkward ledge right where the water came out, leaving you hardly able to put your hands under the water. The televsion was an old tube TV, and again, as I mentioned previously, for what this hotel charges, there is no excuse for not having flat screen TVs in all of their rooms. Additionally, we could hear the people in the room next to us having casual conversation. Not yelling or speaking loudly over the TV, just simply talking. The walls are paper thin. There is also no free high speed internet. Again, related to the old tube TVs, this is 2011 - unacceptable for such a "high class" place. Positives - Our king size bed was comfortable, as was the bedding. There is an Au Bon Pain almost right next door to the hotel and this was convenient for us in the morning to eat breakfast. The hotel is very centrally located to anything in Boston and is also convenient to the T. The staff was pleasant and all were very friendly to us. These were all helpful. Given our overall experience, I would not use Priceline again in this area of Boston and risk being given this hotel. To me, it would be worth the extra money to stay in a name brand hotel which likely would offer free high speed internet, newer decor and furniture, and possibly even a continenal breakfast of some sort.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but expensive”
Reviews.Author: MizzouLizard
Reviews.Content: The Park Plaza is a beautiful, historic hotel in a great location near Boston Common and all of the shopping and restaurants in the Back Bay area. They have retained the historic quality while updating the hotel so the common areas (lobby, restaurants, and meeting space) are really nice. For a business traveler with all expenses covered, it is a great hotel. For anyone else, it is rather expensive even beyond the room rate and Boston taxes that apply to all the hotels in this area. The Park Plaza basically has no parking so you must use valet parking that was $44 a night (plus tips), which seemed very high even by Boston standards. Web access was over $10 a day, and it was unreliable. The bars and restaurants were expensive compared to other places in the neighborhood so leave the hotel to eat. I would generally not recommend it for families as the historic hotel rooms and especially the bathrooms are too small for more than one or two people. There is also no pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly, not too expensive”
Reviews.Author: PalmTree80
Reviews.Content: The historical Park Plaza hotel in Boston is a nice place. It is clean and the staff is friendly. Their cardkeys sometimes fail to work, but they are easily fixed. The food court downstairs is fairly expensive, but considering its a city, everything is expensive. They do take security serious however; this one time i locked myself out of my room and the maids could not let me in. they had to call security for them to open the door.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a great location.”
Reviews.Author: sjray78
Reviews.Content: Advantages - Great price and location, comfortable beds and excellent service. Disadvantages - Room does not include refrigerator. Bathroom is also dated if that is an issue for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Betsyat240
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while in Boston for a training, it was a wonderful experience. Had booked a single room and then upon check-in found I'd been upgraded to a double for no extra charge. This was a lovely touch and helpful since I'd brought a friend along and gave us MUCH more room. Location was supurb, would walk through Boston Commons each day to get to the training but the T line was also very close by and easy to use. We found the Boston Park Plaza Hotel & Towers to exceed our expectations and would recomment to anyone looking to stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “We hated this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jasper298
Reviews.Content: Very expensive and supposedly upscale. Forget it! Showers are the size of a very small closet. Literally, I could not turn around in it. Try another property.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for doing the city”
Reviews.Author: PerfectionOnly
Reviews.Content: Superb location for shopping and sightseeing. Very large rooms. Nice bars. Very good service. Would stay here again - great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: deanfuller2
Reviews.Content: Old property. Location can't be beat. Bathroom and fixtures could use updating. Concierge wasn't at desk the two times we checked. Bar: bartender beat the crap out of my Bombay Sapphire Martini. It was drinkable but the T&T I ordered as a replacement was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: deli0
Reviews.Content: I must admit I was a little concerned about staying here because of some negative reviews. We thought it was an excellent experience. Our flights were delayed so we did not arrive at the hotel until after 2 a.m. the morning following our reservation-no problem at all. Our room was large, very clean and the bed extremely comfortable. The staff was very helpful with any questions, although it was sometimes difficult to find someone at the concierge desk. I liked that they kept the old doors with their funky design, just freshly painted. We did not eat here so I can't comment on the food, but we will definitely stay here again. The location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: BeefyWalesUK
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the poor recent reviews about this hotel we were rather concerned that we had booked it for our first trip to Boston but fortuantely I was proved wrong. Check in was very quick and smooth. We had a room on the 8th floor which was very quiet and clean . Yes, the bathroom was very compact but it was clean and had all the facilities you needed. The towels were replaced daily along with other toiletries. The bed was comfortable and king sized and changed daily. The room was warm and the AC was not adequate this needs to be addressed. There was tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms. Rose on concierge was very helpful. The breakfast in Pairings, either continental or full buffet was more than adequate. The staff were over stretched on the mornings when conference customers attended. The location of ther hotel could not have been better, very central and within walking distance of most attractions. Check out was quick and we were able to store out luggage for a small fee. Overall we had a great stay at the Park Plaza and I would recommend it to others. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Location and that's about it”
Reviews.Author: Momtotwo075
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over memorial day weekend. I expected really nice rooms. The room was very small, about the size of a small bedroom. The AC like someone else mentioned was not working and it sounded like a train all night long. It was very claustrophobic not having circulating air all night. After our conference we went on an elevator that would shake really bad. Every floor we would go up it got worse until finally dust was coming off from above..l jumped off on the next floor and it was shut down. I mention this because I feel this hotel needs a major renovation. The floors need to be completely done over with some rooms taken out to make other bigger. My husband was also upset because at check in I was in a conference session and they wouldn't let him check in without my ID even though he was paying and they had his credit card. He had to come get me to get his credit casd back. All I can say is thank goodness we were here for a great conference and I think they bank on the fact that people will not be in their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful, Comfortable, Family-friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iamathew
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two sons, ages 16 and 8 for two days. The location is just wonderful. Steps away from the Boston Commons and easily accessible from everywhere we went. The hotel is just beautiful and historical. Clearly this hotel is popular amongst all types of travelers - business travelers, couples, families, sports and other groups. The high speed internet in the rooms is not free, but it is very easily affordable. There are many choices of restaurants right in and near the hotel. We loved everything about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Itsy Bitsy Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: DAREINA
Reviews.Content: The CONS are you can only fit one person at a time in the bathroom, they are so small.The AC was not in proper working order,we had it at the coldest temp.but it was still hot in the room.The lobby and hallways to the rooms had a musty,molding smell.The hotel employees didnt go out of their way to help you. The PROS the king bed was very comfortable.The location of the hotel was perfect for our Memorial day wk-end. The Public Garden was a block away the "T" to catch a game @ Fenway Park was a short distance away ($4.00 ride R/T to park) and lunch @ Cheers bar was across from park. Overall, our 1st visit to Boston was pleasant. I dont think I would stay at this hotel again - the Radisson or Sheration were in same area so I might give them a try.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A GOOD TIME”
Reviews.Author: Yankees343
Reviews.Content: My wife,son and myself were supposed to stay here from saturday until monday this memorial day weekend. We stayed on the 7th floor--We could only stay one night--The room had a urine smell,stains on the carpeting and the couch--The toilet is so close between the wall and tub I actually had to put one leg in the tub to use the toilet.' The A.C doesnt work,the lobby was very humid and the elevators to slow for the amount of people--Im sure during its time it was a fabulous hotel but not now--Im sorry

Reviews.Title: “All what you get is the location”
Reviews.Author: Biztra
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very small. Staff not helpful at all. My shower was broken. I asked for a fix, they use tape to tie the shower head to the wall, really?

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel, ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: UkMarkC
Reviews.Content: Booked thru' B.A. for the first night of a fly drive holiday, excellent start. Lovely hotel, lots of history and showing no signs of age. As per any city centre hotel though, be prepared for the emergency services going about their business during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 60795Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: Really a beautiful hotel with incredibly helpful and friendly staff...

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced / poor quality”
Reviews.Author: hotelsearch01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while attending a conference.... I let the FD know about the HVAC not cooling and asked to have it checked out. After returning to the room I noticed the air was turned off so I called the FD and they engineering call me in my room to let me know they turned it off since it was cool outside and I should open the window instead. For paying $229.00 a night I thought I could make my own decision to put the air on or off. At check out I let them know about my concerns as well as about the cleanliness and terrible condition of the bathrooms that appear like they are still back in the 1960's... No apology no response - I would not recommend this hotel to anyone... Very poor quality and customer service...

Reviews.Title: “Historical elegance and charm”
Reviews.Author: cyclopsina
Reviews.Content: This is a cool hotel with an really interesting history. The lobby is stunning, the location - very near Boston Common, and the "T". There are several great restaurants nearby. The neighborhood feels safe, and there are lots of upscale shops all around. Our room was large and quiet, we slept well. My one complaint...I wasn't sure the room was all that clean. I wasn't sure the beds were changed when we checked in . I think it is the bedcovers don't lie straight, or something. I looked over the room closely to see if it was dirty and didn't see a problem. But I just wasn't sure. The hotel is old, so some things aren't quite new, maybe a tile in the bathroom missing here and there. Our room faced the empty space between the building, so there was no street noise. No view either, but I was happy to have the quiet. We loved that the "T" station was half a block away. We ate at several nearby restaurants, MJ O"Connor's Pub (we loved that), Maggiano's, and the best desserts at Finales.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: MariaLouisa
Reviews.Content: Spent few nights in this hotel early May and the rooms were quite small, but overall good location, clean hotel, nice quiet bar, great restaurants located in hotel McCormack & Smicks, Smith & Wollensky near by, Au Bon Pan, Whiskey Bar, and wi fi available in common areas. Staff all pleasant and would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but that is pretty much it.”
Reviews.Author: Azzurri17
Reviews.Content: This is your Priceline 3.5 star hotel in the Theater/Copley district. The good: This hotel is in a great centralized location. There is a subway stop that is a 10 second walk from the hotel. With access to the "T" getting to Fenway, Harvard, Sam Adams brewery, and other locations is no problem. Just past the Arlington "T" stop is the Public Garden which leads to the Boston Common and one end of the Freedom Trail. Upon first walking into the lobby, I was really impressed. The lobby has a grand feeling to it. The staff was nice and attentive to request. The hotel offered $5 credit to use at their restaurants if you turned down room service for the day and the room had a Krueig coffee maker. Room size was decent, and I had no issues with noise (our room was an interior one). The oddest part of the room: It had two bathrooms in it! The bad: The rooms seemed old and dingy. Lighting in the rooms was bad. Not that I travel to watch TV, but they where the old school CRT TV's. It would be nice to have an HD TV in the room. Also, the two bathrooms that I mentioned before, the floors looked dirty as can be and the toilet was so close to the bathtub/shower, it made it difficult to use at times. I would of much rather prefered one larger bathroom or a bathroom and a half as opposed to the two extremely cramped ones. I also had to pay $8 to print an e-mail which I found to be a complete rip off. The end result was a hotel that I didn't want to spend much time in. Which with its location, made it a decent hotel to stay in. Would I stay there again, probably not. I also wouldn't rate it 3.5 stars (Priceline).

Reviews.Title: “Historic, not modern...but location can't be beat.”
Reviews.Author: itzMS
Reviews.Content: Like most things in Boston, the price of this hotel is sky-high. The location, however, is first-rate. So much to do and see. Everything is within a half-hour walk (it's always better to see Boston on foot) and then a quick trip on the T if you have to be somewhere quickly. The hotel is quite a site to see and reminds me of a hotel you'd see in the movies but one that isn't practical to stay in. Everything about this hotel is not set up for the modern business traveler. Or the modern family. Or even a couple looking for a romantic getaway. Yes, I know it is "historic" but here is my honest review of some of the issues. 1. Very tiny rooms. Barely enough floor space to lay out two suitcases. 2. No wireless internet in rooms. 3. Bathroom is very tiny and doesn't offer much (if any) privacy. 4. It's not an issue that the TV was not a flatscreen, but the giant box TV took up such a large portion of the room. It truly was cumbersome. 5. There was no "express" checkout. You had to go to the front desk and physically check out. Kind of obnoxious to wait in line when there was nothing I needed to change on my bill.... 6. Lastly, there was a very large prom or graduation group at the hotel on a Thursday night. From about 5PM-3AM, there was no relaxation or convenience for "normal" guests...just tons of teenagers running wild. Beer cans, drink cups all over...partygoers passed out in the elevators and stairwells, screaming & yelling in the hallways, elevators packed to the brim with kids going up & down to their rooms. I didn't call to complain, as I'm sure many other guests did. I was told the next day by my colleagues that the hotel front desk even stopped answering the phone. However, in writing this, I hope that those who read my review will ask ahead of time when making their reservation if there are any large groups staying at the hotel. If there is, expect all peace & quiet to cease to be.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn would have been the same but cheaper.”
Reviews.Author: niesz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had dreamed of staying there someday, and we finally had the time and some extra money. We were there for a romantic weekend getaway, and we almost turned around and went back home after we checked in. It was a very disappointing, very dirty, very run-down, and very cramped room. The staff was cold and brusk (valet was great at least). It was on par with the Holiday Inn, except that it was 2 or 3 times the cost. We will never stay there again. On the plus side, we were motivated to go out and enjoy Boston.

Reviews.Title: “VERY CLOSE TO "T" in great neighborhood. Impeccable Service, Lovely Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: iPackLight
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Boston for a getaway weekend and stayed for three nights at the Boston Park Plaza. We mentioned that it was for our 10th anniversary and were treated like it was our 50th. Upon checking in, which was seamless, we received a room upgrade and privileges on the Towers floor ,15. This meant we got access to the lounge, where they have a continental breakfast buffet and appetizers in the evening (along with a cash bar). We felt very welcomed right from the start. Minutes after we checked into our room, there was a knock on the door. We were delivered a bottle of champagne on ice, two flutes and four chocolate-covered strawberries, and a note in the room also welcomed our stay. We enjoyed the drink and treat very much, but the thought that they put into the gesture meant even more. The hotel is about a 30-second walk from the Arlington "T" stop, in a very nice area of town. (Hermes is the first store you see when you surface from the subway.) :) Tons of restaurants are nearby (several attached to the hotel) and it's an easy T ride to a ton more. Newbury Street (the high-end shopping destination) is about a two-minute walk away as well. In addition, Fenway Park is two stops away on the T, so it was very convenient for these baseball fans. As for the rooms themselves, I would say they were very clean (and I'm a germaphobe/neat freak). You have your typical hotel scuffs on chair legs but everything else was very clean and tidy. The rooms have neat historical features like crown moulding and the bathrooms are still very historic feeling. They are definitely small but totally adequate. I liked the blue tile and felt like we were staying a bit back in time. It was fun to imagine the hotel back in its first few years. Some reviewers have complained about street noise but we had a corner room and weren't bothered by any of it. Others complained about the TVs being tube CRT (not flat panel) but we really didn't care about that. There's definitely wall space for when the hotel upgrades all the rooms to flat panel TVs, but the TV they had worked just fine. We also liked the Keurig coffee maker! All in all, if you want a nice room, in a nice area of town, with hotel employees who treat you very well and go the extra mile, I'd recommend the Boston Park Plaza. We will definitely return in the future!!!

Reviews.Title: “Despite the great location, Starwood should be embarrassed to call this a Starwood room.”
Reviews.Author: michelita27
Reviews.Content: I guess I can't complain too much becaues I got this hotel from Priceline, BUT I did [ay $160 for it, and I checked the 3.5 star box... and I can confidently say that the room was NOT a 3.5 star room. The location is fabulous... The Arlington station is right across the street which was a quick ride to the Garden, and we were able to walk to Fenway. It's also close to Newbury and several great restaurants. The lobby is very nice. My issue is with the room itself, which was smaller than any room I've ever seen (including NYC hotel rooms) and looked like it had not been touched in decades. The room was very dark (minimal sunlight). The queen-size bed and small desk took up pretty much the entire room. The bathroom was tiny (my husband and I could not even brush our teeth at the same time). There are a lot of hotels nearby (we've stayed at the Sheraton before which is MUCH nicer) so if you are planning a trip to Boston, I'd suggest you skip the Boston Park Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “A well maintained classic downtown hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: traveler30159
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a classic full city block hotel with a beautiful lobby to relax and meet people. It is very well maintained with a well trained staff. The hotel is located in a part of the city with plenty to do... a few minutes from shopping on newbuyr St. , the Public Gardens/Common and the theater district. Many excellent restaurants within two blocks of the hotel. Great experience. Rooms were clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, fairly convenient location”
Reviews.Author: DLillith21
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very nice, comfortable, and well decorated. They were more spacious than I expected and my room had a nice view. The location was convenient to the subway and near Boston Commons. There were many restaurants nearby but they were 99% chains and expensive. They were great for business lunches and dinners, but not what I would want for myself personally. For the conference I attended free internet (wired, not wifi) was included in my room rate, but if it had not been included it would have been too expensive to use ($10+ per day).

Reviews.Title: “Birthday to Remember!!!”
Reviews.Author: TinaW1219
Reviews.Content: I visit Boston, MA to celebrate my 37th birthday; 4/13/2011. My husband and I stayed at The Boston Plaza Hotel & Towers and were treated like royality. Check-in was no hassle, thanks to Nicole and Ray, we can not wait to return! We used the "T" as our source of transportation; and the concierge, bellman and the locals were great directors. As we set out for exploration of the city; Ray; the concierge on the Towers level greeted us at the elevators w/ a smile and a plethora of information for things to do, see, and places to have dinner. When we'd return for the evening there was wine and a fruit n' cheese tray waiting. The following night after coming in from the basketball game, Nicole had sent a signature tray of chocolate covered strawberries and wine on chill w/ a birthday card that read; I hope you enjoy your birthday. Nicole. The rooms are comfortable, and the bathrooms remind me of home; the decor is unbelievably beautiful! Our final day as we prepared to depart was bittersweet because we were leaving. Everyone at the Boston Plaza Hotel & Towers were extremely pleasant. When we return next season for a game; we won't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: badvikingman13
Reviews.Content: The Park Plaza is located in a great spot to visit downtown Boston but the guest rooms are a disappointment for a 5 star hotel. The rooms have not been updated in many years. Small tube TVs, no wireless, decor, poor lighting and noise from street make this hotel a 3 star hotel in a five star location. Service was excellent but more signs directing where to go with your car outside would help.

Reviews.Title: “Old but has character to the building”
Reviews.Author: Mj_dalive1
Reviews.Content: Check in agent Hanna was amazing......fixed the room issue right away. Self parking is the option to save a few $$$ but overall the stay was great with easy access to good clubs etc.

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe i got a last minute deal on this superb hotel!”
Reviews.Author: njsixty
Reviews.Content: I had never tried priceline.com before for last minute deals but got a great one for this hotel, which was awesome. Great location--a short walk to the common and the heart of boston. The room had an oddly shaped bathroom--toilet area was tight. I didn't mind, especially when I read that the hotel was a Statler originally and had an interesting history...and some quirky rooms due to the historic renovation. I also got a kick out of the doors to the rooms which still have the locked compartment built into the door. No longer used, but the idea was that the hotel employee could put your freshly pressed suit in the outside door and you could access it from the inside when you were ready and not be disturbed. No free wi-fi, but this doesnt seem to exist in downtown boston hotels.--have to go to an Ohio hampton inn to get that!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingIsFun11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in the beginning of April and thought it was a great hotel. I loved the location, I felt like pretty much everything I needed to get to was just a short walk away (Newbury street, restaurants, Boston Public Library, MBTA stop). The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly, and the rooms were comfortable and clean. Yes, it's a bit older, so the walls are thinner, and if people are walking past your room talking, you can definitely hear them, even if they aren't being particularly loud. Our room was in the beginning of one of the hallways so maybe we got a little more traffic than other rooms did--you could always request a room farther down the hall if that's a problem. I've seen a few complaints about there being older model TV's rather than flat screen TV's in the room---honestly, not a problem for me as I spent most of my time exploring the city and not in my room watching TV. I had a great time in Boston and I owe a lot of that to a great stay at this hotel. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: bal36
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one day on a visit to Emerson College, but felt pampered and indulged from the start, beginning with the moment the door was opened for us to the beautiful hotel lobby. We felt welcomed and appreciated throughout and were afforded courtesies and luxuries (e.g. early check-in; late departure; towers level privileges) at every turn at a reasonable rate for such outstanding service and amenities. It was a wonderful stay and one we will surely repeat.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY HOTEL, GREAT NEIGHBORHOOD, WALKED ALL OVER BOSTON.”
Reviews.Author: RUSTY86NY
Reviews.Content: BUT WE FOUThe hotel wanted $44 a day for parking but we found muni meters right in front of thehotel.. We fed them on Saturday till 8 PM and then they were free on Saturday night and Sunday. so the whole weekend ended up costing $12 to park.Great location we easily walked all over Boston. HAD BREAKFAST AT AU BONNE PAN ABOUT A BLOCK AWAY, THERE IS A SMALL ONE RIGHT NEXT TO THE HOTEL BUT THE ONE WE WENT TO WAS NICER.Room was comfortable and clean although a bit on the small side.

Reviews.Title: “Old doesn't always mean quaint, needs updating & isn't a SPG hotel”
Reviews.Author: SwimAndSki
Reviews.Content: As the title of my review states, old doesn't always mean quaint or charming. That's certainly the case with The Boston Park Plaza Hotel. While this hotel has a great location and is just a block away from many good restaurants, its owners have not kept the old hotel current and it really shows its age. My room was a standard double with two twin beds, a desk, old style picture tube tv and very small bathroom. The beds were comfortable with nice linens and slept well. The desk had wired high speed internet and the TV had a decent selection of stations but was small and old. The room itself was clean but felt old and I noticed paint pealing off the ceiling in several places. The bathroom is where the room really felt outdated. It was very tight. The sky blue tile was probably original and had badly yellow stained grout. The tub/shower had been recently renovated cheaply with one of those tub inserts that covers the old tub and tile with a new one. When you stepped in the tub, you could hear the insert crunch and pop under your feet because it didn't fit the old tub properly. It was an extremely cheap makeover. While I'd rate the room as average, the bathroom was definitely worse and not appropriate for this grade of hotel. The public spaces of the hotel were fine but honestly, nothing to write home about. The hotel was very ordinary in that sense. Service was average too. No one greeted me at the curb when my cab pulled up and the front desk staff was polite but didn't try to be friendlier than was required to move things along. Finally, while this is a Starwood MANAGED property, it is not a Starwood PREFERRED GUEST property. Didn't know there was a difference? Neither did I. When I saw the Starwood logo on the hotel's web page, I just assumed it was like every other Startwood property and I'd earn points and stay credit. If you dig around on the hotel's page and find their FAQ, they explain that they don't participate in the SPG program but it's hardly obvious unless you hunt for that info. In fact, the hotel collected my SPG number when I booked the room and the stay showed up in the SPG iPhone app as an upcoming stay. Whoever owns this place is obviously extremely cheap. Not participating in the program is crazy especially when other Starwood properties are close by. If you search around the internet, you'll find plenty of others complaining that they were burned by this as well. I would have stayed at the Sheraton or W nearby had I known.

Reviews.Title: “World's smallest shower”
Reviews.Author: JLR
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip so we loved the location. It was close enough for us to walk to our first meeting. It was nice to be surrounded by so many restaurants and near Boston Commons. I liked being near the prime downtown shopping areas too. But the hotel rooms were unbeliveably small. The room was just large enough for a full sized bed. And the bathroom was really small. I've never seen a shower (no room for a tub) that narrow before! It is an old, elegant historic hotel with a great history. It used to be a Statler Hotel back in the 1920's. It has that old, grand hotel look about it. The room was very clean and nicely decorated (except for the big old TV perched on a wooden stand). A room that small really should have flat screen Tv bolted to the wall. I was afraid I might bump the TV off the narrow stand going to the bathroom. I could also lie in bed and listen to the hum of the subway. It didn't bother me but it did bother my coworker who was one floor higher than me. If you don't care about the size of the room it's an OK place to stay. I give it thumbs up for the location & cleanliness. But it's also a bit pricy and parking is expensive too. There is a parking lot down the street that costs a little bit less. Not many places to park inexpensively downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vinuanand
Reviews.Content: I was travelling for a business meeting with tight schedules. The hotel is located in a good location and thats the only good part about this hotel. This is a old hotel and is clearly seen in the quality of the rooms. It does not have any amneties for a business traveller like No shuttle service, no free internet, no free breakfast - everything in charged.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, small rooms w/o wifi. Great service in an old hotel.”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustMBA
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean. The linens were nice. There was no wifi in the rooms-strange in 2011. The entire experience was outdated. But the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: laallen
Reviews.Content: When in the city my daughter and I always stay at The Park Plaza. It's beautiful and the staff is outstanding. The restaurant's surrounding the hotel are some of the best in Boston. A short walk will take you to The theater district ,Downtown Crossing, Boston Public Gardens and Newbury Street. The T or a short taxi ride will get you to any other destination. We love staying in The Towers. A little more $ but the extra amenities are worth it!

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: 2011ann
Reviews.Content: I visited Boston with a friend, and honestly we loved this hotel,our room was on the 12th floor internal windows,very quit.We had two bathroon in the room!!,everything was clean and nice,The hotel crew,front desk/door all of them extremely friendly. The only negative point that I found: the botlte of Water in the room was very expensive USD5 each (so bring your own bottle) ; ATM fee( if you run out of cash be ready to pay USD4),I definitly will stay again in this lovely old Boston hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No sleep for me”
Reviews.Author: Soniab13
Reviews.Content: Overall the Park Plaza was about what I expect from an older, classic hotel , but the noise in the rooms was unacceptable. Even though it's the closest hotel to my Boston office, I will avoid staying there again at all costs. I stayed for 3 nights. My first night, the room next door seemed to be used as a baby-sitting room for a bunch of kids. It sounded like 20 of them shouting in my ears until well after midnight (even with ear plugs in). Not the hotel's fault (except for the thin walls) and I knew I could call down and change rooms, but I was just too tired to get dressed, repack, etc. The street noise was also really loud, despite being on the 12th floor. And the ice machine on that floor didn't work. I called the next morning and they put in another room on the 14th floor facing the back (not the street). In this room, the outside noise was minimal/not an issue. But the radiator sounded like Niagara Falls when I turned up the heat. I had the choice of freezing or sleeping. The first night I went with sleeping and woke up bitter cold. The next night I went with being warm. I did not call to complain because I didn't want to change rooms a third time and one of my travel companions had the same complaint so I figured it was a crap shoot to try to get yet another room. On checkout, I was not asked "how was your stay" - so I wasn't given the opportunity to give feedback. Other negatives were that in the 1st room, some TV channels had so much audio buzz I couldn't watch them, in the the 2nd room the TV image was yellowed. Also - one of my pet peeves - the ice bucket wasn't emptied of melted ice/water after my 2nd night even though I left the lid off, and when I came back it was on (so the cleaning crew definitely saw it was used). Other negatives - no bill under your door so you had to check out in person, and no in-room wi-fi which meant working at a desk instead of in the comfort of bed. On the plus side - the staff at the bar and restaurant were great - very friendly and helpful. The bed was comfortable and all the furnishings were decent. And even though I expected small rooms, they weren't that small. But, for the cost ($233/night + fees/tax), I'll be taking my business elsewhere even if I have to walk a little farther to my office.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, great location, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: JFerguson
Reviews.Content: The Boston Park Plaza is a decent hotel. The rooms and bathrooms are clean and the rooms are comfortable. This is an historic hotel, so some modern amenities are missing. The rooms and bathrooms are fairly small, the TVs are old, and the internet ridiculously expensive considering many cheap hotel chains provide free wi-fi. It also isn't the quietest hotel, but the vintage character and location are excellent and the staff, helpful. My only real hesitation in recommending this hotel is the excessive rates for the room and internet use.

Reviews.Title: “I love Boston and the Park Plaza Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joep63
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location near to everything in Boston

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: mmp59
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff. Very short walk to the T. Lots of restaurants within walking distance. The bathroom is small but immaculate and adequate. Beds are very comfortable. Looking forward to another visit in warmer weather so can take advantage of proximity to the Public Garden

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING!”
Reviews.Author: SageandAndy
Reviews.Content: No only is the hotel in the heart of the city, the charm and service far exceeds the run of the mill chains. I stay here frequently with the airline and always look fowards to my stay. Go to McCormick and Schmitt for their happy hour specials. Best property in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay, but you could probably do better”
Reviews.Author: DerrickNYC
Reviews.Content: I really have mixed feelings on this hotel. The location is not great - you won't be walking to many attractions, either get a car (or bring one) or plan on taking Taxis. Rooms are small but pretty nice. We had an issue with the thermostat in our bathroom - which was tiny and not really up to par with the hotel - but they did fix it within about a half an hour which was nice. I guess I was just expecting more. We booked the hotel last minute as we had to change destinations because of a passport issue (originally going to Montreal) so the price was pretty good for a same-day reservation - but it wasn't Holiday Inn cheap - so I was expecting a little more, particularly from the staff and size of the room. Two different people at the concierge were inept and most of the staff just stood around and watched me and my girlfriend haul our luggage into the hotel, never offered to help or even hold a door. We just got a strange vibe, the staff seemed kind of detached and uninterested - not rude or anything, just somewhat apathetic. Overall, I would stay somewhere else next time in Boston, but I wouldn't say that I'd never go back to this hotel. As a plus, the restaurant in the hotel was actually quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: GJS_8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, the room I had on the 12th floor was large and clean, the bed was very comfortable. The best thing was that every staff member I came in contact with - the front desk workers, the employee in charge of a.v. equipment, the doormen, etc., were all unfailingly polite, cheerful, and helpful. I had a very nice stay here.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Boston, amidst the pulse of the city.”
Reviews.Author: JuliannaKempton
Reviews.Content: I love staying at the Boston Park Plaza because it's so genuine. One of the city's older hotels is always my first choice for the age-old quality it offers. The rooms are clean and welcoming, the staff couldn't be nicer and the building itself truly feels like the rest of the city rotates around it!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Boston Park Plaza Hotel and Towers”
Reviews.Author: Michaeljh_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights and thought it was great. There are quite a few restaurants right on the hotel property. That really impressed me. You can walk through the lobby and right into a restaurant. I believe that they had about five different dining options. The hotel is very clean. Even the lobby rest rooms are clean. The hotel is a charming, old style hotel that has had some nice updates, but keeps with its history. I ate several meals through the banquet meal service. The dinner I had on Friday night was the best hotel food I have ever eaten and I have stayed at some nice hotels. The staff there are just great. Some of the best I have encountered. Very friendly and helpful, but never intrusive. I would stay at this hotel again. Right in the middle of everything and just a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay more for concierge”
Reviews.Author: Roc_OnVaca
Reviews.Content: We paid extra to be on the "Concierge Level". These "recently renovated" rooms are no different than the rooms on the lower levels. No view and the same small "charming rooms" as in the rest of the hotel. The lounge amenities aren't enough to account for the difference in cost. The street noise (despite a room on the 15th floor) kept us up all night and didn't quiet down even on Sunday morning. The hotel is in a nice spot with great access to many downtown offerings but there are far better options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, great location”
Reviews.Author: illin0isguy
Reviews.Content: A big room in an elegant old building, with a tiny bathroom, a little too much heat and thin walls, and an often-absent concierge. But it's a great location for anyone who wants to explore Boston -- and the discounted rate was impossible to beat. Half a block from the subway, a five-minute walk from the Freedom Trail and an Au Bon Pain next door for breakfast. Also a good fitness center and a large, well-appointed lobby. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: FranceJen
Reviews.Content: Park Plaza is a perfect location for exploring Boston on foot or by subway. All the main tourist sites are close by and Arlington subway is just a block away. Close to great restaurants and wonderful shops...if you can stretch your budget to Chanel! OK, its a bit noisy at night(we were there on St Patricks day)but the beds and the room was really comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nighmare on Park Plaza”
Reviews.Author: michlaj
Reviews.Content: I want to start by saying that my husband and I are not picky and we realize that things are not always perfect, however if we expect a hotel to be at least decent. We stayed here for my birthday and the location was great. We arrived back at our room on a sat night around 11pm to the night club bass jammin our room out. We were on the 5th floor just above the "Whisky Bar" - aka the nightclub of the hotel. Would not have been that bad if it weren't for the feeling of sitting at a concert, but wanting some peace and quiet. After 30 minutes we knew we couldn't last another 2 hours til the club closed. We called the front desk and they moved us. We didn't know they were moving us from a king room to a queen room. Ok, whatever, i was tired and we were on the 11th floor on the other side of the hotel - quiet?? Noooo. Fell asleep and was awoken at 2pm by a group of drunken people - in rooms on each side of us and it felt as though they were in our room. PAPER THIN WALLS. So we didn't want to complain AGAIN and just prayed they would go to bed soon. Well, once 4am came along - SILENCE - finally!!!! However, after 5 minutes, the guy to one side began throwing up like crazy!!! I will never forget that sound - I hope he was in the bathroon!! Sounded like he was in our room!!! My husband and I had to laugh. So needless to say, we got NO sleep that night. Next morning, we ate breakfast at Pairings and it wasHORRIBLE - the buffet was the smallest thing I've ever seen. The sign should have been someone leaving the restaurant and telling us "This place is horrible!". yup they were right. Too bad because we love Boston and stay a few times a year....NOT this hotel, that's for sure. The management of this hotel really needs to take a step back and see what they can do to make the customer experience better. Good luck here - we will certainly not be back and will not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JSRHETZ
Reviews.Content: We just got home from our 24th wedding anniversary romantic weekend in Boston. After hours of searching the net for a speacial hotel,i came across The Boston Park Plaza.Boy did i find a great place,Our daughter is a student at BU. We have stayed in Boston dozens of times.This hotel was excellent.I was impressed the moment i entered the lobby.Outstanding Decor,met with smileling faces and great service.The front desk staff was so nice.I mentioned my anniversary and he smiled and offered us a free upgrade.The room was beutifull.Clean,spacious,quite comfortable.The bed even had 7 pillows!!! It was one of the most comfortable sleeps i ever had.The onsight restaurants are superb.All of what Boston has to offer was a 10 minnute walk away.For under $200 a night we were treated like royalty.We hope to go back when we pick up our daughter from BU in May.By the way her dorm was less than 2 miles away.This Hotel is great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KayBee24
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are small since it is an older hotel but the room was clean and I liked staying in a hotel room that was unique from newer hotels. The location is great...the Arlington subway is a block away and we were able to easily get back to airport through it as well. There are lots of places to shop and eat around the hotel and if you take the Old Town Trolley tour it is not a far walk to one of the stops.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and perfect location, don't worry”
Reviews.Author: canadiantraveller031
Reviews.Content: I was just in Boston with my husband and my 3 year old son, and got a great deal on priceline for the Boston Park Plaza. I was worried with the reviews I saw on tripadvisor, but I must say this hotel is much nicer than I expected, and very good value when purchased via priceline or hotwire. First the pros : - great service, staff was extremely professional and made our stay great. For example, they switched us to a suite when our neighbor smoked against hotel policy and the smell got to our room, they tried to locate my son's nightlight that we forgot in the first room, and when it did not turn up, sent us a teddy bear to the room for him! I usually stay at 4 stars hotel, was at the Taj on our last Boston stay, and service is as good at Park Plaza as any 4 or 5 stars; - bed was extremely comfortable, with duvet pillows and all white sheets; - suite was quite big, and decoration on par with other hotels, I've been to a few 4 stars hotels in Boston, and I always got pretty small rooms so that was a nice change; - free wi-fi in the lobby and in the suite; - location close to shopping Newbury street, Boston common, as well as Arlington subway station, with young children it is one of the best located hotels in Boston in my view ; - historical feel of the hotel, you can feel the Statler 1920's ambiance, from the piano bar to the elevators style, to the doors shape, we loved it; Cons : the only real con is the size of the bathroom, yes they are small, although in a suite you get 2 small bathroom so at least you don't have to share with husband! As for the size of the room, the first room we got was a king size bed and very nice size (for our son's crib), they showed us a smaller room when we were switched (was small but same size as room at the omni), and we ended up in a big suite. I believe we've seen almost all sizes available and even the smallest was similar to what you would get in another Boston hotel. All in all, a great value hotel and would definitively merit a 4 star if not for the small bathrooms. Would definitively return and ask again for an upgrade to a bigger room if available.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel let down by historic layout”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan552
Reviews.Content: This hotel has very nice public areas and is probably in the most central location you could ask for in Boston with a huge choice of nearby restaurants and other attractions. However, although clean with comfortable beds, the hotel's rooms are from a different era and let down by a lack of major renovation. Rooms are small with Victorian bathrooms and somewhat eccentric heating. Worst feature is the paper thin walls where you can easily hear next door conversations and the TV. I had to call my neighbor at midnight to ask her to turn the TV down. Make sure you bring earplugs if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bonnie0358
Reviews.Content: My husband and i had the pleasure of staying at The Boston Park Plaza last week. I was taking a training and he traveled around the city. The Concieerges on the 15th floor: Concierges Tower Level, were the best, Justin and Ray! The service was ultimate and their knowledge of Boston was extremely helpful. We had a king size room which included breakfast and evening hot snacks in the club room. Loved the private non-stop elevator to the 15th floor. At night you need to use your room key to get off. This hotel is exquisite and we hope to return soon. What a memorable stay. Bonnie

Reviews.Title: “Probably not best for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: aorrdalca
Reviews.Content: I liked this classic, well--located hotel. I had one of the basic rooms, which was very comfortable: not everyone wants or needs a giant marble bathroom. However some mildly rowdy guests came in late, and were plainly audible through the door. Not a big deal for me, although my colleagues reported very thin walls. I'd probably return.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby is the best part of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: beck1159
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Park Plaza three times. The first time we stayed in a corner suite. It was a fine, no-frills room, although the bathroom was very cramped and outdated. The second time, we stayed in a regular room with a king bed. Well, at 12:30 am we were awakened by drunk people hanging out in the hallway and it sounded like they were in our room!!! We heard every word of their conversation! After my husband finally got up out of bed to tell them to please quiet down (and I need to preface that we NEVER complain about ANYTHING) they moved to their room...........only to our dismay it was next to ours, so we continued to be a part of the party until they finally went to bed at 2:30 am! OK, given that, we gave the hotel one more chance. It was the other night. It sounded like there was running water in the pipes above our ceiling all night long, and even though we tried to drown out the noise with the TV, once the TV went off, we could still hear what sounded like running water through the pipes. Then, to top it off, we could hear the the moans and groans of the couple in the room next to us. Needless to say, sleep was at a premium. I always try to give a hotel a second chance, but this place has had their two chances! Overall, VERY thin walls, teeny tiny outdated bathrooms, and small rooms. It is unfortunate, because the staff here is very nice, the location is great, and the valet service is top notch. If you are looking for a luxurious hotel, or even a 4-star hotel, then this is not the hotel for you.
