One of these stays was for my husband's birthday, and I always try to spoil him with a nice hotel, and this one was just a bad choice!

Reviews.Title: “A Priceline deal that served the purpose”
Reviews.Author: mfnyc
Reviews.Content: Used Priceline "Name your price" and was given this hotel at a rate almost half of what was listed on the various booking and hotel sights. At the Priceline bid rate it was worth it. If I had paid the price listed, I may have been a bit disappointed. The room was small, dated, and the bathroom tiny. It was clean, and fairly quiet although you could hear people talking in the adjoining rooms. It looks like it's in need of a facelift. There were cracks on the ceiling, and other signs of wear and tear. We were there for a quick weekend visit so it was adequate. The T (green line) was steps away from the front door. There's also a Starbucks and Au Bon Pain a block or so away, for a convenient, quick breakfast. There is free WIFI in the seating area next to the restaurant (and in the restaurant as well), so no need to pay for it in the room. We parked down the block at Central Parking (they have a $25 coupon for 24 hrs on their website). The hotel garage was $44 so this was a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but smoke on floors unbearable!!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne1
Reviews.Content: Location excellent, atff worked really hard especially conference food/beverage/IT, meertings,. Rooms small and dated (bathroom- think cruise ship) but typical for a city location. What really ruined my weekened was the 3 calls a day I needed to make to security to report my neighbors on the 7th floor who were smoking non stop. Colleagues reported the same on the 8th and 14th floors. Our clothes, towels and linens really smelled bad. The hotel is non smoking and has a fine policy but clearly this not enforced, Worse is that in such an old building, a fire would be a disaster. The hotel needs to be proactive and police their smoking guests!!!!

Reviews.Title: “yet aagain a great trip to Boston”
Reviews.Author: Sara1964_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Plaza for the third time and it was as good as ever, we received a complimentary upgrade which was very nice a huge room with two bathrooms, lovely and quiet. The service was excellent..nothing too much trouble and the concierge knows everything!! Walking distance of Boston Common and downtown Boston, lovely restaurants very close by, try Finale for dessert and a glass of wine late evening. The T (underground) is a minutes walk away and you are straight on the line to Cambridgeside which has great shopping and the hotel will arrange a trip to Wrentham for you. It will be our first choice every trip to Boston

Reviews.Title: “Charming and unique.”
Reviews.Author: adholla
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my birthday with a few friends at the end of February and we all loved it. Having worked in a historic hotel, I had an idea of what to expect. I was very impressed to see how well this massive property was maintained. Our room was tastefully-decorated and offered some modern conveniences (Keurig machine, cordless phone, wired internet) that did not hinder the historic charm of the room. I know some of their rooms overlook other sides of the hotel, so I requested a view of the town. I was on the 6th floor and had a great view of Boston. My friends and I dined at Maggiano's (across the street), and overnight parking was a steal at $31/night at the Motor Mart one block away. The lobby was beautiful, the staff was very friendly, although I think the girl checking us in was a little off due to the fact that the guy who checked in before us swore at her. Her name was Hannah and she was very sweet. I would love to come back and definitely plan on doing so on my next overnight trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away unless your a heavy sleeper”
Reviews.Author: sinter102
Reviews.Content: I stayed in his hotel the second weekend in February. When I arrived it took 20 minutes to check in since they only had one person working the front desk. This is a time when Harvard University was holding a convention in the hotel so it was wall-to-wall students. The room was quite aged and it still had a tube type TV! The room was small without an easy chair to sit in so the only place to sit was on the bed. We were awakened on Sunday morning at eight o'clock by jackhammering and drilling. When we complained on check out, front desk person said there's no construction going on in the hotel even though I told her I would bring her up to the room so she could hear it the nonstop hammering and drilling which appear to be coming from the adjacent room. Small rooms, unsympathetic staff, having to walk down 11 flights of stairs because the elevators were so crowded, $40 per night parking and being awakened at eight o'clock by construction sounds make this a definite thumbs down

Reviews.Title: “I don't mind a dated hotel room but I do mind a dirty room with bedding held together with safety pins.”
Reviews.Author: NHPenny
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately a conference, sponsored by a local university, had taken place for two days prior to our arrival and the students left the hotel hallways, lobby and elevators full of trash which was still there the following morning. Plus, once checked out, the students hung around the lobby in groups apparently waiting for flights, again leaving trash on tables, etc, which also was not picked up by the time we returned from dinner later that night . Perhaps the hotel staff was overwhelmed. Its the only excuse I can think of to explain our experience. Our room had a very dirty heating unit which meant that when the heat was on it blew dust into the room. The shades were ripped. The bedskirt, which was ripped from the bottom of the bed to the headboard, was held together by safety pins. The Keurig coffee machine was filthy. We wiped it out with a tissue but decided to go to Au Bon Pain next door for coffee in the morning. I didn't expect a newly renovated hotel room but I also didn't expect a dirty room/hotel either. I was very disappointed and can assure you that next time my friends and I go to Boston, we will not stay at the Park Plaza. I must say that the hotel staff behind the desk was very friendly and helpful. Unfortunately, that is the only positive comment I can make about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie201183
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this great hotel numerous times. It is centrally located, a half block from the Arlington T stop and a block from the Public Garden. It is also easy to access when driving into Boston - not usually an easy thing to do. Wonderful restaurants are within walking distance as is fun shopping. The hotel has an elegant, old-world feeling to it. The rooms are large, furnished nicely and the beds are very comfortable. Some rooms even have two bathrooms, a plus when traveling with others. The staff has always been helpful when needed. This hotel is a great value for the cost, especially when booking using one of their many specials. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “One Night Stay - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mtsmith131
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Park Plaza Hotel and Towers was just for one night, but it was a good stay. We booked the "petite" room, which was about the size of a standard hotel chain room, and was sparsely, but nicely, furnished. You could tell that it was an old hotel (older style on the walls and some doors, etc.), but it was immaculately clean. The bed was very comfortable (for a double) and the television actually worked. The bathroom was small, but not too small, and could have used a better ventilation system.; otherwise, the entire experience was great.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: WannaGoToASkunkFight
Reviews.Content: Location excellent. Rooms need refurbishing. Door man not attentive - and doors are very heavy. Concierge tried to sell us tickets for a sightseeing trolley that was NOT running that day because of the weather.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been any better!”
Reviews.Author: per0myscus
Reviews.Content: I just returned from attending a two day symposium at the Boston Park Plaza. Having never been three before, I turned to TripAdvisor for some of their reviews. Some were good, but most were mediocre at best. Such direct criticisms as 'old paint, broken tiles, dirty carpets' made me less than enthusiastic about the choice of hotels. And they couldn't have been more wrong. My stay at the Boston Park Plaza was one of the best business stays of recent history. One review suggested getting a room with a 'road view'....and I followed this suggestion (room 533). The room was spotless, the bed inviting, the bathroom sparkling.....and the view was very nice. The meeting room was elegant, and handled the relatively large crowd (~120) quite nicely. Arrived just in time to catch the Superbowl at the adjoining McCormick & Schmick Restaurant. All I can say is.......SUPER!

Reviews.Title: “Big name, small room”
Reviews.Author: Jetsettergal_11
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a 4-5 star hotel, but the rooms were definitely not. The lobby is beautiful, staff is friendly and the hotel bar, Whiskey Park, is amazing. I guess a room is a room, but it needs updating. The bathroom was from the 1970's and the ac/heat unit barely worked. Their rooms come with double beds and they charge extra if you want a queen bed and charge more for a king bed. The doors to the rooms were all cracked and they have an outdated lock system. The room was cheaper than other hotels near by. Not as extravagant as I thought it would be.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location (affordable luxury)”
Reviews.Author: seabass747
Reviews.Content: Spent Christmas there with family. There is a parkade across the street for the hotel (quite pricey ~30$day but so is all other Boston parking). Would absolutely return, lots of amenities in the ground level (Au bon pain, Finale desserts, 'The melting pot' restaurant, etc) and walking distance to Red and green "T" stations, Boston common, Beacon Hill, Chinatown, Theatre disctrict and AMC movie theatre. Room with 2 double beds is enormous as it consists of what used to be at some point in the past 2 former rooms. Wall was taken down and now it's only one room, but still has two bathrooms. Mattresses were very comfortable. I liked the fact that the hotel was historical/old and yet the bed was super comfortable, no noise from the other rooms and they brought us a mini-fridge for free (even though their site says it comes with a fee). We were given a room facing the street, great view. I would recommend that you insist on street-facing, as some rooms face a faux-courtyard so you're basically facing other room windows... And for the price, it can't be beat!!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel's sales team gave us extraordinary service.”
Reviews.Author: hyellin
Reviews.Content: I recently managed travel for a group of about 30 people who were in and out of Boston during the month of January, each on a different schedule. Due to weather and changes in our project, arrival and departure dates were changing constantly. The hotelâ€™s sales team gave us extraordinary service, responding to all our changes immediately. We even made a number of last minute reservations on weekends and evenings that went through the front desk, which were also all handled efficiently, including our special needs. Our folks, designers and technical personnel, were extremely happy with the hotel and its services, and I was thrilled with the both the service and price. Thank you Park Plaza, and especially Lauren and Johanna.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby, grea.t location with small rooms. "Extras" are $$$$$”
Reviews.Author: doogha
Reviews.Content: This was the second we stayed at this hotel in the past five years. The location is great with the green line a block away and the commuter rail about four. The lobby is beautiful and has the golden era ritzy feel. The rooms are small and need a little freshness (the hotel opened in 1927). Service and staff are helpfull, polite and professional. Parking, room service and the restaurants are pricey; there are better deals elsewhere (MJ O'Connors). We stayed on the coldest days since 2006 and the hotel had some heating issues (along with the rest of the city). They did what was humanly possible to help and it really wasn't an inconvience. Would I stay here again? Yes for the right price. If you go in the warmer times of year you can walk to almost everything. And if you can't walk the green and red lines are nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay for the Christmas Holiday”
Reviews.Author: michmsg
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased for the most part with our stay during the holiday which included an extra night due to the winter storm. The front desk staff were professional and very helpful, as were the staff in the breakfast restaurant , tea and lounge bar. The rooms were nice, updated some. There is wireless in the lobby area though there is a charge for it in the room and some services in the business center. We were able to fax at the front desk without a charge. The Whiskey Bar was not a positive experience and will not be revisited. The location was perfect for our needs and we enjoyed staying in the historic hotel. The Christmas Tea was a treat and enjoyed by all. All in all we would most likely return.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home in Boston...”
Reviews.Author: TimBeauKin
Reviews.Content: From the convenient Back Bay location and proximity to shopping and Boston's great attactions to the excellent service provided by the staff, to me there's no better place to stay in downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jshummyqb11
Reviews.Content: Ok this was my first trip away from home with just me and my girlfriend. Looking on here for advise i was a little worried because of the mixed reviews. However, i was really, really happy with our stay. We stayed here for two nights. We checked in at 1pm, even though check in says 3, and the guy at the desk was very friendly and helpful. I told him we were going to a celtics game that night and asked him if he knew how to get there. He pulled out a very helpful map and circled the stop to get off on the T subway, he also told us the stop to get off for Quincy market as well. Checkin was very smooth and fast, no problems at all. So when we arrived to the room, i have to admit they were a little small and outdated, for example no flat screen, and the batchroom was small and needed to be "refreshed" with a newer sink and toilet. Not that they were gross, they were just very out of date. The bed was very comfy. Another problem with the room was the temperature. It was so hot at night we had to open the window. The temperature does not go below 65 degrees. The hotel was very clean, has a lot of nice places to eat and the T subway is a block away. The Melting Pot, a fondue restaurant, was very nice, a little expensive, but something different. Overall, i dont understand all the complaints about the rooms. To me when your on vacation, the majority of your time is gonna be walking around the city, having a good time, the only time your really in the room is too sleep. So my belief is if the room is clean, and comfy its fine to me, and these rooms were both. If i was to rate this hotel on a scale of 1-100, i'd give it a solid 90. If the bathrooms and rooms were a little more up to date i would not hesitate to give it a 100. I would definately stay again, and would recommend this hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money - regal hotel”
Reviews.Author: EduTravelerMidwest
Reviews.Content: I'm more of a modern hotel person myself but there is something very nice about an older, well-preserved, regal hotel like the Park Plaza - especially in the winter. PROS - Gorgeous hotel - Amazing public spaces - Comfortable beds - Very clean - Participants in Starwood's Green Housekeeping Program - decline housekeeping and get $5 towards a meal CONS - Small Rooms - Bathrooms are a bit outdated - Not great HVAC, extremely dry air - No Starwood points even though it's a Starwood property

Reviews.Title: “Royal Service”
Reviews.Author: Jessemed
Reviews.Content: The service was absolutely amazing from start to finish! The hotel is beautiful and they really do make you feel like royalty when you stay with them. It was one of my best hotel experiences in Boston, hands down.

Reviews.Title: “What a Regal Hotel!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: plumislerose
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. Everything was top notch. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “UPHA National Convention”
Reviews.Author: kcater
Reviews.Content: The Boston Park Plaza exceeded our expectations from every perspective possible

Reviews.Title: “Grand lobby, great location, average bedroom”
Reviews.Author: malton5119
Reviews.Content: A well located hotel, just walk outside to the beautiful park and within minutes you are on the Freedom Trail. There is a T stop nearby for the airport and further excursions. Step inside and the lobby is beautifully presented . However the room was disappointingly average, a little dated with a strange window dressing arrangement made for collecting dust! The ensuite was clean and the king sized bed very comfy.

Reviews.Title: “The lobby is beautiful, yet that is where the beauty ends.”
Reviews.Author: Zathanos
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review while sitting in my bed on my third night at the hotel. It has been snowing this weekend, and though both of my windows are securely closed, I am feeling a strong freezing breeze blowing on me. The closed shades are actually blowing away from the window. The wall in front of me has poorly painted-over patches, the ceiling dips down, again poorly painted in order to cover the cracks. This is far below what one would expect from the hotel rating and price. This is a Starwood hotel, and as a Starwood Meeting Planner member, I am quite surprised at the state of this room. After reading numerous reviews, and also knowing a couple who held their wedding at the hotel (and who felt that the hotel serviced their event wonderfully), it seems that there is a vast difference between the quality of many of their rooms. Aside from the front desk and wait staff, I found the majority of the hotel employees to be rather cold and put out if asked for assistance. I am a very pleasant, patient, and cordial person when interacting with staff, and was surprised by poor customer relations I was met with. Absolutely no complementary breakfast (and I'm only talking about coffee and toast) is provided, and I must admit that the $10 price tag for a bowl of cereal actually made me laugh, shake my head, and walk away. If you are a business traveler with an expense account, and manage to land a good room, then this hotel could be okay. Otherwise, I would avoid it completely. I would also avoid the $46 a day valet parking, and simply drive around the corner to the parking garage (the same one that valet parks your car in) and pay the $30 a day general rate. When we pulled up and asked the doorman where we could park, he really pushed valet. When we stated that we would prefer to park ourselves, he completely dismissed us, turned and walked away. Wired Internet access is available in rooms for $11 a day (slow connection) and $13 a day (advertised as faster), and wireless is only accessible in the restaurant. (bring a long extension cord because of the few outlets available for power, only one socket is located anywhere near to a table. This can also apply to the hotel room, as sockets are limited there as well.) Lastly, in the evening (9pm) it took several minutes for the water temperature to come up to a luke warm level which was still too uncomfortablly cold to shower in. All in all, I will never stay at this hotel again, and will certainly avoid ever using the hotel in conjunction with any conferences and events that I hold in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: SpringLakeGirl
Reviews.Content: I have been to many European grand hotels but the kindness and care of some of the staff members rivals those hotels' finest. I called this hotel in some distress when trying to make the reservation, as the website did not appear to work well, and I was calling from a place where my cell phone kept going in and out... The care with which I was treated by the reservations staff as i kept losing the line, was outstanding. The room was huge and very comfortable. As it happened I was just coming down with a ghastly case of bronchitis, which reached its full awfulness just as i arrived in Boston, meeting for Christmas with my grown son who had just arrived from London. This hotel cannot be rivaled as a good place to recuperate from a sickness in... In a typical Boston small grubby hotel room it would have been miserable.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with Park Plaza Hotel Boston”
Reviews.Author: Mistytom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 night stay at the Park Plaza Boston. We had 7 rooms with 14 people - 9 adults and 5 children ages 13-22. This is an historic hotel and the details are beautiful. The rooms were all different but charming. We had "deluxe" rooms on 3 different flloors but it only took a minute to get to them since the hotel only has 15 floors and the elevators are speedy. All rooms had two bathrooms except two that were handicap accessible and had huge renovated granite bathrooms. All had updated decor including the "heavenly" beds. The non- tower floors have not yet been updated to flat screens but it was not a problem for us. One of the handicapped rooms did have one however. The concierge gave me (who booked all the rooms) a card to access the Tower lounge which provided complimentary breakfast, evening hors d'oeuvres (cash bar) and refreshments throughout the day as well as free wifi. My teenagers were able to get free wifi in the rooms as well. We were there during the recent blizzard but the 9 hotel restuarants were open. We had dinner at Smith and Wollensky in the historic castle across the street. Highly recommended. Although it was blizzardy we easily walked to the Colonical Theatre to see Jersey Boys and to the 19 screen cinema on Tremont Street. The Back Bay location can't be beat and we got an amazing deal on hotels.com which included the option to cancel up to 3 days in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel great position, staff and service.”
Reviews.Author: 255068Dan
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel was fantastic and a highlight of my honeymoon to the USA everything was top shelf and reasonably priced. We stayed in the Towers suites and would recommend to anyone. Cant wait to stay here again when visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Dame with GREAT Location”
Reviews.Author: DonaldFagen
Reviews.Content: We booked through Priceline at the last minute so as not to have to drive home from a Christmas party on Beacon Hill. Our room was small and the bathroom was the smallest and most cramped I've even seen or used. Despite this, we enjoyed our stay as the hotel is really a special piece of the history of Boston and one of the best located hotels in the city. What made our stay was the kindess of the woman who checked us in. I explained that it was my wife's birthday and asked if they could give us a better room, even though we were Priceline customers. I'd called the day before asking the same and the man said he'd note it. Perhaps he had because the woman checking us in was so very nice and gave us access to the conceirge lounge and also sent wine and cheese up to our room. This was over and above anything we could have expected. Then again, the bathroom was smaller than any we've ever seen! All in all, it was the bed we needed in a location that cannot be beat. Beautiful lobby, great resturants and bars in the middle of the best area of this great city!

Reviews.Title: “Lots to see and do in Boston”
Reviews.Author: SNO-B-GON
Reviews.Content: The Boston Plaza was in an ideal location for shopping, siteseeing and eating. During the day we were at a conference and the Hotel had many restaurants nearby. Our conference rooms were a bit spread out and the grand ballroom was a bit dark. The staff was very courteous and helped give us suggestions for sight seeing. The Duck tour is an absolute must. I would like to return to Boston for a long weekend with my family. I would definately stay at the Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “A morning without coffee is like sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Madtravels02
Reviews.Content: We had a coffee maker in our room. The 1st a.m. we used the coffee and cups. The cleaning service neglected to leave more of each. So I went to the front counter in the a.m. and requested them. They said they would have some sent up. This was early in the a.m. and I was ready for my a.m. coffee. A half hour later we received a call they would send someone up soon. Knowing it would then take time to brew I went out of the hotel for coffee. Which turned out to be a good thing as the coffee never came to the room before we checked out at 9:30a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, Old Rooms, Broken A/C-Heating,Confused Service”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter105
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like this hotel given it's history and great location. But the room I had was so out of date. Old TVs from the 80's, equally ancient alarm clock, no wireless internet service, and the world's tiniest bathrooms (even smaller than what you might find in Japan). Middle of the night the thermostat goes wild and the room registers over 80 degrees. A call to the front desk did not get anyone to the room for 90 minutes although 10 minute service was promised. At that point the helper's suggestion was to open the window (with the temperature 20 degrees outside). Eventually a fan was brought, but even that took a while. I turned the heat off entirely, but the street noise then kept me up. With an important business meeting the next morning, this was a disaster! And the front desk the staff didn't even know where my meeting was being held, sending me to the wrong room twice. I know others have had a different experience, but I couldn't be more disappointed with my stay at this hotel, at least in the room I was given. There's a good reason why they were offering bargain rates....!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and honest staff”
Reviews.Author: Aslaug35
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in november 2010 with a group of friends for 4 nights and we liked it very much. The rooms are perhaps not so special but almost every experience we had with the staff at the hotel was very good. The front desk, the concierge and the cleaning staff were all very friendly and helpful. Only two bellmen that handled our suitcases when we were checking out were a little too insistent on getting a good tip. Fortunately two other bellmen that were on duty a little later that day were not like that, they were helpful and friendly and we were happy to give those two a good tip. On the flight home I discovered that I had forgotten some of my personal belongings in one of the drawers in my room. I was worried because this included some jewellery. When I came home I called the hotel and to make a long story short I ended up in getting all of my things sent to me a few days later and not a single thing missing. Having travelled much in Europe I sort of expected that some of the jewellery would be missing but everything was there so I want to compliment the hotel and the management for the honesty of the staff. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Small, cozy, convenient normal hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bmooreginal
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and cozy. The staff were helpful and hotel is located near the Boston Public Garden and Boston Common.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the "two bathroom" upgrade rooms”
Reviews.Author: leafpeeper98
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of the very low rates at the Park Plaza Hotel during the Christmas season for a bachlorette party. The front desk sweetly offered to upgrade us to a "two bedroom room" which we thought would be a awesome. Yikes, these are horrible little rooms in the really old part of the hotel, very dark small rooms with small windows looking over a parking lot. Essentially they took two tiny back of the house rooms, took down the wall between them and voila you get a medium sized, ugly room with two baths. Two tiny, moldy rooms that were built in the '50's and not updated. They then switched us to a beautiful room with a view over St. James Street. Big room, big bath, all is well. It was great fun looking out over the twinkly bright lights of the big city and down to the city scene below. Great location for shopping and sightseeing, dining and the theatre district. No Wi Fi in rooms! And just a clunky (maybe dial-up) connection in the rooms which did not fit my late model laptop. There is a fee of $10 to use this connection. Or you can go downstairs in sit in the one corner of the lobby that has Wi-Fi. Not great service for a business oriented hotel. But the price and the location were worth it. Just do NOT book one of those two bath rooms. Convenient parking at a good price ($23) across the street at the Motormart. Au Bon Pan and a couple restaurants in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience - upgraded us to a king bed room without us asking.”
Reviews.Author: westthumb73
Reviews.Content: From the minute we walked into the lobby, with the jazz trio playing and the upscale decor it made us feel like it was worth the splurge to stay here. And then when the receptionist looked at how tall my wife was and said "You're too tall for a queen size bed so I'm going to upgrade you guys to a King size, it just kept getting better. The room was very spacious, felt luxurious and everything worked. The only downside was that the internet connection wasn't free. Even though it was above our usual price range, it was still one of the cheapest places to stay in the area. Very convenient to restaurants and the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Not Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi087
Reviews.Content: Although in a great position we did not think that Boston Park Plaza was value for money. There was no plug in the bathroom basin and on the morning we left on our tour while waiting in the lounge for the coach, we discovered a large chunk of uneaten steak on the carpet. It is a beautiful building and has once been an elegant hotel, but we thought it was showing it's age and was now quite dowdy.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: cpbass
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the Saturday evening before Thanksgiving for a 3 night stay to discover the hotel was overbooked. They then moved us for that night to a suite in the Sheraton a few blocks away, which they comped. Cab fares etc were all provided. Returned to the Plaza the next day to find an upgrade to the Concierge Floor, including private lounge on the floor with complimentary breakfast and evening hot appetizers. On checking in the room had an enormous fresh fruit basket. Returning later that evening we found in the room a complimentary bottle of wine with setup, a plate of cheese and crackers and fruit. Also a large souvenir tote bag from Boston containing asouvenit print of Boston, mug, magnet, and a postcard from Sara at the desk wishing my wife a Happy Birthday (it was a birthday trip) and apologizig for the problems. The treatment was fantastic and te Hotel is beautiful. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & best price”
Reviews.Author: russkita
Reviews.Content: despite the negative reviews I have read, my experience was pretty great. The hotel staff were polite and efficient .. the rooms were spacious and the double beds were comfortable with great mattress. The location is unbeatable - right around the corner from Newburry Street.. Personally, I never had problem and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: mike7369
Reviews.Content: I really dont think you can get a better value for your money than staying here. Great rate, very classy, great location, terrific value. By the way, some of the most comfortable pillows and cases ive had at any hotel. Will stay again and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: JBRAVO55
Reviews.Content: We stay at the 15th floor that includes breakfast and snaks at the bar in the afternoon

Reviews.Title: “The Park Plaza is Elegant and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: fleamd
Reviews.Content: upon check in i revecieved a free upgrade to a suite that ncluded breakfast at pairings the checkin process was quick smooth and the staff was incredibly friendly. there is a lot of competition in the boston area and park plaza has stood out. the rate was reasonable comparable to theriu cometition. the only negative thing i would say is the room was a little noisy between the heating sytem and the street noise, but overall great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Publius2003
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here four nights for a large conference. I found the facilities to be more than adequate, and the experience perfect for my first visit to Boston. The hotel has a wonderful location. It is right across from the Boston City Garden and the Boston Commons, and very close to iconic Boston dining (eg: Legal Seafoods). We did not have a car until the last night, due to the exorbitant parking rate ($44/night, valet only), but did not really need one anyway (the T station is a block away). Yes the hotel is old. That is the charm of it. Personally, I loved the classic Boston feel. The lobby is large and elegant, with many hotel reps ready to serve you. One person in particular, named Charles, approached me several times during my stay to answer any questions or concerns I had. I found the service to be top notch. The rooms are classic and elegant. I slept very well each night I was there, and found the furnishings to be updated and well kept. The bathroom was classic, with vintage checkered tile and fixtures. Still, it was very clean and well ketp. Overall, I loved my stay, and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ragazzo421
Reviews.Content: Wonderful old charm hotel with great location. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location is the only positive- poor staff, poor rooms, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Traveller238510
Reviews.Content: This was very disappointing, we had to move hotels after the hotel that we were in could not fit us in for an extra night. This hotel was just around the corner from the one that we had been staying in so when we walked past we decided to check the rates. The lobby looked ok and they quoted a price that was similar to our first hotel so we booked in for a night. Don't let the lobby fool you- the rooms are old and falling apart, the beds are very uncomfortable, our tv cut out every 15 mins or so, there was a radiator that would not turn off so the room was boiling and when we told reception we were simply informed "some of the rooms have that problem" and they suggested that we put the air conditioning on. The AC is preset to have a minimum of 67 so that didn't work. Overall it was a very uncomfortable night but what topped it off was when getting our bags the man didn't speak but scowled at us and then held out his hand for money. As we walked outside to get a taxi to the airport the doorman was tried to shove us in one of the unmarked shuttle buses that was parked outside- they quoted us $30 a head (a taxi costs less than that for all of us) and then the doorman tried to bully us into taking it. When we said no he refused to get us a taxi and moved on to the next hotel guest trying to get a taxi. I can't believe that the hotel allows this to go on- I see other reviews have mentioned this issue so they are clearly aware of it and must encourage it.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel - would avoid”
Reviews.Author: butlerstl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one day on 11/16 because of a business conference at the hotel. While we had requested a king bed, one wasn't available when we checked in around noon (check-in is at 3 pm). The bed in our original room appeared to be a double. We immediately requested another room and were given another one an hour or so later. The wait wasn't an issue as we had to go out for lunch anyway. Our new room was much larger than the first one and had a king bed. What made the room unusual is that it contained two separate full bathrooms - each one identically sized. The showers were extremely small even for my wife and me, and we're on the slim side. I'm sure that other travelers might have some serious issues with this. As others have mentioned, there is no free wifi in the room which is a mild inconvenience. One of the hotel restaurants did offer complimentary internet access, however. On the plus side, the subway (the "T") close - only one block north on Arlington. We used it to go to dinner in Cambridge the first night - the subway was very easy to use. Overall the hotel seemed to show its age. While nothing was terrible, there wasn't anything outstanding either. We didn't eat at any of the hotel restaurants, so I cannot comment on them. Given the number of other hotels options, I would opt for one of them if traveling back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room, great hotel location”
Reviews.Author: marcyro
Reviews.Content: My room was closet-sized, yet comfortable since I spent almost no time there. The bed and climate control were excellent. The room was not quiet, you could literally hear footfalls outside the door and every time a room near by was entered, it sounded like someone was entering my room. The conference facilities are ballrooms and salons on the mezzanine and smallish conference rooms on the fourth floor. The elevators can not handle conference capacity at breaks so it is nearly impossible to steal away to your room unless you hoof it, which I did b/c I was only on the 7th floor. The staff was extremely accommodating and helpful. The lighting in this hotel makes you feel like you are in an old movie, hazy and a little out of focus. Okay for special events but not so much for meetings. The location was fantastic and it is nice to be in an historic hotel, especially in such an historic city (when you don't have time to do the touristy things). There are several good restaurants in the hotel itself, but lots in the surrounding neighborhoods of Back Bay and Beacon Hill. Right across from Boston Common and the exquisite, high end shopping district, the location is really superb.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nrstrong
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful stay! The management more than made up for the problems I had in the summer. The many little details they paid attention to were delightful. I'd recommend staying here to anyone going to Boston. (Also, I recommend going on the Boston Chocolate Walking Tour - what fun!)

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting the worst - was pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: westcoastvangirl
Reviews.Content: I will keep this review short, because I am writing it many months after our visit (we were there in May 2010). What I will say that was unfortunate was all the bad reviews that this hotel was given. So upon us flying into Boston I was prepared for the worst hotel ever. Well - that did not happen. The front desk was amazing. We had a fracas with the taxi system in Boston and ended up on the wrong part of town, but seeing my sweaty exasperated face...the front desk immediately upgraded us to the Towers. Now taking this into consideration, this may be different than a regular room. It also included a concierge and free happy hour and breakfast! :) Still, the fact is that this hotel is an older hotel. I'm from Vancouver and the reason why people stay at Hotel Vancouver is for the nostalgia. If you want modernity - go to the W. If you want a great location with fantastic restaurants close by, fantastic staff, comfy bed, clean and functional shower & bath area (yes it is small, but based on how the hotel was built, there is no way to fix this unless you completely demolish it and rebuild it!). We actually thought this was better than our hotel in New York which got a higher trip advisor rating (mind you our expectations were higher) and more comfortable (huge room and bed) than our hotel in Chicago (Affinia). Again, like anyone who reads Trip Advisor, if you are researching your hotels, you know what you are paying for. The only reason I had no choice was that I got a steal on Priceline for peak season in Boston. I would definitely stay here again, but probably only if I got a deal and was in the Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Very underrated, would recommend without hesitation”
Reviews.Author: tanfms1978
Reviews.Content: Got a really good deal on this hotel but was apprehensive ahead of the visit due to the relative low rating on Trip Advisor (#50 of 73!?). Have to say it ticked every box. Efficient staff, met all special requests we made in advance, room was more than satisfactory, service was great, on site amenities plentiful, location ideal. Yes it was busy with conferences etc, but then that's what it does, cater for large groups, but never taking its eye off the needs of the individual guest. And most of all, the concierge team has to be one of the most helpful and knowledgeable I have ever come across. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Elena41771
Reviews.Content: The Boston Park Plaza hotel is not only rich in history, it's a terrific place to stay for both business and pleasure. From the amazingly comfortable beds (the pillows are like clouds), to the wonderful staff who will accomodate your every need, to the onsite restaurants it's the best place to stay in Boston in my opinion! It's only a 5 minute walk to the Boston Commons as well as the theater district. We all know location is key and this is no exception! You will not be disappointed if you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Customer service that went above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: mcintyly
Reviews.Content: The hotel was everything we had expected from the Park Plaza, until there was a knock on the door. We certainly had not expected the front desk to send us up a bottle of wine and a plate of cheese and crackers with a personalized note extending their wishes for us to enjoy our fundraiser that evening. Remarkable customer service in an already wonderful location and beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It is like visiting the most wonderful family ever”
Reviews.Author: jamaica077
Reviews.Content: Ever wonder why travelers continue to frequent the same hotel?? it is because there is the comfort of family with the staff. The Sales staff Lauren Drozdow and Johanna stegerwald provide impecable service, and are just the Most amazing staff the hotel could want. Not only are they upbeat, full of amazing knowledge - blue ribbon for sure. They are the two reasons i continue to visit the hotel. beautiful, charming and most amazing .

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel for Group Meetings”
Reviews.Author: CharlestownNH
Reviews.Content: I organized a three-day conference for a group of 40-80 people for various meetings. The staff at the Park Plaza were superb! The only issue I had was sleeping. The streets were quite noisy -- horns blowing late into the night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - most comfortable bed I have ever slept in!”
Reviews.Author: 41841Klf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. It is a beautiful gem in walking distance to everything. It was quiet, extremely clean and the concierge desk knows Boston inside and out. Best of all, the bed was incredibly comfortable. I have decided to make this my "Boston" hotel when ever I am in that city.

Reviews.Title: “Maria Genovese is a goddess!”
Reviews.Author: larsonya
Reviews.Content: For the last two years I have planned a 500+ person conference at this hotel, and have been immensely satisfied with my experience there. We worked with Maria Genovese, a fabulous salesperson, who helped us make every detail of our vision real. She rules!! Also, she's incredibly warm and a genuine friend to her clients. We are big fans of the Park Plaza Hotel because of Maria. If you're thinking of planning an event at this hotel, get a hold of Maria Genovese!

Reviews.Title: “Park Plaza is a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: wscharer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a conference I was helping to run. Maria Genovese made everything run smoothly and was a true pleasure to work with. The Park Plaza rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Very old world - in good ways and bad”
Reviews.Author: marmtravel
Reviews.Content: Two adults, one teenager and one child stayed for one night at the Park Plaza Hotel, and had an interesting time. Location is perfect, excellent for sightseeing and college touring, both of which we were there to do. We had a very reasonable rate compared to hotels in the area. The very nice employee who checked us in offered a complimentary upgrade to a larger room, which was great with four people, but what a weird room. We looked out on a rooftop with fake grass and several decoy geese (I imagine theyâ€™re there to scare off real geese), so a very strange view. We had two teeny mini-bathrooms, one with a somewhat modern shower and a sink, the other with a toilet, sink and very old shower. I didnâ€™t shower in that one, but understand it was difficult to stand facing the shower head and you had to awkwardly stand sideways in the shower. Everything was clean and tidy, and the two double beds were comfortable, but the sleeping rooms in the hotel are in need of modernization. No flat screen, no wifi, no iPod dock, no refrigerator. The room did feature a one-cup Keurig coffee maker. The lobby is very old world elegant, and the entire party enjoyed a wine/tea nightcap while listening to the wonderful piano player in the lounge. Having a selection of restaurants accessible right in the building was nice on a rainy night â€“ we ate at both Pairings (breakfast) and The Melting Pot (lunch) as well as Au Bon Pain, but everything was expensive. And when you pay $20 for a â€œcreate your ownâ€� omelette (at Pairings) then wait for 20 minutes for it, you should get the right order. Our obnoxious waiter didnâ€™t write anything down, and they were wrong. In a hurry, we ate them anyway and went on our way, but it was disappointing. We paid the steep $44/night for parking because it was raining and we were running late for an appointment, but you can walk over to the Boston Common garage a few blocks away and pay $27/night on weekdays, $11/night on the weekends. Iâ€™m rating the hotel very good because of the location, and we had a good night's stay -- there was nothing inherently wrong â€“ but it could have been even better.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort within easy walking distance of the attractions of this great city.”
Reviews.Author: jan43_10
Reviews.Content: Previous reviewers worried me when I had booked this holiday, but I am glad I went ahead with it. I asked for a quiet room and the receptionist put us on the 11th floor, away from lifts and ice machines. Take ear plugs if police sirens might wake you! The room view was of a new little park being constructed, but you could skip the view for an internal room. The bathrooms are the size of those in a British hotel, no problems there. We didn't eat in the hotel as BA offered 'room only', but the little cafe (Au Bon Pain) along from the front door,provided masses of choice for breakfast and snacks with lovely, friendly service. The beds & pillows are soooo comfortable and the ladies who cleaned on our corridor were very helpful and cheery. ( Does anyone know what a reasonable gratuity is for these hard working people? We asked at Reception & they couldn't help). The entrance is grand, sometimes with musicians playing along as you enjoy afternoon tea at the tables. You are only a short walk from all attractions/metro and friendly locals offering guidance if you are lost.So much to do, a week wasn't long enough!

Reviews.Title: “nice - but there are limits”
Reviews.Author: Bill-Vancouver
Reviews.Content: yes it is a nice hotel - history abound - but ther comes a time when there is only so much BS one can take. Small rooms with no wifi or bar fridge. I am on the 6th floor as I type this . The walls bewteen the rooms are very thin ... and when your surroundred by chatty cathy's it can be annoyining. So much for a good nights sleep. The room I am in is 618 - its in the back, above Whisky Jacks - a nightclub for the weekends??? anyways the boom boom music is present in the room. Having to get up at 6 am and getting a good nights sleep has its challenges. Don't get me wrong - the hotel staff are great and the hotel over all is good - just beware your room is.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for our wedding guests”
Reviews.Author: dsstagemanager
Reviews.Content: Our families truly enjoyed staying at The Park Plaza. The location was perfect -- walking distance to the Common and Public Garden, the Freedom Trail, and terrific shopping and restaurant choices. The staff was always efficient and friendly, the rooms were very nice and the lobby is beautiful. We especially enjoyed our rooms in The Towers with its access to the The Lounge (free breakfast and afternoon snacks). The Park Plaza was a wonderful choice for our families to get together for our wedding. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location. Excellent Service. Classic Hotel. Reliable in Every Way.”
Reviews.Author: cdcastellani
Reviews.Content: I live in the Boston area and whenever family or friends visit, I insist they stay at Park Plaza. The hotel is in the perfect location, at the nexus of all the T stops and steps from every important Boston site. The service has always been impeccable and the rooms fairly price, spacious and in excellent shape. I highly recommend the Towers level, which costs more but is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Business Meetings”
Reviews.Author: VATravellers
Reviews.Content: I work for a small company and have planned three business meetings at The Boston Park Plaza over the past two years. The location is fantastic, the Park Plaza staff make meeting planning easy, the meetings are very well managed, and the function food is wonderful. I have had an excellent experience personally and the meeting guests have echoed my enthusiasm!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute great location, beautiful public areas, teeny rooms.”
Reviews.Author: rac-columbus
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Park Plaza. It would be hard to have a better location: a half block from the public garden and all the shopping of Boylston and Newbury streets. Just a short walk to Trinity Church (a must see), Copley Place, Prudential Center. The hotel is quite lovely - spacious lobby, lounge, and numerous restaurants. We splurged for a concierge level room (they call it the tower level) at a conference rate of $365 per night, including tax, so quite expensive I think. Our room was spotlessly clean, the king bed was very comfortable, and the large flat screen TV worked ok. The bathroom was miniscule. In fact we could not open the door all the way, because the toilet blocked the door! And the bathtub has this very strange gel-like padding on the bottom. It made for a rather dangerous shower, since you had to worry about keeping your balance. Just don't close your eyes, or you might fall over! The size of the room and bathroom are typical of older, historic hotels. But this bathroom was REALLY teeny. The concierge level had a nice lounge that served an ok breakfast and a nice afternoon snack with a cash bar. Overall the Park Plaza is an ok place to stay. Just don't expect a large room like you might get at the newer hotels. It's an historic building. Great staff, very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kristensvilla
Reviews.Content: We recently took a trip to boston to see a ball game and stayed at the Park Plaza Hotel. I was pleasnty surprised with everything the hotel had to offer. The rooms were nice. Old fashioned but very spacious. The bathroom I found to be on the smaller side. A little too small. Valet parking was $44 which is expensive for me but thats the going rate anywhere around. We were able to walk all around from this hotel. We walked down to the harbor for a whale tour and walked the other way to get to the mall. We took a taxi to get to fenway only because we were running late after the whale watch tour. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Skamom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend in Boston visiting our son. This was our first stay at the Boston Park Plaza and we weren't familiar with the location. We were very pleased once we realized how close we were to the Arlington T stop and Newbury Street/Boylston shopping areas, as well as the Boston common and trolley stop. It's an easy walk to almost anywhere and there are plenty of places to eat in the restaurant and around it. They even have afternoon tea in the hotel. The staff is friendly and this is a very historic hotel, so it's interesting to learn about the origins of the hotel. Our room was HUGE!! We had 2 double beds and we were in a corner room, so two big windows as well. We wished there was more light-we couldn't really see into the closet area and some extra lounging chairs would have been nice. the only hitch was we noticed we had been charged ($5.50!) for a bottle of water which we did not purchase nor drink, but they took it off the bill with no problem. We were very satisfied with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We were so pleased with our choice of hotels for this trip.”
Reviews.Author: JeanneDecatur
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently visited Boston for the first time. We stayed at Boston Park Plaza Hotel & Tours for 4 nights. It was an excellent choice, the location was perfect for getting around the city. We didn't have a rental car so that was important. The service was excellent, the room was spacious, clean and the bed was very comfortable. There were 9 restaurants in and around the hotel. The hotel was on the historical record and very elegant! It was located one block from the Public Gardens, several blocks from the Cheers Bar and the Capital House. Newberry Street was just a few blocks away and Copley Square wasn't far either. The only complaint one might have is the size of the bathroom. Being an older hotel, the bathroom was small but everything worked well and it was very clean. The location more than made up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Fall Getaway”
Reviews.Author: jlsatud
Reviews.Content: Loved, loved, loved the location of this hotel! Steps from restaurants, shopping, sights, and across the street from a T stop. There were multiple restaurants in the hotel but the food was definitely big city prices so we walked around town when we were hungry. Disappointing that the internet wasn't free but that tends to be typical in nicer hotels. (Can't figure that one out!) Room was small, but typical of a historic hotel and was clean. The bathroom was starting to look even more historic but it was clean every day! All in all, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Old, Indifferent, and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: harrison_post
Reviews.Content: Value. None hear. The front desk staff either were ignorant of how the hotel functioned or just could care less. We think the later is the case. We have never written a bad review. This was not a horror story, just a sad waste of our time and money.-

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Luxurious Experience”
Reviews.Author: paticake88
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful. The room was clean and spacious. We upgraded to the Tower Level and enjoyed the amenities (complimentary hors doevers and deluxe continental breakfast), Walking distance to everything in town!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ARyding
Reviews.Content: I got upgraded to the towers floor wich was amazing. It has it's own concierge, breakfast and a light evening snack are included in the price. The location of the hotel is right between all the main areas and one block from the common. The rooms are well furnished although a little small (make sure you shut the bathroom door before you sit on the loo! Overall a great hotel that I owuld recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Luxury”
Reviews.Author: kandoli22
Reviews.Content: The Park Plaza is a wonderful hotel for a trip to an exciting, historic city. It is centrally located, and you have easy access to many sites and tourist attractions. The hotel staff is incredibly helpful and accommodating, and the rooms are very nice...with amazingly comfortable beds! There are multiple restaurants inside the hotel, which is helpful if you want to stay close, though there are a variety of options very close to the hotel. The only complaint is about the restaurant Pairings, which has incredibly slow service. All and all, an excellent choice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel to stay while in Boston”
Reviews.Author: jc319
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a week long conference in the hotel itself. Service is very professional. I only had to wait a few minutes to check in and was able to head up to my room. Rooms are clean with the amenities that one would expect. Only minor complaint was that the room was a bit small, which required the desk/chair to be pressed up fairly closely to the bed. Other than that, no other problems. The location of the hotel is fine, as it is within walking distance to many restaurants, both pricey and economical. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: TrioOfTravelers
Reviews.Content: If there are redeeming quailties to this hotel, I hardly find them worth mentioning based on how disgusting our room was. First off when you are staying at a "premier" hotel you have certain expectations, one of which is that you have a clean room to sleep in. There was brown stuff on the toilet, dirty tissues on the made bed, holes and dirt on the laundry bag and grease smears on the headboard. That was the worst of it, there were other less offensive issues throughout the room that were more dissapointing than totally disgusting. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Palamino2
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely old fashioned hotel. The bathroom was small but hey it was clean and the water was really hot. All we ask is that the room is clean and comfortable and the bed was certainly the most comfortable bed I have slept in. The location was perfect for walking to the attractions - near the Park, Cheers Bar, Trinity Church, Pru Centre shops, Quincy Market and not that far from Fenway Park. We only took the T to Harvard and back and forwards to the aiport as the T station was just across the road from the hotel which was really handy. The food in M J O'Connors the Irish Bar in the hotel was really good - try the Guinness stew. The Piano Bar had a nice atmosphere for a nightcap.

Reviews.Title: “atmospheric and well located”
Reviews.Author: AndyShihtzu
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and conveniently near transport options. Very comfortable rooms and courteous staff. A very historic hotel with nostalgic ambiance. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but very old”
Reviews.Author: mikesbecky
Reviews.Content: The Boston Park Plaza Hotel & Towers is a beautiful hotel in the heart of Boston, and listed on the National Historic Register. This is both a plus and a minus for this hotel. While the lobby and the building itself are beautiful and grand, the hotel rooms are very small, the amenities sparse and the bathrooms tiny. When my husband and I arrived there was no bellman to greet us, open the door or help with the luggage. This was a huge disappointment for me for a hotel with a 5-star listing. The first room we were given had a very foul smell, but it was late and we stayed in this room until the next day. My husband requested a room change very early that day, but when I "checked" on the room change at 11 am, the desk clerk told me "he had forgotten about us and lost the note!" We were given a new room, with no foul smell, but you could barely turn around in the bathroom and the air conditioner could not keep up with the heat outside. The best part of this hotel is its location, central to many sites, shopping and restaurants. The concierge desk was helpful, but more than once I was given directions that took me way out of my way instead of a more direct route. I wouldn't stay at this hotel again if given a choice, but would choose a more modern chain.

Reviews.Title: “Park Plaza gives Old fashion "customer service" with a smile”
Reviews.Author: bpalank
Reviews.Content: I booked a block of rooms for our daughter's wedding guests at the Westin and Park Plaza over Labor day weekend. I visited both hotels and while the spaciousness of the Westin was a plus, the Park Plaza gave our guests wonderful service and went out of their way to give upgrades and special requests.. We were especially impressed by "Russ P. "/ concierge who went out of his way to arrange a special request for billing complimentary vouchers for tours that we gasve many of our guests. I think this hotel and service is what a 4star hotel should be! Chris P., West Virginia

Reviews.Title: “Opulance on the farcade hardly translates to a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: jmw245
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel at 9:20PM and after a long wait at the reception line where two staff members were working, ever so slowly, completely ignoring the waiting line snaking around. We were told that our room was not available becasue it had not been cleaned. The receptionist offered for us to freshen up in another room and then move to our king bed room after it being cleaned. However once he consulted with his senior colleague, she said that she would not be able to put us in a clean room first. After we pushed back really hard and questioned why a room was not cleaned at this hour, they finally conceded and offered for us to dine at the lobby restaurant on the house while the room was being cleaned. And yes, the dinner bill showed up on when we checked out, as feared. Having to explain the whole experience to a different receptionist was a painful and embarrasing and agnizing process. When it was said and done, we were very turned off. Oh, that is not to mention that the plastic-wrapped cups were so misplaced in a hotel of this heritage and opulance, and the doors and bathrooms and furnishing were so tired and the layers of paint=-on-paint in the bathroom was quite unsightly. Spartan at the best and awful awful service. Even Hyatt Regency delivers wall street journal. The "old world charm" doesn't have to resist the better media.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: scarletletters
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a convenient location in the Back Bay area. The lobby is beautiful. I didn't try the restaurant or room service. My single room was small and a little cramped with a small double bed, hardly any closet space and a cramped shower with no tub. The bathroom had hardly any counter space for toiletries, makeup, etc. The shower spray was very powerful, however; I ended up with a huge puddle of water all over the tile floor whenever I used it. Also, there were no available outlets in the room, so I had to unplug a lamp to charge my cell phone. I was told when I checked in that there were no king beds available. I had a choice between the small single room or a room with two double beds. I was alone, so I chose the single room. Had I known how small it was, I would have picked the room with two double beds. I know the hotel was busy and there was a convention being hosted there, but I still find it hard to believe that in a place that size they didn't have any larger single rooms available. Maybe the receptionist gave me a limited choice because I booked the room for a reduced rate on hotwire. Anyway, I was a little disappointed. I expected more from a 3.5 star hotel. By the way, bring your laptop if you need internet access. It's free in your room, but they charge for it in the business center. I wouldn't stay here a second time. There are better options in the Back Bay area for the price.

Reviews.Title: “The comfiest bed, ever!”
Reviews.Author: Amcailleach
Reviews.Content: Lovely historic hotel with the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in. Park Plaza is centrally placed, close to the T and within walking distance of the historic attractions, such as the Freedom Trail, Fanieul Hall and Cheers bar

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, stately hotel”
Reviews.Author: tsfl61
Reviews.Content: Park Plaza is a gorgeous old hotel. The rooms are tiny, but in their location, why would you spend much time there? Everyone was friendly, everything was clean. My only complaint is that even though I "made a green choice", the maid took my towels every day.

Reviews.Title: “Wrapped plastic cups.”
Reviews.Author: gjsand
Reviews.Content: I think my review is best summarized by my first observation: they provide wrapped plastic cups in the guest rooms. Seriously - the same you might find at your local Motel 6. I expected better. My only other issues are the room furnishings (the room was very big, but sparsely furnished) and the parking was $48 a night. Everything else is what you would expect from an old classic hotel. I will not stay here next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cocobebe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night. We have a 11 months old baby and travelled by car from NY. The hotel is elegant and clean. Upon checking in, my daughter received a beautiful swam (stuff animal). The lady who checked up in was very friendly. We requested a crib and got it delivered to our room after we checked in and also a follow up curtersey call to make sure we got it. I also asked if they have a room on a higher floor and was given a room on the 12th floor. The highest floor there is the 15th floor. Room was nicely decorated and extremely clean. I have no complaints except that the wall is a little thin. I can hear the two ladies in the next talking and they were not screaming...just having an early morning conversation. Also the cleaning lady knocked loudly on everyone's door for housekeeping. She even knocked on ours eventhough we were checking out that day. Luckily she didn't wake up the baby or I would be very upset. The location couldn't have been better. We were able to walk to Quincey Market (good half hour walk) but that's the way to see Boston and we were only two blocks away from the Newbury Street and one block from the T line. I would stay there again next time when I visit Boston. Btw, the bellman, conceirge, bartender were all so friendly and made our visit perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property with Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: coopchang
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 9/14-9/18 for conference. Property was exceptionally clean and beautiful. Check in was very quick and we were off to our rooms. I had read earlier reviews and visited the hotel web site so I knew the hotel itself was extremely old. The rooms are small and the bathrooms even smaller, but not unlike hotels in other big cities like NYC or San Francisco. The beds are new and comfortable, with beautiful linens. Just a few negatives: micro-mini bathroom without vanity so no place to place personal toiletry items, no updated tv's, pay internet with ethernet cable, somewhat noisy and not so efficient AC. Positives: Room safe, comfy beds, great coffee maker, easy access to cabs, Orange & Green line subways. Lots of restaurants close by within walking distance to parks, Freedom Trail, Quincy market. Conference rooms wer also very nice. Would definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been way better”
Reviews.Author: neptunepan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremely dusty and it made my eyes itch but that just may come with very old hotels. Some of the service was excellent such as the catering service but the hotel has some of the worst food I have ever had. Unless you buy the $50 and up plates it is not even worth trying. The accounting department completely botched about 25 guests room reservations. We were tax exempt and we are still unable to receive the tax exemption. The front desk could have shown better customer service and the management had an attitude problem.. Other then that, the hotel is in a good location but I would not recommend it unless they happen to get a fantastic deal, it's not worth your money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: unichick1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights during our holiday in Boston. We ended up booking at short enough notice as we had been let down by another hotel. I was worried about the standard of the hotel as I expected it to be booked out. However I need not have worried. When we checked in they were very efficient and we stayed on the 14th floor. There was some confusion as we went up to our rooms about not being able to use one of the elevators as they go straight to the 15th floor for VIPS so it may have been helpful to know this beforehand. However our room when we got there was a decent enough size. Having stayed in New York in the city centre 5 years previously I was expecting it to be a shoe box like that hotel but it was big enough with a great view of Boston. Location was perfect to get to tourist attractions and the T Arlington was nearby. There were several bars and restaurants beside the hotel. I would recommend Finale and Davios as they were lovely. The only gripe I would have is that the buffett breakfast at $20 is overpriced so we tried to find alternative breakfast options. The lobby is really breath taking and even some tourists were coming in just to take a picture of it! All in all a great stay and would have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply put: "Wow!"”
Reviews.Author: bentcruiser
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. It is very elegant. Everyone there is accommodating. They are just simply amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Made my first trip to Boston awesome. Will definitely stay here again and again”
Reviews.Author: ConstantTraveler22
Reviews.Content: So I took a spontaneous relaxation trip to Boston for just a night. I had never been to Boston and it was literally planned on the spot. I picked the hotel for the very good location, and it didnt dissapoint. First off, like I said I had never been to Boston and it seemed like I was everywhere on the train in 5-10 minutes, I arrived early and Mike at the front desk was very courteous and helpful. My room wasnt ready but when I got back from my walk in Boston Commons he told me that he had upgraded me!. Made my short stay that much better. The room was great, bed was incredibly comfortable and very clean. The concierge was also amazing in recommending where I could get the best Clam Chowder and the doorman was always ready with a cab. I appreciate everyones effort especially since I work in the industry and I will definitely come back again

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: NCJulie
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times while in Boston visiting our daughter in college. We always manage to find a great rate either through Expedia or through the college package offered by the hotel. The rooms facing the courtyard are very large but not much view. The rooms with a view tend to be smaller. The staff is always professional and friendly, and the rooms are very clean. The beds are VERY comfortable. The bathrooms are small, but it's an older hotel, so I'm not surprised. This is my first choice when I come to Boston. It's very convenient to the Green line on the T and within walking distance of Boston Commons.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive public spaces, guest rooms typical of 'old' hotels, clean, comfortable but pricey.”
Reviews.Author: TeqToo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we were attending a wedding at the hotel. The public spaces in the hotel are very impressive. The family had negotiated a special rate for the wedding guests; the room we were in was very clean and comfortable, but not luxurious. I had to call down to ask for a new iron because the iron provided was spitting water all over the gown I was trying to press. They did bring a brand new iron up for me, which worked fine, but the delay caused some stress. The mattress was very comfortable. There are NO "freebies" at this hotel - internet access was wired, not wireless, and cost $10.95 for 24 hours. The only parking available was VIP parking at $44 for 24 hours. No complimentary breakfast, in-house restaurant and room service prices were on the high side. Staff was very pleasant and solicitous.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Gigi429
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very near the Public Gardens, convenient to the Arlington stop on the T and in a central location. The rooms were very nice and spacious. The staff was friendly and helpful. My only complaint is that the walls were paper thin and we had very noisy neighbors who didn't sleep much on Saturday night. We called security but that was not much help. The hotel did compensate us for this inconvenience with lunch in the hotel restaurant. Otherwise it was a pleasant experience and a good value

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: kklaus6
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Boston, central position, subway 50m far away from entrance, Boston Common a few meters further.. The rooms was very clean, the service helpful and efficient, the staying really confortable. My room was on a high floor with a nice view f the city. There is NO free internet, which for me is the a minus.

Reviews.Title: “Really happy with our last minute booking”
Reviews.Author: WenPen
Reviews.Content: Our circumstances changed and we picked this hotel last minute. We booked two rooms to accommodate 5 and found the rooms bigger than our last hotel. The hotel is very tastefully decorated and the location fantastic. We were there two nights (never having been to Boston before) and found it within access to most things. The staff on the front desk were helpful and efficient. Frank on the concierge desk really helped me when a major change in plans happened (I couldn't rent the car I had planned and needed to make other arrangements to travel to Canada) and I needed some moral support as well as practical support to enable me to continue on my journey. So thanks for that Frank. Also I asked for a late checkout and they obliged, and this was before the travel plan incident. My son used his laptop in the designated wifi area. This came in really useful for our forward planning which was crucial to our journey. The irony here is that I choose this hotel to be near the Hertz rental place which is on the next block!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cazhappydays
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a really good location. It is within easy reach of all the local attractions. We stayed in the Towers and found the concierge there to be very helpful, nothing was too much trouble. I would recommend this hotel and stay there again on my return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Service and Value”
Reviews.Author: redsox999
Reviews.Content: We stayed here earlier this year and had a very pleasant stay. The property is located in a primo spot to explore the city by foot. Our room was on a high floor and featured a great view of the neighboring rooftops. Despite the age of the facility, our room felt updated. The bathroom was very small. Also, there are nearby parking options that are more economical than parking onsite.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kelli_07
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! Steps away from the Arlington T and Boston Commons. Hotel was clean and staff was very friendly. I booked through Priceline and was assigned a room with a queen bed. I asked to be switched to a king bed and they did it without any problems or extra fees. The room was very small but the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was also very small but clean. The air conditioner wasn't working very well the second night, I called the front desk and the hotel sent someone up to fix it within minutes of the call. The air never really did get real cold but it wasn't unbearable. I didn't realize upon booking that you must pay for internet service ($11 per 24 hours). You can only get free internet service in the hotel's bar. It was a nuisance having to lug my laptop down there every time I wanted to get online. Free internet in hotel rooms should be standard by now in my opinion. If you need cash, bring it with you before you get to Boston, the hotel's ATM charges a $4 fee. We ate at The Melting Pot (the hotel's fondue restaurant) and it was very good and the servers and bartenders were extremely friendly. If you are looking for a cheap and casual but good place for breakfast or lunch go across the street to the Park Square Building and eat at the Park Square Cafe (next door to Subway). My husband and I both ate breakfast for $12 total. Other than the little things, overall I was pleased with my stay and would recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel In An Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: firbolg
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a fascinating history and the communal areas are comfortable and stylish. The rooms are decent quality but cleaning standards could be higher; if you move any fixtures then you'll likely find a layer of dust. Room service is pricey and the food served is pretty poor but the main resteraunt does offer tastier dishes. Some of the service leaves a little to be desired: reception and resteraunt staff are friendly enough but we found both the bellhops and the doormen surprisingly rude on several occassions. The location is however simply unbeatable, with the subway on your doorstep meaning most of Boston is only 10mins away.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in the best location in Boston”
Reviews.Author: wprensky
Reviews.Content: This is a stately and excellent hotel in the center of Boston's most interesting area. My wife and I stayed in a one-bedroom suite which was perfectly appointed and arranged and the beds and furniture were very comfortable and everything was spotlessly clean. The staff bends way over backwards to be helpful and friendly, from the Front Desk staff to all the hotel support staff. I would have to say that there is no better place to stay in Boston in our experience. The food was delicious, and the entire stay totally enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jimo50138
Reviews.Content: Located very close to train station. Frank was ablle to get us very good tickets to a Sox game at the last moment. Really liked the "little things" like offering us an umbrella to use when it was pouring rain outside. We have stayed here several times and the service has always been super!!

Reviews.Title: “Solidly Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Continental American
