Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Boston Park Plaza at least five times over the years. It was a nice surprise to discover a new freshness as a result of a recent refurbishment. My room was small, but since I was alone, it was perfect for my needs. The bed was so comfortable, I could hardly get up in the morning. The Keurig coffee maker and high end coffee capsules was a tremendous convenience. I did get a weak signal of the hotel's wifi that did the job, and I was not asked to pay for it. Many people are very critical of this hotel, but I think most of them simply like hotels in another style. You can't fault the Park Plaza for being what it is - an older hotel that has served Boston for a long time. You will never get a better location. Everything is walking distance, and there are a million restaurants of all kinds within a close range. I've often been able to get some good rates at the Park Plaza during slow times, and I'm sure I'll keep returning.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly what I expected”
Reviews.Author: lsullivan68
Reviews.Content: When you hear the name Park Plaza, you think you'll actually get Park Plaza quality. This was not the case during a recent stay. The mattress was in desperate need of being replaced. The towels were thread bare and everything smelled musty, like an old gym locker room. The amenities cost the same as many of the other Park Plaza hotels I've stayed in, but the quality of the hotel was NO where near any of the others I've stayed at before. I'd skip this one if at all possible.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ckgosch
Reviews.Content: This place was a letdown in many ways. Our first room was awful, very small and it smelled like something was dead in the closet. And I'm not exaggerting. I'm in the military used to some bad smells, but this was intolerable. At least they switched our room, but we still were not impressed. The bathroom was tiny and you could hear the pipes running all night, which made for horrible sleep. For the price, I would not stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but unremarkable, good location”
Reviews.Author: Eyes_Wide_Open01
Reviews.Content: Mrs Eyes Wide Open and I stayed here for a wedding. And quite frankly, Iâ€™d describe the whole stay as â€˜nice, albeit unremarkableâ€™. This is despite receiving a free upgrade to â€œTower roomâ€�, which basically means you had free wifi (all hotels of this price-point should by rights have free wifi, but thatâ€™s a pet whinge of mine), access to the breakfast room (we did not use this though) and your own floor concierge (again, we didnâ€™t avail them of their service). The floor also has its own elevator (there are six elevators â€“ one of them services exclusively this floor) The question you will ask yourself when booking is â€œIs the upgrade worth it?â€�. My answer here is no. But with caveats. I use wifi a lot, but if you get an ordinary room, its expensive here. Across the road is a Starbucks. Not only do you get a better coffee, you get to use their free wifi. I also do not generally suffer through bland hotel breakfasts so this was lost on me. Concierges are contentious subjects. In this internet day and information age, some local knowledge is no doubt extremely useful. Its just that not all concierges are created equal. I did not use these guys so will not offer an opinion. Dedicated lift banks are nice but really, will this mean I rate this hotel higher? Probably not. The upgraded room itself was modernish, is of good size, linens were fresh and clean, the in room dining options looked extensive and the beds were, in my opinion, a tad on the soft side. Flast screen TV with plenty of viewing options were available too, as shld be the case with a hotel at this price point. It had an in room safe and the bathroom was of a good size (and notably clean) Worth highlighting that I did NOT see one of the regular rooms, so can not offer a fair comparison (the points above are the exceptions) Location? Back Bay is my preferred area of Boston, and the wedding was around the corner so that was perfect. You are about a 10 minute walk to the Prudential Building/Look out and the assorted shops. There is Champions Sports Bar in the Marriot there which I can recommend for atmosphere and food. The Phillies were playing the Red Sox when we were staying, so to point out the obvious.. easy access to Fenway Park. Overall? Nice. Maybe a tad on the plain side, with no obvious special stand out features. Reliable then I guess. Which in my opinion is not a bad thing at all I hasten to add.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: hilamonster
Reviews.Content: All in all what the Park Plaza is an old hotel. It's beautiful and historic but could really use a couple of cosmetic upgrades. The service is lovely and the employees are very friendly. The location is perfect - steps away from transit and walking distance from great spots to see. Main complaints are the dated decor and the tiny bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Over Rated”
Reviews.Author: 19854ever
Reviews.Content: The Boston Park Plaza is an old school hotel, that needs to make some simple overhauls that will pay dividends. The old school charm and staff are nice, but the rooms need work, please get a flat screen and movie choices in each room, please join the 21 st century. The reception on the 1995 zenith tv's are awful. Also please fix the ice machine on the 5th floor, stayed there recently and was broken the whole time after I alerted them of the problem. Other than that bed was comfy, however I would reduce the parking rate from $44 to $39, no need to be over the top there. Would I go there again? Maybe, when they get their act together,

Reviews.Title: “This old girl still standing tall”
Reviews.Author: Chiefy
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Park Plaza after winning a bid on Priceline. Knew about the hotel and some of its history, but usually prefer the newer hotels. Arrived and was met at check in quickly and promptly. Went up to the room without being made to feel that I was a second class citizen (Priceline customer). The room had no view, was small, a little tired, and reminded me of that back bedroom in Grandmas house that no one wants to stay in. Asked at the desk about possibly moving, and Nichole saved the day> She spent 15 minutes with us, trying to find a room to work for us, even getting us an escort to go look at the new room to ensure that it would be ok. It was, and the rest of the stay was great. TWO bathrooms in the room, super comfy king size bed, pretty quiet. Nothing that would be considered luxury by today's standards, but nice anyhow. I would compare this to a Corvette...sure, a brand new one is great, but who wouldn't want to try out an older Stingray?? This old hotel was the best of the best back in the day, and has held up extremely well over the years. Take a minute to watch the in house TV channel, with a brief history of the hotel...fascinating. Even if it is on an old tube TV instead of a flatscreen plasma........ Walked everywhere, didn't need the car once we parked it. G R E A T location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: awinsawin
Reviews.Content: Clean room exactly how you would expect a room to be having seen it on the internet. Spotless. Excellent staff who were polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: jc17oh
Reviews.Content: Parking is available and reasonable across the street with easy to get to location. Subway is very convenient. The location is great for walking to everything. Only downside is no free wifi to the general guest???

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good rooms, bad rooms just depends”
Reviews.Author: DougDilvo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for three nights for a conference. Based off its Tripadvisor rating would not have stayed here, unless designated as the Conference location. Booked a Tower room in advance as based on previous reviews those rooms had been recently updated and reviewed well. Upon check in was told they were "over booked" and they placed me in a 9th floor King room with an attached suite. Really, as a solo traveler i didn't need a big suite, and truly all I did was walk through the suite when I came and left. My King room was small, with a poor functioning AC. Bathroom was even smaller. I was let down to have a room as was described in other poor reviews. It was fine, but not what i had paid for. This room had standard tube tv, (not the plasma that the tower rooms have) and was just old and tired. The rooms don't have wireless internet and cost 12 dollars a day. I believe you can get wireless access in the lobby for free. The plus is the location of the hotel..great for everything in Boston and the people that work are very nice. I would not pay full fare to stay here, but if you win on Priceline or get a good rate through AAA, or some other consolidator it may not be too bad. If I return to Boston for any kind of travel I will not be staying here. It needs to get catch up to the year 2010 and get up to speed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: bstanley123
Reviews.Content: I found a very good rate on this hotel at AAA.com and wish I had booked more nights! It is a great location--close to Newbury Street, Boston Commons, Quincy Market, and subway stops. I loved the history of the hotel--they do a wonderful job on the TV channel recounting its background and updates. Hotel offered a shuttle to the airport that took only minutes. There are nine restaurants and on the immediate sight and Legal's Restaurant close by so you won't go hungry if you don't want to venture too far. My meal at "Pairings" was mediocre--I got the wine cooked salmon small plate which was served over polenta; my husband got the macaroni and cheese which was phenomenal! (Mac and cheese would not be something he would normally order) The sheets and linens were superb--the room AC was noisy and kept cycling off and on--should have left it on ON instead of Auto. I would still stay here again and it would be my first choice!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at the Boston Park Plaza”
Reviews.Author: essenceofe
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews for the Boston Park Plaza I was a little worried, but my worries were put to rest after I discovered the exact location and walked into my nice air-conditioned chilled room!! We went July 16th weekend when highs were in the mid 90's! I made it a point to request a room with a king and air conditioning that cranked when we checked in and the front desk came through!! This is a historic hotel with lots of character! There are a ton of dining opportunities in the building itself or right across the street, Legal Seafood, McCormick and Schmicks, PF Changs, among others. Our room was huge and had two separate bathrooms as well (free upgrade to Deluxe)...the bathrooms were on the small side but nice to have my own bathroom!! The shower pressure was great and there was plenty of hot water! The bed was super comfortable with both down pillows and regular foam pillows. TV wasn't plasma or LCD but was 32 inch and had plenty of channel opportunity. coffee maker was a krups machine with 4 servings to brew! The fitness Center wasn't your typical 10x10 room....they had several precor machines, free weights, a yoga room and strength training machines! If I go back to Boston I will definitely stay at the Boston Park Plaza! We booked through Priceline and got a fantastic deal!!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant lobby, great service people, convenient to everything”
Reviews.Author: traveler33878
Reviews.Content: Helpful & courteous staff. Bed was very comfortable but bathroom had a lack of shelves or counters on which to put cosmetics, etc. On request, we immediately received a refrigerator. Air conditioner in room was old; could not get nightime temp. below 72 degrees. We got a great rate from 1800hotel but they never paid the hotel even though our credit card was debited. We heard they went out of business. We still are unable to reach a live person when we call them. When we checked out the hotel mgr.was still trying to resove it. He was very good about the whole mess. I would go back to this hotel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Isn't it 2010?”
Reviews.Author: Henry26
Reviews.Content: Apparently Boston Park Plaza does not care to have repeat stays from business travelers. Wireless internet in the rooms is a simple service provided by every hotel these days, except this hotel. I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff & location, clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: RSB_8
Reviews.Content: The staff is amazing- so helpful and the location is excellent. Blocks from the Prudential Plaza, 1 block to Boston Commons, in a great spot with no noise when trying to sleep. There is an Au Ban Pan right next door with excellent breakfast options. We booked with lastminutetravel.com and got a great last minute rate for July 4th! We were able to walk down to the water to enjoy the Boston Pops Fourth of July celebration.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed with the ghosts or my stay here”
Reviews.Author: sfbrooks
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a 2 night stay at the Boston Park Plaza Hotel. We were in room 1411. The view from the room was nice and the location of the hotel is excellent within walking distance or subway to everything, but that is really the only thing I can say was nice about this place. The room was old and small. It stayed hot even with the a/c set on 64. The shower was really difficult to adjust and set. Water was either scalding or freezing. The hotel was in the dark ages as far as technology. No wifi, and you had to pay to use the internet in your room. You also had to pay to use the computers in the business center. Needless to say I did not use my laptop while here. Also found out on my second night that the floor was haunted. Someone said the floor used to be a hospital. Came back to my room several times to find the radio on and the interior closet door open so that the door to get in the room would hit the closet door and you could not get in. Really weird!!! Bed was hard as a brick. There was always a line at concierge and the lady was rude. Also the bellhop literally yanked a dollar bill out of my hand after I had to carry my own bag!!!! I was shocked! The room was way to expensive for this kind of service! With all that said I would not stay here again nor would I recommend it to anyone. I loved Boston and hope to return but I will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A health HAZARD!!”
Reviews.Author: theresa03NY
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights during my husband business trip. Since traveling with 3 small children we reserved a 1 bedroom suite. Since i brought my newborn I asked staff to make sure room was cleaned etc. Well, on the second nite my husband slept in attached living room in fold out bed with kids. He awoke with severe allergic reaction and a doctor had to called to take care of him. $550 later and tons of benedryl and prednisone, the front desk offered my $100 discount on my stay. I have since contacted starwoods and was told someone would respond but its been 2 weeks and so far nothing. a cleaning crew wa supposed to come up and check the couch/bed/pillows that were taken from a closet but they said they couldnt get access to the room (there were 7 of us there) The last time my husband had an allergic reaction where he had to be hospitalized was 3 years ago when he cleaned out the garage while our house was being painted/sanded. I am scared to think about what would have happened if we werent staying with him. (oh and he travels alot for business and never had a problem with dust in hotel rooms so I wonder what other chemicals were there)

Reviews.Title: “The hotel picture are decieving,dusty, needs renovation this is not a 3 1/2 star”
Reviews.Author: 2205tray
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a overnight stay at the Boston Park Place Towers, for one when we walked into the room it had a used condom in the trash in which my kids found and was grossed out, the bathrooms need to be updated, hotel room very dusty I used the telephone and it was so dusty my allergies started acting up. I call the manager on duty and she came to our room right away, She changed our room to a suite and that room was not a suite that room was bigger and dusty just like the room we transferred from. I was so upset I checked out of the hotel and went to the Marriott Copley. The pictures online are deceiving, they did not have a flat screen TV nor did it have the beautiful cherry pine desk with the beautiful arm chairs. This hotel should be shut down for renovations, this is not a 3 and half star hotel this a 1 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: N2NY
Reviews.Content: We just spent three days at this hotel and found it charming, very clean, perfectly located, and staffed with very friendly, helpful people. It's Old School but we found that very charming in a Don Draper/Mad Men kind of way, and I prefer that to some of the new mega-hotels out there. Our 8th floor room was small but very comfortable and very clean. Air conditioing was fine and quiet. The bathroom was very clean but small. Room service was very expensive but there's an Au Bonne Pain in the hotel that's much more reasonable. Would definitely stay here again, especially since we got it at a very good price via Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back”
Reviews.Author: GreekPrincess80
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Fourth of July weekend, which also happens to be my husband's Birthday. I was SO Disappointed! I too got a room (Deluxe Room on the 10th floor) with 2 stand up shower and OH MY were they disgusting. I too did not want to shower without my flip flops on, but had to. The tiles were old light blue tiles and the bottom portion of it were white tiles that come to find out since one of the showers was SO small and bumped my elbow on it, weren't even real tiles. It's this plastic cover that moves in when you touch it and the mosaic floor, disgusting!!!!! Dirty grout, tiles broken, faucets don't even match on the sink and the sink is so old and small. The handle to the shower says hot on one side and cold on the other, but when you actually move it, it's the opposite! And the sinks are pedestal, so you cannot put anything on it comfortably. Then I requested turn down service, which they told me that it's not available on my floor, B-U-T, I had asked the front desk after I made my reservationsand she didn't even bother to ask me my reservation #, or anything and so she told me all about it and I was so excited. Time comes, I asked for it and housekeeping or room service said we don't offer that on your floor, but she would do it as a courtesy. Wow, great! Guess what?? never got it! Then since this was a Birthday special stay (meaning, you pay full price $ 335.00 first night and 2nd and 3rd night you pay the year that you're born), which is a great deal if this was a great hotel, so anyway, they offer champagne and chocolate covered strawberries 4), the champagne tasted like beer, disgusting and cheap. The first night we stayed there we had teens staying in the room next to us and in front of us who partied till 4 AM. I thought that they were in the hallway the entire time, but actually they were in both the hallway and room right next to us and you heard them like they right outside your door, that's how thin the walls are. I had to call the fornt desk twice. They remedy this by providing complimentary breakfast at Pairings, which is basically buffet style (not on the menu) items and a $ 100.00 refund, which I appreciated very much thanks to the sales manager. The location is perfect!!!!!! Walking distance to everything and to the beautiful park. All and all, I would not stay there again. We decided the next time we go to Boston, we know exactly where to stay assuming it's for one night, since it's so pricey, but worth every penny (a hotel not too far) and that's where we stayed the first time we went to Boston. The only way, I would go back to The Park Plaza Hotel is after asking a million questions and making sure I don't get this disgusting room that I got. They fool you by putting pictures of the marble bathroom on their website, when in reality that's not what you get in all rooms. OH and the view.......buildings and windows and a fake back area with fake grass and birds. So stupid!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away "RUDE STAFF"”
Reviews.Author: ny-snowflakes
Reviews.Content: Stay Away "RUDEST STAFF" arrived on June 27th 3:00pm arrived on Park Pl side of hotel unloaded the luggage & passingers. Bellman tells me to go (L) & find the parking valet. Well I go (L) do not see any parking valet. Get lost in the cily by myself for 45min. Get back to hotel to find out that my room is not ready. Ask Not to be placed near the 5th floor. I call the front desk @ 5:30pm informed that my room is not ready & the hotel will call me I do not need to call them. I ask what floor will I be on informed 9th. 9:30pm go to the front desk still no phone call. Told that there is only 1 room left & it is on the 6th floor. I ask to see a manager "Erin"" Rudest person. I ask for a room on another floor, told the hotel is completely booked you can take it or leave it. I asked why the hotel did not call me to let me know my room was available. Erin said I don't know & we gave the room on the 9th floor to someone else. No Hot water if you need to take a shower @ 5:30am. Called the front desk who stated no one else complained. Well everyone else @ breakfast complained of the NO Hot Water. Stay Away from the Boston Park Plaza. Ice Machine on 6th & 8th floors did not work either. Here for a conference had to stay 5 days. Great to be back in NY with nice people. At the Boston Park Plaza the customer is never right.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing is the word I'd use to describe this hotel”
Reviews.Author: littleone49
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great but unfortunately it's the only thing that was positive about my stay there. The first room we were given had two stand-up showers but the floors in the showers were so disgusting that I would not have taken of my shoes to shower. We were given a second room - the air conditioning was broken and it was a mere 94 degrees outside. We were finally given a third room but with only one bed when we need two. It's not worth the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, wonderful staff, super comfy bed!”
Reviews.Author: kwilliga
Reviews.Content: Lovely old world hotel with modern twist! The room was charming---the bed was super comfortable. The staff was always so nice too---each morning the housekeeping staff would wish me a good day as I walked through the hall to the elevator. Location in Boston can't be beat---walking distance to major sites---great restaurants and shopping. The staff made the experience, I can't wait to go back on a non-business vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Slightly dated but beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ladyfitch
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice at the Boston plazas and had slightly different experiences. It's located in Back Bay, which is a great area that is accessible to many things and nice to walk around during the day. At night, it's quite deserted and there isn't even many take away or fast food options if you are looking to eat (I had to eat food from a CVS store..). The check in the first time was breezy, however he wouldn't let me use my credit card that still had the generic card as I hadn't received the new one. The signature matched my identifitication.. but anyway, go to the atm he tells me. The atm was out of service, so i had to walk to a bank. Minor inconvenience, but inconvenience in any event. The lobby is very nice and there are many staff members on hand to assist you in you need help. The room was very-very large (as big as a suite almost) and had 2 double beds. There was a desk area, lcd and windows that opened to a sheltered roof that clearly many people sat out and smoked on. The bathroom was large in size with a full bath and seat in there, so perhaps it was a disabled access room (explains the size?). My only complaint about the room was the noise associated with the old heat/cool system, so loud. The room was next to the ice machine too, so some noise. The breakfast was sufficient (fruit plate, berries, muffins and coffee with juice) and there were no complaints with service otherwise. There was a candy/drink machine in the iceroom which was convenient also. But they didn't accept many coins or notes (evens ones listed, just shoots them back.. randomly), so I think they need updating or calibrating. The second stay I was placed in a much smaller and dated room. The bathroom was a lot smaller, but still had a bathtub. The tv was older however, but there was an nice street view available. I received an express checkout slip under the door the night of leaving, which was missed during the first stay. The girl checking me in accepted my credit card with no questions. All in all a pleasent stay, some inconsistencies within the hotel - but with a hotel of this size.. you half expect it. Gym is small but open 24 hours. Some of the equipment needs updating.

Reviews.Title: “A taste of Boston history”
Reviews.Author: Katiebird1
Reviews.Content: I used to be quite snobbish against this hotel, when I worked for a competing hotel that was part of a chain and much newer. However, now that I had a chance to stay at the Park Plaza, I loved it. It has many of the original touches that add such charm in the public areas. It's also large enough so that a good-sized convention can hold all of its meetings and meals under one roof. Rooms are small, but the tub and sink have been renovated. The original tile is in the bathroom, giving it that old-fashioned look. Typical charges for full-service hotels apply, including a charge for wireless internet access, and $9.00 to make a long-distance (in-state) call.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: gerilync
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at this hotel on June 17, 2010. After booking the hotel through Priceline, I read some good and bad reviews. We had a great experience! The room was large with two double beds. The room was very clean. The bathroom was on the smaller side, but completely workable. The hotel is centrally located, which made getting around the city with an aging mother, very convenient. We again stayed at the hotel on June 20 and 21 and had my aunt join us. This time we had one double bed and the room was large enough to accommodate a cot. My only complaint is that you have to pay for internet service..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: lazyeyepatch
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the previous reviews I was a bit worried but on going there I found no problems at all with the hotel. Its location is perfect for seeing the sights in Boston. Very close to the T, and very walkable to most main attraction. The public gardens are less than 100m away which is pretty much the centre of it all. Hotel lobby was nice. Staff were friendly and courteous. The hallways to the rooms looked a bit dated but I didnt notice any old musty smell as you might expect. Rooms were a bit small but totally adequate. Bed was clean, soft and inviting. TV was a bit old but who cares when youre out and about. Very nice coffee maker for single cups. Washroom was a bit small as well. A little dated. Though it was clean and it served its purpose. The AC was a bit loud though. Wasnt bothered enough personally to try and turn it off. This hotel is a great place to stay if you want to see the sights in boston. I had no issues with it whatsoever and great deals can be found on priceline etc. I do have to say that I cant imagine paying the full price mentioned on their website which is upwards of $300. Perhaps then my review would be less impressed. I think hotels should provide free Wifi. This hotel does not.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jesser
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for a long weekend to tour the city, go to a Sox game, eat, drink, and just have fun! We LOVED this hotel, it was perfectly located for touring the city of Boston...the max price for a taxi to return to the hotel from everywhere we ventured was around $20. The room was the perfect size for a long weekend, the windows opened all the way to let the breeze and sound of the city in. The bathroom was a bit small, but the hotel is old...so it fit with the ambiance and the water pressure was great in the shower. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. When we return to Boston we will definitely stay here again, also...my husband has stayed at the Copley for business and he said the Park Plaza is MUCH better!

Reviews.Title: “Two words: LOVE IT!”
Reviews.Author: DCircus
Reviews.Content: Hotwire rated Boston Park Plaza a 3.5 star but we definitely felt like 5-star guests. Wonderfully situated only a block from Boston Commons, Public Garden, only a few blocks from Quincy Market, on the Trolley and public transportation lines, right across from Maggiano's, Legal Seafood, Finale (the best dessertery EVER), Ben & Jerry's, and some great shopping, we wished we had 5 more days here! We enjoyed well-informed concierge services, bell service not to be beat and a guest reception that was very nice. We spent only a few minutes checking out the luxurious marble lobby with seating throughout filled with accents from all over the world. THEN, we got to our room (with a $25 upgrade to a larger one than we'd booked on Hotwire)! Wow! 2 sumptuous double beds, 2 well-appointed bathrooms, a nice pull-out sofa (a bonus for our 3 adults and 2 kids travel group). At night, the deep doors afforded us the luxury of hearing nothing in the hallways. Except for very minor noise from shared plumbing in the walls, we felt like we might be the only guests staying! Love, love, love the service, amenities, location, cleanliness and overall ambience of this circa 1912 hotel. I've already recommended this hotel to friends and family traveling in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Old style, but nice and good place”
Reviews.Author: alex0kdt
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a couple of days. The hotel it self is quite old fashioned, but really well maintained and have some kind of "luxury" feeling. The rooms are bright, and quite big. Check in - check out procedures was nice and fast. We did`t manage to use the hotel restaurant, but it is quite nice bistro in the same building. T-station is just few meters from hotel. Or you can have a 20 -minutes walk throw a nice park to a city center.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel ...pleasantly surprised after reading some bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: amycd
Reviews.Content: A great stay....stayed on the Towers level/Conceirge floor....excellent ammenities in room included: bottled h2o, wifi, upgraded bath ammenities, breakfast, etc. Room was very clean...yes, small....but fine for one or two people. Bed was fantastic--super comfortable. Hotel staff were very nice and responsive....when I arrived at the hotel I noticed there was no soap in the bathroom...stopped at the front desk and they had it delivered to my room on the spot. Great location...perfect spot for shopping, eating, went for a couple of great runs around the commons, back bay,etc. Breakfast was good...they serve Starbucks as their coffee....a great stay overall....no complaints from me and I am a very picky traveller with regard to comfort, cleanliness, and food.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location, but Many Small Hidden Costs”
Reviews.Author: avalemar
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at the Boston Park Plaza. The stay was a mixed bag. The GOOD aspects were: the room was clean; the lobby/elevators and other public spaces were beautiful, clean, and full of historic charm but with modern updates; the staff was friendly and very helpful in finding restaurants [they even had a discount card for one restaurant that we wanted] and helpful in neogitating public transit; the air conditioning worked well; the room was quiet and sufficiently dark; the bed was comfortable; the room had a nice safe for valuables; and the location was excellent - both close to the commons and very close to the subway. The BAD aspects were: there was no free wifi nor internet in the rooms [a per diem charge of about $10 was pricey and unwelcomed] and the only usable wifi was inconveniently located in the small tv lounge downstairs; the computer or work desk in the room had an uncomfortable chair; there was a very hefty charge for local phone calls; there was no complimentary breakfast of any sort; and the vending or snack machines had a very high charge. [Although most of the charges are waived if you stay in the "tower" section which costs more than the non-tower rooms]. We also ran into some problems where the hotel received payment from our employer and cashed the check, yet had no record of the transaction and tried to charge us personally a second time for the rooms. The issue was cleared up after much effort on our part but there was no apologies from the hotel staff for the inconvenience [which was the hotel's error]. So that was disappointing. However, overall the stay was good.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: libratech
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect with easy access to the Common & the Public Gardens, T-stops, & sightseeing trolleys. If you REQUIRE a flat panel tv for a good trip, look elsewhere. If, however, friendly, efficient and accomodating staff are on your 'must have' list, stay here. While the bathrooms are teeny, we did have two of them. Bed linens were lovely, bed was wonderfully comfortable. I prefer the charm & cleanliness to overpriced modern lookalikes.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with it!”
Reviews.Author: ILoveTexas
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Priceline a couple of months ago, and worried about it ever since because of the negative reviews. We have just spent three days here, however, and we were very pleased. It's true that it is an older hotel, with small bathrooms (almost no shelf space) and thinner walls, but our standard double was pretty, clean, comfortable, and relatively spacious. The staff has been 100% helpful and friendly, and the location is excellent. And good news for previous guests who wanted in-room coffee/tea makers---they just added them during our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, centrally located and clean old hotel”
Reviews.Author: meegarian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boston Park Plaza Hotel in April and couldn't have been happier. The hotel is centrally located near the Public Gardens, Theater District and Boston Commons which made our excursions easy. Our Deluxe Double Room was perfect for myself, my young daughter and my senior mom because it included two beds and two bathrooms. The rate on hotels.com was very good ($140 a night for a Deluxe Double). Hotels.com refunds $ if you find the rate cheaper on-line after you book so I highly recommend this site. The hotel's Conceirge and front door staff were very helpful and accomodating. I recommend parking at the Boston Commons for the best rate if you're staying for several days.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet, great value”
Reviews.Author: Elsa_O
Reviews.Content: After reading a number of negative reviews, I was afraid the Park Plaza may have deteriorated since the 1980s when I had been there for several meetings. I decided to book anyway because I got a great rate and the location was fairly close to where I needed to be. Wow, am I glad I did! The hotel has been kept up with new carpets, drapes, fresh paint, and renovated bathrooms. The bed linens were beautiful and comfortable. Everything was spotlessleslly clean. In other reviews I noticed people complaining about noise/thin walls, but my husband and I did not notice anything like that. Our 3-day stay was quiet and thoroughly pleasant. We would definitely come back. Tip: If you want to park and leave your car for the duration of your stay, you can save by using the self-parking garage across the street, but be aware it does not have in & out privileges.

Reviews.Title: “very small rooms and poor facilities”
Reviews.Author: possum50
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Boston with 3 nights at this hotel and definitely the worst hotel on the trip. The rooms were tiny as were the bathrooms - glad I am only small not sure if a larger person would have managed. Room facilities limited - no coffee maker or mini bar and no wireless internet - only wired which was very slow and very expensive. Stayed the previous 5 nights in the Hyatt for the same rate and the facilities were excellent. Despite being a historic hotel it is not worth the price it charges. Also most of the rooms look over enclosed roof space and have no view but very noisy air conditioning units.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure to get a renovated room!”
Reviews.Author: melstevens
Reviews.Content: Overall, I would suggest staying elsewhere if at all possible. The hotel is very old and only some of the rooms are renovated. The first day I checked in, they put me in the tiniest hotel room I have EVER seen. It barely fit a queen bed, one nightstand, and a small dresser with TV on top. And the bathroom was so small that I could sit on the toilet and wash my hands in the sink and my feet in the shower. And the bathroom was old and dirty (hairs on the floor) and the bedroom carpet was awful. Not to mention the fact that my headboard shared a wall with the elevator shaft! I tried to get them to move me, but they said they were oversold that night but could try to move me the next day. They also said the elevators would shut off at 9 pm so it shouldn't be as noisy. 9 pm came and went and the elevators still went. All through the night they went on and off and I barely slept a wink. So at 6 am, I decided to get up and go to the front desk. That guy was actually very nice and tried to be accommodating by offering me breakfast which I already had with my group. I asked for a renovated room and he was able to get me into a handicapped king which had been renovated and was MUCH nicer than the room I had been in. It was a normal size, had nicer bedding and bathroom, and was just in general much more pleasant. If I had gotten that room to begin with, I may have given it a slightly higher rating although the walls were still quite thin! I was frustrated that I lost a night of sleep though since the room was already available at 6 am when I complained! The hotel is in a great location and the staff seemed friendly, but overall, unless you can be guaranteed a nice renovated room, I would say find somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to competition”
Reviews.Author: BH7832
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the positives, which I think are very positive, but doesn't outweigh the negatives, which leads me to Not Recommending this hotel. My recommendation is to pick another hotel such as the Fairmont Copley, Four Seasons, Taj, Back Bay Hotel, Marriot Copley, or Westin Copley for comporable prices. Pros The Park Plaza is a fantastic location, situated in the Back Bay, very close to the Public Gardens and Boston Common, a short walk to Newbury Street shopping and Copley Square. It is not surprising that it is just steps from both the Four Seasons and Taj (formerly Ritz Carlton) hotels. In addition, the staff is very friendly and courteous. Cons I understand that rooms in downtown hotels are often small, however, these are postage stamp size. I could live with that if it was the only flaw. Also, the furniture is sparse and low quality. The bed was uncomfortable. The TV was an old style with low quality resolution (not a flat screen). The only chair in the room was a rickety desk chair, so no place to sit and watch the TV, unless you want to lie on the bed. Calling out the quality of the toilet paper may seem petty, but it is indicative of a hotel that just isn't keeping up with its competition. The Park Plaza has apparently found that one way to save money is to buy cheap toilet paper. I don't expect to always get the highest quality, but this stuff is the type that you would expect to find in a McDonalds off the highway. Finally, I had a very bad experience worth noting with my electronic key. When I checked in I was given a room number on the 6th floor (a good ways from the elevator). After walking to the room, I found that the key card wouldn't work, so I went all the way back to the lobby. The same guy who just checked me in (and was friendly) told me that he had mistakenly written the wrong room number (story sounds suspect, but I can't prove it). So, he gives me a new key with a room 3 doors from the original room. After 5 tries with the key card, I get in to find my previously noted postage stamp room. A couple of minutes later, I decided to walk down the hall near the elevators to get some ice. When I returned I tried to re-open my door and couldn't. (I expect that most readers would think that I am deficient with a key card, except that I actually had a maid cleaning another room come over and re-try the card for me and she couldn't get it done and said I needed to go back down to the lobby). So, I see the same guy again and he gives me 2 key cards to try. Thankfully, one of them worked and more importantly, that I didn't need to leave the room again, because I had no trust I would be able to get back in. Overall While the Park Plaza is nicely located and clean with friendly personnel, it is in a very competitive area with comparably priced hotels that beat it in every way. It does not seem that the management is even trying to put up a fight to be competitive. I highly doubt that they have many repeat customers. Once you have stayed there, you just want to try someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Better hotel than previously reported - good value”
Reviews.Author: JitkaTravler
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to get a good-sized room - probably larger than other rooms described in earlier posts. However, even a small room would be a good value if the traveler booked one of the 'special' rates of which there are many. The hotel is, yes, old but I find its age to be part of its charm (similar to the OMNI Parker House in Boston) ... and the rooms could use some updates... but, we found the room and public spaces to be clean, beds to be very comfortable, the amenities, fine. All personnel we interacted with were helpful and accommodating. Sometimes I wonder (in general) if the negatives people describe might be eliminated with a shift in the traveler's own attitude; i.e., approach and demeanor.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest rooms in town”
Reviews.Author: PeterDV
Reviews.Content: Check-in was great. Fiendly and efficient. I had originally booked a standard room. Check-in desk advised that these rooms were very small and that as I was staying for six nights they could offer me upgrade to a King jnr suite for a reasonable additional fee which I accepted. This additional fee included free breakfast, free wifi, free bottled water in the room etc. All sounded great. The King jnr Suite ... was TINY. No room to swing a cat. I shudder to think what my standard room would have been like. The condition of the room was poor, almost run down. Bed was big and very comfortable. Free internet was an irritation as it was only provided by plugging into the ethernet port on the tiny desk squashed into the corner. I eventually went to Bestbuy and bought a $20 wifi access point so I could work from my bed. The location was great. Easy access and walking distance to most areas of interest. Restaurant in the hotel were very average and expensive. Eating outside of the hotel was much better and cheaper. Would I stay there again ? NO. The rooms really are too small, too old and too run down. At those prices there are definately more modern / better facilities in a similar location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: freqbustrvl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awful. I only wish I had read other recent reviews before deciding to stay here. There were so many things wrong I don't even know where to begin. Better yet, when you read all the other low rated reviews rest assured that everything they say is simply too kind. old, delapitated, dirty, broken, unfriendly, hot, expensive, unresponsive, indifferent... Seems like they go out of their way to ensure such bad overall experience in every single area that matters.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: MMS44
Reviews.Content: The Commons, sub-way, trolly stop, history just outside the door

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: njsue6
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent as well as a former Property Manager, I do not know why people write such bad reviews. This hotel is gorgeous, airline pilots stay here, has doormen, brass & marble everywhere, 2 huge chandeliers in large lobby. You are greeted by a towering live flower arrangement on a table at least 6 feet tall (including table). The staff is very friendly (as to people who say anyone is rude, my experience has been that if you are rude to them, then perhaps they are going to be rude back to you?). Room large, well decorated, wallpapered with trim insets for contrast, bathroom has large, deep bathtub, pedestal sink, new fixtures/towel bars. Excellent location, 1/2 block to subway.

Reviews.Title: “If you like run down, dirty rooms and surly service, this place is for you...”
Reviews.Author: splato
Reviews.Content: The staff were indifferent, the room was quite dirty and poorly maintained. (broken window shades, broken internet cable, rattling AC vent), the dining room food was drastically over-priced even for a hotel and barely edible. Asking for 2 extra towels was beyond their capabilityâ€”three phone calls and I gave up.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel overpriced, guests undervalued”
Reviews.Author: tigbear
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hote - April 30 and May 1 while attending a conference there. I was upgraded to the Concierge floor, with promises of an enhanced stay. My room was shabby and badly in need of a refurbishment, and was unbearably hot, despite my setting the thermostat at 60! Finally, I opened the window and let in the 78degree weather outside to cool off the place. Coffee pot was broken and spilled coffee all over the table.The Concierge floor did not live up to it's name - the concierge was hardly ever in evidence, food provided was sparse - nothing at all at lunch and only basic continental breakfast and finger food in the evening - and cash bar. Unlike any concierge/club floor I've ever experienced. At least it was relatively quiet up there. The Bell staff/luggage staff lost my suitcase - they'd failed to put the ticket on it and had stacked it with someone else's, so when I came to collect it at check-out they couldn't find it and it took me ten minutes of hunting through everything in the store-room to finally locate it. Instead of an apology the staff were rude and tried to make out that it must have been my fault. How?? I had my ticket, they didn't. I left the hotel feeling sad that it had been let go so badly and very angry at the way I'd been treated.

Reviews.Title: “This aging dowager needs some work.”
Reviews.Author: Adventuregals
Reviews.Content: As a holiday gift, someone gave us 2 nights at the Boston Park Plaza and Towers. We had lovely time in Boston - the weather was gorgeous, and we walked all over town - from the MFA to the waterfront. It's also a good thing that the weather was so perfect, because we would have been miserable if we'd been stuck inside. Our room was tiny - so small that we were constantly in each other's way. We had a view of a construction site. The bed was very comfy, but there are not many amenities in the rooms (TV and reception poor, no conditioner, one bar of soap for the sink and the shower, no way to heat water for coffee/tea). The high speed internet, for which we paid $10.45/day, was not wireless, so you were tethered to the desk. No, these are not a big deal, but in a luxury hotel one has certain expectations! The bathroom was also very small, and not particularly nice - perfectly acceptable, but not luxury hotel quality. Also, we could hear everything that happened in the adjoining bath - so were awakened several times to hear the vomiting of the person next door who drank too much on Saturday night - which we could hear in bed, on the other side of a wall and a door. Not very restful, and just plain gross. All in all, this hotel did not ruin our weekend or anything, but if we'd been paying full price for the room we would have been extremely disappointed. It needs to be remodeled, and perhaps better insulated between baths. In the end, this hotel's pretensions of grandeur (and the lobby is lovely) are not matched by what you find in the rooms - not even close. And since it is expensive - parking is over $40/day, for example - and every "extra" is charged at very high rates - it really needs to live up to its reputation. The staff was very nice and very friendly - they get top honors for that.

Reviews.Title: “okay but could be better”
Reviews.Author: babiesquuensland
Reviews.Content: No tea, coffee etc in room, front desk staff helpful. Rooms big but thats about it. Parking very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely property in a great location”
Reviews.Author: LoveVirginiaBeach
Reviews.Content: We had a great, quiet room with two queen beds and two full baths! It was pristine clean, with comfortable mattresses and plenty of room. The only downside is antiquated "boxy" televisions sitting on the dresser.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Rick_in_Cincy
Reviews.Content: I won't be staying here again. Next time I'll pay a little more for a better hotel. First, the positive: The location is really great. A block to Boston Common. Arlington T stop right out the front door. Decent breakfast in the restaurant downstairs. The facility itself is old and charming. And the bad: Our room was very, very small, particularly the bathroom. No pay-per-view. Very noisy. We could hear very clearly the toilet in the next room when flushed. Lots of street noise. The maid service was the worst. The first day, I read the sports page in the bathroom. The newspaper was never picked up. The trash can in the bathroom was never emptied. We returned from out first day of sightseeing. The bed had been made, but that's the only way we could tell the maid had been there. The towels and wash cloths had not been replaced (even the ones on the floor). Same thing the next day. Used up the shampoo, not replaced. We got a very good deal on the room on another website. But in hindsight I wish I had paid more and gotten a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience...Ideal Location...Professional Staff”
Reviews.Author: annfj
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently stayed at the Boston Park Plaza for a special birthday/college scouting weekend, and after reading some of the reviews, I was extremely nervous, but having spent a lovely weekend in this beautiful, clean, comfortable hotel, I have no idea how you wouldn't love your stay. The staff was friendly and efficient. We checked in with no delays, and even when we walked through the lobby during very busy check-in times, the lines seemed to be moving well. I suppose things might get a little crazy Marathon Weekend, but I have to believe you'd run into that at any hotel during such a huge event weekend. The location is ideal. We parked in the Motor Mart, and never moved our car. The "T" stop is a block away, and we were all over the city, including to Fenway Park, easily. The concierge helped us with reasonably priced tickets to a Red Sox game and gave us great dining suggestions in the North End. I'd absolutely stay again...and again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: phlenk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Boston Marathon and due to mismanagement of the room inventory, we, as well as many other runners, had our check-in time pushed back by two hours on the Sunday night we arrived. The desk clerk blamed the European volcanic ash (as in: travelers originally headed for Europe were overstaying their reservation at the hotel due to the grounding of flights); fine, but given that you've known ALL YEAR that the Boston Marathon was coming up, and that you would be fully booked for that event, I very much expected better handling of the overbooking. How about comping us for the meal you suggested we go out for while waiting for our room to open up? Or how about a complementary breakfast to make up for the fact that the 21 room hours we paid for in full were now reduced to 19 hours? Rooms are fair: worn out and not too clean; few amenities. Our room was sorely in need of a good dusting, and the little touches were off (room service menus were dirty; the desk light was burned out; cheap toiletries in the bathroom; no mini bar). Room was also not very soundproof - noise traveled easily from the hallway to the room. Finally, we were given a room with one queen-sized bed for two people - not sure if that's standard, or due to the overbooking, but I thought it was pretty standard to put two people into a king, not a queen. In positives, the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Utter disappointmentâ€Ž”
Reviews.Author: dgrosen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here and it was the most overpriced under performing hotel I have had the misfortune of visiting. Check in time was 3:00 but they could not manage to have a room for us before 6:00. We were supposed to have a king bed, however, they "ran out" so we were given a queen room. The air-conditioning did not work. The room was so small the TV was literally in the closet.....literally located in the closet!! There was no chair except for the uncomfortable desk chair at the small desk. The room did not have a coffee maker. The way this hotel presents itself is a complete misrepresentation of what it is.

Reviews.Title: “doesn't deserve the bad rap”
Reviews.Author: haneyb
Reviews.Content: I traveled alone to Boston for the Marathon; booked Park Plaza through a tour group and was a little nervous after reading the reviews. But it was a perfectly pleasant stay: no, it's not a small boutique hotel, but the staff was friendly and helpful, my room was clean and comfortable, although you could hear some sounds from adjoining room. The elevators were very efficient (a plus for such a humongous place). It was MUCH better than the Marriott Copley place I stayed in last year. The location is very convenient to Boston Common, the Charles River,the marathon finish, Back Bay and Newbury street, and the T.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, Good Value & Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: hilarionmartinez
Reviews.Content: Save money and time when you arrive in Boston. I took mass transit into the city to my hotel. It was easy, cheap, pleasant, and calming. I remember that the last time in Boston I was stuck in a tunnel in traffic and the cab ride was costly. This is what you do: when you arrive (I arrived in terminal B), I went to the Information Concierge in the baggage area. A wonderfully coiffed, smiling lady told me what to do: walk to the machine with a â€œTâ€� near the Information Desk, purchase my weekly pass (or day pass or single fare ticket). I used my credit card and chose the 7 day unlimited pass for bus and metro for $15 (I was staying four days). She told me to step outside and stand by blue posts and board the #55 bus to the Airport Station. The bus arrived within minutes. It was quiet and clean. We stopped twice to drop off or collect passengers at other terminals. At no time was the bus crowded, loud or uncomfortable. We arrive at the station in minutes. I used my weekly pass to access the Blue line â€œinbound.â€� I needed to get to the Arlington station on the Green line. The station is a block from the Park Plaza. I change at Government Station. The Airport Station was clean, well marked, and had operating escalators and an elevator. The metro was clean, organized, and each stop was announced. The connection from the Blue to the Green lines was simple. This is when I realized I had arrived at a highly civil city. Not one piece of paper anywhere in sight, no noise, no graffiti - absolute civility. When I arrived at the Arlington station there was a large map of the neighborhood. A policeman was standing in front of the map and when I said I needed to find the Park Plaza he directed me to the right exit and told me what to do adding â€œIf you blink, you will miss it.â€� He was right. I arrived at the hotel with my roll-on carry-on and laptop. It took me less than 35 minutes (from the airport), including transfers, and the one block walk to the hotel. And it was sort-of â€œfreeâ€� since I had purchased the one-week metro/bus pass. I knew that the return to the airport from the Park Plaza would be equally simple. The Park Plaza lobby is old-school elegance. Not as grand as others but it is elegant, clean, and welcoming. I waited a few minutes for a Front Desk attendant. The Front Desk attendant was excellent. He was pleasant and professional but not overly friendly. I think he was amused when I told him I had used mass transit to get from the airport to the hotel. I urged he recommend this option to other hotel guests â€“ fast, extremely pleasant, easy, and cheap. My room was not ready but for the first time ever, he asked for my mobile number and said someone would call me when my room was ready. I was amazed. In all my hotel stays in all my years of travel throughout the world this was the first time anyone offered this service. He suggested I leave my roll-on and laptop with the bellman and enjoy the city or relax in the comfortable lobby. I chose to leave my luggage. It was handled quickly and efficiently. I did not have change with me and asked the bellman if he would be around in a few hours when I returned. He smiled and said he would. It was nice not to feel pressured to leave a tip immediately. I walked outside and realized what other readers said is true. What a superb location and after all, it is all about location, location, location. I walked to Newberry Street to find a wonderful mÃ©lange of high-end stores, boutiques, spectacular galleries (with museum-quality art). I enjoyed visiting some of the galleries and seeing art which I would not otherwise see as it would likely go into private collections. I walk along Newberry until I stumbled onto Bostone Pizza (which has also been covered by readers). Well, itâ€™s true. Delicious dough (not chewy), wonderful flavors, and reasonably priced. It was a walk-down small location with a few booths and some counter seats. It was perfect for a quick bite. When I returned to the hotel my room was ready. It was a deluxe King. Yes, it had two small, but very clean and functional bathrooms. And one large room with a wonderful king size bed. The TV was just fine. Not flat screen but it had a clear picture and functioned properly. The furniture was fine, nothing extravagant. It was clean, not broken, functional, and comfortable. The bathroom and room had an ample supply of wrapped plastic cups which were just fine. The toiletries were also fine, nothing extravagant but just fine. The corridors were very clean and pleasant looking. I loved the old-world elevators which functioned very well and required your room key to access the floors (added security which is nice). Honestly, I had no complaints. I am amazed by some of the reviews. I could not find anything wrong with this very nice hotel. It was just fine for the price. Iâ€™ll return to the Park Plaza on my next trip to Boston if the price remains competitive. Its clean, comfortable and the location canâ€™t be beat.

Reviews.Title: “OUR LITTLE GEM.”
Reviews.Author: Hingham_maHorsie
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights. Service was great and lots of restaurants around. Parking is expensive but worth it,found my car upfront after i called down . Bags were handled by the bellman and the valet ,very friendly and efficient. Special thanks to the smiling african valet guy for directions i did not get lost. Looking forward for the boston marathon!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: LindyP2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in September 2008, for 5 nights, it is perfectly located it across the street from Boston Public Park which is adjacent to Boston Common. It is very near to Arlington street which is the main shopping street in Boston, it is very central hotel. It is a 5 minute walk to Copley Square and a ten minute walk from Faneuil Hall. It is a 15-20 min cab journey from the aiport. The best thing about Boston is it's all little areas which are 5/10 minutes from each other. The concierge at the hotel was extremely helpful everytime we went and asked questions, if we had any questions reagrding opening hours of things we wanted to see or do, they would ring for us, they would book things for us, they booked whale watching, a trip to Wretham outlet shopping centre and rang Fenway Park for us. The only bad experience at the hotel was the waiter who worked at the express breakfast station he was extremely rude, he actually gave out to us for using the disposal cups instead of the ceramic ones. Another waiter came over to us and said if we took a seat he would get us coffee and breakfast. It didnt put us off the hotel, all the other staff more than made up for this. The bar O'Connors in the ground floor, is great value for drinks and food and staff there are extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not much changes in 10 years and that is not a good thing”
Reviews.Author: gregdem
Reviews.Content: 10 years ago I stayed at the Park Plaza for a convention and we complained about non-working elevators, room that were way too hot, the inability to keep a window open, and that this would be an awesome hotel with a couple of minor tweaks. Needless to say, the owners didn't listen to a thing we had to say. I stayed for a weekend for a different convention in Boston. The location of the Park Plaza makes it perfect for getting anywhere in town and the price is very reasonable. However, the hot and stuffy rooms are unbearable. We literally had to turn the heating system off because the A/C never came on. When we tried to crack a window open, it was so heavy that only I could do it and it would not stay open. So bleeding 2-4 min of hot air out of the room was the most I could manage at any time. The hotel used to have a back passage way to get to Au Bon Pon but they have now blocked that off with a restaurant that leaves much to be desired. Basic food that is overpriced. All in all, this could be a great bargain for Boston if you could only get a not so humid night of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, stuffy rooms”
Reviews.Author: talazia
Reviews.Content: I love the park plaza's location, but they seriously have issues with the rooms being way too hot. We couldn't shut off the heat, and barely could crack open the window. The hotel itself is in a perfect location, close to many Boston attractions, but the sleeping in stuffy, overheated rooms is really not worth the cost of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: stks4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. However, the hotel rooms need to match the lobby by being updated. The furniture looked like it was taken from a garage sale or off someone's curb. The bathrooms need to be updated and looked dirty even though it was clean. The woodwork was very worn and looked dirty as well as the wallpaper being torn in spots. The heating and windows need to be replaced with more efficient ones since there was a horrible draft and the thermostat needed to be turned up to accomodate the draft. You could hear everything going on outside as it was noisy. The bellmen and parking attendants were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: nesten
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Boston Park Plaza hotel and was overall satisfied based on the price we payed. We got a good deal through Hotwire for less than $60 a night which, at this location, would be hard to find otherwise. Regarding the hotel itself, the common areas are very nice and well appointed, but the rooms are very dated and show lots of wear. The bathrooms looked like they belonged to a 2-3 star hotel and did not have bath tubs. The beds were very comfortable, though. In all, I would stay again in this hotel only at the price we payed. On a more positive note, we did try the 3-course tea menu and was absolutely outstanding. Not only the quality of the food was great, but the service was superb. They went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed it and even customized the menu for my wife, who could not eat many of the included items.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravels027
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Boston Park Plaza Hotel and Towers while attending a conference in the hotel. When we first arrived to hotel's main entrance, we waited in our car as the doorman carried on a personal conversation. When we finally got his attention, he looked angry that we had interrupted him and told us to park around back. We drove to the back of the hotel only to find that THERE IS NO PARKING, unless you're willing to valet it for $42 a night. As we drove around shopping parking options, I called the hotel to see if they offered any discounts at local garages. Again, I was dealing with another rude hotel employee with absolutely NO customer service skills whatsoever (oh, and by the way, no discounts at garages but he basically scoffed at my suggesting such as thing). And so, we arrive and check in and head up to our standard guestroom (with one single king bed). The room is very small, stuffy, and the looks dated. The TV is huge (and not nice, flat screen tv huge either but a big box). Even though we were on the 10th floor, the noise from the street was so loud that we barely slept all night. Further, the noise from people in the halls didn't help either. All in all, a stuck-up hotel that has no reason to be. Save your money, go elsewhere and actually enjoy your stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: BritishIceQueen
Reviews.Content: Came to this hotel in March after quite a last minute booking. The location was great - we could easily walk to the main places we were going to! When we arrived it was a nice surprise - I didn't really know what to expect but we did pay such a good rate it seemed too good to be true - it was better than we could have imagined! The staff were great - I can't remember her name but the woman who checked us in was very nice and personal - she remembered us the next day when we checked out which was nice. The lobby area is beautiful. Our room was great. The beds were so comfy and we couldn't believe what we got for the price - such good value! Staff were helpful to every need we had. If I had to say one thing, and this is just a minor thing, the alarm went off at about 4:30am - so clearly someone hadn't checked it was off before we checked in. It didn't bother us too much. The toilet did make a strange noise for our stay but it didn't keep us awake. There was a bottle cap on the floor in the bedroom and some of the mirrors had smudges on them. This is just me nit-picking now - working in a 4 star inn including the cleaning side of things makes me notice minor things others wont! Best night sleep I've ever had, loved that checkout was noon!

Reviews.Title: “Service & value...NO GOOD”
Reviews.Author: cmtsil
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I (in our mid 20s) were treated like delinquents...not allowed to have beer in our room, followed by bellmen/doormen. We paid a steep price and requested 2 beds since a couple friends were staying with us and they had to sneak in or risk getting kicked out or charged extra money. You can't use the elevator unless you have a room key, so it's a complete hassle having anyone visit or come by your room. Very tiny rooms and bathrooms for such a "nice" and expensive place. Great location but that's all it has going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Lachenda
Reviews.Content: The previous reviewer said it best - don't freak out! I also booked a room on priceline and after reading some terrible reviews on a few different sites I was quite nervous about staying at this hotel. I was travelling for business, and was worried that I would not have a restful stay. I am happy to say I was very pleasantly surprised by this hotel! I arrived at 630am hoping to just drop off my bags and the staff checked me into a room right then which was a great surprise! My room was small (especially the bathroom), but very clean. You can certainly tell this is an old hotel by the room doors (old wooden doors) and the fact there are no closets, but the Park plaza has put some nice furniture in the room that subsitutes well. My bed was super comfortable, and the hotel was very, very quiet (and I was next to a stairwell!). I did not have any of the problems of earlier reviewers hearing others tvs, having noisy heater fans, etc. The rooms do not have much by way of ammenities (no coffee makers, fridge / minibar, wifi, etc), but where my stay was only 3 nights, these issues did not effect me much. I did use the high speed internet service while at the hotel which was sufficient. All staff I encountered were very pleasant and helpful. It was hit or miss whether or not there was a doorman or bell captain to help with your bags. The location was excellent just 2 blocks from Boston Common and Newbury Street, and a few blocks from the theatre district. I was able to walk to all of my destinations, and there are many great places to eat nearby too. Overall, I would stay here again if travelling alone. I would not choose this hotel if travelling with a family as the rooms are quite small. Also, I would not choose this hotel if I was travelling for leisure as my own personal preference would be to want some of the ammenties the Boston Park Plaza rooms did not have.However, for a few nights of business travel, the Park Plaza was great, with a great location and even better price!

Reviews.Title: “I stay at the Park Plaza Biston Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: JBialik
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Park Plaza Biston Hotel whenever I travel to Boston. The rates are reasonable, the service is great and the location is close to Boston Commons, Emerson College, shopping, dining and subway. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best city in the U.S.”
Reviews.Author: RuthannD
Reviews.Content: In any season, this is one beautiful place. The hotel is vintage class from a time when quality mattered. The staff is professional, helpful and always available to answer questions or make you comfortable. I have stayed here more times than I can count and it has been consistently wonderful for many years. So close to the never ending beauty of Boston Common and some of the best shopping within walking distances, restaurants abound and there is a local flavor that mixes easily with a world class feel. Boston is rich in American history....be sure to immerse and educate yourself. From Paul Revere to famous seafood this place has it all. I have traveled the world, the comfort of this hotel appeals to my sense of tranquility. Tho the rooms are small, they render a feeling like going home to visit Grandmom....it's my favorite place in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: mrkarizma
Reviews.Content: Could not ask for a better hotel. The accomdations were excellent as well as the staff. The rooms were very nice and the beds are out of this world. One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to spend an enjoyable night and just relax.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: smith747777
Reviews.Content: I had planned a romantic evening in Boston with my wife for Valentines Day. Since we donâ€™t get out much I figured I would book I would book a room at the Boston Park Plaza. We arrived at 3:00 for check in and were told there were not any King rooms available and they would call us in 45 minutes. After an hour and half I didnâ€™t hear anything from them so I decided to check. And I was told they were still working on it. It was not until 7:00PM that we were able to check in. The hotel was very loud and was jammed backed with conference goers. Even trying to get on the evaluator was a nightmare as it was filled to the max with young kids attending a conference. Once we got on our floor we noticed it was very loud and kids were running up and down the halls yelling. The room itself was not a king room that I had reserved but rather a small double room, dark and dingy, the bathroom was dirty and the trash can was filled. We called to the front desk and demanded a refund, which we were granted. However this experience ruined our weekend and rather then get another room we decided to make the 2 hour trip back home.

Reviews.Title: “Historic and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanViking
Reviews.Content: Though the weather was a little chilly, Boston was fantastic. The Park Plaza was great, the only small problem I had was an old sticky door to my room. Otherwise everything was superb. I will definitely stay next time I am in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and stately with a great location, but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: zzvalika
Reviews.Content: The Park has a great location just south of the park, right in the heart of the theater district. It has a grand interior ... and main lobby reminiscent of classical ballroom eras. However, families, couples, singles, and tourists were all noted to be wandering about, with a range of attire from jean shorts to a crowd of men in black tuxedos. It seems to be a prime location for conference meetings of all sorts. The room was small, but at approx 300 sq ft pretty competetive if not bigger than most basic rooms at hotels in the same area. There was no coffee maker or tea available in the room, this was a minus. The restaurants downstairs included a fondue place, an expensive steakhouse, and a trendy all-around food place, all with a relatively expensive price range. There is an Au Bon Pain 20 ft outside of the lobby to the east of the hotel. The concierge person we spoke to was surprisingly not helpful w/ making suggestions for restaurants, but I saw pleny later being helped w/ maps of the area nearby later. There's a nice tea area in the main lobby w/ overpriced servings but a nice atmosphere. Guest services was quick and helpful at bringing up towels when asked. Overall great hotel but not mind-blowing, excellent interior but an overall attempt at elegance that doesn't live up to the mood actually felt; a staff that also attempts at grace and grandeur but doesn't meet up to the challenge. The location is the key attraction; close to the park and newbury street, in the theater district and near the start of the freedom trail. Good experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Park Plaza Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DebbieTuey
Reviews.Content: Very nice, but very old hotel! Has been kept up nicely, and is very ornate. Lobby is breath taking!! Only problem we had, was the toilet was so close to the tub, made it difficult to use it. Oh, and the prices for room service are astronomical, so be prepared to pay a lot for that luxury. Where the hotel is located is really close to good eats, so no worries there! Plus, they do offer a shuttle bus tour of Boston that I highly recommend! You need to book ahead though, it fills up quickly. Very reasonable prices though.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel - great location.”
Reviews.Author: mysticaldreamer
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in three nights in the Park Plaza, and I was pleased at my choice. It was centrally located, and right beside Boston Common. It was only a short ride from the Trollybus Tour, which I enjoyed, and it was a short Taxi ride to the Cambridge Mall, which pretty much fulfills your shopping needs! The rooms were good, the staff friendly and knowledgeable, ask them what is on that day, and they will know. I found it convenient for the Harbour area, and the Theatre, and most of it in walking distance, but the trollybus tour is a great boon too. Try the Oyster House on the Harbour - The Scallops in Pasta with White wine is superb! When I return to Boston, I would happily stay here again. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Who could ask for anything more!?!”
Reviews.Author: tomatocan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our 16 month old stayed over for a Friday night and had a fantastic time. Our room cost $104 per night. After catching the T from North Station, you can see the hotel when you come up from the platform at Arlington Station. The entire staff was absolutely friendly and personable and the room (a queen size bed) was clean, comfy, and very cozy. The bathroom was spotless and the three of us slept soundly the whole night through in our very quiet room on the 11th floor. There are a number of restaurants located right out the front door--everything from upscale to slices. In the morning we grabbed croissants and coffee at LaRoma on Newbury and walked the Common together. Fantastic stay

Reviews.Title: “Grand dame with a few wrinkles”
Reviews.Author: SeattleRedBear
Reviews.Content: I was here for 5 nights attending a conference. Location convenient to T, theaters and Boston Commons. Because it's an older hotel, rooms are definitely on the small side. I was in Room 901 (just past the service elevator, only one small window facing backside of other building) so the room was dark. If you looked closely, you could see maintenance needed to be done (some peeling paint, carpets worn) but nothing serious enough to affect my experience. My only complaint was with heating. The fan was very loud and I could never turn it off (I could turn the heat off, but the fan was always on). Normally, sound doesn't affect my sleep, but this was loud enough that it woke me several times during the night. Don't know if this is a common problem or just my room. I didn't eat at any of the hotel restaurants, but there was an Au Bon Pain halfway down the block that had good affordable breakfast and lunch, Chinatown is about 5 blocks away and if you like beer and German food, Jakob Wirth was a great find on this trip (so there is good affordable food in the neighborhood). Public areas are lovely and well-maintained. Service was variable, reception was very business-like, porters were friendly. Free boarding pass checkin and printing in the lobby but regular internet access (either in-room or business center) was more expensive than it needed to be. I booked this room on priceline for $69/night and for that price in that location, it was a GREAT value.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Its Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Tarheel444
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews on this site and arrived expecting the worst. I was very pleasantly surprised. The room and the bathroom were a bit small but they were well maintained and spotless. The bed was very comfortable and the service good. The location is great and there are many places to eat (Legal Seafoods, Maggiono's, Au Bon Pain) within a block of the hotel. The T station is just around the block. I was very pleased with my stay and will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Should Have Listened to TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: libstuff
