Reviews.Content: I read reviews that said this was not a good experience, but I had to see for myself! Internet did not function in room (they said they would give me a pass to Internet use in the Lobby), in-room movie function broken, carpets stained. Strange place...in hotel food very expensive and nearest reasonable foods at least 3 blocks away...nearest drug store also quite distant. Pluses? Green line train is a short block away if you exit the right door. Do not stay here if you cannot walk or weather is too cold to do so. Price (through aggregator) seemed right but amenities did not follow.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: atfLondon_England
Reviews.Content: Looking at some of the reviews of this hotel i am wondering if I stayed at a different hotel. The rooms are spotless and the beds are clean. The bathroom is small but is entirely functional. The location is fantastic (50m from the Arlington metro station) and the staff friendly and helpful. The room service food wasn't fantastic but there are a number of places around.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst”
Reviews.Author: mariner53newyork
Reviews.Content: The service and cleanliness of this hotel is terrible. It's obvious that cut backs have been made during hard economic times. I felt like I was staying in a fleabag hotel; long lines at the desk, slow service in the bar and the place was filthy.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff - but WORST BATHROOMS EVER”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveler021
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night while I was attending a conference at the Four Seasons next door (company policy wouldn't cover the $400 room rate there!) The Back Bay location of the hotel is fantastic - and expensive - so the hotel was very well priced given the location. Should have been a clue! The lobby and common areas were nice and the staff was exceptionally friendly and attentive, I thought. Even the hotel room itself was okay, if a bit tired. I was upgraded to a "deluxe king" room, which I believe was a combination of two tiny little rooms - since my room also had two, teeny, tiny, tired bathrooms on the mirror image of each other! Now, together, these two, teeny, tiny, tired bathrooms would have made one normal sized bathroom - why the hotel has not bothered to combine them is a huge mystery to me. First, they were still tiled in 50's light blue tile - a clue as to the last time they were renovated? The sink also looked distressingly original, with a rubber stopper instead of a more modern levered stopper. However, the bathroom was so small and the bathtub stuck out so far into the tiny room that I banged my knee on it every time I approached the sink. Also, the bathroom door didn't quite open all the way, since there was a towel rack behind it, and when opened, the door came about 2 inches from the sink (did I mention the bathroom was small?) As a result, between the bathtub and the bathroom door, you had to angle your way through an opening of about 12 inches to work your way to the sink. It was awful. I'll never return to that hotel until they upgrade the bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, would use again at a push”
Reviews.Author: GeoffKenWill
Reviews.Content: Apart from the room decor being a little dated, no tea or coffee making facility and a plug in the hand washbasin that didn't work, the stay was okay. The staff were friendly and the service in the adjoining restaurants was very good. The location is the big plus point, very central and close to the T.

Reviews.Title: “don't trust the book by the cover”
Reviews.Author: bonneappetite
Reviews.Content: The tea somellier refused to serve us tea during their advertised tea tasting event. We rushed to finish the tour of the sity to return in time for this event advertised on hotel site, in room info, in the lobby... But we were told by the "tea lady" that in order to do this we need to buy a 4 course meal (??? between 3-5pm? we just had a lunch!) Had to involve a front desk manager to get a cup of tea (they served it to us in a different reataurant to avoid unpleasnt "tea lady" encounter again) Would highly recommend "Parings" restaurant there though. Great food and service! We didn't have a good dining experience in other restaurants. Go to Finales or Maggianno's across the street if Parings is full

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: mykiel111
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel, we asked about car parking and the Car park Valet took the car away, there was no mention of the $40.00 per night charge, it was only by coincidnce we found the charge displayd in small print. There was plenty of car parking facilities close by at less cost and street parking was available. On collection of the car it was noticeably damaged on the rear bumper bar, fortunately, we took out full insurance on the rental car, so there was no problems with the rental company. The accommodation was reasonable, but the bathroom was pretty small and the fact that there was no tea or coffe making facilities was a dfinite minus!! The room service charges were exorbitant and the additional mandatory gratuities and admin charge for the service was another major minus point. All in all I would rate the hotel as a thre *** star hotel, and overpriced at that even thou we got a deal price.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: clipperitis
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for Thanksgiving weekend via Priceline. Then after reading reviews here, I was initially disappointed, especially given comments about the small bathrooms and poor service (I went with my wife and children, ages 4 years and 6 months). Our experience was fantastic. To address my initial concerns, I'd say that the bathrooms were small but that the service was very good (special thanks to Ari, who worked the front desk). Further, the other folks at the front desk seemed courteous and helpful when approached by hotel guests. A few comments about the Deluxe room we stayed in...The room was well-maintained (not 4-star quality, but I wasn't expecting this). Bathrooms, as others have noted, are tiny, and the tile floors could use a little refurbushing. When I asked about why the rest of the hotel was updated but not the bathroom floors, one of the employees indicated that the tiles were untouched to retain hotel's "charm." For me, the small bathroom size was not a big deal, but I can see how it might alter the experience for some. Regarding amenities, we weren't a frequent consumer of the hotel's ancillary offerings. We didn't use the business center (not free), breakfast (expensive), gym (I'm building a tire, if you know what I mean). So, buyer beware. The hotel's lobby is fantastic. Christmas decorations were already up, and there is plenty of seating - several guests were reading newpapers or enjoying take-out dessert. Very spacious and luxurious setting, all in all. Parking is $40/night at the hotel. I opted for the covered parking across the street (where Maggiano's guests park) because it's slightly cheaper at $31/night. Last but not least, the location is perfect. The Arlington station (green line) is less than a block away. Boston Common/Public Garden is a block or two away. Chinatown is a 10-minute walk (with kids). And there are several dining options either inside the hotel (McCormick & Schmicks, Melting Pot, Ben & Jerrys) or within 1 block (Smith & Wollensky, Finale for dessert, PF Changs, Maggiano's, Legal Seafood). I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very tired hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: SusanfromSTL
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently at the Parl Plaza as they had a promotional rate that caught my eye and I remembered it was a nice close walk to Newbury Street. The front desk didn't answer the phone when i tried calling three separate times . When I got to the front door with suitcase in hand the doorman just stared at me and didnt open the door. When I got to the front desk they didnt have my reservation on file (luckliy I had my confirmation # with me), While the lobby was nice, the actual room was very small, very tired. The floor in bathroom looked like it needed a good scrub. The room had no coffee maker as I have come to expect in even low end hotels. All in all, yes it was inexpensive but it detracted from my overall stay in Boston. I would not recommend and would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered”
Reviews.Author: FreakyKitties
Reviews.Content: A slice of heaven - life doesn't get much better than this

Reviews.Title: “Sweet location, OK room”
Reviews.Author: eastcoastballer
Reviews.Content: If you book this hotel at a decent rate and understand that you are not going to be staying in the 4 Seasons, then you will be satisfied. The hotel is located close to what most people would like to do in Boston....either by walk or a quick cab ride. The rooms are OK. Definitely outdated and a bit dingy. Service by reservations as well as by the concierge was great!

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was nice”
Reviews.Author: Andrew1985
Reviews.Content: My room was nice, I got it at a good rate online, it was cleaned immaculately each day, and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom facilities were fine and clean. It would have been good to have had a refrigerator but there was an ice machine on my floor. The room had good heating and air conditioning if you wanted it. I really can't fault the hotel, and if you secure your room at a good rate then thats even better. Its is also well located between the downtown section of Boston and also the shopping area of Back Bay. I'm not sure what the other reviewers were on about - perhaps they did have bad experiences, or perhaps they may just be very fussy people? Either way, the hotel was fine for me - you wouldn't want to pay $300 a night for it - but if you can get it around $150 online then I think you're doing well, particularly for Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, terrible rooms.”
Reviews.Author: gypsy716
Reviews.Content: When I first heard we were staying at the Park Plaza where my husband was going to be at a conference and I was going for leisure, I was very excited. I've always heard the name and thought it would be the epitome of comfort and elegance. I was wrong. The Best Western I stayed at in a small town in California had more luxury than this supposedly 4 star hotel. When you walk in, the lobby is grand and it's right near Boston Commons and the subway station so you can't beat the location. However, the facade hides what's lurking in the hotel rooms. It's fine if you are just looking for a place to sleep for a few hours and then you are out of there. However, I'm one who likes to revel in the comfort and coziness of a hotel room after a long day or night out sightseeing and this didn't do it for me. First of all, the room keys are a joke. This is an older hotel built in 1927 so they added card keys instead of regular keys but every guest I talked to had problems getting their doors open. You could stand there for five minutes and the darned thing won't open. When we finally did get it open, the disappointment was palpable. The rooms are some of the smallest I've ever stayed in. Comparable to those little European hotel rooms. We had two bags and could barely fit them in the door. We looked for a closet - but there wasn't any! There was a tiny wardrobe that my husband and I had to try to fit our clothes for a week in. The bathroom was small and outdated, and I don't mean charmingly outdated. Just old. No storage for anything here either. There is a place in a small TV cabinet where a small refrigerator could go but there was no refrigerator in the room which is standard in most cheap motels, much less one that's supposed to be superior. If you are coming at all on business and you need wireless, don't come here. They only have phone lines for it and the line is so short that you have to sit at the desk. It would be nice if it would have at least stretched onto the bed. O.K. I struck out on the room so I thought I'd go out and explore. I called the concierge for a simple question but since they only have one concierge for hundreds of rooms, I waited 20 minutes before I hung up. I went down and there was a line to speak to her. There were other people working behind the desk but they weren't concierges so I guess they never thought of coming over and helping to get rid of the lines by at least answering simple questions. By the way, this wasn't a one time thing. Unless you go at 10 or 11pm, there's always people waiting. They are getting enough money for their rooms that they could at least half two people working there to help out. I tried to go on the TV and check their hotel channel to see what the local happenings were but guess what? The area video and information channel didn't work. I guess you've guessed that I won't be staying here again. To me it looked like a hotel on the brink of a changeover. I wouldn't be surprised to hear that another hotel company is taking over them soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Near Public Garden and Boston Common”
Reviews.Author: travel192
Reviews.Content: The hotel enjoys a good location, and is housed in a historic building. The lobby is beautiful, and there are several restaurants on site. One drawback is very small bathrooms with little counter space. The windows are not insulated, so the street noise can be disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobic and outdated”
Reviews.Author: stonyMD
Reviews.Content: I agree with other travelers. Although the lobby appears impressive, my room was very small and bathroom was outdated. The door to the room look like the entrance to a refrigerator or casket. I checked out one day early because I was claustrophobic. Hotel staff was adequate. Would not recommend this to a friend even though it is very convenient to Downtown Boston venues. I would rather pay more to stay at a more modern hotel with standard amenities.

Reviews.Title: “After reading previous reviews, pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Skelf_78
Reviews.Content: Was slightly apprehensive about the Park Plaza, particularly as my stay there was to celebrate my honeymoon with my new wife, however, I was pleasantly surprised on arrival. The building itself is very grand as is the decor in the lobby. It has an excellent postion, within walking distance of many of Boston's attractions. It also helps that its only a $20 dollar/15 minute cab ride from Logan Airport. The reception were always very friendly and helpful and on arrival my wife and I were given an upgrade to a Towers level Suite. The room itself was spotlessly clean, as was the rest of Hotel, and the views from the 15th Floor were impressive. That said, the room wasn't the biggest but if you only visiting Boston for a few days you're unlikely to spend much time in your room anyway. Overall really enjoyed our stay at the Park Plaza and hope to stay there in the future. Will definately be returning to Boston, anybody going for a city break will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Trip Ever”
Reviews.Author: Usalucky7
Reviews.Content: concierege perfect Todd English's Restaraunt - Perfect Bar in the lobby - Amazing Staff - Perfect Absolutely 0 complaints about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “top-notch service & location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: clrn911
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a business/leisure trip. advantages: once I got perspective, realized how great the location was. unless you have health conditions, within walking distance to the freedom trail, boston commons/park, newberry st. (incredible shopping), trinity church, copley square (incredible shopping again), public library, the prudential center (incredible skywalk, lots of restaurants/shops) and more. hotel rooms had a safe that fit our 2 laptops plus--the 1st time i've seen that. top-notch service in all areas. beautiful grand lobby, alot of history here, hosted every u.s. president since it's opening in 1927, has formal tea time, and a tea sommelier--1 of a handful in the world. disadvantages: a bit of street noise heard in our room, small room, bathroom very tiny. tub had some soft spots in the middle, an old hotel, don't expect a like-new room--keep in mind it is a very historical hotel. reports free wi-fi in lobby, but couldn't get it to work with staff help, paid $10 plus/day for room internet service. no frig in room or coffee maker, tough to have that 1st cup of the day in your jammies. parking for valet=$40/day, nearby parking garage $30/day, but, expected when you stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “I hated everything about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: browan04
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny and the staff was rude. I had to wait until almost 5 pm to check in because they were overbooked. I had over $100 in charges on my bill for room service I never got, movies I never ordered, and calls I never made. They told me when I checked out that apparently that same bill had been slipped under the door of everyone on my floor because there was a computer glitch. Don't you think someone would notice that every single person on the same floor ordered the same thing and was getting the exact same bill? Clearly no one knows what's going on here. I would never stay there again. Aside from the lobby, there's nothing nice about the furnishes. The location is great, which is why I booked it, but I would rather spend $50 more bucks to stay somewhere that's really a four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Why did I stay here?”
Reviews.Author: TravelsWithChildren
Reviews.Content: Possibly one of the worst Starwood properties I've ever stayed in. While the lobby is convincing enough that this is a worthy hotel, immediately upon entering my room, I realized that this hotel was completely overrated. I'm usually pretty laid back about this sort of thing, but I'm pretty sure my first apartment in Chicago, after I graduated from college, was nicer than this. Bathroom is decaying and its clear there's been no attempt to even attempt an upgrade (the fixtures are all cheap and old). TV is circa 1990. Room generally feels old and dirty (see attached pictures of bathroom and window shade). Gym smelled and many pieces of equipment were rusty. Other comments on this site regarding the general lackadaisical attitude of the concierge were right on, although the front desk staff was helpful. Overall, I fully understand why the other Starwood properties were sold out and this one wasn't (even at almost half the cost!).

Reviews.Title: “I am so glad I didn't pay for the room myself”
Reviews.Author: module
Reviews.Content: The first impression of this hotel was excellent, the lobby is spacious and everything is very well maintained. Unfortunately there are a couple of things that we found very problematic. First of all, the rooms are tiny, especially since we were traveling with a 1y old baby, there simply wasn't enough room for us. I am fairly sure the room was the smallest I have ever seen in the US. For that price you definitely expect larger rooms. Also the service was not always that great, especially we felt the concierge service to be a bit rude after asking for our delayed luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Explorer63
Reviews.Content: Having read the earlier reviews I was dreading our stay, but was very pleasantly surprised. Great location, very close to all the major sites and Arlington "T" station. We didn't eat in the hotel, choosing instead to get lighter bites for breakfast and evening meals from the local Bon au Pain, which offers pastries, tasty soups and light snacks at reasonable prices. We had a King size room, so we didn't have the problem others have written about and the bathroom was spacious. On one occasion we asked the concierge for details of how to get to Salem for a day visit and she kindly printed out the train timetable for us. Free internet access available in the Business Centre if you need to check-in for flights or print boarding cards. Wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, great ambience”
Reviews.Author: brisbanesbest
Reviews.Content: We were big fans of the Park Plaza. The location couldn't be beat. The internet in our room didn't work, so they upgraded us to an amazing suite. Two bathrooms for just two of us - fab!! The foyer is beautiful and the rooms were large. We'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, comfertable, no luxuries included”
Reviews.Author: UkLuckygirl
Reviews.Content: We found the Plaza an excellant place to stay for the location and comfert but were somewhat surprised at there being no fridge in the room, and the biggest shock of all was a $10 daily charge for internet use! The hotel is located next to some excellent resturants and great shopping, including a store where you could buy water to take up to your room as none was provided. All in all we would stay at the Plaza again, but only because of it's location, they are just a bit cheap when it comes to providing basic amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, shabby bath, good resto nearby”
Reviews.Author: francenut
Reviews.Content: The room is fine but they need to finish the remodel with new baths. Providing robes would be nice also (like other fine hotels). The location is good for walking tours of the Back Bay and, across the park, Beacon Hill. We also did the Freedom Trail on foot. An easy and excellent restaurant is across the street (Via Matta) but avoid ordinary Legal Seafoods unless you like boring food. We got a $220 rate (total w/tax) from 1800hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, hot water problems, pleasant enough staff, but comfy beds and good location”
Reviews.Author: angus s
Reviews.Content: Greeted by large glitzy foyer of yesteryear design (think enormous chandeliers, swirly carpets, ornate side tables and you're there) the Reception staff were pleasant and the check-in process quick. The key card worked first time (always a good start) and familiarisation with the room v easy (difficult to hide things in small box - felt NYC hotel room size). If there is one thing that all hotels need to be able to do that's have hot water always on demand - went for x3 showers: 1 v luke warm, 1 warmish, 1 hot - not good. The bed was v comfy and ultimately I was there for a couple of nights and for what I needed it for it was adequate. The hotel needs modernising though and for the price (approx 170GBP pn) was hoping for something a bit more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sshoys
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel choice for us-- we were able to walk easily to the Freedom Trail as well as to great shops and restaurants. It was also very close to public transportation and made getting to and from the train and airport very easy. Our room was huge-- two bathrooms!-- and it was very quiet and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated hotel”
Reviews.Author: cbilowich
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a business trip to Boston. We stayed for three days and every time we wanted to get a shower there was no hot water. We had to call every day and ask them to remedy the problem. I would then proceed to get a call from maintenance saying they turned a valve and we should have hot water. That valve turn seemed to do the trick. But everyday we had to call and repeat the message of no hot water and they would turn the valve on again. What kind of hotel turns the VALVE OFF!!!! Plus, if you are looking for a spacious rooms, count this place out. The rooms are small and the bathroom is the tiniest bathroom I have every been in with hardly any counter space. Oh and one more thing, the hotel is on some busy roads. So if you are looking for peace and quiet, this hotel is not for you. The street noise is overwhelming. You can do much better that this hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Uconnhoopsfan
Reviews.Content: After reading the recent reviews I was wondering if I had made a mistake booking the Park Plaza. We had a great stay, room was spotless, comfortable , and the front desk and bellmen were all very pleasent and helpful. We can't wait to go back. The T stop couldn't make it any easier to get around.

Reviews.Title: “sad, shabby ghost of a time past”
Reviews.Author: metalmaiden
Reviews.Content: It was supposed to be a quiet, romantic escape. We thought we were checking into an luxury historic hotel from a bygone era. Instead we experienced a horrible overnight stay. There were a couple positives. The location was great for the city activities we had planned. The bed was very comfortable and the dual shower head was wonderful. Most everything else fell flat. Upon arrival no one greeted us, took our bags or even opened a door for us. We had paid for the "tower level" service and it was nice to be able to go straight to the 15th floor for our check-in but the greeting we received was hardly welcoming. Our room was so small. A couple times I was whacked by the bathroom door by my spouse because it was so tight in there. There was only one robe is the closets (and no promised slippers) bringing me to the conclusion that generally the room was used for one person not two. A few things in the bathroom had been updated (they advertised new marble bathrooms in the tower rooms) but the bathtub bottom buckled and creeked under our feet (I'm only 125 pounds). The room was in OK repair but slapping a coat of paint (paint spray was on door locks and furniture told the story) right over dents and dings doesn't mean an upgrade. We requested, and never received, turn down service. The concierge was never at the desk to help us out with problems or answer questions. The room was very noisy. Not that people were being loud and disturbing us but city noise came in loudly through the window and any little sound out in the hall was heard loudly in our room. The tower lounge was nicely appointed but the food & beverages were only available for a very short time each day. Breakfast had minimal offerings and was just average. The "happy hour" offerings were no better than a local bar, hardly what I was expecting from a luxury hotel. The staff in the lounge was more annoying than helpful. Save your money, this upgrade is not worth it! This hotel also claims a fitness facility but it was a small, poorly maintained room with a couple pieces of equipment. We decide to skip it and jog the park instead. This place really needs an overhaul. Having a staff that was welcoming, professional and more service conscious would go a long way to improving the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: kcamper32
Reviews.Content: This apparent expensive and historic hotel in downtown boston was definietly not worth the price. We stayed in the hotel, because of a wedding at the hotel in mid-September. The rooms were quite small and freezing, we called the information desk regarding the cold temperature and they told us that the heat was completely turned off for the season. At the wedding (which was a beautiful room) I was moving my bag from under the table and when I put it on my chair and got read to move, i looked down and on my chair was the largest roach you've ever seen. The only good part of our stay was we got upgraded to the chancellors suite, which was nice because we were travelling with two young children. The rest of our party had traditional rooms, they were extremely small and they were all disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: ViajeraSanClemente
Reviews.Content: Although this is one of the "Historic Hotels of America", it is definitely in need of a facelift. Good points: comfortable beds and pillows; courteous staff; good location to shops, restaurants, subway. Down side: no coffee maker in rooms; rooms are very dated and poorly maintained. The bathrooms are very tiny for American standards, along with dirty, cracked caulking, poorly draining tubs - you get the picture. Also, they appear to be very stingy with toiletries. I went two days in a row with one bar of soap for the shower and sink until I swiped another from the housekeeper's cart. After four days here, still am not provided with another body lotion. Time for another swipe...Rooms are noisy. On the 11th floor, the traffice noise is quite noticeable (and there are a lot of sirens in Boston). The fire alarm system malfunctioned - although it DID NOT AWAKEN us to evacuate (which is worrisome), the very loud announcements that it was OK to reenter the building did. Then we were in bed thinking what the heck - what if there had been a real fire??? Obviouisly, my first choice for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: MrJohn1960
Reviews.Content: This is a very difficult one to write. The location is great, central and one minute from the subway. It could be so much better. Check in was good, no waiting. We were told the floor our room was on and pointed towards the lifts. This suits us, but there were two bell boys standing around doing nothing and watched us pass them. The room was really nice but the bathroom is tiny. Far too small for such a grand looking hotel. The bed though was huge and really comfortable. We asked reception / concierge for advice a few times but not great unfortunately. The room could do with a coffee machine which would be a welcome addition. We left with mixed views. Very comfortable bed but the tiny bathroom was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: mtrottier
Reviews.Content: Although the location is great, we found the room very small, and not soundproof. There are no coffee makers.... Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This is the Worst Property I Have Ever Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: FrankBocaRaton_FL
Reviews.Content: This property is terrible. I stay in hotels 4 nights a week (most of it business related) and this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. The Valet. Be sure to add $60 a night to whatever rate you are quoted to cover parking and internet. Bell People and Front Desk are all extremely friendly and courteous, unless you ask them for any special request. Then you get, Sorry, I can't help you. The rooms are clean but are EXTREMELY tiny. We were supposed to have a Queen or King bed and got two tiny singles. The hotel would not correct the situation. Don't expect to get your Starwood points at this property. It is a Starwood property that doesn't issue points (I never heard of such a thing before.) The HVAC doesn't work and our defective unit woke us up with blasting noices during the night. The 12th floor didn't propect us from the street noise in this old, uninsulated buildong. The defective fire alarm system went off waking us again and frightening usv for no reason. The bathroom is terrible. The tiny toilet is next to a 50s sink. The bathroom has no counter/vanity space at all and is decorated in 50s' tiny blu tiles. I'm sure some of the rooms most have the yellow and green tiles. The shower trickles water. Stay somewhere else in this great city. The entire property is non-smoking which is a pleasure for me.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: michellejeanne
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at this hotel for a little over a week. We were very unhappy. The bathrooms are tiny. I'm 5'4 at 115 lbs and could barely fit in the shower. The was no coffee maker in the room and the front desk and conceirge were not helpful. Two days in a row the fire alarm went off and everyone had to vacate the building. The first time it was 4am and the second time was around 6pm. The only things that I liked were the beds, which were very comfortable and the location, which was great. The next time I return to Boston, I will not stay here again. You definitly don't get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: adnil48
Reviews.Content: Having just red the previous reviews, I think we must have stayed in different hotel. We had very large room with two bathrooms and two super size beds which were extremely comfortable. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. The only downside was the lack of coffee making facilities in the room but as mentioned by someone else there was a coffee bar just next door which was great. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “trip to boston”
Reviews.Author: tatilci2008
Reviews.Content: beds were not comfortable at all. bathrooms were too small and there is construction going on at the hotel therefore too noisy. but its location is great, we had changed our room three times. none of them worth the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay...beware!”
Reviews.Author: Franknap
Reviews.Content: This had to be one of the worst stays in a hotel in my life. The air conditioning was not working. We were first told that it was being worked on. The next day the front desk advised that some rooms A/C is not good. Also said they had 24 hr room service...this was another fabrication. Not offered a different room or anything. Would NEVER stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Location! Great first visit to Boston. No complaints.”
Reviews.Author: VAJimVA
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful five-night stay. This was my first trip to Boston and it was made all the better by staying at the Park Plaza. The hotel's biggest asset is location; it is in a very nice area, less than a block to the Arlington stop on the Green T-line, one block from the Public Garden, and walkable to many of the great areas of Boston. The hotel was beautiful. I stayed in one of the Economy rooms, #768, for $119 per night deal off Orbitz. The room description said Double bed, but it was a Queen. The window opened to an interior view, but then there was no street noise, so I was fine with that; it's not like I was going to spend my time in the room gazing out the window anyway. I easily slept in a couple of mornings, which I doubt I would have been able to do with a street-side room because of all the traffic. The room was very nice, very comfortable bed, great linens, very clean, no issues at all. If I had to come up with one complaint, it is no coffee-maker in the room; I really need coffee first thing when I get out of bed. There is an Au Bon Pain in the same block, so with not too much effort I had coffee. I did not realize until my last morning that the hotel cafe' sold "to go" Starbucks coffee in the lobby for the same price as Au Bon Pain...Doh! Oh, one more thing, while the towels are very thick, they are very rough; they will take off the top layer of your skin; pat yourself dry, don't rub, unless you are looking for a spa treatment. The staff was great; efficient check-in, Concierge staff quickly helped me with looking up schedules for the commuter train to Salem, quick check-out, there is a computer station in the lobby to print boarding passes, and they stored my bags until later in the day until my flight. Really, it was a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here - stuff goes missing!"”
Reviews.Author: Leukonoe
Reviews.Content: The Park Plaza is a beautiful hotel in a lovely location, very suitable for business travellers, although the rooms and decor are a bit dated and could do with a bit of refurbishment. The room service staff was lovely and very helpful. However, I would like to warn everyone to keep a very close eye on their belongings - I accidentally left a suit hanging in the hotel cupboard when leaving, and despite me noticing it and ringing immediately within 6h of departure, the item was nowhere to be found. Their security staff was extremely unhelpful, took ages to reply to my phone calls and only offered me a very poor recompensation - and no apology at all. When I asked them to check with the cleaners - who, according to their key card logs, had been the only people in the room since my departure - I was even told by the hotel's security staff that cleaning staff had been found on earlier occasions to have taken lost belongings home overnight by accident....by accident?? This is totally unacceptable for a hotel of this class - I will definitely not be back and warn everyone to keep a close eye on their possessions when staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Not great....”
Reviews.Author: celihazel
Reviews.Content: - rooms not very clean - staff: not pleasant, not welcoming and certainly not professional. - cards for the elevators weren't functioning properly - very noisy due to the ventilation

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to almost everything”
Reviews.Author: ColdStaind1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend. We arrived at around 11 and the bellmen gladly took our bags until we were able to check in at 3PM. The hotel is a block from the Public Garden, and two blocks from Newbury Street and the Boston Common. There is a T station less than 1 block away. There are so many restaurants within 5 minutes of walking. We checked in at exactly 3PM. We had two rooms. One room wasn't ready but the other one was. On our way up to one of the rooms, we were called to say the other room was ready, so we only had to wait an extra 5 minutes. The rooms were small but it was only two of us in a room so we didn't need much space. The bathrooms however are tiny and do not have fans or any ventilation beside leaving the door open. The shower was extremely quiet. I had read reviews about thin walls but we didn't hear anything beyond the occasional door shutting in the hallway. The shades were hard to open and close and need to be updated but they did a good job of blocking most of the light from the outside. The fire alarms went off at 2:30AM on Saturday night/Sunday morning and the spoken instructions weren't clear on whether or not we were supposed to evacuate. Lots of heads were poking out of rooms because nobody knew what to do. We knew where to go to evacuate, but we didn't know if we were supposed to or not. I opened the door to the stairwell and the alarm stopped. It wasn't very comforting on the 12th floor at 2:30AM not knowing if you need to leave or not. Their evacuation and emergency alarm procedures need to be updated to be more specific and clear. We were never given an explanation about what the cause for the alarm was. We got an amazing rate, which was a big reason we stayed here. The normal rate for the dates we stayed were roughly $230/night. We booked a non-refundable rate months ago for $129/night. Besides the fire alarm, it was well worth it. We will definitely consider staying here again in future trips to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: fred11Halifax_NS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the beginning of August as our original hotel had overbooked and moved us to here. At first I was a little apprehensive as it was a lower grade hotel but can honestly say that it was the best thing that could have happened. Our stay was to take a look around the city and as such the hotel was in the best location possible. All the resturants and cafes around the hotel (Underneath) were great and were ideal no matter what kind of meal you were looking for. The service in the hotel was very good and the receptionist very cheerful and helpful. The room had everything we needed apart from a great veiw but it was OK. Everything worked in the room and a blown lightbulb was replaced very quickly. Overall a great location and very nice hotel for the money paid.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: canadianmastermike
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very nice, however we rented a room on the tower level and it sucked! When you took a shower, the bathroom floor flooded, this was due to the poor workmanship of installing the shower doors. "They don't close all the way". The mini fridge did not work! Come on people, when your paying $400.00 a nigt for a room, you would think these things would not be an issue......People are friendly and nice area but not worth the money at all.......

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Drey98
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. Location, Location, Location. It is in the heart of Boston, right off I-90, near the theatre district. There are a slew of restaurants on-site and off -- we particularly went to the Ben and Jerry's, Au Bon Pain and Legal Seafoods. The hotel is a block away from the Green Line Metro and a short walk to the Public Gardens too! The lobby is gorgeous and the staff helpful. Because we got the hotel for $ 80 a night on Priceline (which says it's 3-1/2 stars), it was a bargain! On the minus side, we were in one of the older rooms and the a/c leaked (they fixed it), there was a stain on the sofa, one of the phones was dead, etc. but the location and service made up for that. In addtion, onsite valet parking is $ 40 a day which is high and the Motor Mart Garage is located down across the street if you want that option instead. Back on the plus side, there is a free USA Today located near the elevators and the bell captain, a gym, a sundries/souvenir shop and we had a great time and felt like we were in opulence since the Boston Park Plaza Hotel is a historical hotel as well!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and poor quality”
Reviews.Author: pyke8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and would seriously advise anyone to consider carefully whether to stay here. Like a lot of american hotels superficially everything looks good with an impressive lobby area etc but the rooms are basic and depressing with minimal facilities. I've stayed in hotels all over the world and would say that this place is 2 star at best in fact the rooms are no better than a Travelinn or Travellodge standard [ if you are based in the Uk] but of course you pay 5 star prices. Simple examples of how cheap the place is:- plastic disposable cups no glasses, no mini bar or fridge, tatty decor, dirty shabby bathrooms. If you have suicidal tendencies DO NOT stay at this hotel as it could well be your last night. The place is a nightmare avoid at all costs!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_visitor79
Reviews.Content: The Park Plaza is right in downtown Boston near everything. Parking at the hotel is very expensive ($40/night) but it's expensive everywhere! The hotel breakfast was also very expensive. We went down the block to a small cafe for a cheaper and tasty breakfast (Au Bon Pain). The hotel is older so the room looked like it could use an update. It's also a small room but very comfortable. We heard lots of sirens all night long due to the downtown location. We used AAA membership which was helpful. Concierge was helpful. Have to pay extra for internet in rooms. That sucked when cheaper hotels gave it for free.

Reviews.Title: “Park Plaza is lovely, and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: tilda54
Reviews.Content: I had a great week in Boston at the Park Plaza. I was a bit concerned because I found a great sale on what was specifically described as an economy room, and thought it might be a closet. Instead, the room was very well appointed, and the only sacrifice was that I had an interior view. I found the staff, from housekeeping to the doorman to be very friendly and helpful. The lobby is beautiful and the location one block from the Public Gardens and the T is unbeatable. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzieq23
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is great- it's in walking minutes of the Common, the T, Back bay and the South end! The lobby is really nice and the rooms are pretty big. We got a handicap accessible room (though didn't request one) so I think that may have contributed to why the room was so wide. But the room was nice and spacious- great linens and towels. The only thing that we didn't like was that we faced the inside of the hotel- so instead of having a view of the park or the city... we had a view of the other rooms. Overall though, I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “johanneditlevsen, Denmark Reply”
Reviews.Author: mystreyshopper1
Reviews.Content: First the correct term is Bellman. Second Any bellman can tell a no tipping dead beat a from mile away. Good service costs. especially in 2009. Give it a try...next time you are visit a grand hotel like the park plaza or any for that matter...Trying taking care of your bell "boy" with a decent attitude and give him a tip perhaps "$2" a bag...Anyway just food for thought...So quit crying and get with it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: YROCOrlando
Reviews.Content: After seeing some of the reviews I was a little nervous... but we were pleasently surprised by the great service and quality of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boston Gem”
Reviews.Author: gracie2762
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for vacation and had a great time. The room was clean and spacious, very close to a T station, Boston Public Garden and Boston Commons and the staff was very courteous and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Hertz, Close to the Boston Common, Far from ideal”
Reviews.Author: ChinookRiver
Reviews.Content: Well, If you are looking for a bathroom and a bed near the Theatre District and the Boston Common, this is the place. The hotel is just huge, full of restaurants and other places to spend money. It is encouraged. Not many bennys in the room. No coffee maker for instance. The day we arrived was a little chilly, but then temperature in the room could not be independently adjusted, it is a hotel wide issue. The elevators are slow and the lobby while pretty large is not the kind of old hotel lobby where you can sit in an easy chair and strike up a conversation with a fellow guest.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Well-Kept Old Lady Located In the Heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Mark_On_Vacation
Reviews.Content: My wife & I spent a single night in a "Deluxe King" room. It was large and comfortable and had TWO full baths- which was a great plus. The bed was excellent. The rest of the furniture was pretty pedestrian, but who really cares? The Hotel is a triangular building, and our room was on the inside of the triangle- looking out into a open utility area surrounded by two other walls of hotel room windows- so there was no view to speak of. But we wanted a Hotel within easy walking distance of the heart of Boston, and the Park Plaza IS that place. Great location. Helpful, friendly staff. Clean and well-kept. We enjoyed our brief stay and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but nothing more.”
Reviews.Author: johanneditlevsen
Reviews.Content: At arrival we didn't get any help with our luggage - even though there were plenty of bell boys around. Our room was okay, but very small. The location was excellent, and the nearby irish gastropub is highly recommendable. Breakfast was disappointing. Not the greatest selection.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Park Plaza”
Reviews.Author: knorman410
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be lovely, with friendly service and great location. Not sure if it helped or not but I requested a standard KING and the room had ample space( I had heard that some of the guest rooms are small)

Reviews.Title: “Atrocious service stay away”
Reviews.Author: Mfarquar_MA
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great reputation, but I was also very disappointed in the cleanliness and service when attending a national conference in March. The only positive was the location. I can honestly say every member of the hotel staff that I encountered (with the exception of the bellhops/doormen who were wonderful) was rude, uninterested and oozed a sense of superiority. From check-in to purchasing breakfast items, everyone made me feel as though I was a bother, rather than a professional attending a conference. My favorite incident was the service at a formal luncheon. A colleague and I arrived 10 minutes late for lunch because we were entertaining questions after giving a presentation (in a conference room that had a bathroom with a very loud flushing toilet, btw!). Soup had already been served, and the staff was rushing around the ballroom collecting soup plates, even though the other members of my party who WERE on time were not even 1/2 finished. When my fellow latecomer asked if her soup could be warmed, she was YELLED at. The quote was, "Well, if you arrived on time, you wouldn't have to worry about cold soup. Next time be on time - we don't have a way to warm your soup. There's no nearby microwave." CLASSIC. Managers were equally uninterested and rude when expressing these described problems. Our room was consistently dirty. Moreover, one morning when I called for an iron (the one in the room was broken), I was told that we couldn't have one for over an hour because "all the housekeeping staff is in a meeting until 9am". I questioned how it is possible that they do not have any housekeeping service between the hour of 8-9am, and no one could provide me with an answer. After 3 more polite, but persistent calls I received an iron. Another evening, we called and asked for an extra blanket because we had a cot and it only came with sheets and a blanket that was so over-used it was see through and about as thick as a 2-ply tissue. We were brought extra sheets and told there were no extra blankets - there is only 1 comforter per bed and comforters cannot be removed from unused rooms. No exceptions or additional accommodates are ever made for blankets. It was 12am, so we gave up after 2 phone calls and 1 visit. This is supposed to be one of the better hotels in Boston? I've received 10x the service at chains like Hampton Inn. This is certainly no way to run a business. If I had paid for this (rather than my company) I would have DEFINITELY found a way to be refunded or better yet, move to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “old style, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jschombe
Reviews.Content: beds were extremely comfortable; neighborhood was great; very close to subway stop. Staff was prompt in responses, though not overly friendly. Food for business mtg was excellent. Expensive, but a nice place. Would stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “no in-room wifi, a must for biz travelers”
Reviews.Author: cordeliaj
Reviews.Content: The staff were excellent, and the location is good, but c'mon, people, a business hotel without in-room wifi? There's an Ethernet cable but that chains you to the desk -- no putting your feet up in bed to check e-mail. I also wish the reception clerk had asked whether I prefer to be near the elevators -- I do prefer it, and there was probably someone who would have gladly traded for my quiet room with the very long walk.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel that needs to be renovated”
Reviews.Author: clarasev
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in June on business. The hotel is centrally located, just a few steps from Boston Commons, Arlington T stop and lots of restaurants. When I booked my time at the hotel there were a number of discounts available both through Expedia and the Starwood website. Without these discounted rates, this hotel would have been much too expensive for its level of service and aesthetic appeal. Check-in was quick and without incident even though I arrived hours ahead of the check-in time. However, the room left much to be desired. First, I had a hard time opening the door as it was quite heavy. The look of the room was very dated. The window had two old-style roller blinds with plastic cords. The wallpaper, the carpet, the old CRT TV...all added to old look of the room. There were a number of cup/mug rings on the desk as well. All this aside, it was the minuscule bathroom that I had the hardest time with. The toilet was very industrial looking, there was no counter space around the sink and the one shelf that did exist in the bathroom was very narrow and right over the toilet! I could not imagine two people trying to make use of this bathroom. On the bright side, the bed was large and very comfortable. I used the hotel phone to make long distance calls with a calling card (1-800 number) and it was quite expensive! Beware of this. Also, the balance of the express check-out invoice and what was charged on my credit card were not the same. After contacting the hotel, they sent me an updated check-out invoice. I thought this was very poor service on their behalf. I don't know why no one informed me of the change in charges when I called down to check-out. The charges had been incurred the day before check-out so I don't know why they weren't reflected in the original invoice. There are plenty of hotels to choose from in Boston. The Park Plaza is not one I plan to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boston Location!”
Reviews.Author: MassCouple2
Reviews.Content: -Great location, one block from Boston Public Garden, great restaurants a just short walk away. -An old hotel (originally built in the 1920's?) but nicely renovated. -Room was interesting in that two very small rooms were combined into one larger room, which is fine, but there are still 2 very small bathrooms in the room (with barely enough room for one person in each - and you need to shut the door just to get to the towels!) -Bad view out the window: of another wing of the hotel (typical of an old city hotel), but not a problem. -No parking garage, but a large self-park garage across the street ... convenient, but not affiliated with the hotel, very expensive, and no validation offered -The hallways are clean, bright, well air-conditioned, and very pleasant (not like more modern hotels) -The Park Plaza is affiliated with Starwood Hotels, but they don't give Starwood points (a disappointment)

Reviews.Title: “There Are Better Choices in Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: ToughCritic36
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at this hotel and was offered a conference rate of $189 for a queen bed room. My colleagues did stay here and I saw one of their rooms. The room, like the rest of the hotel, was quite dated, musty, and dingy. Although this is a "historic hotel of America," it needs to be revamped and returned to its former glory. After reviewing TripAdvisor's recommendations and consulting a map, I chose to stay just one block away at the Back Bay Hotel (formerly Jury's). I have written a separate review on this experience, but to summarize: a top-notch experience, a beautiful hotel, and a promotional rate of $175. But at the Park Plaza, the service ranged from indifferent to hostile: an indifferent desk clerk when my colleagues' lost luggage was delivered, an indifferent concierge providing information about tourist trolleys, and a totally indifferent service staff at the in-hotel Irish pub (85 minutes to receive Fish and Chips!). On our last morning in Boston, I joined a colleague in the lobby restaurant for breakfast. When I asked to see a menu, I was told that breakfast was served from the buffet only. My colleague interjected that another waiter had let her order off the menu. The waiter sneered at me and said "We only let customers order off the menu if they insist." I insisted. My $18 omelette was adequate but did not arrive for 30 minutes. I guess the conference organizers chose this hotel because it does have sufficient conference space. But, overall, it is a faded hotel offering faded service at high prices, and I see no reason for anyone to stay here when the lovely Back Bay hotel is just one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissappointed in the room and service provided by the management”
Reviews.Author: psamson
Reviews.Content: This hotel has slid downhill. The room had smoke detectors that would make noise periodically even though the batteries were not low. There were bare wood doors hanging on the closets. Management refused to return 5 separate contact attempts to resolve an issue. Service has never been this bad in the past, but it appears that all good things must come to an end. WIll not return and advise that you do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great for conferences”
Reviews.Author: ConferenceCollegeGuy
Reviews.Content: I was pretty worried what my conference was going to be like. Some of the reviews across the internet expressed pretty negative opinions about the Boston Park Plaza. This place is great for conferences. The facilities are more than adequate. The staff gets the job done without being obtrusive. The location allows many options for meals and other outings. There is a great park not even a block away. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend the Boston Park Plaza for any business conference.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: nam4anad
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for just one night on our way up to a vacation in Maine. I booked through Expedia and got a rate that was much cheaper than what was advertised on the hotel website. Unfortunately, even for about $100 off the regular room rate, I still feel like I got ripped off. First of all, the room was tiny and dingy. We were on the 5th floor, but when I looked out of our window, I saw only a rooftop right at our level, and several other hotel rooms directly across the way. We got absolutely no direct (or indirect) sunlight and couldn't even keep the shades open because anyone across the way could see right in. That alone wouldn't rate such a negative review. But after dinner and drinks, we came back to our room with hopes of watching some TV. But the TV channels were all so fuzzy that we could barely make out the picture. They had cable, so I'm not sure why the channels looked so terrible, but we couldn't watch TV at all. Overnight, the air conditioner in the room clanged and clattered, keeping us up all night. The next morning, when we went to take showers, there was no hot water. After about 15 minutes, the water still wasn't warm enough to actually shower in, so we just decided to shower at our hotel in Maine that afternoon. Also, there was no actual shower stall, just a curtain that separated the shower head and drain from the rest of the floor. So after running the water for a while, the entire bathroom was soaking wet. As we were getting dressed for breakfast, housekeeping burst into the room, even though the "Do Not Disturb" sign was clearly displayed on our doorknob. We went out to breakfast and then came back to check out. I complained about the TV, AC and lack of hot water as we checked out and the desk agent asked me if I called anyone to come repair it. I told her that we obviously didn't, as we didn't find out about the TV until almost midnight, and we didn't find out about the lack of hto water until that morning. She said that she couldn't do anything for us because we prepaid for the room. She offered us a free breakfast in the hotel restaurant but I told her that we'd already eaten and asked her if she could comp us our valet parking ($40). She refused. It was only one night, but it was a terrible experience. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Central location; In room internet is wired with too short cord”
Reviews.Author: elodTlv
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel based on business meeting location. Internet connection in the room was wired and hotel didn't have long wires to allow me to move the computer away from the desk. The connection was also shaky even when using the provided wired. Helpdesk didn't solve the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel, Ever.”
Reviews.Author: geib631
Reviews.Content: Letâ€™s start with the good: 1) Location, location, location. Very close to wonderful Boston Commons and wonderful Boston shopping (Newbury St.). 2) The Hotel Bar (Whiskey Park). My husband was very excited that they served absinthe (but not very excited about the $13 price tag). Now, the (much longer) bad: 1) The bell hops didnâ€™t take our suitcase out of the cab for us (the taxi driver even scolded them for this) and they didnâ€™t hold the door for us either. It seems they just got paid to stand there and look disgruntled. 2) The room itself. I think it was made for little people. The drawers on the chest of drawers could not be opened without hitting into the bed. Iâ€™m very, very thin and could barely walk through the space between the tv and the bed. Also, the dÃ©cor was overly tacky. 3) The bathroom was very small. There was mold and water damage near the door where water leaked from the shower. We didnâ€™t notice what it was at first but after we had both showered, water began to pool by the door even though we clearly had the double-lined shower curtain fully extended. You could also push on the lining of the shower walls and feel it move, indicating it wasnâ€™t securely connected to the foundation of the bathroom. 4) The prostitutes. Yes, I said prostitutes. They seem to be in abundance around this hotel. (I suppose some of you may find this to fall under the â€œgoodâ€� title, but I did not.) There were many trashy-dressed less-than attractive women who continued to stager back into the hotel dragging various college-aged men and local bar patrons. 5) The internet situation. $12 per day. Even The Holiday Inn has free WiFi. â€˜Nuff said. 6) As my husband and I were leaving the hotel, we asked a bell hop to fetch us a cab, of which there is a presence 24 hours a day. He asked if it was for the airport (which it was) and he directed us to a very nice luxury SUV. Assuming it was a hotel shuttle service, we got in, but the man driving attempted to charge us 30 dollars for the trip (the cab ride coming to the hotel was 24). The bell hop had been conversing with the driver outside of the hotel all morning so one can assume this is a way that they con tourists into unlicensed jitney services.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SRW7
Reviews.Content: I agree with the others that the staff is very rude. I had a bigger problem. When we got home lokking at my credit card bill i realized they had over charged me by $156.00. I called and everyone gave me the run around. I left messages on4 different people's voice mail and no one has called me back in 10 days. I called back and said I wanted to talk to a person and no voice mail. The second in command said the finical person would called my back either that day or the next morning. Guess what? Five days later no one has called me back. The people it did talk to were very short with me. I repeat DO NOT Stay at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: pamplem0usse
Reviews.Content: My schoolmates and I were here for a conference in Feb. We liked its location, close to Newbury St, the Arlington station of the T, and Boston Commons. We even managed to walk to the Charles River and MIT and Harvard in Cambridge (though it took us an hour). The hotel is old (apparently every American President since 1928 has stayed at the Boston Park Plaza Hotel), but quite charming. The rooms are not very big. We had a double room with a cot, and there was barely enough space for the three of us and our three luggages. Closet is pretty big though, and bathroom, though slightly cramped is clean. We quite liked the decor in the room too. As a conference venue, the hotel served our needs well, with high-speed internet and nice rooms. We didn't have any meals at the hotel, choosing, instead to have breakfast at Au Bon Pain a few metres away, and lunches and dinners on Newbury St or Government Center. We did feel, however, that the overall experience did not justify the rates we paid for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: PPS1234
Reviews.Content: I must say this among the worst hotel to stay. They charged me USD 320 per day without breakfast and were poor in all sence. Smallest room size as if you are staying in a store. I would rate this hotel as one hotel which is just charging for its location. Guys please do not stay here. Only good thing was breakfast which they charges USD 26 separately apart from this it is all [--]. Television remote not working... enter the room and you end up lying on the small 4*6 bed not even double bed, old building at a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: jamllew
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights on a recent trip. Location was excellent, rooms were very nice, lobby absolutely beautiful. I'd highly recommend this hotel, was a bit of luxury from staying in small cramped shared bathrooms in new york. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Unresponsive -cancelled reservation”
Reviews.Author: FWT
Reviews.Content: I had reservations to stay here this coming September -- I just cancelled them due to unresponsiveness of the hotel -- I call, the phone rings once, someone picks up and hangs up. I email and no response. All I wanted to know is which T-stop is closest to the hotel. The lack of response and reports of cockroaches and bedbugs is enough to keep me away.

Reviews.Title: “small gem...even smaller rooms...overall not too bad”
Reviews.Author: MissDivaD
Reviews.Content: first of all keep in mind this is a very OLD hotel!..it's very quaint, in a GREAT location, but it is based upon the "old" TRADITIONAL hotel style...the beds are very comfy(not too soft - i detest a too soft mattress!) however the bathrooms are VERY small...some have no tubs only a shower unit..if you with children, you might want to ask for a tub. the elevators are slow and heaven forbid you are on the opposite end of the hallway - pulling luggage along the heavy carpeted floor can be a pain! so many restaurants and bars within walking distance..easy access to the trains too. a solid 3 star hotel...if not for the tiny rooms another star could be added.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location near EVERYTHING!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveler2008
Reviews.Content: The Boston Park Plaza is a really nice hotel. I found a great deal on a site, so the room was cheaper than normal. The hotel is huge and has lots of character. The location cant be beat. Its near the Commons, Chinatown and many points of interest. Upon checkin I was greeted by friendly people. Once in my room I noticed that it was decorated well. It was slightly small but overall comfortable. You can hear people in the hallways. The bathroom had character and was very clean. The downside was that I had a view of the room opposite of me. Typical city hotel. I was on an upper floor, so had some daylight. Always ask for upper floors in hotels in the city. Only downside was when I asked Concierge for directions he told me a place that was MILES away. If he actually looked at where I wanted to go, he would have known it was only a few blocks away. He was RUDE. I wish I remembered his name.

Reviews.Title: “COCKROACHES”
Reviews.Author: hpfan73180
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my stay @ the Boston Park Plaza Hotel and until this morning, I had a pretty good experience. I was there with a friend from Thursday afternoon until Sunday morning. The room we were in had 2 double beds and 2 full bathrooms, which I thought was pretty cool for a standard room. Housekeeping took forever to get to our room on Saturday, but since we were out most of the day, it did not affect us. I woke up this morning (Sunday) to find a cockroach crawling around our room!!!!! It was not something we brought in with us and until last nite, we had not eaten anything in our room (brought back Coldstone Creamery to have to eat after a nite out). After a major freak out and making sure our stuff was clean and roach free (I trapped it in a glass on the floor), we got the hell out of the room. The hotel staff was very apologetic and even took Saturday night's stay from our bill, but, I will probably never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL & LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Diana287
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 friends stayed here for 4 nights. Hotel was very elegant and staff were very helpful and pleasant. Lots of restaurants nearby - our favourite was the Italian one Maggiano's" - great value, this is just opposite the hotel. We booked the duck tour at the Prudential centre which is a short walk away just past Copley Square. Don't miss Quincy Market and take a harbour trip. Unfortunately most of the trips don't begin until 1st June so we will have to come back again! This is a great area for shopping and there were lots of bargains to be had. We did use the metro (Transit) it was very efficient and easy to use but slightly dated! Check out was easy - we were able to print our boarding passes in the reception lobby area and the hotel arranges an airport shuttle bus. Would certainly all love to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Historic art deco hotel - large bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: smudge66
Reviews.Content: Great deal on expedia but was worried because previous reviews described it as a bad choice, this was not the case - we were pleasently surprised. Our room was a corner room and thus very large, bathroom was on the smaller side compared to the room but this was not an issue to us. Handy for the "T" but nearest entrance/exit currently closed. Short walk to Back Bay and Boston Common. Used Au Bon Pain for breakfast each day - excellent, bars / restaurants in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: JSIrish
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 3 kids (ages 4, 7 and 10) to Boston to see a Red Sox game and stayed at this hotel and we couldn't have been more pleased. The hotel was beautiful and in a great location. The staff was so accomodating and the front desk associate even gave my girls stuffed swans which made their day. Not only was the hotel amazing but it was right by Boston Commons. It was so nice to get up and walk to the park and let the kids run and enjoy the city. When we got there, we valleted the car and realized that we forgot my husband's wallet in the car. When I asked the vallet associates where I could go to get the wallet, one of them gladly walked back to the garage to get the wallet for me. Whereever we went in the hotel, one staff member after the other was greeting us and talking to my kids which made them feel very important. We can't wait to go back again this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Property”
Reviews.Author: SS76
Reviews.Content: good location, reasonably priced rooms and excellent eateries nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: rezajun
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for four nights. Not too happy about my experience. Rooms are very small, even for a delux king. Most of them face an inside courtyard. The bathroom is distgusting and very small. Not that many amenities. Rude staff. Overpriced for what you are getting

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Alex1426
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I had some doubts about booking the hotel after reading some mix reviews. Finally I made up my mind, since it was the best price I could afford for a hotel. I found this hotel wonderful and up to my expectations. It has a great location (very close to Back Bay, Boston Common and Downtown). The reception desk is OK but don't expect much from them since this is quite a big hotel. Breakfast is not included and quite expensive (but there's a Au Bon Pain just outside the building). The room was very good and clean, and so was the bathroom. I recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but dowdy and bad beds.”
Reviews.Author: docwatson_236
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a number of Boston Back Bay hotels, and was booked into this one because of a business meeting. My first impression was not good, as we drove up to what looked like the official entrance, and were told that valet parking was on the other side of the building, and we had to get back in our car and keep moving. We observed that several other arriving guests were met with the same off-putting reception, and they were steamed. After the hair-raising drive through Boston traffic, it's not the sort of welcome you want to get. As for the room -- it was really small. The furnishings looked tired, and the bed was awful -- a queen-sized bed was about all they could fit into that teeny room, and the mattress transmits your spouse's every little movement. Neither of us got much sleep -- during either of our two nights there. We both woke up tired and cranky. The bathroom was also incredibly tiny, with barely enough room to swing the door open. No countertop space, just a narrow glass ledge. So toilet cases had to be left in the bedroom. All in all, I would not come back to this place. If you want to stay in the Back Bay neighborhood, go to the Colonnade instead.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: thewoodith
Reviews.Content: Now I only live about 20 mins away form Boston but I decided to stay in Boston for the BIFF Film Festival so I was looking around the web and noticed some amazing specials that the Park Plaza were having. I ended up getting a rate of $119 a night for the hotel so I stayed there a Sat and Sun night. When I arrived to the hotel I was suprised about how beautiful the Atrium Lobby of the hotel looked with its great appeal and fixtures. Once checked in I was notified that my room was an executive level room which comes with extras such as Bathrobes, Premium Bath Products, Sitting Area and a free breakfast each morning. All of the staff at the hotel were amazing from walk in and check in to check out. The room was the cleanest I have seen around Boston and would stay here again and probably will within a month or so from now.

Reviews.Title: “Very dirty, wouldn't come back”
Reviews.Author: grjo3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business and the place was filthy. Housekeeping here is a joke. There is dust on everything including all the molding, even the bathroom tissue box. There are long hairs on the floor in both the bathroom and bedroom that are way to long to be from me. I highly doubt there was any attempt to vacuum the floor. The age shows with damaged wood and/or peeling paint. The room would look at a lot better after a day or two of touch ups. Would not stay here again. Walls are very thin. Noise from other rooms as well as from the street is quite loud. Location is great but that is about the only positive.

Reviews.Title: “Problems with smells in room”
Reviews.Author: lunar35459
Reviews.Content: Bed sheets/pillows had a terrible odor to them; complaints met with minimal support from hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...would go again at the drop of a hat!”
Reviews.Author: KayLenore
Reviews.Content: I loved the grand entrance hall with its two impressive chandaliers and a player grand piano. I took advantage of the exercise room in the basement and loved getting a coffee from the bar to take up to my room. The cleaning staff were particularly pleasant, greeting me every time we happened to pass. The lift behaved a little oddly towards the end of my stay so we all had to use our room keys to get it to go to the floor we wanted. I loved the decor which preserved the feel of the original 1920s building. I really appreciated being able to print off my boarding pass in the computer room.

Reviews.Title: “There are definitely BED BUGS in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: NycJPo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week for a business trip. I woke up in the morning COVERED in over 100 bites. When I returned home, I went to my doctor who was able to confirm that they were indeed bed bug bites. Now, not only do I have to tend to my dozens of bites but I also so have to fear that I brought them with me to my apartment. If you MUST stay at this hotel, please ensure that you thoroughly check your room for bugs. I made a huge mistake staying here. You are better off at the Westin or Marriott down a couple of blocks!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vonnyDublin
Reviews.Content: Spent 15 nights in this fab hotel in April with Hubby and two teenage daughters. We got an upgrade on arrival to a lovely large room with two bathrooms. I was very worried about this hotel having read the reports on trip advisor. Having stayed there I really don't know what these people were talking about. Everything about this hotel was wonderful from the very comfortable beds to the food and the lovely staff. The staff couldn't do enough for us especially Georgina in housekeeping who looked after us like we were her own. The hotel is old ( part of the historic hotels of America ) also very elegant which added to its charm for me. Ate in Bonfire a steakhouse attached to the hotel very nice indeed though a little on the expensive side. Mc Cormacks and Schmicks also very nice especially the sea food more reasonably priced and there is an irish pub also in the hotel where my husband enjoyed a few pints of Guinness. Hotel very centrally located to all amenities. Could not say enough about this hotel and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: BSLj
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Park Plaza Boston in March 2009 for 3 nights. It is a beautiful historic hotel. Our room was very clean, large, bright, airy and comfortable. It is at a very good location to explore Boston and it is easy to get to from the airport with the Metro. We would have no hesitation to recommend this Hotel to our fellow travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaBusiness
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for business during the last week of March. Hotel staff were wonderful. As a facilitator for our business program I found the staff extremely responsive to my needs. I had only to ask and my request was fulfilled. The events staff checked on my group several times each day to make sure our every need was met! Food was absolutely wonderful and my clients were thrilled with staff service and food. Each day was long but each night was restful do to my wonderful bed! It is an older hotel but who said that was a bad thing?!The only problem was the internet. Sometimes I had to go into the lobby to get a signal but other than that I would never have a problem recommending this hotel to other businesses or staying there again! All of our needs were anticipated and met!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful historic hotel in a spectacular location at a reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: larkster
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review, but I had to comment on Park Plaza Hotel in Boston, because it is very rare to find a beautiful historic hotel in a great location at a reasonable rate. The hotel is in walking distance of Newbury Street shopping, Boston Commons and walking distance to Haymarket square. What was more surprising is that the hotel staff felt personally invested in the well being of all the guests, as opposed to the "not my job" attitude encountered in most large, conglomerate hotel chains. It should be noted that the rooms are smaller than most American hotels of similar quality, but are typical for most European hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant but old”
Reviews.Author: bluemmlabz222
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, probably really nice at one point, but a little old now. Very elegant lobby. The rooms are a little small and old fashioned. We stayed in January and the room was FREEZING, the heat did not work well. I was impressed, for a smoking room, it was clean. Lots of restaurants in and near the hotel. Room service very expensive

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: goingonatripGa
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I was terrified of what I would experience when I got to the hotel based on all of the previous reviews. I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was WONDERFUL and the concierge was very helpful and polite. The rooms were clean and the bed was so comfortable. Yes, the rooms are on the smaller side, but this is a historic hotel!!
