I loved the double shower head. If I go back to Boston, I will be sure to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but room just ok.”
Reviews.Author: LLL89
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was the best part. It was near lots of what we wanted to do in Boston. Parking was an issue. Couldn't find a good place to unload luggage and was glad we dropped off rental car for our stay here. Booked this room on hotels.com so maybe that's why we ended up with the room we got. It looked onto the gravel roof of another part of the hotel. Some of these rooms had a sofa, but ours did not even though I requested one. The bathroom was really small so for our group it was a very tight fit. Looked like they tried to update this room to be larger but didn't bother making the bathroom bigger. The concierge was very limited in their help, talked down to us and didn't offer any tips or help unless you specifically asked. Odd, since helping you is their job. One night an alarm and warning to evacuate the hotel sounded at 4:30 in the morning. After listening to the alarm and trying to figure out what to do, they cancelled it and said it was a false alarm. When we got our bill, it was an amount that was lower than what we prepaid on hotels.com and the staff wouldn't help or offer any explanation. There are probably a lot nicer rooms in this hotel than what we stayed in, but our deal with hotels.com was not a deal after all and wouldn't do that again. Would only stay here again for location, not for the service or rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Good Service”
Reviews.Author: icatalina97
Reviews.Content: Overall, my stay was great. Staff members were courteous and helpful. The food was very good, although expensive. The hotel itself is lovely; my one complaint was that the room were a bit small and dated, particularly the bathrooms. I also did not like the fact that I had to pay $13/day for internet access. You can't beat the location. It is within walking distance of Newbury Street, Boston Common, Public Garden, hospital, Beacon Hill, and countless restaurants and shops. It is also just a couple of blocks to the nearest train station. Enjoyed my stay and would definitely recommend, although there are lots of hotels in the area so I suggest shopping around for best value.

Reviews.Title: “Much more than expected”
Reviews.Author: HernanStibanelli
Reviews.Content: Outstanding value for the money. Very good location, the rooms were big and clean. there is no fun at all, but is quiet and elegant. Sometimes you could really need that.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: wme79736
Reviews.Content: My room was dark and smelly. Someone had left their dirty underwear in the closet drawers. The bath did not work. There is no parking and validation is not provided. The staff are unfriendly and unhelpful and tend to shrug rather than respond to questions, but they were nothing compared to the person who ran the breakfast room who was unbelievzably rude, in fact nasty. The room was not bad for the web rate of $158 but it is not at all what the management seem to believe their rooms to be, judging by the self serving pamphlets left on the desk. The furniture is new and so are the mattresses and the fabrics including the curtains, but the walls, closet and doors date from 1927 and smell quite bad. While its location is good, this is a noisy, smelly old hotel with poor service and it's better to find somewhere else even if you have to pay a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Not so”
Reviews.Author: Kyrra
Reviews.Content: This was the worst night sleep I've ever had! The bed was supposedly a "Heavenly" mattress but was hard as a rock. I was there with a friend for a conference. We only stayed one night which was MORE than enough time. The room was so small the two of us felt a little claustrophobic! The bathroom was miniscule! The paint on the back of the bathroom door was cracked and peeling, the toilet and sink looked as though they hadn't been updated since the 40's, and there was even some hair on the floor! Gross. The only neat things about our room were the metal bottle opener on the back of the bathroom door (but it was covered in dust!), and what looked to be the original doors on the rooms. Very thick with the old locks (not working, there were two other much newer locks) but that was pretty neat. The "view" out of our room was an ugly brick wall, which we believed to be another wing of the hotel, and before we closed our curtains we realizedd that we could see into the rooms on the other side!!!! There were a few restaurants in the hotel itself, but we decided to go out somewhere else for dinner to take advantage of the Boston atmosphere. They did have a fondue restaurant which looked like it might be interesting. The staff was rather dull and boring for a Boston hotel that is part of the Historic Hotels of America. The girl who checked us in (and we both work in hotels that are part of the Historic Hotels of America so we know what we expect and what is expected of us) could not have had LESS enthusiasm. There was no inflection whatsoever in her voice, and when we asked about a room with a more comfortable bed she was less than helpful or even concerned about our plight. The concierge was not as knowledgable about restaurants (or how to walk to them) as we wanted and didn't even go to the ones she suggested!!! When we went to check out, their system was updating so they had to call us to get the credit card number that we wanted to use. We understood the whole issue of having to update the system, but it was about 10:30am when we wanted to check out and when we came back after our conference around 1pm the system was STILL down. It wasn't until we were 1/4 of the way home when we got the call to change our card number. All in all the whole experience was overly stressful, and not at all what we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cupcake135
Reviews.Content: This hotel probably was grand once but not so much now. The location is good however. The room was small, the bathroom even smaller. There was no space around the sink for toiletries (one of my pet peeves). The staff overall wasn't the friendliest, except the concierge was great. There was a "Model UN" event going on so there were high school kids everywhere. Including up and down the halls at night. Expect to wait a while for an elevator too, especially if there is a big conference going on. We stayed here only because it was the place the job was paying for. I wouldn't stay here on my own, there are so many nicer hotels in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Worst night's sleep ever!”
Reviews.Author: Netlizard
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel with small rooms. The walls are paper thin and you can hear your neighbors breathing! It was so loud, I was woken up several times throughout the night. I was attending a conference. The food was excellent as was the morning coffee. It got crowded when sessions ended and people needed to get upstairs. The elevators shake when there are more than 5 people! It's renovated and charming, but too old to accommodate modern uses.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good room, mediocre service, tiny bathroom”
Reviews.Author: dublinone
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a great location, the room was good, not the most spacious ever but good. you couldn't swing a cat in the bathroom so if you like luxurious bathrooms this is NOT the hotel for you. The housekeeping service had a tendency to call very early to make up the rooms. The reception staff were less than welcoming when we arrived before the check in time of 3 (only 30mins before). Overall a good but fairly standard hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ralphIreland
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, Great location. Staff very helpful. Rooms very spacious we had 2 bathrooms in the one room. Very clean and warm.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: myraleal
Reviews.Content: The rooms were beautiful. Very nicely kept and the most confortable beds. Nice and spacious it was perfect. After being in a hotel in New York for a week this was a great room to settle in Boston. It was a perect location from all the main attractions. The conierge office was really helpful in giving us some great local restraunts to try out in the city. Truly an enjoyable experience!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfully beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: robdrew
Reviews.Content: What a great experience I had here. I booked the room using "name your own price" on Priceline and after putting in what i though was a lowball offer ($70) i was sure I would end up in either a smoking room or one right near the elevators. On the contrary, my room was in a separate corridor with 2 other suites (room 634 I believe), tucked away from the other rooms on the floor, right on the corner of the hotel, with a great view of St James Ave and Arlington St. The bed was super comfy with clean and luxurious linens. The bathroom was very upscale with a dual head shower, porcelain tub and pedestal sink, marble flooring, and plenty of fresh smelling, clean towels. Of course there was a nice wood desk as well as a tv sitting atop a tv stand/dresser with an unstocked mini bar and fridge below. All this right in the heart of downtown Boston. Looking forward to staying here again. I highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Standout”
Reviews.Author: thesecondcity
Reviews.Content: A grand setting and everything went smoothly on my recent "staycation". I needed a bit of time away (I live about a mile from the hotel), and this really fit the bill. I was able to check in early on Saturday, went down to the fitness center and was pleasantly surprised to find a nice selection of workout machines (ellipticals, treadmills, free weights, etc.) The room was nicely appointed, and there's a good selection of restaurants (Bonfire, McCormick & Schmick's, etc.) located within the hotel....excellent place for a getaway! Max Grinnell www.theurbanologist.com

Reviews.Title: “Stay here - it's lovely”
Reviews.Author: pongosmum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights as part of our 25th Wedding Anniversay holiday. We loved every minute of it. The staff were very friendly, nothing was too much trouble - from minute we got out of the cab to check in, to the doorman loading our cases back into the cab on our way to the airport - they were all great. We wanted to get a train to Salem, the receptionist searched for the timetable, printed it out & drew a map on how to get to the station - couldn't have been more helpful. We'd forgotten the charger for the camcorder so they told us where we could buy one (drew a map for that too). The room was huge...needed to be to accomodate the 14 pillows on the gigantic bed. Room service was great and the food was lovely. All in all, a great time. We loved Boston and are planning to go back in a couple of years - we'll definitely be booking a room here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location -- loud mornings”
Reviews.Author: KTI123
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location and the room was a nice size but this may have been the loudest hotel I have ever been in. At 6am on a Sunday someone was singing opera, at 8 the cleaning service was in the hall clanking around, and the heating was loud. Both Saturday and Sunday the cleaning staff were in the halls talking loudly at the crack of dawn. When I go to a hotel I want to relax and enjoy myself -- not wake up earlier than I do for work because there is so much noise in the hall!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RedSoxGirl84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Plaza Hotel for a night after seeing the Nutcracker. We got there a little early but our guest room was ready. The man at the desk seemed very professional and got us our keys quickly. I stayed in one of their suites and it was very open with a lot of free space. Their shower heads in the bathrooms made it feel like a rain shower, it was a very nice change from a typical hotel shower head. We were in and out of the hotel for most of the stay but there was always transportation available outside. The doorman was very kind and had nice things to say each trip. I forgot a couple things from home and the woman at the concierge desk was very knowledgeable as to where to go. Most of the places were in walking distance which was convenient. At the end of the night we ordered room service and it came so quickly, I was very impressed and the presentation was beautiful. At the end of the stay we were able to take advantage of an "express check-out" which was nice. I hope to come back soon for a longer stay to try out their restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “I am the manager of valet but it's not my job to find your car!”
Reviews.Author: MargaritaFenwayI30
Reviews.Content: So it was bad enough that they put us in a handicapped room that included a shower that was European style over a toliet and didn't have a bath tub, or anything and there was water all over the bathroom within seconds...OK fine...I didn't really care, i just wanted to shower and get to dinner...The location IS fantastic- but lots of hotels in Boston are because Boston isn't that big! WELL it says on the valet ticket for the car to allow 30 minutes - so the next morning I call for my car 30 minutes before I need it. they say its going to be 45. OK fine.. So I go down there and 45 minutes passes- NO CAR. I ask the valet service guy, he says that my car is very next and it will be out in five minutes. Five- 10 fifteen minutes later still no car. i ask the manager who tells me " i have like 50 cars I'm trying to get right now it's not my job to know when yours is coming" (it's now been almost an hour and 15 minutes that I've been waiting in the cold with an appointment to get to) i told him 1. it actually is his job because he is the manager of valet, he rolls his eyes on me and walks away (such great service) i told him i refused to pay for it...he took my name and room number and agreed to take it off the bill the next AM at check out GUESS WHAT WAS STILL ON MY BILL!!! they eventually removed it after I had to seriously argue for a significant time. they are really rude and unprofessional...there are better hotels for sure

Reviews.Title: “Mascara on a Pig?”
Reviews.Author: skipmays
Reviews.Content: This older hotel has undergone some recent freshening but it's still an old hotel. My Expedia discounted room was a tad larger than a closet and needed a thorough cleaning (Coke spills all over the desk and phone from several days before). Linens were first class and partially made up for the other shortcomings. Banquet dinner service for our small conference was plain awful. Food was OK but the table service was comparable to a diner. No, actually a diner might have been better. There are better lodging destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value at the Park Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Allibaba13
Reviews.Content: I searched for a while looking for a reasonably priced hotel with at least 3 starts in a good location in Boston. The Park Plaza fit the bill. We were able to check in early (11 AM) and because I was staying with two other friends, the receptionist gave us a free upgrade to a room with two bathrooms. The room was nicely sized and was clean. The front desk and concierge were friendly and helpful. No complaints. I parked my car at the Motormart garage next door and that worked out great.

Reviews.Title: “Was I staying at the same hotel?”
Reviews.Author: mcnuttle
Reviews.Content: Reading the previous reviews after staying at the Park Plaza, I can only ask, were we at the same hotel?! Stay at this lousy, dated hotel if you get an unbelievable low, discounted rate, otherwise there are so many better places to choose from... Good news: Yes, the location is a positive, accessible to so many attractions and restaurants. And the beds were very comfortable. Bad news: Everything else. We had to switch rooms, as the first one had a radiator that banged and hissed nonstop. (not that you can really control the temp. anyway). Second room, also on the 12th fl (St. James and Arlington St. side) had windows that leaked and blew cold air (on a frigid winter night), almost welcomed when the heat roasted us, but they'll also let you know when the garbage trucks and freight trucks made their deliveries throughout the night. Knowing that the high-end condo building, The Heritage, is right across the street, and from times visiting there, you'd have no idea you were on a busy street, I'd say the Park Plaza needs new insulated windows. What I'm trying to say: we didn't get much sleep. (also walls between rooms are paper thin, you could hear the toilet flush next door) And the baths are ridiculously small. The size of a toilet directly next to a pedestal sink next to the shower. At night and the next morning, the shower was barely luke warm. I could go on... We had a great dinner right across the street at Davio's, but the night at the Park Plaza will by our last. Definitely!

Reviews.Title: “high class on a budget”
Reviews.Author: UndrH2O
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are both in graduate school, while working full time, and decided that after finals we would take a weekend to get away. I bought tickets to the Blue Man Group at the Charles Playhouse, and found a deal to the Park Plaza (nearly next door) for $99 per night. We booked a Saturday night in December. The hotel is VERY regal, full of history, as can be seen in the chandeliers and mouldings, and original tile in the bathroom. The room we booked was, understandably, very small, but completely sufficient. It needs a little updating, but it was more than sufficient for our needs. We didn't utilize the restaurants, shops, or room service, so I can't speak to those aspects of the hotel. Check in was easy, no problem. We found our room with little difficulty. Bed was VERY comfortable, and there was a plethora of pillow choices. Cable was great, nice deep tub in the bathroom, everyone was pretty friendly. The one main downside of this hotel was that the walls were VERY thin. We could hear arguments going on down the hall, and we could hear EVERY word. I've never come upon this problem before, and was a bit confused as to what to do. Eventually it just stopped and everyone, presumably, went back to sleep. Other guests were stomping their feet on the floor and banging on the walls to get them to stop, but they were obviously intoxicated and oblivious. It was 2 AM. We could also hear other guests down the hall having a completely different and seemingly more pleasant interaction. Very clearly. I'm not sure if it was the clientelle was that there that weekend of if the walls are particularly thing, or a combination. I like to go away and be alone, but this aspect made it difficult to feel like you're alone. You were aware of everyone all of the time. It might be different in the upgraded "tower" rooms, but certainly not in the cheap seats. Otherwise, we really love Boston, and love to visit, just not sure we would go to the Park Plaza again. We went for a little of Old Boston on the cheap, which we were able to achieve.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK...”
Reviews.Author: MB6td
Reviews.Content: This property was just OK. My husband and I tend to stay in historic hotels so we are used to some signs of age but certain aspects of this hotel were just completely impractical. For expample, our room still had the his and her bathrooms with all the original fixtures. At first this was cool but once you tried to use it - not so cool. I am a fairly slender person and I could barely fit in the shower! The room was very clean and extremely spacious. The bed was comfortable and had new linens. Our view was of an interior area with astro-turf and four fake geese...boo. The walls are rather thin too. There was a bachelorette party or something going on next door and I felt like I was there with them. The location is nice. Off of a side street so less congestion but still convenient. There are just so many nice districts in Boston though that you really can't go wrong - like the Italian section and down by the Harbor. We absolutely loved Boston and will return but not the Plaza Hotel. If you do stay I would recommend the the luxury rooms with the renovated bathrooms. My sister has stayed in those a number of times and says they are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: jesslca321
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Everything is within walking distance and it's one block from the park. Hotel has restaurants, bars and a nightclub. Rooms are large and we even had 2 bathrooms in our room. For the price you can't beat it, it's a 4 star hotel. Will defintely stay again,

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room”
Reviews.Author: SuNWLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and were very pleasantly surprised by the size of the room, 2 queen beds and 2 separate bathrooms - this maybe due to the fact it was upgraded from a standard room when we checked in. The beds were very comfy, lovely good quality linen, but no mini fridge. Location was very central and walking distance to major sites, nearest T Stop (subway stn) is Arlington. Staff were very nice and friendly and overall stay was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay !”
Reviews.Author: JonathanRowe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the UK for 2 nights before moving on to Cape Cod. I had booked a deluxe room on a flight & hotel package through Expedia. The room was huge (to us) and had 2 double beds and 2 spacious bathrooms. Really, really nice. Very clean and definitely a great start to our holiday. Great location for visiting this very interesting city. Would definitely stay here again if we return to Boston !

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Great Location, A Few Details Missing”
Reviews.Author: kyoto5301
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled for business to Boston, and the meeting was at the Park Plaza. It was a pleasant surprise to be at a hotel right in the center of town. The Park Plaza is perfectly located adjacent to the Boston Common, Newbury Street and Comm Ave at the top of Arlington Street with lots of shopping, restaurants, T (subway) stop, and points of interest nearby. The lobby is nice. The room was quite small, with a small bathroom as might be expected for a "vintage" hotel such as this. Everything was very clean. However, upon check in, the room was extremely cold. Someone came from engineering within 30 minutes and solved the problem by turning up the steam heater in the bathroom, which helped. They had tags to hang on the door to get a newspaper daily, and while they took the tag, the newspaper never appeared during my two night stay. Worst of all, was that I hung a tag out to order a room service breakfast-I also called room service to let them know the night before, and they assured me, that this would guarantee that the room service breakfast would arrive as requested. Unfortunately, that didn't happen, and when I mentioned it, the person said "oh yes, unfortunately that happens" (though they did bring me breakfast, a bit late but I made it to my meeting). In summary, for the price and location, this is a perfectly alright place to stay, as long as you can roll with the punches when it comes to ironing out a few details.

Reviews.Title: “mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: knitter06
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights for a conference. I generally like old hotels, but have very mixed feelings about this one. The room was small, which was OK, and the bed was great. Room was clean. But the bathroom was a challenge- you were smack up against the TP rolls when using the toilet, and the sink faucet did not come out far enough so washing hands, etc. meant some wrist contortions. It got to be quite annoying and uncomfortable! There is no free internet service of any type anywhere in the hotel. Their cafe is small for such a large hotel. I would not like to stay here again if all the rooms are like this.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to sleep, don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: jeff1232
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel many times for business and this was the worst. My room was on the 5th floor over Whisky Park which is an in-hotel bar/nightclub. It's right next to the check-in area. I checked in at 10:30pm and when I got in the room, I could hear and feel it vibrate from the bass from the music in the bar. At 11:15pm I called down and asked when the music would stop. Very soon I was told. At 12:30am I went downstairs and the music was so loud I could hardly talk to the person at the front desk. They said that nothing could be done and the bar closed at 2am. I spoke to someone at the front door of the bar and I think they actually turned the music up. 4 floors above the bar and my room was vibrating and I could hear the bass. The hotel will do nothing. If you want to sleep before 2am, avoid the Park Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Terrible Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorCorrie
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is its best asset! We were able to walk to everything in Boston Common and surrounding hot spots and get cabs for only the real far-away places like Fenway and the harbor. The lobby and hotel amenities are okay and average -surely not of park plaza style and comfort (like we had expected for the $275 a night rate - and that was the hotels.com special rate!). Most of the hotel staff are rude and impatient with tourists. The rooms were by far the most horriable experience we've had in a very long time. There was definately a mold problem. Our air conditioner was of poor quality and not even working. The room was damp, smelly and the bathroom was the size of telephone booth! You had to turn the shower water off to soap up because there was no room to manuever with bathroom products while bathing - very bad! The pictures on the site do not show you the amazingly small/issues of the rooms. Granted it is an old hotel from the 1920s so location was great - but because it was rennovated we expected more from the Park Plaza company. The price was way too steep for the quality. My guess is they are charging this high because of its location. Try the Marriott or Raddison - which is one block from this hotel - same location better price and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it!”
Reviews.Author: Thorsten12
Reviews.Content: Really liked the hotel! Very good location and within walking distance to many interesting sightseeing points! Our room was very spacious and clean....we had two double beds and an extra bed...the beds were absolutely great! There were also two bathrooms not very large but really convenient! The concierge was very helpfull and friendly! We enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: spillersm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the Theater District, right across the street from Boston Commons. The Freedom Trail starts about a five minute walk from the hotel. Also convienant to grab trolley tours, gray lines, Boston Ducks. About a 15 minute walk to Faniual Hall & Quincy Market. I got a room with a king bed, which made the room extremely small. A friend had double beds and their room was larger. My room was so small, you couldn't open the dresser drawers all the way. There was barely enough room to get in between the bed and dresser. In the bathroom, you had to manuver between the toilet paper holder and toilet. It is a small room and bathroom. I am a light sleeper and didn't hear alot of outside noise, although the hotel was busy. Shower heads are excellent. Some of the staff was a little rude. The female consierge (I think her name was Ashley) was very kind and extremely helpful. The male consierge was a little rude and hard to work with. Got lost and tried to get directions from security, and found them hard to work with.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, below average rooms”
Reviews.Author: WestCanTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a conference and it certainly seems well prepared for this kind of visitor. The public spaces and meeting rooms are all of a high standard; staff well able to deal with the volume of guests and all remarkably friendly/helpful. In-hotel restaurants are varied but pricey; a better option is the right next door Au Bon Pain that allows for a quick and inexpensive meal any time of day. I did eat a couple of meals in hotel restaurants and food and service were both very good. The rooms at the hotel are another story, however. Small, ordinary, and--at least where I was--very very noisy. I could hear the phone ring in the next door room as well as any coughing etc. Doors along the hallways in desperate need of oiling instead of the squealing noise that each of them seemed to make. And the heating system was so loud, I turned it off and had a cold room instead. And there was no way to lessen the incessant street noise outside. I seldom have trouble sleeping when I travel, but this was not a good experience. One positive: the shower in the bathroom is really good--two power heads, as others have noted. But the bathroom was tiny--closet sized (and it must said that the closet in the bedroom was less than closet sized--also tiny) and dated. I liked the original tile floor but toilet/basin/faucets needed upgrading. The shower curtain had a number of small, but nasty stains. Both the bedroom and the bathroom desperately deserved a fresh coat of paint--I've seen dorm rooms in better condition. Overall the room seemed out of step with the public areas of the hotel and the hotel's image of itself.

Reviews.Title: “fenway park”
Reviews.Author: dreams4u1961
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Boston and we can't wait to return. My husband's dream was to see NY Yankees play at Fenway Park. The dream became a reality. We stayed at the Boston Park Plaza which we found to be a great central place to stay. It was located within walking distance to a wide assortment of things to see and do. Boston Common Park, Cheers bar!, Gray Line bus depot, Fanueil Market, Fenway Park, Commonwealth area and Copley Place to name a few. Everyone at Park Plaza were friendly and helpful. The room was great with the exception of the small counter space surrounding the bathroom sink. A little over priced at $399.00 a night. and food a bit pricey so we ate elsewhere. We felt safe at any time of the day as we were walking, walking, walking. Details: we booked Wrentham Village Outlets which had great shopping bargains. Yes ladies......5 hrs. of solid shopping! With the location of the hotel we only had to walk 1 1/2 blocks to the bus depot. This depot is also where you can book and catch the trolley tours, duck tour, etc.. Fenway is a brisk 40 min. walk from the hotel. Cheers is located on the other side of the park (couple of blocks from the hotel) which is an approximate 10 min. stroll. This takes you into the Commonwealth residential area which is a great reminder of our Europe vacation. Narrow cobblestone streets with flower boxes and wrought iron railings. Beautiful. The hotel is also adjacent to Newbury and Robson Streets which are popular with pubs, restaurants, shops, etc.. Charley's on Newbury is a must for some great food after a day of sightseeing. Lots of Au Bon Pain eateries for some on the go healthier eating alternatives. Tips on purchasing reasonably priced ball tickets would be appreciated. I ended up purchasing tickets online so we had guaranteed seats for our trip. The price was ridiculously inflated @ 4 tickets for just under $1200.. The price printed on the tickets when I rec'd them was $45.00 each. With the weather not being a guarantee one of the games ended up getting rained out. Great disappointment after paying that steep of a price for tickets. Guess one out of two isn't bad. Could have been worse if both games were rained out. We will return to venture the trolley tour as well as Cape Cod and whatever else our hearts desire. Great City!

Reviews.Title: “Good conference venue”
Reviews.Author: doc_M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference. When I got the conference details and looked at the room rate, I began looking for a different hotel! But the others in the vicinity seemed even more expensive. The Park Plaza has a certain slightly old-world charm: it is an older building, and they play that up a little. It is, however, well-appointed, clean and well-maintained. (The heater/cooler in my room was making a loud noise when I arrived, but they quickly sent a technician to silence it). The fitness room is barely adequate - much better than some hotels, but not satisfactory for anyone who wants to do serious resistance training. In-room internet access is not cheap ($11 basic; $13 for "VPN-capable" service. There's no explanation of what the full extent of the difference is). Breakfast was not included in the rate. The Hotel breakfast is not cheap, but there is a cafe outside, on the same block, which does all kinds of stuff. Similarly, for dining, there are several restaurants and a pub on the same block, and several other restaurants (for various budgets) within a block or so. Provided someone else is paying the bill, or you are reconciled to paying good money for a hotel - as you will need to in this part of Boston - the Park Plaza offers a comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel- good location”
Reviews.Author: trasna80
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a great central location. Staff were friendly and it was clean and well maintained. I found the room and beds to be a bit small by comparison to other hotels and the bar and lobby bar were a bit stuffy and boring for young people. On the whole though a really nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than I expected”
Reviews.Author: SueMae
Reviews.Content: I was unable to stay at my first choice hotel in Boston and was offered this hotel. The hotel was much nicer inside than I expected. Lobby decor was nice, not sparkling new but not shabby at all. The room had been redocrated and the bed was very comfortable, with high quality linens and a great number of pillows. The bathroom had also been redocrated, but the original tile mosaic floor was left, a nice historic touch. This room had the best shower I have ever had in a hotel, with two side by side shower heads, great water pressure and a curved shower curtain rod. Tub was European style, deeper than most. Location is central to The Commons, and about a 15 min walk to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: MallyBeckenham
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We stayed for 1 week. The room was clean, spacious and very comfortable and the hotel clean and nice. The staff were helpful and friendly and gym was good. The location was perfect and very close to transport links. Only negatives: Concierge desk always had a queue and only seemed to have a single person serving. The maids knocked at 08:00 sometimes which wasn't very welcome on holiday!

Reviews.Title: “great location near Boston Common, Theaters and Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: TXglobetrotter_09
Reviews.Content: Pros: Wonderful downtown location. Near Boston Common, Theaters and Chinatown. 2 blocks from two different T stops (train). Near the start of the Freedom Trail and several landmarks. New carpet. Coffee maker in room. Cons: Old, small rooms. Tiny bathrooms. No breakfast included, but standard at the high end hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms questionable”
Reviews.Author: BunkoRT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during a conference last week and it was alright. The concierge was very informative and the front staff very polite. The room cleaning was questionable though as they did not remove empty water bottles the whole time we stayed. They also only dumped the garbage, they did not replace the lining. I think that towels were just refolded and replaced instead of giving new towels. The showers were actually very small although there was excellent pressure from the showerhead. We didn't dine at the hotel, although we heard firsthand that there was one restaurant that was very slow in service (main course took 2 hours). The location of this hotel was good, the subway station was not too far away. If I had to go to Boston again, I may look elsewhere to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay someplace else!”
Reviews.Author: heelsfan603
Reviews.Content: I travel for work and pleasure non-stop and this is the worst hotel that I have stayed at in a very long time. Check in went smoothly, but when I got to my room it was very old and the door in great need of a paint job. I ordered room service dinner, which came and was wrong. Upon reordering dinner it took another hour to have it sent up - and 3 phone calls. While the supervisor removed the room charge, I was starving and not happy. There are no hair dryers - what hotel doesn't have hair dryers in this day and age - the bathroom is tiny and street noise went on all night long. For the money, stay someplace else! This hotel is an embarrassment to the Starwood chain.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Tykerb
Reviews.Content: This hotel, located in the Back Bay area of Boston, is perfect for tourists in Boston. Prices are very reasonable, and you get quite a lot for your money. We stayed here mid-week. It was not too crowded, staff were pleasant and helpful. We were staying in a King room, which I would recommend, as it is very spacious; the Queen rooms looked far more compact. The decor is a small bit dated, but very well maintained. This is not the place to stay if you're looking for a mad party, or to meet people.

Reviews.Title: “This was probably one of the most beautiful hotels that I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: California-Cindy
Reviews.Content: This was probably one of the most beautiful hotels that I have ever stayed at. We ended up here by accident, attending a conference in Boston held at a nearby hotel that got sold out. What a nice surprise. The Boston Park Plaza was old-world elegant. The entrance was gorgeous. We had an room on the 10th floor on the corner of the building. The room was a bit small, but had a wonderful over-stuffed bed with lots of pillows. The bathroom was marble. Everything was spotless and very inviting. It was noisy though because of the street below. We ate at two of their restaurants. McCormic's-was a very nicely decorated Seafood establishment. The service was great. Seafood was tasty, but the Seafood Salad only average. There was also a high end desert bar, that we enjoyed. We snuck a peak into the grand ball room and could not believe how beautiful the room was. Would be perfect for a wedding. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Primus33
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel and great location. I can recomend this hotel, the location is great for all tourist attractions and the airport. Very friendly staff and worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: rokeedy
Reviews.Content: Found a good deal on Expedia so I decided to try this hotel on my trip to Boston. Elegant hotel, friendly staff, clean and cozy room. Bathroom is a little old, but everything else was nice! When we first arrived and got into our room, it was a smoking room and we had requested non-smoking. They quickly and happily made a room change for us. Great location, walking distance to Boston Common, Newbury Street, Faneuil Hall.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Park Plaza!”
Reviews.Author: Barcelonamom
Reviews.Content: We loved the Park Plaza. We got a great rate from Travel Zoo, $159 a night. Our room was beautiful, two full size beds, lots of pillows and two bathrooms, one on each side of the room. That was a pleasant surprise upon check in. The area was very nice, alot of restaurants nearby. The lobby was grand and everyone at the hotel was very helpful. We had forgot to pack toothpaste. So I went to the lobby to ask where I could buy some, along with a place nearby to pick up coffee. They asked my name and within a few minutes my husband said they sent someone up with toothpaste. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooom, good location, luke warm reception...”
Reviews.Author: Adrian9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Plaza for the first three nights of our honeymoon from 25 to 28 Aug before travelling on to New York. We stayed in a 'Deluxe Room - 1 King'. Our room was on the fifth floor I think and was definitely not small. It looked like it used to be two rooms that had been knocked together but the result was excellent. One of the biggest hotel rooms I've stayed in actually. The room and bathroom were clean and well kept. The cleaning staff kept the place really well. The only downside was our reception on arrival, but I can put that down to one dodgy member of staff because the others were quite nice. Only other things to mention is that some reviewers found this hotel noisy, but we didn't at all. Not a peep from another room. Also the location is great, the subway is a block away and gets you to the airport in 20min, you can walk to downtown in half an hour, and there's a good pub and restaurant downstairs. All in all highly reccommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Crystalclare
Reviews.Content: Wonderful base for most tourist attractions. We tried some of the hotel restaurants and found the food excellent as was some of the restaurants nearby. Hotel lobby looked very upmarket. Room was clean and tidy, very average but bathroom was extremely small, no room to put anything. Room had no view, just overlooked air conditioning fans which were quite noisy at night. Concierge desk very helpful and all staff we encountered were courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellers123
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in main part of Boston. Right in Backbay District of the city. Walking distance to the Boston Common and other areas downtown. T train station is a walking distance away about 1 block. Hotel was close to many good places to eat and drink. O'Conners Pub on same block and a Ben and Jerry's ice cream shop. As well a fine dining and whiskey bar in same area as well. Hotel had an amazing looking lobby, very glamourous and enchanting. A grand piano right at the end of the lobby in the fine dining restaurant. Well reliable door men, always prompt at opening the door when entering or exiting hotel. Always called taxis on command and never complained about getting no tips either. Rooms were a bit small but clean. Housekeeping staff did great job and worked very fast to get rooms clean and neat for my next night. Always had hot water and clean towels. Overall I would stay here again and I highly recommend this hotel. Would tell others to go here as well.

Reviews.Title: “definitely an old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Heather053
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and well-decorated and the bed was comfortable. That's where my positive experience ends, though. To begin, in three days, I never once experienced a truly warm shower: after ten minutes of running the water, it began to approach lukewarm at best; the staff's explanation was a sheep-faced, "uh, sorry, our boilers are old". To make matters worse, there must be no insulation in the walls; I'm not a particularly light sleeper, yet I heard (and couldn't sleep through) every bathroom activity of neighboring (above and adjoining) rooms; it sounded as if the water other guests were running was running in my room. And I've never encountered a toilet with such a loud flush before! Finally and inexplicably, the TV was about twenty feet away from the bed and at a right angle to it so that there was no way to comfortably watch TV in bed, as I like to do when I'm traveling on business. All in all, it certainly seemed to me that this is a hotel coasting on its historic status and location; I recommend avoiding it, particularly when taking into account the price (not cheap).

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service .........Never again”
Reviews.Author: Tim068
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Staff were rather blunt and abrupt. We had to look for someone to assist us in getting our gear to our room. The bathrooms really weren't great and the room was so very small. Tha gas / air con unit in the room was really noisey and I should have asked for a move but we could not be asked. There were spurts of noise which was quite frightening throughout the night (no I am not precious). The beds were nice and there was a bit of a view but other than that and the location, I would not return to this hotel again. The staff really put me off. Oh and at afternoon tea we had to wait some considerable time for service. On, exit they gave us this huge telephone bill and when I questioned it, they simply said it was the supplier's rates and not theirs, I don't believe it. I had used the phone for 3 minutes ... I foolishly forgot to take my change from the traveller's cheque I had paid and no mention was made by the assistant either as we gathered our bags. I refused to tip the doorman as he had simply opened the doors for us and the service had been so bad, he shouted at us in the street to top things off. We had tipped graciously throughout our trip but I refuse to tip when the service has been poor. I agree with all of the negative feedback on this hotel and a local even referred to it as "not very good". Addie London

Reviews.Title: “Great location, so-so property”
Reviews.Author: vacationer71
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the Park Plaza as part of a package. It's a mastadon of a city hotel -- a pile of fairly small and outdated rooms on top of a pile of restaurants and retail occupying a full city block Imagine a mid-point between the two New York paragons of this style: the luxury Waldorf-Astoria and the package-tourist-and-overnighting-stewardess Hotel Pennsylvania. As such, it does a decent job, but you wouldn't want to spend much time in the rooms or the very busy lobby. We didn't dine at the hotel or use any of its services besides parking, but we did use the gym and want to note that it has the best hotel gym we've seen in years -- the full equivalent in range of equipment to a typical private gym, in a spacious purpose-built space, the kind of thing one tends to expect only in top-tier resort hotel or in a hotel which hosts a regular private gym and has it double-duty for guest accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Got a great deal for a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer33
Reviews.Content: When I found an online price for the well-known Boston Park Plaza Hotel for $149/night, I thought there must be a mistake. Or they were doing construction next door. But I never found any problems and got a wonderful rate for a fine hotel at a great location near the Boston Garden near the Arlington St. subway stop. In fact, we were upgraded for free to the Towers floor and got a huge room, access to a lounge with free breakfast and evening appetizers and to wireless internet. This was a great place to stay for a mixed business/pleasure trip to Boston. I'd have been happy even if I had to pay more for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, staff, management â€“ Overall not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: eah565
Reviews.Content: You would think for a hotel of this stature and reputation it would not treat guests like dirt. After holding a company event at the hotel facility for five days I have come to realize that the Park Plaza should not be put on as high a pedestal as one thinks. Management and staff was rude and un-helpful and when something went wrong an apology was never given. When guests complained about having no AC, green water, leaks and more in their hotel rooms nothing was done. The only thing this hotel has going for it is its location and historic value, other than that I would highly recommended to NEVER stay at this hotel. You could probably receive better service at the Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: BI-Travelers
Reviews.Content: My family of four, including two teenage boys stayed at the Boston Park Plaza for 5 nights and really enjoyed our stay. The location is excellent, the rooms, although fairly small, were certainly big enough for the four of us and were well maintained and very nicely decorated. We received very good service and would definitely stay there again if we return to Boston. Everyone, including the desk clerk, concierge, door man, and housekeeping staff were friendly as well as helpful. I have no complaints and would highly recommend the Boston Park Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: michalmm
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on hotwire. This is a beautiful hotel. The bed was very comfortable. The location was great for walking around and seeing the city, The bathroom is small, but has everything you need. Overall, we were incredibly satisfied with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Park Plaza & Towers”
Reviews.Author: bundyboyEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in a tower room. Large and very comfortable bed, ideal for seeping off all the walking in this beautiful city. Nice big room with everything you need, Complimentary breakfast and evening snacks in the tower level lounge were excellent. Hotel itself is great, excellent service and big choice of on site restaurants. The Bonfire for special meal, McCormick and Schmicks for great seafood or bargain dinner between 9 and 11. Walking distance to everything Boston has to offer, and there is a lot! Would certainly recommend the tower rooms, don't know about the standard ones, but Great location and facilities should be enough

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, rude managers”
Reviews.Author: HappyJourneys
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Park Plaza previously and thought it was a good location and a good experience overall especially given the deal we got on the rooms (under $100). This time, a year later, we paid full price and received TERRIBLE service. The managers we spoke with were expressly rude and unhelpful. Rooms are small and smelly. TV was not working. Walls are THIN -- you can hear every word next door. Don't stay here during a busy travel time. If it is not a peak period, you can hope to get upgraded to better conditions. The only good this is the location in terms of being in downtown Boston, near the T and restaurants, etc. And the beds are admittedly comfortable. But it's really not worth the price that they are charging. Internet is an extra charge, even in the lobby. The hotel desperately needs new management!! We never got an apology or a kind word. I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with Poor Billing Practices”
Reviews.Author: uvaqtpi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our 8 night stay in Boston at the Park Plaza Hotel. We booked our flight and hotel in early March and prepaid the trip. Our initial impression of the hotel was amazing. When we checked in, the hotel offered a complimentary upgrade to a "towers level" room, which provided a complimentary continental breakfast, evening hors d'oeuvres, complimentary local and long distance phone calls, complimentary bottles of water in the room, bathrobe and slippers, upgraded marble bathroom, and nightly turndown service. Of course we opted for the upgrade and after taking the dedicated elevator that ran only from the lobby to the 15th floor towers level, found the room to well exceed our expectations. The room was small, after all it is an old hotel, and the bathroom was fantastic. The window opened, albeit a total of about 3 inches, but enough to let a cool Boston breeze enter the room. The towers level lounge was nice and the complimentary breakfast and hors d'oeuvres were tasty (although the same breakfast was served every day). Our only problems with the hotel involve several "clerical errors" that resulted in large pending charges to our credit card. We checked in on a Saturday and Monday we discovered a $1500 hold on our card. My husband went to the front desk and explained the situation and was told that there had been a clerical error and our room charges (which had been prepaid in March) were charged to our card instead of to hotels.com. The staff promptly cleared the hold and instead placed a $400 hold for any incidental charges ($50 a night for the 8 nights we were staying). We had no other problems until we were returning home the following Sunday and discovered a $757 hold on our card. This was after checking out and being told that we had no charges. My husband called the hotel and they explained that there was another "clerical error" and that the charge would not be processed. Today is Tuesday and the charge is still pending but has not cleared. I will watch it closely. While we were pleased with the hotel accommodations, we have been very displeased with the "clerical errors" affecting our credit card. I definitely would expect more from a 3.5 star hotel. Perhaps they were just hoping to make an extra buck - who knows. I would stay there again, but would definitely be careful what card I give them upon check in.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms and bathrooms are small”
Reviews.Author: anitajd
Reviews.Content: I attended a convention at the Boston Park Plaza, and stayed there for 3 nights. I am originally from Boston, and I was very excited to stay there. As another reviewer wrote, I was excited because the lobby is so grand and beautiful. But I was greatly dissappointed by the size of my room and bathroom. There were no "extra" amenities, ie. breakfast incl. in price, wireless (or even free) internet access, robes., minibar, etc. I can't even remember if shampoo was supplied. Luckily I got a "good rate" on the room for being in downtown Boston. On the more positive side, the hotel staff was very friendly and efficient, especially the wait-staff during our convention luncheons and banquet. And the location can't be beat. Close to *everything*.

Reviews.Title: “OK for Budget Travelers”
Reviews.Author: saracalvin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Plaza for a conference. The hotel is an older property, but the facilities are well-maintained. The lobby area was very nice and reception was always helpful. The room (612) was of average size with a queen bed and work desk. Overall, the room was very clean even though the rooms are "older." Unfortunately, the room smelled very musty on checking in. When I turned on the A/C, it smelled like it was burning. Maintainence came right away to make some adjustments, but the "burn" smell never went away. Also, the A/C is older and can't seem to "keep up" if you want the room very cold. The bathroom is on the small side, but clean (especially the shower). Given that I'm paying $180 per night (which I hear is a steal in Boston), I think this hotel is adequate. It certainly has personality, but the musty smell might turn some travelers off.

Reviews.Title: “Really good stay at the Park Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Sarahms
Reviews.Content: We had a deluxe king size corner room with 2 windows and a small view on the 12th floor. The room was a great size with a sofa, desk, walk in wardrobe and huge chest of drawers with a large tv. Strange thing to mention but the bedside cabinets were a good size as well which made it easy to put books,clocks etc onto. Very quiet couldn't hear a thing from adjoining rooms. The bathroom was small but very clean and plenty of towels and a great shower. Normal size hairdryer as well instead of those silly on the wall pull out ones - important detail for us girls with lots of hair to dry!! One of the most comfortable beds I have slept on with loads of different types of pillow so you just chose the type you liked. All kept very clean and tidy. Location of hotel is ideal with good restaurants on the doorstep and easy to get around the city. Literally the only thing I could complain about was that the concierge wasn't that helpful when my husband had a minor but irritating eye infection which to be able to get anything for he had to get a prescription from a doctor - the concierge told us there was no choice but to go to a hospital and be referred to a medical centre which would have meant a long wait into precious holiday time. We went to the local CVS who sent us to a walk in clinic next door and it was sorted in 2 hours in total. Small point but I did think the concierge perhaps should have known about that for guests who have minor problems. Other than that - great stay and would definitely stay at the Park Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel in Great Back Bay District”
Reviews.Author: G0neTravellin
Reviews.Content: We read some negative reviews and were a little skeptical about the hotel, however we were very pleased with the hotel and thought it to be one of the best values. It is located in the prime Back Bay area, two blocks from The Boston Commons and Garden, two blocks from Newbury Street (Boston's Rodeo Drive), several blocks from the Esplanade on the Charles River, Prudential Center, Copley Place. We walked everywhere from the hotel; i.e. the Freedom Trail, Faneuil Marketplace, Beacon Hill, the Wharf. It's also in a quieter location. The hotel is an older, classic hotel, but very well kept up and recently remodelled. The rooms are small, but well appointed and clean. Some rooms are more updated than others. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel has a nice fitness center, breakfast buffet (though a little pricey $20) and a McCormick & Schmick's Seafood Restaurant that features a half-price Happy Hour. We ate there three times during the week. They even changed the menu during the week. In the evenings, there is live piano music that you can enjoy in the lobby or the cafe. Overall, we were very satisfied with the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste Your Money...Terrible Service, Unfriendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: PedrosDaddy41
Reviews.Content: Staff is rude and incompetent. Upon arrival key didn't work to get into room, 30 minutes to get someone to even meet us in the hall, the employee, couldn't get us in the room. He recommended telling the front desk to move our room. Moved to another room, with new key, which worked for one use. Key didn't work again in new room. Front desk sent another employee to get us into our room...never asked for ID either. TV in room was fuzzy. Made a complaint, found out from their engineering staff that the room wasn't equipped with cable tv. Phone in room didn't work. Concierge was supposed to make dinner reservations, never made them. Upon check out front desk charged $10 more per night than what was quoted. All in all service was horrible, rude staff. The only competent employees were the valet staff, who retrieved our car in 10 minutes, just like they said. Wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: norseman747
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel,in a central position Room was clean and beds very comfortable. Bathroom small but adequate and newly done up. All it needs is a cheap breakfast room on site

Reviews.Title: “It Should Be Put Out of Our Misery”
Reviews.Author: roadie53
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? The place is OLD and somewhat, but not much updated. The rooms are small and the Towers level is a joke. The lounge doesn't seat 1/2 of the people who are on the level. The first room I had was adequate in size, but the internet and phone did not work. When I reported they said they knew it was bad, but booked the room anyhow. They changed my room to one with a view of an airshaft and the size of a shoebox, I guess in retaliation for complaining. In addition, I sent laundry out, it came back, shirts requested folded, on hangers. All in all, they need to just give it up. The service is awful. Easy to understand why Starwood deflagged the place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: aicirtapc5
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we were looking for. It's right in the middle of everything in Boston. Directly across the street from the Boston Commons and close to a subway stop. We booked this hotel at a very good rate through Expedia. We expected to pay over $350 a night since we stayed over the holiday weekend but found prices around $200. We stayed in a deluxe king room and it had more than enough room. Everything was very clean and the staff were very friendly. They gave us great tips and directions on anything we needed. Make sure to put your "do not disturb" sign on the door when you are sleeping because the maids do knock quite early. I would definitley suggest staying at the Boston Park Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: aztraveler0
Reviews.Content: We booked the Park Plaza for 3 nights over the 4th of July holiday. We chose the hotel because my wife had stayed there for business a year ago and knew it would be convenient for all of the sites we wanted to see in downtown Boston. It is close to Boston Common and has close subway access and is within walking distance (a few miles) of all the major attractions and historic sites. We booked a King Deluxe room which was a very large room - much bigger than the standard room my wife had stayed in previously and a very generous size for a downtown hotel. The room was very comfortable with new pillow top bedding and white linen bed covers, a desk and two armless chairs (I would have preferred a lounge chair as there was room) and a flat screen TV on top of a 6 drawer dresser. I believe this room had once been two smaller rooms as there were 2 bathrooms - one with a tub shower and one with a stall shower. However typical of downtown hotels both bathrooms were quite small with limited shelf space so having two made the small size workable. The shower bathroom lacked a niche for soap/shampoo and the toilets in both bathrooms were packed in pretty tight quarters. The room was very clean and the hotel staff kept it that way throughout our stay with thorough and efficient service. We had a drink in the hotel bar and the prices were reasonable and the cocktails well made. Overall we found the hotel to be very convenient and a good value. We highly recommend it for people traveling to Boston to see the sites.

Reviews.Title: “PFFF, what a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: mchayegan
Reviews.Content: In all honesty, don't waste your money on this hotel. Its over rated, over priced and definitely does not stand up to the Starwood name and I'll tell you why. The AC was broken in our room and when we called the front desk to see if it could be fixed, the receptionist was rude to us telling us we had to deal with it until the AC man could come, but he wasn't to be coming for another 5 days! Obviously they couldn't put us in another room. This is the first hotel where I have been to show my ID to get a new room key, they don't even do that in 5 star hotels, who on earth do they think they are? And it took the receptionist 5 minutes to find our reservation. Don't stay here! Seriously, I recommend going for a cheaper and better 2 Star hotel or another 3 Star hotel because this one is not worth your money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a very good location!”
Reviews.Author: EvieDMn
Reviews.Content: We booked a last minute trip to Boston to see the 4th of July celebration with the Boston Pops. We really enjoyed this trip and the hotel! It was convenient to so many things - walking distance to the public garden and many other attractions. We walked to the banks of the Charles River within about 15 minutes. The service was EXCELLENT! Everyone we encountered was helpful - from our check-in to check-out. We were upgraded to a room with a King-size bed without even having to ask. Even when there were countless people streaming back into the hotel after the 4th of July fireworks (just before midnight), there were staff members there directing some of us to the staff elevators to help us get back to our rooms quickly. The lobby is very beautiful and welcoming. The lobby bar was a nice and comfy place to relax and have a drink and snack. There are also two very good restaurants in the hotel - McCormick & Schmicks as well as Todd English's Bonfire. The beds were very comfortable. The room was quite small, but it wasn't unbearably so. The bathroom did leave a bit to be desired with no counter space - just a ledge above the sink that was quite narrow. The tub/shower was recently re-done and it was nice. We hope to be able to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Content: I paid a fraction of the standard room price by booking through Priceline. Boston Park Plaza is the only hotel 3* that they have in the Boston Common area, so there was no risk of getting something that I didn't want when bidding through the website. I was a little concerned when reading other Trip Advisor reviews that mentioned budget rooms, that were of a lower standard but thankfully I have no complaints. The hotel has been refurbished and the three rooms that we booked were all of a very good standard. The hotel was better than some 4* hotels that I have stayed in but I assume the lack of bathrobes and sily things like that are the elements that keep it at a 3*. The bed and pillows were the best that I have ever slept on and provided the best nights sleep I have ever managed on a jetlagged first night in the U.S. and for that alone, I would return. There is nearby garage parking on the same block as the hotel and cheaper than using the valet parking and about 6 options in terms of food and drink, including a Starbucks in the hotel. We had dinner in the Bonfire Steakhouse restaurant that adjoins the hotel. Food and atmosphere was good. $ rate meant that it was pretty reasonable for UK visitors. Even better.... it was within crawling distance to our rooms. Staff were friendly and attentive. Overall a great hotel and I would recommend it to anyone and would stay again when returning to Boston

Reviews.Title: “Not sure why the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: jd5066
Reviews.Content: Our room was very large with two double beds. The room looked like it had been renovated within the last year or so. The beds were comfy. The hotel has a great location. A few negatives (but certainly not worthy of a bad review). The bathroom was small, dated, and in need of a refurbishment. The AC made alot of noise. The hotel lobby could use more chairs. There is a "lounge" for hotel guests that has some couches. Our problem was that guests must use their room key to access the lounge. So, after we had checked out, we were unable to use the lounge while waiting for our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ScottTP
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 days at the Park Plaza. You couldn't ask for a better location. 5 minute walk from Boston Common and 10 minute walk from the T. Great for sightseeing. Rooms were not large but adequate. Bedding was very comfortable with a nice duvet and lots of pillows. A/C worked great. The bathroom was a little small but that is to be expected in a a 90 year old historic hotel. Housekeeping was well done and concierge was very helpful. Overall a great stay. i would recommend it to anyone and will stay there again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Confirmed reservation not honoured ruined our last day, May 2008”
Reviews.Author: Harry08
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked for the night of 15 May 2008 being our last night in Boston prior to our return to the UK. On presenting the confirmed reservation voucher provided by our travel agents, we were advised that no booking had been made, but they had recorded a booking for the previous day. No rooms were available as there was a convention in Boston that evening. After much deliberation we were found accommodation at another hotel but about 12 miles outside the City! There were inaccuracies in what we were told about the alledged earlier reservation. We subsequently learned that we had probably been 'bounced' and, i presume, the room let at a higher rate in view of the great demand that evening. The experience ruined our last 24 hours in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: colfrica
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got an amazing deal for a 1 night stay, so decided to go for the night. The hotel is in a great location and the lobby is very elegant. We did battle to find the check in desk as it is on the opposite side to the parking. Also, there is valet parking only-for a $30 a night fee!! The room was a bit small and the heating system was quite noisy. However it was very clean and presentable. We loved the location of the hotel. The in-house restaurant is very expensive, however, a few blocks away is Cheers, and of course many other restaurants in the are.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, but thatâ€™s about all to recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Sunnybird
Reviews.Content: First, to distinguish, when I checked in I asked if I could get Starwood points for my stay. The hotel said that only half was a Starwood property - so as you are reading reviews, check if the review distinguishes between the â€œTowersâ€� (Starwood side - more expensive, and probably nicer), and the rest of the hotel. To be clear, the review below is for the non-Towers side. I stayed in a Single King Size room, approx. 300 sq. ft. based on the Expedia description. The review for this size room/hotel is as follows: Location: the hotel location is great - itâ€™s right near the Public Gardens, Copley Square, Newbury Street, easily walkable to the Freedom Trail and Beacon Hill. A CVS is within walking distance up Boylston Street in case you fly and donâ€™t want to pack toiletries. I took Amtrak. The hotel is within easy walking distance from the Back Bay Station. Additionally, plenty of eateries nearby - chain, non-chain, fast food, etc. Lots of people out and activity in the area, so safe to walk around. Service: adequate. Staff ok, not overly friendly. Received wake-up call at the wrong time. Room: bed - comfortable. Space: fine - not overly large, but served its purpose. The rest of the room: thoroughly lacking - nail polish splatter on night stand, paint chips on the walls (one rather large chip), lampshade peeling, TV remote did not work, bobby pin, and other stuff on the floor. Bathroom: old but fine. Bottom line: I booked this room through Expedia and got a good rate for the room - I had called another hotel (4 Star) and their â€œpetiteâ€� economy room was 155 sq. ft and $10 - $20 more for the days that I stayed in Boston. Other Back Bay hotels were much more expensive. Despite the favorable location, I would think very hard about staying here again - it would probably depend on area hotel rates. Out of curiosity, I did a search on Boston hotel rates in June, and the room I stayed in was showing up almost $100 more. At the $159 rate I paid, I was still disappointed (although, I realize everything else in the area was much more expensive). However, once you hit $200+, given the condition of the room, I think that would be too much, and I would go across the river and stay in Cambridge where hotels seemed less expensive. From Cambridge, you could easily take the T line into Boston, or several of the Trolley Tour companies pass through Cambridge.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great.”
Reviews.Author: shawbee99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel one night in the summer. The rooms are dated and noisy. I think they had one of those bath-fitters bathrooms put in. No view, no charm; just really a in need of renovation. The location is pretty good near many eateries and bars. Spend your time out in the city, not in the room of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mellij
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Boston Park Plaza for 4 nights while in town for a conference, The hotel was beautiful, the room was nice, immaculate, the beds were very comfortable! The bathroom was kind of small and our water heat didn't work properly at first, but any negative was very minor, and in the grand scheme of things didn't make a difference. I would definitely reccomend this hotel to others! The central location was within walking distance of pretty much anything!

Reviews.Title: “Park Plaza: on the whole I was satisfied”
Reviews.Author: SueRyan
Reviews.Content: I happened to be visiting Boston, unwittingly over Harvard and MIT graduation weekend. I tried to get a hotel for weeks but there was not a room in the city until I tried Priceline for the umpteenth time and got a room at the Park Plaza for $200. As it happened, it couldn't have been a better choice. The hotel is located right in the middle of the heart of Back Bay, close to all the shops and restaurants. The lobby is stunning, in an old European kind of way, and was full of gorgeous flowers. The bell captain, concierge and front desk could not have been more helpful, I was impressed at their professionalism in the midst of all the chaos of a full hotel. The elevators, lobby and corridors are lovely. My room was very nice, too. My bed was wonderful, with loads of fluffy pillows and a duvet and really crisp sheets. The view was nice from the 14th floor. It seemed as though the room had recently been upgraded because the decor was beautiful. The bathroom was marble with stainless fixtures, plenty of hot water, a little cramped but the fluffy towels and the depth of the bath made up for that. Everything was super spotless. I was extremely happy. My only problem was that there is no wifi. The ethernet cable stretched about 18" and the plug would not stay in my computer. I didn't ask for another one because I was in and out doing stuff and could manage but that could be a problem for a business traveler. One very nice thing happened, I had put a doorhanger on my door to say I did want USA Today. But there was no USA Today. I asked the staff for one, and a nice gentleman arrived within two minutes with a copy for me. I thought that was impressive because these days you don't usually get service like that. I was very happy with the hotel. No complaints from me.

Reviews.Title: “great location....nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheri18
Reviews.Content: Decided last minute to stay in town after getting tickets to the Celtics game.. I must say this wasnt our first choice, most hotels were full, but I am so glad that we stayed here. first off, couldnt beat the price..the location was perfect, near Newbury St. ect.. After reading some of the reivews I was a little leary, but for $200. a nte last minute we decided to book.. Yes this is an older hotel, which we knew going in, I think some people just expect too much. the room on the 15th floor was very nice, yes the bath was small, but so what it was very clean which is the most important thing. nice vview, great bedding..we got to hotel at around 12:30 in the afternoon, front desk was very nice, got right into room....had a drink in bar then took cab to the Garden...less than $10.00...cant beat that.. after game (which was incrediable by the way), back to hotel, went to the Conceirge who got us last minute dinner reservations at Mcormicks and Schmidts...very nice.. the hotel is very beautiful, staff very nice, and th best location, and great price, not sure what all the complaints are all about. If you realize from the get go that this is an older hotel with great character flaws you will love it..I would definatley go back again...perfect for couples and families....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: GMill
Reviews.Content: Reading all of the reviews prior to going to Boston, I feared our stay at the Park Plaza. However, once I got there, I was VERY pleased. We arrived late and by the time we went to check in, the type of room we booked was not available. The clerk at the front desk was VERY FRIENDLY and, without us even asking, agreed to upgrade us to a room with a king bed and a great view of the city. The room was very neat and clean. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was on the small side, but the shower worked well and the towels were clean (unlike some of the other reviews indicated). I think it was well worth the price and glad we stayed there. It is also in a great location---close to a lot of sites in Boston and very close to the T station. The hotel has a classy feel (beautiful lobby) with friendly employees. Other reviews also indicated it is loud, but isn't that what you would expect from a hotel in the middle of the city?!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: juliebCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Old, but beautiful and comfortable hotel. I had a gorgeous view from my room and the service was great. The room was spotless. The McCormick and Schmick seafood restaurant is outstanding and can be accessed from inside the property. I would definately go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Reasonable Price,”
Reviews.Author: DCtravelin'girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Thanksgiving as a treat for my mother who grew up in Boston. Bought a air/hotel package from Expedia. We were going to move out to Newton for two nights but extended our stay at this hotel because we liked it. They also extended the same rate to us. We all know Boston very well and we would stay here again for several reasons: REASONABLE PRICE, GREAT LOCATION -- one block from the park, and right next to the best shopping and historic sites. Great not to have to get in a car. Fantastic fun to jog/walk around the park in early am. Had a rental car and it was easy to get on and off expressway to get out of Boston -- easier than staying in Newton or Weston. Yes, it is an older hotel but our rooms were comfortable, nice bed, and we had two small bathrooms in our double room. Hotel prices in Boston can be sky high. So if your company is paying, maybe you stay some place grander. If you are paying, this is a good bet. We had a lot of fun, and found the staff helpful. There might be more issues at a time of year when there were lots of college students or tourist groups running around, but Thanksgiving was full of families but still relatively low key.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alias605
Reviews.Content: The Park Plaza is a beautiful hotel - we were in town for a conference for five days. Conference rooms were spacious and well groomed. Tech staff was outstanding, bell staff was great. That's the good - I tried for over a month to add a day to my reservation, finally the day before I traveled I was told I could get a room but it was on the Concierge Level and $400 a night - I had few choices so went forward. The room was tiny, hardly worth double what I paid for the regular room I had the remainder of my stay. In addition, the hotel appeared to have a number of empty rooms as many of my colleagues changed rooms at least once that day. I moved to my regular room on Day 2 - it was huge - much nicer than the $400 room. It had 2 bathrooms which was strange but great! The concierge staff wasn't helpful - regularly gave wrong or incorrect information to me or my friends. We asked the concierge for an Italian Restaurant that was casual, served stuff like brick oven pizza. They provided us a reservation which was nice was for a fancy Italian Restaurant - exactly what we didn't want. The service at the hotel cafe was wretchedly awful - we were ignored by the wait staff for nearly 30 minutes. We finally simply had the salad bar - never got a beverage, simply awful. When we asked one of the "waiters" a question he grunted and walked away.
