There was a scary fire alarm in the middle of the night which was worse than a "Chinese Fire Alarm" Very poorly run by the hotel staff who were heard saying, "This happens about once a month or so." For the $200 plus spent each night - spending an additional $11 on the internet makes me crazy! The maids knocked on the door each morning before 9am - I would have put a do not disturb sign out but didn't have one in the room. Temperature controls in the room were nice to have but they didn't work - Skip this hotel - not worth the $$$$$

Reviews.Title: “rude, and inept”
Reviews.Author: billlb
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, and amenities. BUT! Booked 2 months in advance. When we got there with that LONG TIME RESERVATION. They said the 1st night was o.k.(3 days). But the next two were NOT?! They would TRY to help, but could NOT guarantee! Room was $100 than quoted, only when getting a mgr. involved the NEXT a.m., no one at the p.m. could make a decision,was a adjustment made. Left next day. Boston is nice ,and picturesque but a NIGHTMARE to navigate. Stayed at the new(7 mos. old) Renissance and was great. $120 per cheaper. Nicer amenities, incl.37" lcd/h.d. t.v. great new health facility, and outstanding customer service. Would HIGHLY recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: JakeyAustin_TX
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Plaza for a conference. Based on the hotel's website, where it says that presidents and world leaders stay there, I expected it to be luxurious and highly service oriented. Instead, it was a worn old hotel with a low commitment to customer service. Here were some problems with my room. --occasional sewagey smell in bathroom --broken heater (heater would not turn on, then after it was "fixed" would not turn off) --old TV with remote that did not work --shower with water pressure that increased and decreased at random --shower that got hotter and colder at random --tiny bathroom with bad design - it was hard to wash my face without bumping my head on the shelf that stuck out above the sink --broken hair dryer --scratchy towels --hairs on bed when I arrived --filthy mirror --NO free WI-FI (they have free WI-FI even at the Holiday Inn) and the business center was not free either. It required a $10 payment to go online for 30 minutes. --very long wait times when I called to get some of these problems addressed In addition, the hotel could have been very charming if it had been properly restored or renovated. But instead there was 80-year-old tile in the bathrooms and it looked just a little dilapidated in general. I stayed a Doubletree in February which was cheaper and WAY nicer. The neighborhood was wonderful though.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Rach_8
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were very helpful. We did have to change rooms as the heating would not work. The heating was not great in the second room although it was bearable. The hotel was very noisy with outside noise and noise from joining rooms. The walls were very thin and you could hear the tv and also talking. The hotel was in an excellent location for exploring Boston and was very close to a lot of bars and restaurants. We got a bus from the airport to the subway and then caught he subway to the hotel, it was really easy and very cheap, i would definately recommend this. if we visited Boston again we would stay at this hotel as it was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: frieda-f
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and the second time I stayed. They've done significant room renovations since my first stay in the late 1990s. The location is fabulous - walking distance to alot of great restaurants and shopping and easy access to public transportation. Convenient also to the airport (about a 10 - 15 minute cab ride). Only disconcerting thing was that a foreign diplomat was staying in the hotel while I was there and there were police, dogs and secret service agents everywhere! And none of the hotel staff seemed to know what was going on (or weren't allowed to say)! Rooms are small but very comfortable. Wonderful beds and great showers with two shower heads. Fitness center was adequate, but it was much nicer walking in the Public Garden and the Boston Common, which are about a block away. Definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable visit to boston Park Plaza”
Reviews.Author: GillyFlower
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boston Park Plaza in August. We had left it til the last minute to book and we had very few options left. I managed to get a room through Expedia- one on the Towers Conceirge level which was obviously more expensive. I was worried when I read the reviews- mixed reactions. However we were pleasantly surprised. This level was quiet and the room whilst not really spacious, was clean and well equipped. We found the breakfast provided free was adequate for the day- breads, rolls, fresh fruit, yogurts, pastires and eggsetc. We also had some snacks in the evening . Found the location great for exploring the city- lovely walk acoss Boston Common to reach Harbourside and many of the other sights.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you request a tub!”
Reviews.Author: njoy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on hotwire getting a room for $88 a night. I would be furious if I was paying the rack rate. When I stepped into the bathroom, I realized it was missing a tub. There is a tiny stall shower, 4-6 inches from the toilet separated by a curtain. Not what I expect from a three star hotel. Its in a great location, so worth it if you are just here for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: mary244
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a scientific conference. It was a horrible experience. Our room cost $220 a night, but had only a single queen size bed. Of the three room lights, only two worked, making it difficult to read/work at night. The light in the closet was broken (perhaps to hide the peeling paint on the ceiling) so it was difficult to find anything in there. The bathroom did not appear to have any sort of ventilation, and taking a shower made the entire room excessively warm and damp. Our door was very sticky and required a ridiculous amount of effort to open and close. Even a maintenance man struggled to open it. Internet access cost $10 and our room's cable was broken, so we were unable to access the internet (and it took several calls/discussions to get the internet charge removed from our bill, I'm still not certain that we were successful). Despite directions, housekeeping took old towels and replaced them with new ones (but not enough, so each day we were required to hunt down housekeeping and get an additional towel). The hot and cold water in the shower was poorly regulated and went from cold to hot at random. Also, when booking the room, we asked to have a cot placed in the room. This required three telephone calls and two visits to the concierge before we finally received a cot (which was oddly short). Though we made an honest effort to be friendly, nearly all of our interactions with staff were negative and they all seemed really offended that we were bothering them. I would definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone. The only good thing that I can say about this hotel is that they have lovely flower arrangements in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: KevAndTer
Reviews.Content: We are confused by some of the lousy reviews about this hotel. Sure, it's an older place and certainly not as fancy as the 4 Seasons, but neither is the price. We had a terrific stay in Boston - a mix of business and pleasure. Fantastic view of the Public Gardens from our room. The beds were sooooo comfortable, I don't think it took me more than a minute to doze off. The size of the room was a surprise, too. Been to NYC lately? Our closet here was bigger than most rooms in the Apple. Boston was a pretty sight in the light snow we experienced, and the staff was very helpful. We ate an amazing dinner at Mama Maria's in the North End, drank some wonderful ales at some pubs around the Haymarketplace and enjoyed a great breakfast each morning at a place in a nearby building called Croissant duJour. We didn't have time, but the hotel is near a lot of theaters too. Maybe next time. My wife Terri and I were really delighted with our stay at the Park Plaza. It was a very fair value and we wanted for nothing. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably bad”
Reviews.Author: sansovino
Reviews.Content: We decided to treat ourselves to a couple of nights in a good hotel to relax after the flight from England - what a mistake! The room was a small single, filled with a double bed over which you had to lift your cases to put them down. There was an empty condom packet on the floor and the lights didn't work. The restaurant staff spent our first breakfast arguing loudly in front of us and one of them tried to involve us in their dispute (we went out for breakfast on the second day!). We complained to reception at the time and left full details on their evaluation form but nobody seemed in the slightest bit interested - we didn't even get an apology, let alone an explanation or assurance our treatment had been unusual. AVOID THIS HOTEL LIKE THE PLAGUE.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Stay”
Reviews.Author: BostonMnV
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Park Plaza last weekend to celebrate a special occasion. We had a reservation at Bonfire, the hotel downstairs, and a "deluxe" room at the hotel. Bonfire was excellent, and the hotel lobby and public areas are all nice enough. It's been pointed out that the place is a bit frayed around the edges, and I'd agree with that. For the most part, though, the place is nice, if dated. The problem is that the walls are paper thin and it seems like they're catering to rowdy, loud clientele. Around midnight the floor we were on, which was the eight floor, apparently turned into the party floor, with kids (late teens, early twenties) running around, yelling down the hallways, loud music, etc. It was like being in a college dorm We called the front desk and after some discussion were moved elsewhere. That seemed to solve the problem until around 3:00 in the morning, when something similar happened in the new room. I went downstairs to talk to the front desk in person, and was told that the noise was probably because the bars had just closed and that everyone was coming home. From what I could tell, a fight between drunken idiots had broken out diown the hall, and this guy was giving the "aw shucks, just people heading home after a night of fun" routine. He did point out that it could be worse with a "you should see the eight floor", which, of course, was where I started. Ultimately, a manager appeared and was at least apologetic about the whole thing. They also refunded the charge for the room, which I do give them credit for. I think the problem is that the weekend rates are pretty low, which attracts guests who wouldn't otherwise stay at a "luxury" hotel, the walls are too thin, and they don't really have adequate. I appreciated the manager taking care of the bill for the room, and he did seem like a good guy who was trying but just a bit overwhelmed, but all the same, we weren't looking for a free room, we were looking for someplace nice where we could enjoy our special occaion and that was totally ruined. I would definitely not go back nor would I recomment the hotel to others who place any value on peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “The Great Towers Swindle”
Reviews.Author: Elaine36
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing. We booked (and paid in advance for) a room on the Towers Level as part of our honeymoon trip to the States & Carribean. On arrival we were shown to a lower grade room on a different level without any explanation. When we queried this we were told the Towers Level was closed for refurbishment. Surprisingly(?!) there were lots of guests who appeared to be involved in a convention at the hotel using the Towers Level. We got some money back, but it didn't offset not getting the room we expected for our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Faded glory”
Reviews.Author: DX-Traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very worn. Expect about 100 years worth of paint, that in places is chipping, some poorly done repairs, lots of scuff marks on walls etc. The furniture was old, the chair wobbly, the desk had water damage. The door locks malfunctioned repeatedly and always required repeated tries. The TV in the room was old and the picture quality terrible (lots of 'snow''). The bathrooms was small, and cramped, with a severely damaged sink that had no plug. The shower was fine, and the towels excellent. The bed was fine. Internet was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “grande dame with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: ilasik
Reviews.Content: Came to hotel for a conference. The conference "special" rate ended up being $50 more than the regular website price. The public places are beautiful -the lobby, convention area, etc. Service fairly good, quite good location -7-10 min walk to Copley sq. There many parking lots nearby - avoid the $38/nite valet parking. The rooms are on the budget side - bathroom very small, the heat unit makes a fairly loud sound all night long (turning on and off). Beds and linens are comfortable and soft. Good choice of movies on pay-per-view.

Reviews.Title: “Ever-so-slightly faded glory -- for a great price”
Reviews.Author: DrewKnightWV
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Park Plaza this week, when we decided to add a night to a kid-friendly museum trip. I jumped on Hotwire and found a room at the Park Plaza for a very good rate; knowing the location and having seen the public spaces, I thought it was a good bet. We were not disappointed! At eighty years old, the Park Plaza recalls a grander era of travel. The hotel has been well maintained over the years, and, while there are signs of wear-and-tear, they in no way diminished our enjoyment of the comfortable room we had on the 11th floor. The room was nicely decorated, the beds cozy, the bathroom small but well appointed -- and had the power to transport you back to the Deco era, with its lovely mosaic tile. As my kids said, "Wow! Fancy!". "Wow! Fancy!" works equally well for the lobby and other public spaces. Maybe I have spent too much time in anonymous business hotels in the last year, but the warmth of the Park Plaza, even if it's just a bit tatty around the edges, really made me feel good. The Park Plaza is in an excellent location, close to the Theater District, the Boston Common, etc. We were thrilled to fall out the door and walk a minute to the nearby Legal Seafoods for a wonderful family meal that really warmed us on a cold, rainy Boston night. There are several good restaurants right on the property (speculating here -- but I would imagine the Todd English steakhouse, Bonfire is worth a try)... and my kids were once again wowwed by the hotel restaurant's breakfast buffet (really just average for a high-end hotel, but a nice change for two kids I dragged to the hinterlands of New Hampshire). Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the Park Plaza. The combination of a great value and a flashback to a more elegant time had us immediately planning a return trip...

Reviews.Title: “A boutique hotel warmth with utmost professionalism.”
Reviews.Author: lizong88
Reviews.Content: Well, It was my first week in Boston as a 19 year old freshman. I was new in town. My cousin and I booked the room over hotels.com and we were hoping to have a nice stay without having to pay an extreme amount of money. Security was very important since she was going to leave me after the first day. During my stay the staff was incredibly helpful and understanding. Room service was really great. I mean the food,service,punctuality. Other than that the hotel is just beautiful. It is old but very elegant. The doors of the rooms are really heavy though. If you're looking for a modern and luxurious stay this is not the place to go. but if you need a safe,comfortable and economic place to stay in a new town I'd definitely recommend Park Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: PRGNYC
Reviews.Content: After just having a marvelous stay at this hotel, I was surprised to see some of the less flattering reviews of other recent visitors. I showed up at 10:30 in the morning, expecting to check my bags with the concierge, and was immediately given a lovely room on the 14th floor overlooking the bridge in the Public Garden. The staff was particularly accommodating and congenial. The location is unbeatable. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “a good choice”
Reviews.Author: lozzdog
Reviews.Content: We found this to be a delightful hotel with loads of atmosphere. Rooms very clean & comfortable (good size). Bed comfort excellent. We were not happy with our room on arrival (queen on a smoking floor when non smoking was requested) but we were very quickly upgraded to a king on a non smoking floor which we were extremely happy with. We had 4 night here just before Christmas and it was absolutely delightful particularly as they had had a very heavy dump of snow the night we arrived and we had not seen snow before. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: houstonguy2010
Reviews.Content: We booked a hotel on Priceline and this is what we got. It is a nice hotel for the price we paid (less than $100.00) but nothing great. The lobby is outstanding but the rooms are average. The carpet could be replaced. The front desk clerk we interacted with seemed robotic and indifferent. I will say the food from room service was outstanding, although a bit pricey. I would stay here again at the rate we received from Priceline but would not pay full rate for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 5manor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights after Christmas with my mum. Having read previous reviews and previously stayed in the Sheraton can't say I was expecting greatness!! How wrong I was though, this hotel was fantastic!! Location, Staff, Rooms, Bar etc can't complain about anything!! Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I Had A Great Time There”
Reviews.Author: bertramFlorida
Reviews.Content: I have no clue why some of the reviews of the Boston Park Plaza are less than complimentary. I stayed there Feb. 6-9, 2008, and had a wonderful time. First, you cannot get a better location. Plenty of shopping and scads of terrific restaurants all within one block of the hotel on all four sides. The hotel room was not large, but it was large enough with a wonderful sturdy king bed with all the frills (pillows, quilts, etc.) you could ask for. Pleny of drawer and closet space. A nice 25" TV. The bathroom was small, but the shower--with two shower heads--was as good a shower as I have ever had at any hotel. The staff was very personable. The business center charged $10 for 30 minutes on the internet and I had no problem with that at all. When I go back to Boston, I'm staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: misocksgal
Reviews.Content: A friend and I had to attend a conference at the new Westin. We were too cheap to pay to stay there. The Park Plaza was very nice. She scored a great rate on hotwire - less than $60 a night. The room and bathroom were smallish, but beautiful and clean. The lobby and staff were warm and accomodating. Would definitely stay again. The location is very central to downtown Boston. Plenty of things to do and places to eat very close.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, good location, noisy”
Reviews.Author: HudsonValleyNewYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. Beautiful lobby and very friendly staff. The rooms are a bit on the small side and a bit noisy with the subway and street noise. Probably would request a higher room if I stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Christmas location”
Reviews.Author: MaryChristmas
Reviews.Content: What a great place - the hotel is beautiful it looked so gorgeous with all the Christmas deco's up just beautiful - we must have been upgraded to a deluxe room it had a BIG bed and a lovely big bathroom spotless and comfy - would recommend this to anyone - city was great too - not a place for shopping though.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay (apart from the TV internet)”
Reviews.Author: dubai2000
Reviews.Content: Arrived on dec26 for a 5 night stay in boston arrived early from UK and got checked in early, Grand lobby area make for a impressive entrace, Room wasnt large but then again wasnt tiny it was clean and serviced everyday, Hotel is in a great location 5 mins walk from the park/common 5 mins from the upmarket shopping of newbury street and 10-15 from the shopping mall at the prudentical centre, With the T subway system within 5 mins cant fault the location But as written on here before the TV internet in the room is useless worst than useless i then paid $10 for 30 minutes on line at the buisness centre which worked fine at check out they were more than happy to remove the in room internet charge and also a couple of failed phonecalls to the UK with a post office phonecard that wouldnt dial through a couple of times, would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good value but don't use the TV Internet”
Reviews.Author: jamc204
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel a lot. It's beautiful and elegant. While it's definitely old (1927), it's well maintained and clean. My biggest complaint though is that they don't offer computers for customers to get online. You can hookup a laptop in your room, but if you don't have a laptop, they offer an internet service on your TV for $12.95/24 hours. DON'T BUY IT!! The TV internet doesn't work at all. It's not compatible with any websites and is painfully slow (slower than any dialup modem). So, if you're addicted to the internet, make sure you bring a laptop or stay somewhere else such as the Sheraton. The Sheraton offers multiple computers for guest use. If you go, make sure to visit the Bonfire restaurant in the hotel. It is excellent and worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!! stay here if you're in Boston”
Reviews.Author: lozana36
Reviews.Content: The hotel was phenomenal. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I stayed in the economy room and was still impressed. The only minor negatives were a few water stains on the ceiling, there was a bottle cap under my night table- indicating that the cleaning was not thorough before I had been given the room. Otherwise, everything was in place and the amenities were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service and Overcharged 15%”
Reviews.Author: zapatamama
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel customer service with misleading advertisement on their website that is borderline-fraudulent. Will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, comfy bed, thin walls”
Reviews.Author: digtravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Plaza for one night thanks to an incredible price through Priceline. The lobby was beautifully decorated for the holidays, and check-in was fine. My room was small but adequate, on par with other city hotel rooms I have seen. The bed was very confortable, with lovely white linens and lots of pillows. The room was clean and comfortable, the bathroom was a little tired but clean. The dual showerhead was a nice touch. I will agree with some other reviewers about the thin walls in this old hotel. I was awakened at about 2:30 am when some holiday revelers returned to the room next door for a little more partying. I tried to wait it out, but the volume increased until I finally had to call down to the operator. They sent someone up almost immediately, and the party soon quieted and dispersed, so plus points for the quick service. However, the walls are so thin that I could hear even normal conversation the next morning as I was getting ready to leave. I guess this is a by-product of an old grand hotel, but one to be aware of if noise is a big issue for you.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst - Any Alternative Would Have Been Better (Motel 6, Best Western)”
Reviews.Author: DavidZGreenberg
Reviews.Content: Having spent many nights in low-end hotels during business trips to remote locations, I am used to spartan accomodations. However, this place was a dump. Truthfully, the rooms are no where near the quality of even a Best Western or Red Roof Inn -- let alone a Holiday Inn. Yes, the lobby is fancy. Don't let this deceive you. The mattress in my room felt like it had been picked from the garbage. The other furniture was in awful shape as well -- similar to what you would find in a thrift store. The showers were too small for an adult. I am a little surprise that the major travel sites haven't stopped selling rooms for this hotel. Don't get ripped off. If you wind up unwittingly staying here, complain to management, the authorities, and the BBB. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: KittyPG
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Park Plaza Hotel in Boston for 5 nights early December. Location is perfect., you can walk to Newbury Street, Quincy market, 20 minutes from airport etc I was really nervous about the hotel as the reviews I read weren't always great. We got checked in immediately on arrival. We were on the 9th floor and had a large bedroom, large bathroom and plenty of space in the wardrobe for both of our stuff. We had a problem with the heater on arriving and called down stairs. Someone came to our room within 5 minutes of the call and fixed it and we had no further issues. Housekeeping came each day so clean sheets and towels every day. Concierge was really helpful all 3 times we spoke with him and we checked out with no delay. I would defenitely stay there again. Everyone was polite and friendly and my sister thought the door man was a hoot. No complaints our end, only thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value”
Reviews.Author: radiorock
Reviews.Content: Great price as part of an Expedia package. Beautiful lobby, nice desk staff, super comfortable bed, great location. Will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty darn poor”
Reviews.Author: UkGMan
Reviews.Content: Stayed during a major conference in town, so place was heaving but even so.... Very pricey. Room tiny and run down. "wardrobe" too small to fit my case in and had to remove ironing board to corridor just to hang my shirts. Shower same height as my chest despite there being 2ft of space above. Breakfast was chaos - they didn't clear tables (customers just stacked the stuff on the floor in the end) but still managed to bring the bill before we started! Nice splintered woodwork around my door where it had obviously been kicked in Checkout farcical. They told me when I checked in that they had a corporate account to settle to....but insisted I paid in full on my card. Location is ok...but would never stay here again. To be fair, other colleagues said when they've stayed when it isn't busy, that it's quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfactory hotel”
Reviews.Author: Noni1126
Reviews.Content: My office booked this for me through Orbitz. The hotel is older, but I thought very well kept. The king-sized bed was incredibly comfortable -- pillow-top mattress, nine pillows of varying size and firmness, a comforter. Small bathroom but nice toiletries. Everything very clean. My only criticism of the room is that it was a bit drafty, but the heat worked well, and there is separate heater in the bathroom. Helpful staff. Nice fitness room. Absolutely unbeatable location! An especially useful touch is a small "guest lounge" off the lobby, accessible only by room key card and comfortably furnished. I used it to hold discussions with my clients. Although the hotel restaurant is very expensive and not exciting, it is surrounded by lots of great places in all price ranges

Reviews.Title: “Showing its age but good service and location”
Reviews.Author: jmfangio
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel for business travel. One thing off the bat is that even though starwood owns the hotel, they do not offer SPG points! That is pretty odd. Great location for the hotel. It is right around the corner from hotels costing 2-3 times as much as this one charges. The first room I had was pretty small, but clean and decently furnished if a little old fashioned and out of date. However, there was a smell of sewage coming from the bathroom, and next to no hot water in the shower. I complained about this, and was upgraded to a tower level room which I thought was the correct way to handle situation. This room was larger, had great hot water and was thankfully devoid of any sewage smells. It also came with access to a lounge that had complimentary breakfast in the morning and drinks and hors d'ouvres at night. I would stay here again for business, but the style of the hotel is not my thing if I were paying. That being said, service was excellent and the location can't be beat for the price.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed the hotel”
Reviews.Author: JRWB1960
Reviews.Content: Given the reviews and my own prior experience, it was with some trepidation that I booked a double room at the BPP Hotel. I have heard the rooms were small and shabby. But the price and location could not be beat so I booked it. Besides, who spends time in the room on a trip to Boston? It's a party town. In the event, my room was spacious, clean and quiet. I recommend getting a double. The lobby was beautiful and the bar/restaurant is a nice place to meet for drinks before getting the night started. The location is really the best quality. It is surrounded by the wonderful restaurants and shopping of Boston's Back Bay and South End. It is also close to the Public Garden and Commons making for a nice walk over to Beacon Hill and the Waterfront. The staff was a little aloof, but proficient at what they did. The housekeeping staff however was very gracious and did a nice efficient job. Overall, a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the hotel”
Reviews.Author: jotabecu
Reviews.Content: Location, service and cost all excellent. Very good room. It shows its years a little bit but with some make up it stays on top. Will recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “mainly positive, but primary advantage is its location”
Reviews.Author: rwchicago
Reviews.Content: I was able to get a special package deal on Orbitz combining my air travel to Boston with 3 nights at the Park Plaza. I would say that the experience overall was positive, but I would have been disappointed if I had to pay the full price. I had a standard room with a comfy double bed, but the carpet was dusty and stained and there was a mysterious leak in the bathroom. I found a puddle of water near the tub every morning... before I even started the shower. The bathroom was also quite snug... not a whole lot bigger than a telephone booth. The staff ranged from helpful to inattentive to somewhat brusque. There were some voicemails on the hotel phone for me, and the main desk was no help at all when I called them to find out how to access my messages. I never was able to retrieve the messages that were left for me! As I said, the room overall was comfortable but a bit threadbare. Even the sheets were so worn that they had holes, probably from being laundered thousands of times. Park Plaza is very conveniently located in the Back Bay/Copley Square area, and so it's perfect for both business and tourist travelers. But I would only decide to stay there again if I had a discounted rate. I would look elsewhere if the hotel only had full price rooms.

Reviews.Title: “You must be joking”
Reviews.Author: MaineHobo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were "guests" in the Park Plaza hotel from 11/22/07--11/25/07. During our stay, we encountered the following unfortunate situations: 1) A gentleman on staff who decided that "Honey" was an appropriate way to address me. I am a 44 year old professional woman more accustomed to being addressed as â€œDoctorâ€�, but Maâ€™am, Miss or even Lady would be preferable to â€œHoneyâ€�. 2) On our last night at the hotel, we had the unpleasant experience of encountering an extremely strong and pervasive odor of marijuana when we returned to our floor for the evening. 3) Adding to the overall experience of our last night in the hotel, I was awoken at 3:30 in the morning by a security guard slipping a piece of paper, with our checkout charges, under my door. Consequently, it took me quite a while to go back to sleep and I was exhausted in the morning for our trip home. 4) When I brought the issue of being rudely awoken to the attention of the front desk manager, I was told, "Oh, that was security how funny." 5) When we checked out, I brought this issue up again and asked if it would be possible to avoid having the charges slipped under my door, if we came back. The young woman who waited on us responded with a very hesitant "I guess" and then proceeded to argue the point of whether I had in reality been woken up in the first place. To say that her attitude was argumentative is to fall short of giving her â€œshpielâ€� justice. It is a rare experience in my life to have another person accuse me of lying, and, while the young woman's statements fell short of that particular accusation, it wasn't by much. 6) Despite being addressed in unfortunately familiar terms, surrounded by illicit drugs, woken up in the middle of the night, and accused of lying by the staff, we decided, as a matter of convenience, to make our reservations at checkout for our next trip in December. At this point, the same young woman in question informed us that there were no available rooms. In fact, according to her, the hotel was overbooked. However, when I returned home, I checked the validity of this statement. There are apparently a large variety of rooms available. Needless to say, we will by staying at the Hyatt down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Return to Park Plaza”
Reviews.Author: newengland001
Reviews.Content: We were extremely unhappy with our stay at the Park Plaza. The level of service was embarassing; I waited for 30 minutes on hold for the concierge twice during our one-night stay, once in the evening and again in the morning, it took over 20 minutes to check in, and the hotel bar staff was disgruntled and far from accomodating. I will never return to the Park Plaza and encourage everyone else to explore the many other hotels in Boston that far exceed the Park Plaza in quality and level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!! Would return in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: Oakiesis
Reviews.Content: We reserved two rooms through Hotwire for two nights, Oct. 19th - 21st, 2007. The rooms were fine, a little small but they were very clean and suited our needs perfectly, we were only in the room to shower and sleep, the rest of our time was spent exploring Boston which you can do from this hotel entirely on foot! My experience with the staff was wonderful, from the moment we arrived (which was early 10am), the very friendly and curteous lady at reception really took care of us, she got our rooms for us early so that we could start exploring Boston, concierge was also very nice and helpful, gave us a map and directions on how to use the "T" to go to Salem and the great doorman hooked us up with reasonable limo driver for our ride back to the airport. I would absolutely recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Colonial Class”
Reviews.Author: Rye22
Reviews.Content: Cannot say enough about the people and the overall atmosphere of this hotel and its staff. We attended for a wedding, although the only time we were in the hotel was for sleep and the reception. The rooms were very nice, although I have to say the washroom we stayed in could be bigger. We had to do some serious sidestepping to get around the door when you were trying to access the sink or toilet. I think we just had a regular room (1 king bed), but the room was well kept and overall a good experience. This was my 2nd time in Boston, and was lucky enough to have a great tour as my girlfriend and all of her friends attended BU for Dental School. I HIGHLY recommend you see Fanieul Hall, take a Duck Boat Tour (book in advance), go to Fenway and see the Sox play, and take a nice walk down Mass Ave, Copley, and Newbury to see some of the awesome shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Elevator Safety Issues!!”
Reviews.Author: NickScull
Reviews.Content: All three of the south bank of elevators malfunctioned the entire four days we were there! One group of guests was stuck in elevator #3 for over an hour and a half. My wife and I got stuck between floors twice in elevators #1 and 2 two days in a row when the electronics suddenly just went dead. After fiddling with the buttons it started up again each time after about five minutes. I believe these sorts of maintenance/safety issues are unforgivable in a hotel this expensive and we will not be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced shoebox”
Reviews.Author: EarlieGirlie
Reviews.Content: I would not stay at this hotel again if it was free. I paid an exorbitant amount for two nights for a room that was not even big enough to accommodate a standard (double) bed. In fact, it was so small that the bedside table would not fit next to the bed and was at the foot of the bed. The TV remote control did not work, but that was not such a problem as the TV had no reception anyway. Lighting in the room was so poor that it was impossible to see the clothes in my suitcase. Which reminds me, there was not even a rack to hold suitcases, let alone a closet to hang anything in. The hotel staff were rude and arrogant, if you could get to talk to them. I waited more than 20 minutes on hold to speak to the Concierge before I gave up. Waiting at the counter did not provide any better service. For the price, I would expect a free shuttle service to the airport, as is common at other hotels. The best the hotel could offer was the phone number of a local service (not even booking the service). The only experience at the hotel that was good was dinner at Bonfire restaurant. The staff were friendly and very accommodating, and the food was terrific. Do yourself a favor and stay at another hotel, but if you like a good steak, check out Bonfire.

Reviews.Title: “Less than what I expected”
Reviews.Author: snowshoe_bunnie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Plaza near Christmastime last year, and was attracted by the special rates offered by Expedia.com as well as the old charm of the hotel. The lobby was beautifully done up, but the rooms were not of a very good standard. The bathroom was very old and gave me the creeps. I am a lot more forgiving towards this hotel because I know it is very old- but the "ancient" heater in the room I was assigned to was faulty and funny sounds were coming from it. Despite the maintenance coming up very promptly to fix it, the sounds were keeping me up on my first night there, so the next day the reception kindly upgraded me to a better room, but I realized apart from the upgrade to a king bed and bigger room, everything else was the same. On the whole, for the price I paid, I thought it was okay, not fantastic in any sense. The location of the hotel is great, and the experience of staying in an old hotel with the old fixtures still in there was definite something to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Classic though slightly shabby; great location”
Reviews.Author: mhf_wanderer
Reviews.Content: Situated just off Copley Square, the Boston Park Plaza is a busy, conventionally elegant, older hotel very near Newbury Street and the Public Garden. With a dramatic though slightly shabby lobby and an aging piano bar, the hotel seems almost a relic from a bygone era â€“ as are many of its elderly patrons. Having reserved through Travelocity, my room was adequate, non-smoking and quiet, in spite of a charmless view of a dismal gravel-topped roof spattered with pigeon droppings. The small room was equipped with a plush queen bed, soft linens (nicely turned down each night), and conservative English soaps adorned the early twentieth-century fixtures in the bathroom. No WiFi was available but the ample, ersatz-Federal writing desk featured Ethernet-LAN service for a fee. The overpriced lounge served an indulgent, though a bit greasy, breakfast buffet, and the hotelâ€™s service was expedient, refined and courteous. This hotel is walking distance from the Arlington stop on the Green Line. Overall, for the $260 room rate, three stars.

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to stay ...”
Reviews.Author: candidreview_14
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a work conference and was disappointed by the rooms and the service. The lobby is beautiful and the location blocks from the Public Garden can't be beat, but this property is really in need of some upgrades. Starting with the front desk area - the layout is confusing and I stood in line while several new people approached desk clerks from the side. One of the duties of a desk clerk is to pay attention to the people who are waiting and to not allow people to interrupt or cut in line. When I got to my room, my keys did not work. So I had to go back downstairs with all of my luggage, wait in line again, and then trudge back up to my floor. The room itself was small - not unexpected in an older city hotel. That said, the furnishings are outdated, I had to call service at least twice to fix issues, and the air conditioning was loud enough to keep me awake at night. If you are attending an event, you will enjoy the ornate ballrooms. But I would suggest staying somewhere else when you visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: cinncitraveler
Reviews.Content: This place needs to be shut down and either renovated or torn down. Everything seems run down and outdated. The walls and windows are paper thin. Every noise from the street (non-stop in a city the size of Boston) seems like it's right in your room. I found the bed uncomfortable. On the plus side, there are very good restaurants in the neighborhood. This hotel is living on its historical past as an excuse to continue to charge high rates for quality that's unacceptable. Do yourself a favor. If you are intrigued by the property, stop by the lobby, take your picture, move on to a more updated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DuggyLancs
Reviews.Content: Initially devastated when I read someone's review including the word 'mouse' before we left the UK! This was our first trip to the East Coast and Boston was our first stop (2 nights) on a 2 week road trip around New England. No problems with valet parking- a bit pricey but this is a city and the hotels location is excellent-you can do Boston on foot from here reaching all of the major tourist sights. We upgraded to a tower room which was perfectly large enough for the 4 of us. We could access a private lounge for complimentary breakfast and evening bites and all non alchoholic drinks,water and fruit was always available.Perfect for early morning starts and chilling out in the evening with the kids. bathroom was small but perfectly formed. Private concierge was incredibly helpful and arranged a duck tour for us at the last minute. All in all a wonderful start to a perfect trip. I can't comment on the other rooms but it's well worth staying in a tower room. We will be staying here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and Miss”
Reviews.Author: brookl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel 4 or 5 times, mainly because this hotel seems to be the only 3-star hotel in downtown Boston that's always available at a discount price on Hotwire/Priceline. I've had a couple of forgettable stays here, as well as a couple of satisfied experiences. They have many room configurations here, but the lowest-end rooms are really low-end. And the problem is, there are many of those and you could get stuck in one if you're unlucky. The lowest-end room that I'm talking about is really tiny. I'm talking probably less than 200sq feet, with a tiny bathroom. And both times I got stuck with those, my rooms were facing a small coutryard (if you can call it that) fully enclosed with other wings of the hotel. So you're pretty much looking right into other hotel room windows directly across. It's not a pretty sight, and privacy is an issue unless you keep the curtain closed. The other times, I actually stayed in a decent-sized room facing out to the street. These rooms were still small, but they were more like 250sq feet or so. I would say these rooms were a legitimate 3-star experience. Regardless of which room type you get, my experience has been that the rooms are pretty clean with nice bed linens and such. I still think this place needs to do some major renovations to modernize some aspects of the guest rooms. But the showers always worked well and the carpet was always clean, as I can best remember. I do remember that the walls were not the thickest... sometimes you could really hear the noise from next door. The best thing about this hotel is its location. It's one block from Boston Commons and the happening Boylston St, 2 blocks from Newbury St which is Boston's chic vibrant shopping street. Chinatown and the Theater District are also nearby. The hotel is 1/2 block away from the nearest subway stop (Arlingston St). In spite of all the negatives about this hotel, more often than not this is the ONLY decent hotel in this area that's affordable. For those of you who say the location is the most important thing, it's hard to beat this hotel. As far as eating inside the hotel, I've only eaten at McCormick & Schmick's. I used to love this restaurant and I've gone there about 10 times (both as a hotel guest and otherwise). For some reason, I feel like the quality there has plummeted the last couple of years. On the other hand, there are many decent restaurants nearby that I like better. Like Fire&Ice, PF Chang, Rustic Kitchen, Legal Seafood (mind you, some people still prefer McCormick & Schmick's to Legal). In summary, this is a hotel I'd probably rather not stay at. But you can't beat the location. And often times, you don't have any other options, price-wise. So I'm sure we'll return to them again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Good”
Reviews.Author: IndieGuy
Reviews.Content: I arrived very tired after taking the shuttle and subway from Logan airport. Since it was hot, my asthma was kicking in. The young lady at reception was fantastic and even upgraded my room a notch to a king sized bed. The public areas (lobby, mezzanine, etc. are fabulous. They don't build them like this anymore and these areas are very well maintained. The hallways to the rooms (9th floor) looked like they could use carpet cleaning. The room's bath was spotless and nicely-appointed; however, I dropped something on the floor next to the bed and when I looked underneath, things looked really poorly--in obvious need of a good vacuuming. The first night was heaven. Very nice and quiet. The next six, I was stuck with persons on one or both sides who were very loud. At one point, the hotel sent someone up and things got quiet for about 10 minutes, then resumed. When I was ready to leave, I phoned for a bellman. I waited about 20 minutes beyond the 10 I was told and finally just left the room on my own. Not a big thing, but I was billed $2.00 for a local call. I never used the phone except to call for hotel staff twice. I left a message to that effect, but the charge was not removed from my bill and I needed to leave because of the tardy bellman. Very nice restaurants in the building and in the few blocks around it as well! I would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pittman123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Boston Park Plaza Hotel for a week, in an upgrade Tower Room. For over $300 a day, I couldnâ€™t even get hot water for shower in the morning. I also experienced billing error and loss of item at my room. The staff was trying to help, but the hotel is so overwhelmed with problems that they either couldnâ€™t do anything or did not care. I checked out with an erroneous invoice, and the security manager (service manage was not in on duty) promised that a fax copy of the revised invoice will be faxed to me. As of today (more than one week later), I am still waiting for the correct invoice. I emailed the security manager; she did not reply. I called the security manager and the hotel, and nobody picked up the phone at the front desk, or at the accounting. Apparently, nobody cares in the hotel once you leave. The lesson I learned from spending more than $2k? Stay away from Boston Park Plaza Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Great Service! Small room.”
Reviews.Author: kevnord
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a GREAT location! It's just a block from Boston Commons. The hotel and its staff are wonderful. I believe there are 5 restraunts attached to the hotel, so if you love food, you have a lot of choices. My room was nice although extremely small. I booked an economy room. The bed was probably the best hotel bed I've slept in to date. The bathroom was a little beat up and could use some fixing up. It felt old (which I suppose it is). I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Park Plaza: Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: millim1900
Reviews.Content: In short, our stay in Boston was Above Average thanks to a wonderful dedication to customer service from the staff at the Park Plaza Boston Hotel and Towers. We went to see a Red Sox - Yankees game at Fenway, a longtime dream of ours, and planned on touring the city as well. We needed a hotel that could provide us not just with a bed and sheets but a great knowledge of the city. Positives: - The concierge desk was fantastic, they took time to explain hidden gems, great places to eat, lent us an umbrella, and in general cared about "getting it right" and not "getting us out." They helped us find some great antique shops, they staffed this desk with smart locals and boy did it show, excellent concierge services. - Check in was excellent, quick and easy, no megaphone blasting of our room number to everyone in line. - Room had a nice view and was clean with a polite cleaning staff. - Bar staff were professional, nice and actually smiled. Negatives: - Skycap/Bellhop: were not very helpful. Clearly an area they could improve upon, the man who wanted to help us with our bags was clearly in no physical capacity to do so: I felt bad, did it myself. Park Plaza made this trip great for us. A fine attention to details, staff motivated to make our stay enjoyable and a dedication to excellent customer service; this reviewer highly encourages other travelers to consider staying at the Park Plaza Boston Hotel and Towers.

Reviews.Title: “No need to worry”
Reviews.Author: laracee
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at the Park Plaza on expedia and got an excellent deal, but was still worried after reading all of the negative reviews. We had no reason to worry. Even with the discounted price we still got a larger room and it was all redone beautifully. The bed was very comfy and the bathroom was quite large with a roomy shower. We didn't have a view, but as we didn't spend much time in the room it didn't matter. The concierge was extremely helpful, however the bell men made no effort to be pleasant. Not a huge deal. Honestly, this hotel has the best location possible. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, beautiful public areas, rooms a little tired”
Reviews.Author: chloe8
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Boston Park Plaza before, so I knew what I was getting. We arrived at the hotel and had a pretty quick check-in, only to arrive at our room to find someone waiting outisde it saying that it was their room, but they couldn't get in. I had worked in a hotel before, so I knew that this could easily happen and we went down to the front desk to explain the situation. The front desk clerk was very apologetic and immediately gave us coupons for the breakfast buffet the next day which was very nice! The standard rooms are small and the bathrooms have little counter space but as this is a 1920s hotel this is to be expected. No frig either. Room was very clean, though and bed was very comfortable. Our friends had a superior room which was just bigger, not really worth the extra money. The public areas are very nice. People complained about the elevators being slow, but again this is a large 1920s hotel, so it is to be expected. The location is great and I love the charm of old hotels! If you are like me, you'll like the Boston Park Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Lavish reception area deceiving”
Reviews.Author: AnnieMate
Reviews.Content: We were a little deceived by the lavish luxury and splendour of the reception hall of this hotel. We stayed for 3 nights in what was described as a king-sized bedroom on the 9th floor . We could hardly move in the room it was so small. I would describe it as functional rather than comfortable and certainly no hint of luxury. The only place to hang our clothes was a hook on the bathroom door - we couldn't believe it but there was no wardrobe! Just a few drawers. The bathroom was ok, clean, but nothing special. We were out sightseeing most of the time so we weren't too worried about the room. However it could be quite depressing if the weather was bad and you spent more time there. The window was quite close to the building opposite, so the room was dark , even on a sunny day, and the lighting was inadequate. I would recommend this hotel purely for its central location. There were several restaurants very close by and the Common and start of the Freedom Trail were only a few minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Small and comfortable, but incredibly noisy”
Reviews.Author: BritLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I just stayed on the 5th floor. The room was small, which I have encountered before in another Boston hotel and which didn't really bother me, since I was out most of the time. What really did bother me for the 2 nights I stayed there was the noise level, which was incredibly intrusive. Outside the window, in the interior of the building, was an exhaust fan that blew 24 hours a day. At night, it even went through periods when it would accelerate to the volume of a subway train. I awakened at least 4 times a night. I left a voicemail in the system regarding this noise but did not get a call back or a requested room change, which is really unacceptable. The phone system for this hotel is very substandard. I left a message in the concierge desk system before I arrived at the hotel and never received a call back from that, either. The wait time to get through to an actual person on that desk was close to 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lthomso4
Reviews.Content: We booked the Park Plazza last minute through expedia and after looking at reviews on the hotel were a little nervous. We booked a King Sized Deluxe room and it was fantastic - we had a great view, the room was modern, clean, very spacious with a living area including a sofa. For the extra space I'd recommend the King Deluxe. The staff were very friendly and more than willing to point you in the right direction should you need any assistance. The location of this hotel is fantastic and the hotel is charming with lots of intricate details in the reception area - definately worth staying here if you come to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of character / short on accommodattions”
Reviews.Author: heidionebraid
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed there as part of the AARP National Event. Because it resembled the Park Plaza in NYC (which I have stayed at and found it to be exceptional), I booked my stay there. It really did not measure up to today's standards, however. I had booked a king room thru AARP with a convention rate of $180@night, at least 6 months prior, so I expected the room that I had booked. When I checked in, I was given the key with no other details. The hallway on the fifth floor had an odor to it and the doors looked old. When I went into my room, it was quite small with a double bed, not a king, and had no closet or even a bureau. As I was on my way out to meet a group of people for dinner, I stopped at the front desk quickly to inquire about this situation. I said that I booked this room quite a ways in advance and could not live out of a suticase for 4 days and that I wanted a better room than the one I was given. I was told to stop by the next morning as they were fully booked that night. Due to convention schedules, I was able to stop by the front desk in the early afternoon, at which time I was given a room on the 12th floor at a rate of $20 cheaper per night. This was a little bigger and better, at least it had a closet and a bureau. But the bathroom looked as if it was simply thrown together in a mishmash-old fixtures and shower that you could not even turn around in. But hey, I settled for a place to put my clothes. The breakfast buffet, in my opinion, was very pricey. It cost $19.95 for a hot dish-eggs, potatoes, meat. I did that once and ended up going to Au Bon Pain down the street on the other days. So if you want an old hotel full of character and quirks, this one's for you. If you want a more modern accomdation, go across the street to the Radisson. I know this hotel has character and quirks due to its age, but you should get the accomodations that your booked instead of what they choose to give you.

Reviews.Title: “Charming old hotel with some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: tzyf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week for the AARP convention in Boston. Not sure if it's typical but our room was TINY. But it basically had everything we needed. Bed was comfortable except the hard pillows. Everything was clean. Room service was mixed. Great one late night but lumpy oatmeal and missing selections in the morning. Bathroom also very clean and a nice deep bathtub but also very small. Housekeeping was hit and miss so we finally started leaving a tip and a note every day to get the towels and washcloths we needed. Great location, one block off Boston Common and walking distance (for us) to North End and the complete Freedom Trail.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: djdooms
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard room at the Park Plaza. It was small, but I expected that. Our room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Our only issue was that our room was very hot. We turned the air conditioning down all the way and it was still miserable. We went out for the evening on the day we arrived, and asked for it to be checked. Nothing happened that night, so after spending a sleepless night, we asked for them to fix it again or change our room. We went out for the day and when we returned it was nice & cool. That only lasted for 24 hours. The next day it was hot again, but we were able to open the window and let cool air in so we were comfortable. I won't stay there again just because of dealing with the temperature in the room.

Reviews.Title: “loved the park plaza”
Reviews.Author: funnykitty
Reviews.Content: My daughter, her friend and Istayed at the Park Plaza Hotel for 2 nights recently. I had no time to research hotels and booked this hotel from Hotels.com at the very last minute. I really liked this hotel. It was in a great part of town-very close to the Commons , Copley Square and Newbury Street shops and restaurants. I thought it was beautiful and enjoyed the ornate lobby, piano player and found old fashioned bathrooms charming. I thought it was elegant . Our room was spacious with 2 double beds. Very clean (except for a crumpled wrapper under the bed) and the concierges were very helpful to us. We were able to walk to the South Station for our bus trip to and from NY. Very convenient! I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and would return to this hotel in a minute..

Reviews.Title: “7 Good Nights”
Reviews.Author: 25thWestSussex_UK
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a week at the Boston Park Plaza the only let down was the room to room noise. As far as my wife and I were concerned the sound proofing could be better. The bathroom was small by US standers but did it's job, good shower and clean. Good bed and clean room. Lots to do and see, we walked most places, Coply shops, the harbour ,Park ,and part of the Freedom Trail. If you do not have time for a sit down breakfast there is coffee and patries etc to go by the bar area. Bonfire the onsite restaurant is very good, great steak (but closed Sunday's) Would I recommend it to a friend, Yes, but would have to mention the room to room noise.

Reviews.Title: “Pass the Executive Suite, not worth the money....”
Reviews.Author: nhunsinger
Reviews.Content: Having planned on seeing Boston for my 50th Birthday I chose the Park Plaza, staying in The Towers section for the extra service. There was no extra service; the daily breakfast was either out (no food) upon arrival to the concierge room, or they were cleaning early, stating the time for breakfast during the week ended earlier than the weekend. That was not found anywhere in the literature when booking. With the time difference it meant you had to eat VERY early or not at all. Having paid extra to be pampered this was definitely not the hotel to stay for pampering. The concierge was to have put an itinerary together for me, and I never heard from him again. Needless to say the concierge was not typically present, and when they were at the desk they ignored you unless you engaged in conversation; see previous sentence regarding end result on request. The pictures of the rooms you see online are not what you get. The rooms are old, and very small. A queen size bed, desk and dresser took up the whole room wih just a small walk-way around them. While this hotel is convenient to the park, there are other hotels more convenient to activities in Boston, and probably more prone to customer satisfaction. Dissatisfied and defninitely do not recommend. In addition, my brother-in-law's mom died and we requested to leave early through Hotel.com, but I was told Park Plaza would not allow a refund for the one day early departure. Never mind Hotel.com advertises changes are accomodated. Very misleading as far as I'm concerened.

Reviews.Title: “Grand entrance but rooms a letdown”
Reviews.Author: wesoweso
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a grand scale and built in 1927. It's typical of it's era and looks very impressive outside and also when entering the foyer. However, the rooms are pretty average and unless you wish to take advantage of the ambience of the ground floor facilities (piano player in restaurant etc) i would look elsewhere. Cost was around 200 dollars per night (special rate). Elevators seem to take an age to arrive even though 6 are available. If a nice room is important to you look elsewhere in Boston as there is better value for your dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Have no fear!”
Reviews.Author: wisgirl01
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonderful trip to Boston and Cape Cod with my two teenage daughters. Stayed 4 nights at Park Plaza which I booked through Hotwire for $93 per nite - excellent value. Was very nervous after reading mixed reviews here, but all fears were allayed upon check-in. I worried about getting a bad room since I used Hotwire, it didn't happen. We had a large room (one that had been converted), and it was very clean, beds were very comfortable, nice bath amenities. The bathrooms were small, but not uncomfortable, and were extremely clean. When checking in, Tolga, was very friendly, and seemed to not notice or care that I got such a deal for my stay, and he treated me with the utmost respect. If I had to complain, the elevators were a bit slow, we had to evacuate on our last night due to a fire alarm going off, and housekeeping did not refill our towels or amenities one day. But those were minor inconveniences in exchange for a beautiful hotel in the heart of the city. We were steps away from Newberry Street, The Public Gardens, Freedom Trail, Downtown Crossing, etc. We appreciated Ray, the concierge's help in getting to a beach North of Boston one day, as we had record-breaking temperatures. Manchester-by-the-Sea has a great beach, and is easily accessible by the commuter rail. We even stopped in Salem on the way home, which was a nice side trip. I would definitely stay in this hotel again, and would recommend to any friends or family looking for a clean hotel in a great location, with many restaurants on-site and nearby. And I was relieved my fears were unsubstantiated.

Reviews.Title: “No luxury here”
Reviews.Author: ljsmith
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, right across from the Public Gardens. They advertise and charge like they are a luxury hotel, but believe me, there is no luxury here. Rooms vary, I had a big room with windows that open but the smallest bathroom ever. One tiny little shelf to put your stuff on and had to close the door to be in there. My room also had a pull out sofa (with a big stain on it) so I guess if you are bringing the kids, $259 wouldn't be that bad. TV didn't work, light bulbs out, nasty carpet. Good breakfast though. Also be aware that the charge for overnight parking is $38 per night!

Reviews.Title: “Park Plaza Location is nice.”
Reviews.Author: EbethDallas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for work, and it was acceptable. It was close to Boston Common but be prepared to walk about 10 to 15 minutes to the more interesting parts of The Freedom Trail. I ended up staying in two different rooms (not the hotel's fault). The first one was really nice with double beds and was spacious with a full walk-in closet. The bathrooms are small, but this didn't bother me that much. The second room I stayed in also had double beds, but was significantly smaller. It smelled like smoke even though we were on a non-smoking floor. We were told when we checked in (very, very late at night) that the type of room we had reserved was not available. They said that a reservation guarantees a room, but not the type of room. They did manage to get us in the room we reserved, but co-workers who checked in on another day were not so lucky. Tip: Check in as early as possible to get the room you want, especially if they are hosting a conference. All in all, the hotel was nice enough if you get a deal for it. Don't pay full price to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, great location, room a little small”
Reviews.Author: ScubaDawg97
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying in the Boston Park Plaza hotel and towers in July. It was actually luck of the draw that I ended up here as I used hotwire to book my room. As you may know, Hotwire won't tell you the name of the hotel until you have accepted the price on your credit card...a risk that paid off in this case. Our flight from Atlanta was actually an hour EARLY believe it or not so we got to the hotel much earlier than expected. We were relieved to find that our room was already available, so we got an hour head-start on our activities. The room itself was very nice; it's obviously renovated as the building itself is old. Back in those days, I guess you didn't need a lot of space, so that still holds true. I definitely wouldn't try to fit a family of 4 in a room; but for a couple, it's perfect. The beds were comfortable, the view was good (I was looking South, so there wasn't much to look at), and the service was fantastic. My only complaints I guess were that the A/C didn't get very cold and that Internet access wasn't free. I find it funny that your cheap hotels provide free internet access, but your money-making hotels have to charge $12 a day. Kinda lame in my opinion. But all in all, I was very happy and would recommend the hotel. It's right on the T-line (green) at Arlington, so it's very convenient. It's also right across the street from the Boston Public Gardens and Commons. Its location, coupled with the unlimited "T" pass allowed me to see EVERYTHING I wanted to see in Boston in 3 short days...including the Sox! GO SOX!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasantly Faded Grandeur”
Reviews.Author: QuisCustodiet
Reviews.Content: My room was small and dirty, with most surfaces suffering some form of dirt or stickiness. The smallness I don't mind, but the stickiness I don't need. The decor was intended to signify high class, but the quality of finish (chipped and dirty paint and tile, 50-year old hardware, woodwork, and even a vintage 1950s HVAC system!) destroyed that vain attempt. The bathroom was too small to swing a kitten, which again is no problem unless you lay the thing out without any concern for the idea that people will need to use it. Sinks of miniscule depth located directly under shelves are fine if you want to splash like a dolphin or crack your head open on a daily basis. Did I mention the outlets? Don't plan on using more than 2 electrical devices in your room. Clearly more than 2 surface-mounted retrofitted outlets was going to bust the rennovation budget on this place, as was any kind of decent internet access. The modem was screwed into the bottom of one of the desk drawers (I found out because it was broken and a tech had to come and replace it), presumably because otherwise the clientele would steal it? So I ended up ruining two pairs of trousers on the screwheads that protruded underneath the desk, while trying to work there. That leaves a nice impression too. The crowning glory was a 1:30am fire alarm that sounded without cessation for 10-15 minutes, which although apparently a false alarm (sadly the building was not afforded the opportunity for a proper gut-job rehab) caused all (500+?) guests to evacuate the hotel into the lobby or the street, in complete confusion with no more than 5 hotel staff in evidence. I hate to think what would have happened if there had been a real fire. Conclusion? Don't stay here. It's not nice, it's not classy, and it's not efficient or even clean and modern in any way. Spring for the extra money for somewhere genuinly nice, or stay elsewhere and spend the money you save on cabs to get downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Historical hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Tuuli
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Park Plaza Boston in July, rate 120 $ from Hotwire. We came from Connecticut and the driving directions printed from hotel website were very helpful, better than map (there are sevaral tunnels and oneway streets). Chek in was fast, the only down side was that we were told valet parking was the only parking option and there was no self parking nearby. We found (much cheaper) self parking in the next block (info from TA forum), it was probably the same Park Plaza uses for valet parking. Room was not very big, but spacious enough for us and our two big luggage. Room was clean and in good condition. Location was good, easy to walk everyhere in lovely central Boston. We especially liked Boston common, North beach, Charles street and Newbury street. Loved also Local seafoods few blocks from hotel. While waiting for husband to pick up the car from garage I stood by the front door & watched and listened to the doorman. He was very unfriendly to the visitors who asked for some advice and also to cab drivers. Was it just a bad day for him or the normal behaviour? I wanted to ask for driving directions out of town, but didn't like to discuss with him.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Croqueen
Reviews.Content: I got back from Boston on Aug. 16 and I stayed at the Park Plaza. My boyfriend and I really enjoyed the hotel, and we couldn't understand what the problem was with so many other reviewers. Our room was small, but the king bed was absolutely comfortable. We didn't get scabies, nor did we see any mice or other vermin. Our bathroom was also small but functional, and it had a double headed shower. The concierge managed to get us tickets to a Red Sox game on the day of! I thought that was impressive! The Park Plaza's main lobby is gorgeous and grand, and they have one of those "ghost" pianos that play by themselves. The floral arrangements were gorgeous! The hotel has several restaurants attached to it, and we only went to the irish pub one night because there is so much to see and do in Boston. You must try Legal Seafood Restaurant, which is a two minute walk from the hotel. For $12 you can get a tour of Fenway Park and walk on the Green Monster. The best burger I've had in a long time was found at Cheers, which is also close by to the hotel (the original Bull and Finch Pub). We used the subway system (The T) and it was fast, safe and convenient, and much cheaper then using cabs. The famous Duck Tours are well worth it, as you get to see the city by land and water. There really is so much to do and see in this great city and I would definately stay at the Park Plaza again. My only complaint is that they do charge you for local calls. I used my cell phone the entire time. Other than that I would reccomend this hotel. If you do prefer or require the larger rooms and bathrooms request a tower room, or try another more expensive hotel. The value here was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location, but rooms are in need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkiegirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference that my work was paying for. I must agree with pervious individuals that remarked about the rooms. My room was small, but had large bulky furniture that seemed to have lots of marks on it. My bed took up most of the room. The carpet seemed a bit worn. The bathroom was small and needed to be updated. The floor tiles didnâ€™t match at all the wall tiles. I know a lot of people at the conference I attended were also disappointment. The one thing I can say, it is in a great location!!!! If this hotel would renovate their rooms, it would be an amazing hotel. I do recommend staying on Towers Level Concierge, as it has a very nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Be Afraid!”
Reviews.Author: IHeartPalanga
Reviews.Content: As many others here, I was very nervous to stay at this hotel after reading some of these reviews (i.e. I believe someone mentioned their friend was sure there was a rat in their room!?). We arrived at app. 12:30 p.m. and were able to check into the room immediately. The desk staff was very friendly. I had booked through priceline and had heard that this particular hotel gave priceline customers the worst rooms. The woman at the desk asked if we minded having a king bed instead of two doubles (the default request from priceline). I indicated we would prefer the king bed and she said that the king bed room was much nicer than the two double beds room. Only at the end of the transaction did she notice that we had booked through priceline, so I do not know if that made a difference... As everyone has mentioned, the lobby is lovely and twice during the week we stayed there, I saw myself the huge fresh flower arrangements being changed. I held my breath upon opening the door to our room, nervous as to what we'd find. I was thrilled to discover our room was really quite lovely. It was a very large corner room with the king-sized bed and a sofa, desk, dresser, etc. My immediate impression was that it was very clean. The rug had no stains that I could see. The sofa had some light stains, but nothing more than I have seen at other hotels. I checked the bed for signs of bed bugs and was relieved to see nothing indicating their presence. The bed linens are all very white and surprisingly clean. I didn't even see any light staining anywhere. As some of the other reviews have mentioned, the beds are very pretty, with many pillows, etc. Being in a corner room, we had a very large, walk-in closet with lots of hangers. The bathroom was definitely just fine, although small in comparison to other hotels. Everything was clean, although you can see discolored grout, etc. We were lucky to have what appeared to be a very new bathtub. Getting ready in the bathroom is not particularly enjoyable. The sink is so small (and low?) that when trying to splash water on your face, the back of your head would actually hit a shelf above the sink. The lighting was not flattering. The toilet was about one inch away from the bathtub. The bathtub was VERY narrow. I am average size and could barely shampoo my hair without both elbows hitting the wall and shower curtain. The bathrooms might benefit from the curved shower rods being used elsewhere, except I think the toilet might be too close to use the curved rods. There was a full-length mirror, but it was deteriorating (i.e. many spots due to the "mirror" flaking off). All in all, everything was clean, but not especially easy to get ready. We stayed at the Park Plaza for eight nights and personally had an excellent visit. As others have mentioned, the location cannot be beat and we got an excellent price on priceline. HOWEVER, I do think it would be very possible to have a very unpleasant stay here, mostly depending on your luck in getting a room: 1. The elevators are definitely a huge problem. There are only six elevators for the many, many rooms in this hotel. It seemed like the weekdays were fine (very slow, but at least not packed with people), but the weekends (esp. evenings) were truly a nightmare. On the Saturday evening of our stay, there were approximately 45-50 people waiting for the elevators at one point. My husband and I walked up to the twelfth floor rather than wait. We planned on walking everyday, but discovered that the doorway from the staircase into the lobby is only unlocked for certain hours each day. In essence, you're forced to take the elevators, even if you're willing to take the stairs. (Maybe someone knows a way around this? We were afraid to set off the door alarms...) 2. We were lucky to have very quiet neighbors, but you can definitely hear EVERYTHING going on in all the rooms (and bathrooms) around you. You can hear people coming and going as loudly as if they are entering your own room. You can hear muffled conversations when people are speaking in normal tones of voice. You can hear toilets flushing and shower srunning. You'd really be in trouble if you had loud neighbors! 3. We were in a non-smoking room, but there were several times throughout the week that I could smell smoke very strongly in my room. Luckily, the windows opened. 4. There were 3-4 times over the course of the week that there was the definite smell of sewer gases coming from our bathroom, generally in the early afternoon. It would go away within an hour or so, but that was also a very strong smell. In summary, in comparison to a brand new state-of-the-art hotel, the Park Plaza is definitely not luxurious by any means. However, everything was clean (I cannot believe there would really be rats...) and, in comparison to some newer hotels I have stayed in in the heart of NYC (another big old city), the Park Plaza was really a FANTASTIC old hotel. If I had paid $250-300, I would probably be disappointed simply because it was not a refreshing, luxurious hotel. If I get the Park Plaza in a priceline bid again, though, I'll look forward to my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Tripper1Birmingham
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in this hotel. Our room was on the 5th floor and was a good size with a large bathroom. The bed linen bright white with about eight pillows!
