The Staff were very friendly and helpful and the surrounding bars and restaurants were great. Location was perfect for shopping and access to the subway "T". If we had to say of any fault, it was that the TV in the room was old and the picture not great, but we didn't have much time to watch it anyway.

Reviews.Title: “The not so upgraded experience”
Reviews.Author: Meyta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and has lots of history. The rooms are pretty with classic beauty. (not incredibly fancy). In my personal experience the main problem with this hotel is the lack of motivation, dedication and customer focus from all the staff. The Ugly I had to open my own door and drag my luggage from the cab to registration while bellstaff and porter spent their time conversing. I had to drag my luggage to the executive level (The upgraded experience). I arrived into a room of medium size and average amenities only to find a toilet which had been used and not flushed. The fermentation caused for fetid gases to float all around me My room also had a desk with a white crust that I could scratch out with my nail. lots of it (food perhaps). On my closet door I noticed a few stains of what appeared to be dried blood. I notified my "special" concierge in my "special" floor of the problems and requested his help in addresing the issues while I went out for dinner. Upon my return I walked into the same nightmare. When I approached him again he offered an alternate room and gave me a key if I wanted to go take a look prior to relocating. This one had lovely long hairs in the room evidence of a prior guest with a lush mane... When I requested the opportunity to talk to a Manager on Duty I was told by my "special" concierge that they did not have one. Finally he located someone from the front desk who assisted with finding me a clean room. I am now in my clean room enjoying rather comfortable linens, I took a bath in my clean bathroom with a missing shower mat or rug. the water pressure was low but the water was sufficiently hot. To be continued... I still have 5 more days

Reviews.Title: “no problems with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: harrypotterLiverpool
Reviews.Content: I was very worried about staying in this hotel after reading previous reviews but I had no problems. Our room was big enough for the two of us and yes we only had one bathroom and we managed to cope with no problems. the room was clean yes the a/c was noisy but it did the job. My only complaint was that we could not check in until 3pm and after a 7 hour flight from Manchester England were in need of a shower but thats life. the hotel was in a great location and the price suited us. We were in Boston for 3 days to see the sights and not to spend our time inside a hotel room I think some people need to remember that when posting their comments.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't warn you away quick enough”
Reviews.Author: SouthrnSkyz
Reviews.Content: I can say nothing favorable about this hotel. The lobby is nice. That's one thing. At first I thought it was just because we had a smoking room, but the rooms in this hotel are repulsive. Old, greasy carpet, very small bathrooms with very little space for more than one person's things... the hotel bar, for example, won't make you a Long Island Iced Tea because there are 5 liqours in it. Neither will the hotel bar allow you to grab a glass of wine and take it up to your wife... you must go through room service where they can charge you a ton and coax a tip out of you. No officially available wireless internet in the hotel lobby or mezzanine. TV connection and remotes are lousy and unreliable. The windows are old, the paint is old. The room doors don't shut properly without some elbow grease applied. The AC in the room is hit or miss. There is radiator heat in the bathroom for God's sake. The staff is capable for the most part but this hotel is thumbs down all the way. We stayed at the Westin on the waterfront one night before we came here and I would give my left arm to go back there. What a nice surprise that was and what a disappointment the Park Plaza is! I wouldn't book a hamster into this hotel. Someone said the Park Plaza is old but has a reputation, well let me tell you the reputation is as old and dirty as the carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better then I was thinking...”
Reviews.Author: TriptakerPhoenix_AZ
Reviews.Content: I was very worried when I read all the reviews of this hotel. I am happy to say, that I stayed at this hotel for 3 nites at the end of July and was very impressed by the property. Yes, I will agree that the air conditioning was not the best, but this seems a pattern in the east. The rooms were very large, since we had requested a deluxe room, we had two bathrooms, it was clean and I didn't hear any extra noise. The location was great and the beds were very comfortable. I never had to wait for an elevator and the hotel had everything that I could need at my fingertip. I would absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected, With the Right Room”
Reviews.Author: Maxwell421
Reviews.Content: My wife attended a conference at this hotel, and since the accommodations were arranged for us, we didn't get a chance to choose our lodgings. We chose to take our six year old son with us and to extend our stay to enjoy Boston while we were there. After reading the reviews on this site, I was a little apprehensive and even considered moving to a different hotel for our extra nights, but I am glad that we didn't do that. We received a deluxe room with two queen beds, and I highly recommend requesting such a room. It was actually two old (and small) hotel rooms with the wall between them removed to make one large room with two bathrooms. The bathrooms were small, but we didn't mind that a bit, since my wife and I had separate ones and were never in each other's way. We didn't have a view from our room, but the size and comfort of the room itself made up for it. We did get a chance to see the standard rooms that other conference attendees had, and we agreed that a standard room with a single bathroom would have been much too small. We really had no complaints about the hotel otherwise. It is an old hotel, and it shows its age in many ways, but it is mostly clean, and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice-n-pricey!”
Reviews.Author: MissJessica
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying three nights at the Park Plaza for a business trip with three colleagues. I have to admit that I was a little nervous after reading some of the other reviews on here, but ended up having a pleasant experience. The room was a fine size for one in the heart of the city, clean, and with a nice view. The hotel was conveniently located in the theatre district and close to world class shopping and dining on Newbury Street, as well as Boston Common. The staff was mostly friendly and efficient (the front desk clerk was abrupt when I called about the internet service, but everyone else was nice). The concierge had very little information on our conference, but that could have been the fault of the organizers, rather than the hotel itself. Room service was prompt and the food was passable...the bar in the hotel lobby had poor service. Overall, the hotel could use a bit of an update in terms of decor, but it's still quite nice, felt safe and fairly well served. It's crazy that they charge for internet access (and $10+ per day!), but I had no choice--I needed access. Otherwise, I'd return (and wish I could for the same discounted group rate; this place is quite pricey!).

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: VaSand
Reviews.Content: We just returned from one of our favorite cities...Boston. The hotel was fabulous.....Rooms extremely clean and the beds were the most comfortable I have experienced in a hotel. On our last day we ate in the bar and, believe it or not, they had best clam chowder ...the french onion soup was outstanding... however, it would have been the best if they had used the right cheese. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Too Small”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBoston2007
Reviews.Content: The hotel being in the middle of Boston and near the parks is probably the best thing I can say. The room was small, the bed was way to small, my husband slept on the floor the first night, and let's not even talk about the bathroom. You had to close the door to get to the sink and the toliet was right against the tub. And while taking a shower you had to stand sideways. And the day we were leaving the fire alarm went off, I think I was the only one in my nightgown, where was everyone else. It was very unorganized.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: tas1060
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Boston a few days ago and as we look back on our trip we realized what a great hotel the Park Plaza was. First off the location was great! The hotel was located near one of th "T" subway system stops. Within one block was Budget and Hertz car rental garages. The hotel rooms were extremely clean and nice looking. The room we stayed in had a good view of the city of Boston aswell. The bathrooms were clean and good looking, and the showers were great with duel shower heads. The only bad thing we had happen to us while we were there was the fire alarm sounding in the middle of the night! Still, this is a great hotel and I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience for Us”
Reviews.Author: family_travelerKC
Reviews.Content: Our experience here was very pleasant. The room was comfortable, service was good - we aren't demanding, paid about $153 for a deluxe room, the location was great. Walked almost everywhere (Fenway, Fanueil Hall, Aquarium.) The subway is close. I am a mom and traveled with my teenaged son. When we checked in we asked for a newer room, as another reviewer recommended. Our room was a "deluxe" - formerly two small rooms - enlarged to one. We each had our own bathroom The bathrooms are tiny. It did occur to me that a large person would not be comfortable in the space. The air conditioner had to work to keep the room cooled, but we were comfortable. Our room on the 14th floor was quiet with minimal outside noise. The bed linens were very nice - lots of pillow and a big fluffy comforter. Two comfortable sitting chairs. Smaller but sufficient desk. Good light blocking windows with great light during the day. Internal view of other buildings was not impressive, but we didn't care. About Boston - the people were almost always very friendly and helpful. We noticed a code of acceptance around town to stretch your child's age by a year or two younger for a lower fare or entry fee. We saved the $20+ cab fare on our way back to the airport by taking the green line and transferring to the blue at Governament Center for a total ride of $2 each. The subway is dingy and hot in summer, but safe. In short, the Boston Park Plaza hotel met our needs with price, location, comfort and service. If you must have NEW everything or would not feel comfortable in the small bathrooms, then it probably isn't the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice”
Reviews.Author: Lousviews
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an old, outdated and unclean hotel property and you're willing to spend $200+ night, this is the place. The customer service was average at best, the rooms (original room we were given had a shower with cracked and moldy (and I mean MOLDY) tiles, the smoke detector was falling off the ceiling, and the AC was terrible. For a landmark historic hotel, I was very disappointed to find that it in such poor condition. I would strongly recommend seeking other hotels in the same area. Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as what I've read”
Reviews.Author: MontrealCanadian
Reviews.Content: I must admit, I was terribly concerned when I found out Priceline chose this Hotel the weekend of June 30th what with all the negative reviews I had been reading online, but I have to say it was not as bad as I expected it to be. The room was clean, nice, with amenities in the bathroom so nothing to complain about there. I got super pleasant service from the front desk which I liked, and the location was amazing. My only negative was the noisy neighbor (with children) next door who I could hear day and night unless I had the TV turned on at a loud level. Other than that, the elevators were crowded and that's really about it. It's a historical hotel so it was interesting to read about it in the Guest book provided in the room, as well as quite beautiful, grand and stately.

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever!”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter15
Reviews.Content: Warning - do not stay at this hotel unless you can afford a penthouse suite. Our room was the size of most normal hotel bathrooms. It was a tiny room with a tiny bed that my husband and I could both barely fit in. The airconditioner made aweful hissing noises. The AC was not broken it was just that the building is so old that the AC comes out of some old radiator looking thing. Now if you think the room was small, the bathroom was the size of a closet. The shower was not a typical shower. It was more like a foot bath. There is no way someone over 5'3" can fit in that "shower". There was no hairdryer or conditioner. Only soap and shampoo were provided. Don't let the deals persuade you. Cough up the extra $20 and stay at a real hotel with real hotel rooms. This hotel really put a black cloud over our time in Boston. Don"t make the same mistake we did.

Reviews.Title: “not so COOL”
Reviews.Author: thetravelingdos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Plaza from June 26- July 2, 2007, Hotel is in a great location, close to the Boston Common and the public park. Close to the subway, and taxis are always waiting right outside. People in this part of town are not very friendly or helpful. Our first nights stay was a bit warm and the next day was the hottest day in Boston since 1941. Our air conditioner was not working correctly. We called guest services and they sent someone up right away. He worked on it for a few mins. said it would be cooled off in 20 mins. and after we returned from dinner 2 1/2 hours later it was still not working. They offered us another room which we gladly accepted. The entire airconditioning system needs a major upgrade. There are no air vents in the area of the elevators which are REALLY slow. It was so warm in the lobby that the fresh flowers were wilting 2 days after the arrangement was put in. The rooms are small since it is an older hotel. The bathrooms are a bit small but managable. The beds were really comfortable and there are lots of pillows. The walls are very thin and the doorways very narrow going into the rooms. You hear alot of street noise inside your room. Restaurants in this area are pretty pricey. For the location, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “don't be scared by negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: blrn1
Reviews.Content: My sister & I spent a long weekend in Boston last week, staying at the Boston Park Plaza Hotel. Reading some of the reviews made me nervous, but once we got there, everything was fine. We were given an even better room than what we had expected (two double beds instead of one queen, and nonsmoking). Yes, it was small, but it's a really old building. We expected that much. It was clean. The front desk & concierge were very helpful; we had absolutely no complaints with the service or any unexpected charges. The location, as other reviewers have mentioned, is fantastic! We walked everywhere we wanted to go, and always felt safe coming back to our room after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: oakney1
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through Priceline. The hotel is close to shopping and nice restaurants. A beautiful park is 1 block away. The room was small, but very clean. Beds were comfortable. Bathroom was small, but very clean. Great shower. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre customer service, great location”
Reviews.Author: faura
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location in Boston, at the South West cornert of Boston Commons, and walking distance to Chinatown and even places like Fenway Park. Boston's a small city, so walking almost anywhere is possible. The building also houses a couple of restaurants. We tried Finale, which is an incredible dessert place. At first, the prices seemed a little high for dessert, but they were worth every cent. I wanted to go back every night. Apart from that, the hotel was a bit of a disappointment. We had problems with check-in, parking, room service and the lobby restaurant. At check-in, they said no rooms despite a reservation, and the manager had to be called. With parking, no valets were available, so we had to find a garage on our own near the hotel. For room service, they forgot a few items and delivered well past the promised time, and the lobby restaurant service was bad - a lack of waiters, and drinks took half an hour to arrive. The room was small and very subdued looking. Very clean and tidy, though. I've seen better furnishings in comfort inns. The in-room internet service didn't work and we were still charged for it. The view was into other people's hotel rooms, a few feet away.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: MarsAndJojo
Reviews.Content: 1 - Paid upgrade for a room through Travelocity and was denied the upgrade upon check-in. Explanation was "we do not guarantee upgrades when you book online, our customers have priority". We then asked to be refunded for the upgrade we paid for and were told to contact Travelocity, that they were not responsible. 2 - Internet service @ $12.95 per day!!! ---> Hidden charge. 3 - Parking @ $38.00 per day!!! ---> Hidden charge. I strongly recommend you avoid this hotel. However, Boston is a fantastic city, you should go visit, we will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Average older hotel”
Reviews.Author: lycheefruit
Reviews.Content: We got a room at this hotel after practically ever hotel in the city was booked full for Boston area graduations. Evidently, this is a historical location in the center of Boston. The hotel had some positives. It was a great location, and I was able to walk to many tourist-y attractions from the hotel. The freedom walk is close, as is Boston's central park, and the high-end shopping area is just a couple of streets over. There are a lot of chain restaurants within a block or two of the hotel, such as Au Bon Pain, Legal Seafoods, P.F. Chang's, California Pizza Kitchen, and others (Italian, Irish, etc.). The subway, or "T", is also a couple of blocks away and gave me easy access to other parts of the city. The lobby is really nice, and there are a couple of restaurants and a bar (which I did not try). The front desk employees were attentive, quick, and pleasant, and the concierge was really helpful in providing maps and information about the historical sights in the area. However, overall the hotel was average to below average. The rooms were really, really small, including the bathrooms. The bathrooms had a full sized shower and bath with a curved shower rod to maximize space and a pedestal sink. The water pressure was low, and the water in the toilet and the bottom of the shower often would become covered in sediment from the pipes/water. It was one of those bathrooms where you had to shut the door to really use it, since it was so small. The towels were old and really thin, not the plush, large towels you like to see at this price-range of a hotel. The tile floor was dingy, and was either stained or flat-out dirty. The bedroom was ok, just small and a bit dingy. The furniture was a bit beat up, and I had to reconnect the cable to the TV myself to get it to work. Internet access (not wireless) was available, but it was about $12 a day. There was a desk and chair to work at. The king sized bed was pretty comfortable, and the linens are all washable (I hate it when they have the gross, never-washed comforters, so this was a plus for me). The room was clean as well. The walls, however, were really thin, and I could hear every conversation the man in the room next to me had (including rather unpleasant screaming matches laced with obscenities with his wife/girlfriend). The room services was AWFUL. I tried it a couple of times, and it really was bad. The breakfast was barely warm, and the quality was poor. The belgian waffle (!) was so bad, I couldn't even eat it. The spaghetti was unpalatable. I haven't had room service this bad in a long time. And, it took upwards of 45-1 hour to receive food, and it was really expensive, with service, some sort of room service tax in addition to regular taxes, and a hotel surcharge or something included. The room service delivery employees were also not very pleasant and seemed really annoyed when you didn't give them a tip above the 20% tip already included. One even took the bill from me, and, after noticing I had forgotten to put the hotel pen back in the fold, said contemptuously: "uh, are you going to give me my pen?" When I gave it to her, she grabbed it, spun around without saying a word, and slammed the door. If you forgot to put a "privacy please" hanger on your door, housekeeping was knocking (and quickly entering) by 8:30 am. Overall, I was pretty disappointed with this hotel. It was just average, but it was represented as a really high-quality, landmark hotel. I wouldn't stay here again. Note: We were told it was a Starwood property, but that is a misnomer. It is partially owned by Starwood, but does not participate in SPG.

Reviews.Title: “What A Wonderful Hotel-Boston Park Plaza”
Reviews.Author: QueenTofu
Reviews.Content: Boston Park Plaza is a wonderful place! My husband and I stayed here because the location was in the middle of everything. If you want to eat seafood, there's Legal Seafoods, Finale, PF Changs, Dunkin Doughnuts, Maggino's, etc. If you like St. Francis, Sir Francis Drake or Chancellor Hotel in San Francisco; you will love this place. It is old, funky and luxury. The service is impeccable and everyone is helpful. It has several restaurants within the hotel. It has great tea time at Swan Cafe. We stayed at the Towers on 15th floor. We had our own conceirge, breakfast room, and h'orderves. We were able to watch from a plasma tv and use the computer anytime. Apples and water were always available. The conceirge printed our boarding passes, check our iterinary before we were traveling the next day. Great services. The Grey Line tours are only 2 blocks away. We were able to hope off to Plymouth to see the rock and the Plimoth Plantation. Plymouth has the cheapest postcards, shirts and souvenirs. The tour line offers trips to Cape Cod, Salem, etc. GLines offer a trolley line too. You can use it for two days. Check with the driver when they end their trips for the day. One woman was stranded because they've passed her stop. They took her to the next stop after she discovered they stop trips after 2:30. On another day, they stop at 4. Always ask. The trolley stops all over town. Tips: Cheap theater tickets at BOS tix booth at Faneli Hall area. All tickets are 1/2 off. Cheap sweatshirts in Boston are found at the carts on the wharf by the aquarium. They are 2/$20. Great Boston chowder-Union Oyster House and Legal Seafood JFK used to eat at Union Oyster House. Go at 2 or 3 when the lunch crowd is not there. Boston Museum of Fine Art is a giant museum. Attend the current show with Edward Hopper. Rent $6 headphone guide. It is worth it. If you want to see other art works, it will take all day. Eat prior to the museum. Food is expensive for what you get. Great buildings all around town. Check out the Federal Building made with recycle aluminium and the buildings at MIT. Harvard is Harvard. Bill Gates and Bill Clinton were in town when we were there. Boston is history! I just need another week to see it all.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice....”
Reviews.Author: NycTravelgirl30
Reviews.Content: I was with a group of friends the Friday after Thanksgiving 2006 until Monday. Being from NYC, I thought Boston would have been hopping this time of year, but it was not... It was perfect! The weather was great, the hotel was nice, and the lobby bar staff was friendly. Only negative, which turned into a positive was that we had been woken up one morning (after a rough night on the town) by someone literally putting down new carpet in the room next to us. The constant banging made me call the front desk and ask them to stop, but they went above and beyond... They sent up a bell hop immediately and relocated us to the top floor â€“ with our own concierge and private cash bar that had free snacks throughout the day and free internet. I donâ€™t even want to say how much we paid because we were on a group rate, it was VERY low. I was even able to have my friends come up to the private bar and we were the only ones in there with our own bartender. Absolutely the best trip ever! They treated us like first class people, even though we arenâ€™t. All the rooms had crisp white bed linens and on the top floor, we even had bath robes and slippers in the closet, which none of our friends had. Will definitely stay there on our annual trip next year.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints from us!”
Reviews.Author: zachsaunt
Reviews.Content: Spent this past Saturday night at the Boston Park Plaza Hotel and Towers and have not one complaint. Arrived at 11:30 a.m. and was greeted by a very friendly door man, proceeded into the grandest hotel lobby I have seen. It was beautful. In passing by the bellman, he spoke and asked if we were headed to the game and pointed us in the direction of the front desk. The staff was helpful and pleasant and told us our room was ready and waiting. We stayed on the Tower Level, the 15th floor which has its own private elevator and check in. Our room was clean and tidy. Yes, the bathroom was small, but really, how much time does one spend in there? The tub was extra deep, the towels were pleantiful and fluffy. They provided us with a welcome snack as well as a bottle of water and while we were at the game, came in and turned our bed down and left mints on the pillows. We could hear the traffic on the street but we chose a hotel IN the city, I think its to be expected. We just turned the fan on the A/C up and the only noise from below we could hear was the occasional siren. We didnt hear other guests or even those in the hallway. We ordered room service for both lunch and a late dinner. The staff was friendly and when they said 30 minutes, it was 30 minutes. The food arrived hot and it was presented very nicely. Checking out was a breeze and we would stay here again. We walked to and from the game at Fenway and there are no complaints from us.

Reviews.Title: “If you have booked already and are terrified by the bad reviews, READ THIS!”
Reviews.Author: alpine326
Reviews.Content: I booked a "European style" room at this hotel through Expedia because it was the cheapest find for the location. After booking I started reading the reviews and was very nervous about my choice, but there was nothing to do because the deposit was non-refundable. I needn't have worried; our stay was absolutely fine. Yes, there is truth to the bad reviews -- the rooms are small, the bathroom tile is somewhat dingy (though clean), the air conditioning wasn't impeccable.. but it was adorable and comfortable and clean and quiet and fantastically located and completely suitable for our weekend. The bed and pillows were comfortable, the shower was excellent, and all the staff we dealt with were extremely friendly. So really, this hotel is all about your expectations. Those who expected a 4-star completely modern room would inevitably be disappointed, but for us, who expected a small but functional room in a beautiful old hotel for an excellent city price, this was a great choice. I never write reviews but just wanted to comfort anyone who might be as terrified by the awful reviews here as I was!

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst ever”
Reviews.Author: snark12
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel, which they proudly highlight. I get that it's old and I'll cut it some slack. Maybe that adds charm. But this is one of the worst places I've ever stayed. While the room was large, it was also filthy and smelled. The rug was stained, the bed was uncomfortable, the shades wouldn't close to keep the room dark, and there were strange noises at night. But the real crowning touch was the bathroom. My room used to be a very, very small room with a very, very small bathroom in the early part of the 20th century, apparently, and they made it into one reasonably sized bedroom (by modern standards) and two incredibly tiny bathrooms. I literally couldn't use the toilet in either one without putting one leg in the tub. What's amazing is they upgraded the faucets and such to modern, high-end equipment. They added Internet and on-demand movies (both didn't work in my room). But they left the old, old laundry hampers on the door from the days when you'd put your suit in the door for the valet to take out to clean at night. If this was only $100-150/night then maybe it would be better. But at $400/night it's highway robbery. This hotel should be gutted and completely renovated. On the plus side, the staff was very helpful and courteous. I can't save service was "good," though, because there were a lot of mistakes. Twice room service tried to deliver someone else's food to my door. They inexplicably deactivated my room key in the middle of my stay. We asked to get the Internet fixed in the room and they couldn't do it. Be afraid, very afraid.

Reviews.Title: “Well Below Expectations - Should be Closed Down and Completely Renovated”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveler312
Reviews.Content: Being a frequent business traveler, I have stayed in hotels all over the US, including many in rural locations where business-class hotels are simply not available. Moreover, I have stayed in several New York and Boston hotels where the sheer cost leaves me to feel shortchanged. Yet, the Boston Park Plaza was one of the worst values and the biggest disappointments so far Across the street from the Four Seasons and near the Boston Commons, this hotel is in great location. Combined with a stately faÃ§ade and posh lobby, my initial impression was very favorable. In fact, there was a Lamborghini parked in front of the Whiskey, which is in the same building. Sadly, my initial high expectations led to a huge disappointment when I ultimately saw the room. Even before reaching my floor, I was getting the impression the hotel was not operating anywhere near that of a five star property. The first red flag was the rather heated discussion I had with the front desk associate who tried to put me in a smoking room. At first, he claimed my corporate travel agent had requested a smoking room. When I produced a printout of my reservations that clearly said â€œNonsmoking requestedâ€�, he indicated that it was only a request. Okay then, so I specifically did NOT request a smoking room. In the end, I was given a nonsmoking â€œdeluxeâ€� room, which was far worse than those in most mid-tier suburban motels. The first thirty second experience upon entering the room gave me the â€œyou have got to be kidding meâ€� feeling. The furniture was rickety and circa 1970. There were many visible gouges and scratches â€“ almost as if it appeared that much it was acquired at a thrift shop. But what irritated me most was that the desk was so small and the chair so uncomfortable. It was extremely difficult to work. Instead of having a nicely padded chair to use while working, the hotel provides its customer with what appears to be thirty-year-old dining room chairs that have been garbage picked. While I was most concerned about my productivity, it was quite a shock to see the condition of the aesthetic elements of the room. There were visible stains all over the carpet and scratches on the walls. Giving the hotel the benefit of doubt, these items could be ascribed to wear and tear and poor planning of capital investments. But wait for the real shocker â€“ the bathrooms (oddly, my room had two tiny bathrooms). When first glancing around diminutive bathrooms with their old fixtures and tiles, disappointment quickly sets in. This disappointment turns to shock when opening the shower curtain. What could be so obviously horrible about a shower even before it is turned on? The size. They were not large enough for an average-sized adult. The stalls were a bizarre irregular shape that was about two feet wide and two and a half feet long. The showerheads were angled into the perpendicular wall, making it very difficult to shower more than a small part of the body at a time. This is absolutely crazy. Many of the aforementioned problems were mere irritations that made the stay unpleasant. However, other problems severely impacted my sleep. While the mattress was mediocre, the pillows were absolute junk. They were the cheapest, overstuffed polyfill products imaginable. The whole night while rolling around, I was debating whether to sleep with them, bunch up a towel, or use nothing at all. There is no excuse for what the Boston Park Plaza is making its guests endure. This hotel should be closed and gutted. You were warned.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here if you don't have to”
Reviews.Author: Lanikuhonua
Reviews.Content: I was feeling ambivalent after reading the various experiences of people who have stayed here, so I emailed reservations and never received a response. Sure to form - when I checked in on 5/4/07, I was placed in the smallest room - Room 999. This room was located behind the elevators, the bed was awful in quality, the shower was about 1.5 feet wide and 3 feet long, and it was SUPER SMALL for over $200/night. It was horrible! I came in around midnight and the night supervisor (name started with a "T") put me in this room. The following morning, I spoke with another front desk woman who subsequently booked me in the Imperial Suite (a bigger room on the 10th floor). If it wasn't for her - I would have definitely hated this hotel. The rooms are not well furnished and if you are a bed person - the quality of beds is terrible. Additionally, it's a hit or miss regarding hotel service. Most front desk staff are really awful - while some concierge are great. The only thing great about this hotel is it's location to Boston Commons and restaurants. Went to Finale (great dessert place) and a Northern Italian Restaurant concierge recommended (although $$$$$). Avoid this hotel if you can. You may not be so lucky to get a suite after they purposefully book you in a crappy room - depending on who you talk to and who is willing to give you the exceptional service you deserve considering you are paying about $200/night. I could get a nicer hotel room in Hawaii for that price - and Hawaii is very high re: room prices.

Reviews.Title: “Price makes the Plaza worth it”
Reviews.Author: irishlad70
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Boston Park Plaza and Towers and must say , the reviews and the hotel can greatly differ based on the type of travel, the traveler themselves, and the expectation level. I was lucky enough to find a rate on Hotwire.com for less than $100 a night. For a downtown hotel in the heart of Boston, near the Pablic Garden , that is nearly can't miss. The hotel is old. I'll give reviewers that point. The lobby is grand and very nice. Again, point awarded. Check in was smooth and my room was on the 10th floor. The room was small, and somewhat stuffy, but very managable. With window light and two beside tables, more than enough light. Bathroom was incredibly small, but again, managable. Only compliant i had regarding the bathroom: the shower liner (seemed to be covering an older bathtub) was ill fitting and creaked loudly when stepped on. The dual shower head more than made up for it. Bed was small , but comfortable. Plenty of pillows. Older style tv, but good quality. Overall , a suitable room for $100. Note: would i have paid $180-$200 for the same room? No, not even close. But for the money? It was worth it. Excellent location, had no problems with the staff, housekeeping was friendly and attentive. Would suggest travelers take the time to research the hotel they are staying at prior to booking. Cost makes staying here pleasant . If more for your money is what you are looking for, it'd be wise to consider other options. Not at all a slam against the Hotel. They have obviously tried to make a number of improvements where they can, and with an older building, that might be hard to accomplish.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy neighbors interrupted sleep”
Reviews.Author: kevralkhai
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Park Plaza for a conference held in their ballroom. First of all, the place is lovely. The ballroom was spectacular, and the common areas are elegant. However, the room was attractive, but not well laid out. I was staying alone in a standard sized room with a queen bed and a small bathroom. The TV is perpendicular to the bed and there was only one chair which was upholstered, but a bit heavy for moving from desk to corner for TV viewing. The bed was a bit soft, but the sheets and pilows nice. The windows all faced out onto city streets (though many of the hotels rooms faced interior.) There were 2 blinds to pull down--one which filtered light, and a heavier one which blocked light, though not along the sides of the window (there were no curtains.) The food was good (room service) though pricey. I parked in the motormart garage and walked across the street and half a block down to the hotel. For this I paid $28 per 24 hours. The fitness center was smallish and in a windowless basement room--clearly an after thought. I tried to walk down the steps form my 5th flor room to get to the fitness room. The stairs were open and the sign said they went down to the lobby--however, they ended at a fire door to the outside with no lobby access at all. The real problem with this hotel, however, was the 3 interrupted nights of sleep I had here. The first night the rooms around me were quiet, but the alarm clock in my room went off at 5:00 and again at 5:20 (apparently, someone had set both alarms on the clock.) The second night, the 4 college-aged girls in the next room woke me when they returned loud and drunk at around 2 am. After no let up for 10 minutes, I complained to the front desk and they stopped about 10 minutes later. The third night I was awaken at 5:30 by a screaming (not crying, but screaming) baby which sounded upstairs from me. The walls and ceilings/floors in this old hotel are paper-thin. I have stayed in many large convention/meeting hotels. They are usually much quieter than this. If I have a meeting at this hotel in the future, I will stay in a quieter place nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for the right price”
Reviews.Author: BosLass
Reviews.Content: I'm a local, but have stayed here several times for nights out in Boston, or celebrations etc. I can understand all the complaining if you paid a high rate, but if you get a deal on Priceline like many have, it's an excellent choice. You can walk to the common and public garden, and the nearest T stop is 2 minutes away. There are plenty of places to eat nearby as well. There is an au bon pain located in the same building, as well as a good Irish pub (though of the fake variety) there are also many restaurants within walking distance. The last time I stayed I got a lovely double room for $70 per night on Priceline, it was a front facing room, with a large comfortable bed. I realize there are many older, less luxurious rooms, but if you ask for a new room they will accomodate you if something is available. Would I pay more than $100 for this place? Certainly not, but if you get it for that or less, it's a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “BOSTON PARK PLAZA RIPS OFF ITS CUSTOMERS”
Reviews.Author: keltNH
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few times. If you are unlucky -- you are put in a room about the size of a large closet. Stuffy, and windows that don't open. I hated it. That is not what I am complaining about here - but that is true above. They also took my reservation - which somehow got mixed in with priceline.com/starwood hotels (which it didn't say) -- COMPLETELY screwed up the reservation I made -- wrong # people, wrong #beds, and wrong TYPE of room -- they (in)conveniently put me at the concierge level which cost almost TWICE what I had ordered. And refused to change it! So I canceled this erroneous reservation within 10 minutes after receiving this screwed up reservation , but... THEY REFUSED TO CREDIT MY CREDIT CARD!!!! I am still out $610.38 on my credit card from these highway robbers!!! BUYER BEWARE: THESE HOTELS AND ONLINE RESERVATION COMPANIES WILL STEAL YOU BLIND -- AND APPARENTLY IT'S LEGAL!!!???? How is that possible???? You CANNOT JUST KEEP MY MONEY FOR YOUR MISTAKE!!!! THAT IS ILLEGAL. PARK PLAZA/PRICELINE.COM/STARWOOD HOTELS: I will pursue you and this til my dying day. YOU THIEVES - I told you I will post my experience about you over the internet and file complaints w/ the BBB and Atty Generals office and you snottily responded that I could do what I want.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't the deal we thought”
Reviews.Author: Gwen728
Reviews.Content: The lobby is quite grand, but our room was nothing special - beds were AWFUL, doubles that sagged in the middle. Window wouldn't shut, so had a brisk breeze (and it was 30 degrees outside). Handle missing from bureau, so couldn't open it. No refrigerator or safe. Very small room. Columbus Ave rooms are immediately above a nightclub that let's out at 2:30pm. Both Friday and Saturday were awakened by yelling and horn honking that went on for 10-15 minutes. Will NEVER book a room on that side of the hotel again. Also - got a great deal through Expedia, but didn't find out until later that they only have valet parking - for $38/day!! Probably won't stay there again, even if it were $50/night. Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Clueless Staff, Lousy Rooms, Awful Service for too much $$”
Reviews.Author: avatartv
Reviews.Content: Checking in was just the the start of my problems on this business trip. Slow and inefficient, the staff was unable to recommend any place for a meal, even with so many restaurants. around. We found one on our own in the rain. Each time a question was asked, we were met with shrugs and blank looks. Room was advertised with a refridge... NOT THERE. Internet NOT THERE. Although after tinkering for about an hour, a phone call to the front desk revealed that some rooms had internet disabled and it would talk a few days to fix. Then, while in my nightclothes a knock at the door. The genius at the desk decided that they should change my room so I could have internet, without asking me if I wanted to do so.. I informed the bell man at my door that I was not prepared to move. So he had to go get me new key as the desk had canceled the ones I had. After receiving my new key. I bed down for the evening only to be disturbed by housekeeping. They were insistent that I had checked out and wanted me to vacate the room. I sent them away with a not so nice tone and a phone call to the desk was made. This is just one fun thing... so many others. Screw ups on the room service menu, really BAD service at the steak house. Burned carpets, small dingy rooms...it goes on. But the worst was the bathrooms. I'm all for old world charm, but I need some space. I'm not too big, six foot.. not at all overweight. MAN IT"S TIGHT IN THERE! Without getting too descript... there's hardly a place to sit down. Believe me as funny as it may sound..I'M NOT KIDDING HERE. It's downright claustrophobic. You can't do what you came there to do. All in all.. I won't be back. The help could care less and the hotel is nothing special. I'd stay at a Holiday Inn Express before I'd go back. It isn't the money.. the job pays for that... but I wasn't comfortable, the services I needed weren't available and the people just don't care.

Reviews.Title: “Hate this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamcenil
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel! We booked two rooms through Expedia and did not receive the rooms we requested. When we pushed for the double rooms we requested, we were informed that since we booked through Expedia there was no way they could guarantee our room request would be granted. This response was extremely frustrating, especially since we would not have booked this hotel if not for Expedia. It is infuriating that they reap the benefits of Expedia's booking system, but fail to hold up their end of the bargain. After some serious complaining, they moved us to king-sized rooms, versus the queens they wanted to give us. However, we received numerous disturbances from the hotel service staff regarding the room change. Additionally, the valet service could not get their act together - it took about 30 minutes to get our car.

Reviews.Title: “Park Plaza, you've got a problem...”
Reviews.Author: watfam
Reviews.Content: My husband, children and I stayed one night at the Park Plaza last weekend (3/31/07-4/1/07). The reason for our stay was that one of my daughters was modelling in the American Girl Fashion Show and Tea, which was being held in the Park Plaza's Imperial ballroom. Even though we are from Boston, we thought it would be fun to stay overnight in town, especially since she had five shows over two days. I booked the room on-line via the hotel's website, which was straightforward and easy to use. The room rate seemed reasonable. The location is great and it's a beautiful, grand old hotel. The problems started at check-in. My husband attempted to check us in at check-in time (3:00pm) but the room wasn't ready. Not a huge deal, but mildly annoying. It was ready within the hour. The room, itself, was disappointing. It is outdated, the television was old and didn't work properly, the phone didn't work properly, and there was this old exercise bike next to the bed. Next, my husband and daughter took showers and the tub leaked, flooding the bathroom. My husband immediately called guest services, explained what happened, and was told that someone would be up to take care of it. This was about 5:30pm. He and my daughter and son left the room to go to our 6pm dinner reservation. My other daughter and I returned to the room from the fashion show, not knowing any of this, to find the flooded bathroom. We could not even use the toilet because of all the water. I noticed the message light flashing on the phone. The message was from an engineer who had been up to inspect the problem (pretty quick response considering only about a half hour had passed). He reported that the tub needs a new liner, but, for now, he had poked a hole in it to allow the water to escape. He also said that housekeeping would be up momentarily to clean up the bathroom. That was a little before 6pm. When we returned from dinner, after 8:30pm, the bathroom was as the engineer had left it -- a watery mess. I called guest services to complain. They sent housekeeping up -- it took about a half hour. And they never replenished the towels that had been used to mop up the floor. The took the wet towels and left us with the one that hadn't been used! My husband, irate at this point, called the front desk to complain. They passed him along from person to person. He was able to vent, but got no satisfaction -- no apology for the inconvenience, no offer to move to another room, nothing. So, for about $250.00 we got a room at the Park Plaza for about 18 hours, five of which included the flood bathroom. Not a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great vlaue”
Reviews.Author: Jdg68
Reviews.Content: I booked the Park Plaza to stay for a friends wedding. After reading some of the reviews on here I did get a bit worried that I'd down the wrong thing. I needn't had. Hotel was in a great location, spotless and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than I Thought it Would Be”
Reviews.Author: planetgirl
Reviews.Content: I had a better experience than what I thought I would have, overall. No real negatives. There was a blizzard but I had a nice view (I asked - they gave). Good bed with lots of nice pillows, a dual showerhead, v. clean, room service was prompt, front desk was courteous, housekeeping friendly. My only real complaint was there was no mini-bar/fridge. This is an older, more traditionally furnished hotel, but still fairly nice - or at least my room was. The concierge gave us free dining certificates for McCormick and Schmicks. Once there, we were told they were not supposed to hand those out. In turn, the restaurant mgr. gave us 2 dining certificates and a round of drinks (ticket) to make up for the confusion. The food at this restaurant is very good. Quality seafood. FYI, the Four Seasons is around the corner if you are looking for a more elegant, less pretentious lounge. I had afternoon tea there. Excellent with excellent service. About $26 pp w/out the champagne. I booked through Hotwire w/ a fee of about $100 per night. The daily rate through the reservation desk was $200 per night. Even though SPG is listed as a partner, this hotel is privately managed so I wouldn't have been able to use my SPG benefits or get airline miles. I would stay here again even though I don't like huge, corporate hotels very much. The location is pretty convenient to anything you might want to do in the city. Both the Green Line and Orange Line are fairly close and the doorman will fetch you a cab at the front entrance, like most nice hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: SueFab
Reviews.Content: Have just come back to the UK after spending St Patricks day in Boston. We stayed at the Park Plaza are were really impressed. Great location - right in the middle of everything - and the reception staff were really helpful. Would recommend to anyone having a city break in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks Most of the boxes”
Reviews.Author: TONEMALONE
Reviews.Content: The Boston Park Plaza, would catagorised as traditional hotel that would suit both families and couples. The hotel went through a refit a few years back that increased the size of the rooms (if you stay you'll notice that the hotel rooms have 2 doors - speaking of which each door is a double door - guests used to be able to leave the clothes in the door by opening their side and the hotel staff later would be able to open the lobby side so that the hotel staff never had to meet the and greet the guests with dirty laundry - this is no longer the case unfortunately). The American President comes to stay here when he's in Boston so if its good enough for him... don't let that put you off though. Its a couple of blocks from the theatre district (in English, 5min walk down the road near Court yard by Marriott hotel). I liked this hotel it was clean, comfy, good location, some rooms even have 2 bathrooms if your lucky - if you stayed here you will not be disappointed. Probably one of the best hotels I would suggest would be the W hotel 10mins walk up the road, but its more expensive - why does luxury cost so much ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Dated but good value”
Reviews.Author: Jnshackmaster
Reviews.Content: If the owners spent a bit of cash updating the decor and the lighting this hotel would easily gain a star in rating. The staff and service are fantastic, and the rooms spotless. However the magnificent but ill-lit lobby and the en-suite bathrooms could do with some renovation. The fittings in my bathroom though modern looked like they had been bashed on to the original floor from the 1920s. The sheer size of the hotel means there is a wide range of dining options to suit every pocket. Like most breakfast buffets in the U.S. you have to eat, eat and eat again to get your $20 worth. There is a coffee shop in the building where you can get breakfast cheaper. - however it is very busy on a morning. The hotel is superbly situated for business or touring. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad!”
Reviews.Author: lz22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Plaza for three nights in early February. Our room was huge (apparently two older rooms converted into one large King Room during renovation). The rooms were nicely appointed (I got what I paid for at $130/night). Our room had two seperate bathrooms on opposite ends of the room. These were quite small and dated, but were spotless. Room service did a wonderful job. Great location, a few bars off the lobby made it convenient to go out and enjoy Boston nightlife and no real complaints. Don't come here if you are expecting luxurious appointments, 600 TC linens, high-end toiletries or a peaceful hotel. It is a convention-center mecca (approximately 1000 rooms in this hotel!) and there are always LOTS of people roaming around at all ours. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: CTART
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a weekend and the service was amazing. The rooms were big and I think I got what I paid for. The view from our room was awesome. Stay here you are in boston next time.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it if you research & book right...”
Reviews.Author: SmartTravels
Reviews.Content: I am a former Bostonian and business traveler who recently stayed at the Park Plaza Boston Hotel and Towers and booked my trip via Hotels.com. I was looking for a hotel near the Theater District since I was seeing a show. I 'splurged' for the upgrade and it was worth it! I booked the 15th Floor Concierge Towers Level room for $179.00 ($207.00 w/ all tax, etc.). I could have booked it for much less around $50/$60 for a basic room but I am very glad I didn't. The room was beautiful with: Comfy King Bed w/ tons of pillows, Gorgeous Bathroom, Robes & Slippers, Bottled Water, Starbucks Coffee, a small gift (a gift box of pistachios), simply an overall wonderful room. It wasn't huge but if you've ever stayed in any NYC hotel it was plenty big! The 15th floor provides a concierge especially for the floor and a 15th Floor Lounge which was very nice, decor TV's and all. Complementary soda, coffee, snacks, bottled water and a deluxe continental breakfast with a variety of very fresh fruit, pastries, eggs, etc. A very nice touch to the Concierge Towers Level upgrade. The location was perfect especially if you're seeing a show in the Theater District. Great restaurants all in walking distance. If you're looking for a hotel room in Boston for under $100.00, you can't have many expectations. Understandably you'd want it clean, and to receive good service but you shouldn't have too many more expectations for that price. All in all for the price I was impressed by this deal. If you're looking to splurge just a little ($200 is still a great deal!) I highly recommend doing so. I certainly will!

Reviews.Title: “Great if you want to starve”
Reviews.Author: davidls45
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times in the past with good results. This time was different. I booked a room on the concierge floor for my wife's birthday. We were out late the night before going to a show. The maids began banging on our door at 8:30 asking if they could make up our room, and continued doing so even after being told we were still in the room. We went for the concierge breakfast at 9:40 There were no eggs, no granola, and no yogurt. When my wife asked for more, she was told there wasn't going to be any more, since "we're closing in five minutes." (breakfast was until 10am). At 9:55, the woman running the breakfast removed the little remaining food, in spite of the fact a number of people were just coming in.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EeyoreGal
Reviews.Content: I went to Boston to attend seminar in Nov. 2006. I thought the price kinda high but, I'm just a small time city gal, good thing I was not sharing the room, it would of gotten slightly cramped. The room was pleasant if a little small for the price. The bathroom was very tiny but clean and in good order. The carpet, walls and bedding were clean. After reading some of the reviews, I had my doubts.....but I was pleasantly surprised by my room. The heat didn't work right, but I'm hot natured and had my window open most every day anyway. The food was passable if a little high priced. The hotel was close to everything a tourist could hope for, the T, shops, restaurants and sight seeing. Even though I wasn't footing the bill, I did enjoy my stay and my room. But, one could tell the hotel was past it's 'hey day'. All in all, I enjoyed this spot (but, would have to admit, if it were my dollar, I'd stay elsewhere).

Reviews.Title: “It was Ok”
Reviews.Author: Colokev
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews on here, I was terrified to stay here! As many people have said, the lobby is nice and deceiving. The hotel is very old and it shows. The elevator is old fashioned but it works! I got to my room and realized there was a screw loose on my door. The housekeeper saw me fiddling with it and said she'd call someone to repair it. About 10 minutes later someone showed up! There was a wet rag in my sink, trash in my garbage can and a shopping bag on the floor in my room upon entry. The room was clean but smelled. The above items left in the room was very weird but overall the room was fairly clean. It is what it is-it's cheap but it does have some faults. I was only there for a few hours overnight for business so I could over look the problems.

Reviews.Title: “poor service, bad rooms, dirty”
Reviews.Author: maurnac
Reviews.Content: I booked my recent stay at Park Plaza Boston because I like to frequent Starwood properties, and the room price was competitive. Not cheap, but comparable to other hotels in the area. I regretted this from the moment I tried to check in. First of all, despite the fact that I found this hotel on the Starwood website, they are only minimally affiliated with Starwood and told me I would not accrue points during my stay. The guy at the desk was nice enough and I recognize the policy is not his fault. But I felt mislead. I got to my room and there was one bed despite the fact that my reservation was for 4 adults, I had requested 2 beds and had asked for 3 keys at check in. I called downstairs and was moved to another floor. The second room had two beds and I was impressed with the size of the room. There were 2 bathrooms which seemed exciting. Both had showers. Upon inspection, one of the showers had clearly not been cleaned. Not only was it dirty, there were toiletries from a previous guest still sitting in the shower. The remaining shower which we had to assume had been cleaned, was so small I barely fit. (I'm only 5'8" and 140 pounds, not huge by any means) Additionally, there was a large stain on the wall that was either blood or red wine. The beds were lumpy and the mattresses very old which made for a terrible nights sleep. The bell men werenâ€™t helpful and we often ended up walking to get a cab instead of waiting for them to finally notice we were standing there. We called the concierge once for help with a restaurant but hung up after we were put on hold for over 5 minutes. The maid service made the beds and took our towels but didnâ€™t leave any new ones. This is a big hotel, so the crowded lobby is typical. But the bar in the hotel makes for a late night, very drunk crowd. And walking into the front doors of the hotel at 11pm meant walking through a cloud of smoke. I was in Boston to visit girlfriends and was embarrassed to have been the one to pick the hotel. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. It is like a motel trying to pass for an upscale chain.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal and wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: Lislcat
Reviews.Content: On a Wednesday, we decided that we wanted to fly to Boston for a weekend. My in-laws were going to be there and we decided to join them. I booked a very cheap flight through Northwest and found a deal on Travelocity for a junior suite at the Boston Park Plaza for $189. We flew in Saturday morning, explored the city and checked in at the hotel around 4 p.m. The lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas. The reservations desk had everything ready for us and we headed to our room. I had no idea what to expect of a "junior suite", since I've been in rooms with that title before and were disappointed to find out it was basically a regular hotel room. We walked into the room, went past a small bathroom with a shower and then the room opened up. It was wonderful! We had a fairly large living area, with a pull out couch for my daughter. Then we walked through French doors, into the bedroom. We had a king size bed, with at least 9 pillows. As I walked past the bed to the closet, I found another bathroom. This was much more than I ever expected! Our stay was wonderful and the hotel is located just off Boston Commons, so we were able tto walk everywhere. You can catch the Freedom Trail at Boston Commons and we followed it all the way to the North Church. I can only think of two possible negatives. The first, which is not necessarily a negative, is that I thought that at least a Continental Breakfast should of been included. I always like to eat at the hotel we stay at, so when we leave, we're ready to start our adventure. This time, we walked about 4 blocks to a breakfast place that was recommended to us, only to find the line was out the door. We found a little pastry shop down the street and had a danish, coffee and biscotti. Then we were off! The second negative, was that we had very poor reception on some tv channels, which ultimately caused us to order a PPV movie, so our daughter would have something to watch in the evening. It just so happened, that the fuzzy channels were the kid friendly ones, like Nick and Cartoon Network. The movie was fine, so it was no big deal. We often order PPV movies or play the video games, if offered at a hotel we stay at. Boston is a great city to visit! We always have a good time and the seafood is wonderful! We'd definitey stay at this hotel again. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but...”
Reviews.Author: TB123
Reviews.Content: Travelling to Boston for a few days between Christmas and New Year was a spur of the moment affair. Having stayed previously in Back Bay area, at the Lennox, we decided to locate ourselves a little closer to the City centre. The Park Plaza has an excellent location this fact can not be denied, it approximately half way between the Back Bay and down town areas, and just a few hundred yards from the Common. First impressions of the Hotel were pretty good. The large lobby area was beautifully decorated (Christmas decs etc, not the quality of the paint work!) and the Check in staff made us feel very welcome. We had read reviews that suggested the rooms would be on the small size, so we were delighted to find our accommodation was generous even by US standards. It has to be said that the decor was more than a little tired, and gave the overall impression that things were a little grubby and the bathroom wouldnâ€™t have looked out of place in a TV period drama! I fully appreciate that we did not spend a great deal of money on the room. However, even Comfort Inn (no disrespect intended) can offer working showers and clean towels. Finding a cleaners surgical glove on the bedside table was truely an unexpected delight. We notified the front desk of the problems, and an engineer was promtly dispatched to take a look at the shower. The hotel's opertunity to redeem itself disapeared with the engineers inability to resolve the problem. For the sake of paying a little more attention to detail, the Park Plaza could be a really good hotel. However, when I return to Boston (and I will go back because it's a fantastic City) I think I'll go back to the Lennox.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: sirius1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night trip in Boston and loved this hotel. The lobby and communal areas were beautifully decorated for Christmas and the staff were courteous and helpful. We had 3 rooms on floor 9, all of which were very large and comfortable. The food in the Swan Cafe was reasonably priced and the location was wonderful. Having read some of the reviews on this site we were worried before travelling, but now wonder whether we were staying in the same hotel that has been described by some people! Would definitely recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: JeffMA
Reviews.Content: We had a dinner celebration in Boston and booked a room at the Park Plaza. The internet special was $100 for a standard room. Very good price for Boston and I did not have high expectations for the standard room. The room size was ok and the bathroom very small. Unfortunately, the hallway to the room was littered with room service dishes around 4pm and dirty towels in the evening. We could hear every sound from the adjoining rooms as well as the plumbing. You get what you pay for and I am just glad we were not paying more than $100. Positives - the lobby was nicely decorated and the location is very good. BTW - the parking deck near the hotel was $28 for 4pm to 8am the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: Essie
Reviews.Content: One word to describe the problem at the Park Plaza: Service. The service is so poor that it overshadows anything nice about this hotel. My husband and I booked a Junior Suite through Orbitz. Traveling from Chicago, our flight was delayed due to weather so I called early in the afternoon to advise the hotel we would be arriving close to midnight. The woman I spoke with said she would add a note to the reservation. We did arrive shortly before midnight, and upon walking up to the check-in desk were greeted cooly and told that there were no more rooms available. I asked if a copy of my confirmation would help find the room and was snapped at-after a few moments of silence and the woman checking in her computer, a Junior Suite was "found" for us. The room (636) smelled like smoke (it was a non-smoking room). I called down to the front desk and after about 10 rings I hung up and dialed the front desk again. Someone picked up and put me on hold. After 4 minutes, I hung up-because it was so late, we decided to just stay in the room. The heater made a little noise and we could hear the traffic (this didn't really bother us since we have radiator heat at home and have lived on Lake Shore Drive in Chicago so the traffic didn't bother us). There was a bathroom and a 1/2 a desk and couch. The room was average size, very tiny bathroom, outdated. I would say for what we paid ($200/night) it was not worth it. One night I pressed the wake up call button on the phone and it just rang, I hung up and dialed zero and did reach someone. I only used the concierge twice, the first time the woman at the desk was very nice. The second time, I was ignored so I just left. There is a big Starbuck's sign in the hotel so one morning I walked down for a Late to bring back to my room-it took about 15 minutes to get the Late. The valet and baggage handlers were very nice and our room was cleaned every day. My fault for not checking Trip Advisor before I booked (Fromers has this hotel recommended in their 2007 Boston book so that is why I chose it). If you have already booked at the hotel, it should be fine, but if you have not yet booked and you do have a choice, I would NOT recommend this hotel to any family or friends. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “An Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: leckaroo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night and the experience was average. The hotel has a nice classic appearance from the outside and in the lobby. I knew the hotel was old so the room didn't bother me too much. The room was on the small side, the linens and bedding were somewhat new, but the bathroom was tiny and needed a renovation badly. The only issue I had was the temperature. The heater in my room didn't work and the maintenance guy finally got it to work after three visits. The front desk was very accomodating and offered to change my room even after they fixed the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Not staying here again”
Reviews.Author: ms_muffler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on the Concierge level. The evening snacks were great, and the wait staff on that level were just lovely. Here's what I didnt like... I was there on a business trip with another colleague... She ended up with a far better room than mine, in spite of us paying the same price, and the rooms being 2 doors away from each other. My bathroom was old and dingy. The Air vents were dusty and loud. Had an awful view, and the "renovations" looked like they had been done by a 6 year old. I have travelled in Boston a lot over this past year, and have to say, of all the hotels I stayed at... this was by far the worst.. In the end. I did change rooms (a smaller one) which had an updated bathroom... which made it bearable....

Reviews.Title: “Hot Hot Hot!”
Reviews.Author: buisnesstravler
Reviews.Content: If you come in the summer months prepare to die of heat. These clowns don't have AC in the hotel. They try to claim its because the hotel is so old- but its inexcusable. Many Boston AREA hotels do have AC. It might seem like hotels in cambridge , allston, summerville are farther away- but Boston is a small city. Trust me- if its the summer you will DIE of heat in this hotel. The windows don't open enough to let a decent breeze in. They open a crack- not enough to let the air in- but enough to let you hear the drunk college students leaving the whiskey park bar at 2am. If you expect good service and a good room- go to the Ritz or stay outside of Boston. This hotel screamed rip off as soon as the staff told me that the room cannot get colder than 5 degrees of the outside temperature. I stayed in the buisness floor and it was still unconfortable. If you stay in the buisness floor thinking it'll be great because of the nice bath rooms- don't bother. Marble lined tub MIGHT sound appealing- but it's actually just a normal tub that they've slaped some marble on the side of. Leave boston and stay in a normal hotel outside if you are coming here in teh summer. You will save alot of money and even if you take cabs everywhere you will still comeout ahead rather staying in this HOT HOT HOT hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the guests next door...”
Reviews.Author: rpjs
Reviews.Content: We booked through hotels.com and got an excellent rate, and when we saw the hotel we felt we were getting a real bargain. We arrived about 12.45pm, ahead of the official check in time but they were happy to check us in. The room was clean and had good amenities. We couldn't figure out how to get the built-in Internet access in the TV to work but didn'tr really care. We had the breakfast buffet and it was excellent. The waiting staff were very attentive and polite, and all the staff we encountered were polite and helpful. The biggest problem we had was noise: even though we were on the 14th floor the Boston street noise was quite intrusive, though bearable, but then at 2.45am the guests in the neighbouring room started a loud party complete with thumping music. This was not the hotel's fault of course and we called security who were eventually able to get the people to quiet down. If it hadn't been for our loud neighbours, this would have been close to a perfect hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “I should have listened...”
Reviews.Author: grundahl
Reviews.Content: A room the size of a shoebox came with the price tag of $219 plus $27 tax. It cried for a real renovation, but obviously nobody listened for at least 5 years. There were cracks in the walls, bathtub drain was badly clogged. A comforter -- coffee stained. Internet was $10.95 for a less then a day. You canâ€™t order a drink downstairs and take it to you room, you have to use the room service, which is taking much longer and is a bit more expensive. When our order arrived, it was served on a recycled tablecloth with fresh wine stains. The only good reason to stay in this once probably great hotel is location, location, location. But there are quite a few other hotels also happily situated in the same area, which might be better managed.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: hath
Reviews.Content: Undoubtedly the worst hotel Iâ€™ve used in 30 years. The room was certainly the smallest Iâ€™ve ever seen. The management are rude and arrogant. They make fictions charges to your credit card long after you have left quite a headache to resolve. I would never use this hotel again. Be warned

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but some service issues”
Reviews.Author: chriswin
Reviews.Content: Grand lobby and great customer service at front desk. Hotel is in an excellent location. Only complaints: internet service in rooms is not wireless and there is a fee - even budget hotels are offering free internet service these days; and had to wait a long time for service in the hotel bar, both to get my drink and then my bill. Otherwise, not a bad hotel and has seen some improvements since Starwood bought an interest in the hotel. I would stay at this hotel again, but be sure to use a discount booking service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rosemaryt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days and had a great time. The lobby and public areas are spectacular, the rooms clean and comfortable. The bathroom was a little on the small side. Have breakfast if only to see the waitress who is as old as the hotel! If you are familiar with the Julie Walters sketch you'll know where she got her inspiration!! Tle location is wonderful for all the sights and restaurants etc. Take a trolley tour and a duck tour, the latter is a real hoot! Staff are friendly and helpful. The T (metro system) is very easy to use, remarkably cheap and quite safe. If you want to go to Salem, catch the commuter train, very simple and cheap. One note, no one tells you in advance that almost all organised tours finish around the middle of October!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect online deal! This hotel has everything!”
Reviews.Author: yfunk3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Boston Park Plaza from Oct 21 to Oct 24. Had booked a double room online with a friend, $101 + taxes for the both of us (so around $50 each), and they had initially given us a room with a queen size bed. I asked if they had any rooms with double beds, and they said no, but that they did have a "half suite" with two sofa beds at no extra cost. We opted for that room, and it was HUGE. The room was obviously meant for business meetings, as there was a conference table at one end. Despite the fact that the sofa bed mattresses aren't comfortable and my friend and I just opted to sleep on the couches themselves (with the bedsheets covering them), I still loved staying at the BPP! The bathroom was on the smaller side, but how much time do you spend in the bathroom, really? It had a great, deep soaking tub and two showerheads, was clean and better than expected (there is even a radiator inside so you can adjust the heat). If you are staying at the hotel during a Sunday, definitely try their Afternoon Tea! My friends and I had originally wanted to do afternoon tea at the Four Seasons, but they obviously deemed us not worthy enough to have tea at their Bristol Lounge (they lied to us and said reservations were full, when the Four Seasons concierge and all websites say explicitly that they don't accept reservations for tea). So rather than be disappointed at dropping $40/person at the Four Seasons, we went back to the Park Plaza and found out that their tea service starts at the same time, came with the same amount of food, and was almost half the price ($23.50/person). It was an incredible experience and the food was incredible (this is essentially a late lunch, and there is A LOT of food and unlimited amount of tea! The exclusive blends were wonderful!). Service was great throughout. Room service arrives awfully early (around 8 AM), but you just let them know you're still in the room, and they just come back later. Or just put the DO NOT DISTURB sign on the door until you leave. Reception and concierge employees were all wonderful. The lobby and mezzanine levels (where the ballrooms and reception halls are) are absolutely gorgeous, and there are beautiful fresh flowers everywhere. Last but not least...the LOCATION of the hotel was absolutely PERFECT. Within very comfortable walking distance of the Public Gardens & Boston Common, a huge Loew's movie theatre, Chinatown, Newbury Street shopping, Downtown Crossing, a whole bunch of great restaurants (both connected to the hotel and within walking distance) and the Arlington T-stop is just steps away from the hotel if you don't want to walk! If I ever travel back to Boston with a friend, I will definitely be looking for another online deal at this hotel. The standard price is a bit high, but if you an get an online deal at under $150 per room per night, then it is definitely worth it. However, if you are used to Hilton quality 3-star hotels or tend to dwell on little faults (such as a hairline crack on the bathroom floor or just a smaller-than-expected room), then I would advise you to just stick with the brand-name hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay during the Head of the Charles”
Reviews.Author: MplsMidwest
Reviews.Content: I was one of the skeptics based on reading other reviews but we ended up having a great stay at the Park Plaza. We stayed for 5 nights while in Boston for the Head of the Charles regatta and have no complaints. The location was fabulous - the T is right out the door and there were plenty of great places within walking distance as well. There were a few oddball things with housekeeping - one day the towels would be folded a certain way, the next day there were only three replacement towls and they were put in a different spot, but the bed was comfy, and the room and bathroom were clean and updated. Also had great experiences with the staff - helpful recommendations, always pulling out a map and showing us the exact T route to get somewhere. Would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but Valet people are not friendly”
Reviews.Author: kevertje
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay in this hotel via Priceline bidding and paid 292 dollar for 2 nights which is not bad. We arrived in the afternoon and they gave us a room on the 6th floor. First thing we noticed was that the airconditioning made a lot of noise so after we parked our car in the Common Garage (cheaper and nearby) we called the front-desk and they send someone who switched the airco off with a hidden button. Our stay was OK but the VALET people were not friendly at all. According to the hotel it's allowed to park for 15 minutes during check-in and check-out. They seemed not so happy when you ask for this and they directly tell you that if you're not back within 15 minutes they start charging you. I explained that I will be as fast as possible but that I depend on the front-desk-lines... No excuse... "we will charge you if you're not back in 15 minutes" Location is perfect and there are some nice restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “jr suite with no table?”
Reviews.Author: mareln
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a junior suite for our honeymoon. The suite was quite large but sparsley furnished.
