The elevators were extremely slow and crowded, to the point of being clostrophobic! My company is paying the bill my stay here, and it's a good thing, because I wouldn't waste my money on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Park Plaza was the perfect location for my 5 day stay associated with the Public Libraries Convention. The Hotel is neat clean and cheerful. Easy walk to everything. Theatre district is just two blocks away. MBTA Green Line, Arlington station is just a half block away. Lots of bars, pubs and restaurants right around the hotel. A great place from which to see and do Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend booked the hotel rooms for our conference and after reading all of the negatives I was really worried. But after spending 5 nights, I have to say that really was just an average hotel experience. Small rooms, but that's to be expected from an old hotel. I was fortunate to have one of the remodeled queen size rooms. Bathroom had a great deep tub that was much appreciated after 8 hours of flying. Rooms were clean, housekeeping staff very friendly. I had a lovely dinner at McCormick & Schmicks, but since they lease the space, I don't know that I'd weigh my review in the hotel's favor. Room service was prompt, but the food was rather unexceptional. Wouldn't stay there again, despite the great location.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: LadyMonkeyC
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night early March with my husband. Read such a variety of things I wasn't sure what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised. After a nice drive from NYC, we found parking easily, checked in early and got a really decent room. Sounds like there are vast differences in furniture, size, etc... depending on what room/floor you're on. We were on 5 with a walk-in shower which we really didn't mind. Hotel gave us wrong tickets for our aquarium package, but corrected the mistake very nicely. I would stay here again as long as I specified a certain room. It's a lovely, historic hotel. LOVED Davio's restaurant around the corner. Went there for dinner and back again for dessert after we saw a show.

Reviews.Title: “great Location”
Reviews.Author: Travellerdub
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed in this hotel in early march, we were pleasantly surprised, the room was a fair size for 3 people and the bathroom was not as small as i expected having seeing other reviews, the staff were very pleasant and accommodating, including the maids etc. The location was excellent, we would stay here again, the only gripe is the restuarant McCormicks & Schmicks, this was a disaster, we ordered 3 soups, only 2 came out first and it was cold,we also had to ask for spoons, these were dirty. while in the process of trying to return the 2 soups, the dinners were brought out, one of our party was still waiting on soup, , the chef brought back the dinners, one dinner then came out 15 mins later, the waitress brought this one out on her sleeves, still no knife and forks, the manager eventually came over , we didnt pay, i have never returned food in a restuarant before, but this was really bad, maybe we were just unlucky. The next evening we went to an italian restuarant - Maggianos, go there, the food, service were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing despite being renovated”
Reviews.Author: starbuck212
Reviews.Content: I was traveling on business and had the unfortunate experience of staying here. At first I thought I was going to be impressed... friendly staff at check-in, nice lobby, very nicely decorated hallways that were quite large. But things went downhill when I got to my room. 1) My room was TINY. Despite the fact I could tell they had tried to make it contemporary with their decorating, it was smaller than your average marriott room, the condition of the furniture was not-so-great, and the bed was oddly low to the ground (as if it was missing the spring mattress). 2) When I peeled back the top cover on the bed (as I always do as soon as I get into a hotel room), I saw a dark curly hair! The kind you DON'T want to see! Eeewww!!! I peeled the sheet further back -- another dark curly hair, and then another, and then another. Five in total, which I picked up with kleenex. I am almost 100% positive they never changed the sheets after the last guest. 3) The linens were old, they were not high quality, and you could see small tears in the pillows and bedsheets. 4) The pillows were hard foam. hardly the type of pillow I would expect at this kind of hotel. Heck, I can even get feather down pillows at a Marriott Courtyard. 5) Room service attendant made no attempt to show me my food under the silver covers or uncover them or anything. She just plopped them down on the desk, watched the TV I had on, and waited for me to sign the bill. 6) The WORST part of the entire stay came when I got into bed, shut my TV off, and realized I could hear EVERYTHING going on in my neighbors room. I could hear word-for-word what was on their TV, I could hear them go to the bathroom, I could hear them get in & out of bed, I could hear them cough/ sneeze, etc. I am not kidding you. It was awful. I was up forever -- I turned up my heat to something awfully hot just so the loud drone of the heat would cover up the noises from the next room. I don't think I have EVER stayed in a hotel w/ walls this thin. I'm not exaggerating. My neighbor woke up around 3 am in a coughing fit, and it was like they were in bed next to me. It woke me up! And then when morning came I could hear the wake-up calls & alarm for both rooms on either side of me. One at 5 am, another at 6 am. 7) The bathroom was so small that I didn't even have a place to hang my towel or put my toiletry bag down (I had to put it on the side of the tub). NEVER AGAIN will I stay here. I will say, though, that not all the rooms are as small as mine... I saw one of my co-workers rooms there and it seemed almost normal. The bed wasn't freakishly low to the ground, and her room was a lot bigger (although her bathroom was still terribly small).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel was Lovely, the rooms were really clean and well presented, hotel staff extremely frienly and helpful. Great location for a trip to Boston, not too far from shopping areas and tourist trips/centres. Irish Bar/restaurant attached to the hotel is good for a good night out, with genuinely friendly staff and patrons. Would definately stay here if returning to Boston. .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: NyLc
Reviews.Content: The hotel has ample public spaces where anyone could happily pass the time when the weather turns nasty. The hotel also houses a trendy Whiskey bar and the rumor is that W Hotels will be taking over the hotel in the near future. My room was more than acceptable for one person (especially for $109) although it might be a little small for a couple. I was a little nervous with my room's location as it was next to the maid's closet but noise really was not an issue in the morning - even though I like to sleep late. There is a spa across the street called Exhale that has yoga and pilates in addition to spa services. The hotel is next to the Public garden - beautiful even in the winter. It is a short walk to Newbury Street for wonderful galleries and shops. Beacon Hill's Charles St is on the other side of the Garden -another wonderful shopping street with a couple of great breakfast/brunch finds - The Paramount and Panafico. The immediate area of the hotel yielded 2 truly memorable restaurants. Todd English's The Bonfire is inside the hotel - expensive but worth it. But Davio's was even better and more affordable. See Al the wine steward for excellent advice & schmoozing!

Reviews.Title: “Old lady gone gray”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Truly an old hotel still living off of it's good reputation. Terrible service, it seems that the staff hasn't even been trained? Switched rooms twice after our airconditioner was making loud noises, our bathroom was filled with black hair and in the last room our toilet overflowed on the first night, we then got the excuse "it is an old hotel". We were not reimbursed for anything, not even offered breakfast or complimentary room service. Good prices and great location but that's about all they have going for them. You'd expect a little class staying at the Plaza but instead we got stained sheets, small rooms, hairs in the bathroom and poor service? Will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Boston Park Plaza”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Plaza for 3 nights right before Christmas and absolutely loved everything about it! Old hotel but had the glamorous feel to it. Many restaurants and activities so close by. within walking distance to everything! My wife and I will stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed impression”
Reviews.Author: Itiofele
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at the beginning of January while at a Conference. Got conference rates. I was expecting a bit more. On the good side: Room is cleaned daily, fancy decor (liked the lobby), very comfortable bed. On the bad side: room is small (smaller than my bedroom, and I live in New York), paper-thin walls (could hear the 'recreational activities' of the couple next door). Staff was OK. Do not try to access internet via your TV (too slow). Overall, my experience was not good enough to merit another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great, stay there!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading bad reviews on this website was very apprehensive about staying at this hotel. However, we were very pleasantly suprised! Great location, nice rooms. Don't get put off by bad reviews, stay there! Also staff were fine with both check in and check out.

Reviews.Title: “Uncaring Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kimbun
Reviews.Content: I stayed there four nights in December. I phoned and wrote to them a week before I arrived to say that I had surgery on a leg and needed a room near the elevator. I told this to the clerk when I arriuved and she confirmed it and said they had a room that would meet my needs. The room they gave me was the furthest room from the elevator on the floor ---at the very end of the hall. I objected and they said they were sorry for the inconvenience but would do nothing about it. The accomodations were quite old, with old furnishings and poorly maintained. Stay there at your own risk because the staff is completely uncaring. The lobby, which is your first impressiom , is great but it ends there.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AND VALUE”
Reviews.Author: ChrisMontvale
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two days the third week in January 2006. The location of this hotel is excellent. The hotel is easy walking distance to the Commons, Newberry Street shopping, very good resturants and bars and the T, as well as Boston's small theater district. The lobby is beautifully maintained and harkens back to the day when this was truly a grand hotel. The rooms, although clean, are a bit small and tired. The front desk staff and concierge were very friendly and helpful. If you can get a good rate, and don't pland to spend all of your stay in your room, I highly recommend this hotel. I also highly recommend the McCormick & Schmicks restaurant which is just off the lobby. I usually try to avoid chain resturants when I travel, but it was pouring out, so I gave it a try. The resturant is beautiful and the seafood was outstanding. I have done my share of fine dining but I don't think I have ever experienced such warm, friendly, and knowledgeable service as the staff here provided.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rate & Room”
Reviews.Author: farawayeyes
Reviews.Content: I just got back from an overnight at the Park Plaza Hotel. I often stay in Boston for those special ocassions and this hotel always seem to fit my needs. It is close to the T stop and right near everything. The room was adequate and having two restarants right on site also helps if you are pressed for time. We ate at Mccormicks Seafood and I must say I have never had a bad meal there. Tood English's Bonfire is also a great restaurant if you have the time. Check in was quick and efficient. I booked the lowest priced room and was upgraded. I recommend doing that if you get the europeon room it will be fine however for two people.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rates, Great Room.”
Reviews.Author: Pakmoi
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed one night in the Boston Park Plaza and were very pleased. We were going to a play at one of the nearby theaters and wanted a hotel that was close to the theater. The walk to the theater took less than ten minutes and the whole area was decorated for the holidays. Very delightful! The lobby of the Boston Park Plaza is beautiful and very elegant. The staff was so helpful and professional. Our room had a Queen size bed and for a Boston hotel room, wasn't that small. Yes, the bathroom is on the small side, but believe me I've had rooms with much smaller baths!!!!! The room was very comfortable with elegant furniture and an extremely comfortable bed. We wanted to order an inroom movie but couldn't get it to work. One call to the extension they gave us to report any problems or requests, and the problem was fixed immediatly. I would definatly stay here again and recommend it highly!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BTraveling47
Reviews.Content: The Park Plaza is a wonderful hotel with a wonderful staff. It has everything you could want -- convenient location,friendly service,great restaurants. Treat yourself to a Tower room on the 15th floor. A week before our arrival (12/30/05), we received a call from the concierge to confirm our reservation and inquiring if we had any special requests. I asked that feather bedding or pillows be removed from the room because of allergies. The concierge said that was not a problem and advised us, upon arrival, to go directly to the 15th floor for check in. Check in was elegant, and the conciege confirmed no feathers. Our room was lovely -- high ceiling, large window, marble bathroom with deep tub for soaking. Yes, the bathroom is small but more than adequate. The bed linen and bath towels were quality. The service was wonderful. Example -- I left my gloves in the car when we dropped it with the valet. Within 15 minutes someone had retrieved and delivered them to our room. At 5pm, guests on the 15th floor are provided with an outstanding variety of canapes, cheeses, and hot tidbits in chafing dishes in the private lounge. Full bar service is available. This is where the complimentary continental breakfast is served until 10 in the morning. On Saturday morning, the presentation included pastries, muffins, strawberries, black and red raspberries, melon,yougart parfaits,scrambled eggs,toast,juice,coffee,and tea. I should add that room service is prompt and professional. The hotel is located in a quiet area bordering a residential neighborhood, within walking distance of Copley/Prudential/Newbury shopping areas,the Boston Common and the Public Garden, plus the Arlington T (subway)station. Great restaurants are within walking distance. But, there are also several within the hotel. Their Irish pub is wonderful and reasonably priced. We had a terrific dinner at Smith and Wollensky's,affiliated with the hotel but located across the street. Looking forward to Todd English's Bonfire restaurant next time. The Four Seasons Hotel is between the Park Plaza and the Boston Garden. We love to stop there for a drink when in town. This was the only unpleasant moment we experienced during our stay in Boston. Friday night we were greeted (?) in the Lounge by a cold,unpleasant gentleman with no personality. Although we could see empty tables, we were placed on a "waiting list" while other groups were seated. It was not the kind of reception we've experienced in the past and seriously doubt we would have been showed to a table. We left, walked across the street and through the Public Garden to The Ritz Carlton where we were warmly greeted. Our mini-vacation was perfect thanks to the Park Plaza and the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Family Reunion”
Reviews.Author: cpstets22
Reviews.Content: Like many who have already posted reviews, I booked rooms for five nights at the Park Plaza with some trepidation, but I got a good deal booking through Expedia. I booked four rooms for three generations of one family and all of us were thrilled with the accomodations. The location couldn't be better whether you are a senior citizen being wheeled in a wheelchair to one of the excellent nearby restaurants, or a couple of young men heading out for a night on the town. We had two rooms with two double beds, and they each had two bathrooms, one room only had showers, the other had bathtubs. The room with the king sized bed had a good sized bathroom, and the room with the queen sized bed had an adequate bathroom. The rooms with two double beds were large enough to entertain all seven of us with room leftover for a couple of guests. Yes, some of the bathrooms are small, but they are clean, well-lit, and the water pressure, even on the 14th floor, is excellent. The lobby, as others have mentioned, is grand, in the old style, and was beautifully decorated for Christmas. Check-in and check-out were a breeze -- the staff was friendly and knowledgeable, and they thoughtfully offered to place us all on the same floor. My brother had a problem with his room key, so they moved him immediately to a nicer room. The concierge made an excellent recommmendation for an early dinner in Harvard Square at a place I never would have chosen on my own. Breakfast at the Swan Cafe, just off the lobby, is expensive, but Au Bon Pain is just a few steps away and an even more reasonably priced Croissant du Jour is in the building across the street. The valet parking is expensive at $36/day, but worth it if you have to have a car available. We had such a great time, we're already talking about staying at the Park Plaza for next year's Christmas family reunion.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Birthday Pkg for my Wife 40th”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the money on the mini suite,superb room,and the birthday pkg that came with it,perfect romantic spot just to get away without spending a fortune.the hotel is very pretty decorated with christmas display....they have an excellent birthday package well worth the money spent ..will go again..

Reviews.Title: “Boston Park Plaza worth the trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend stay at the Park Plaza in Boston. Enjoyed the stay very much. The staff was attentive and helpful. We received the hotel with a priceline reservation of $70/nite. This made no difference to the desk staff. We checked in easily, and when I mentioned I had forgotten my toothbrush, someone was at the door to our room 15 minutes later with a toothbrush and toothpaste, without having to ask. The room was on the smaller side, not uncommon in an older historic hotel. You can not beat the location. We did some Christmas shopping and were able to walk from the hotel, to the Prudential Shopping center to Quincy Market easily. If you are not up for the walk, "T" access is almost right out the door. The restaurants and bars attached to the hotel are excellent, with good atmosphere and some very reasonable price for Boston. You can not beat the desserts at Finale's next door. We stay in Boston for long weekends three to four times per year through priceline reservations. This was very nice and I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with helpful,k nowledgeable staff.”
Reviews.Author: hootiejohn
Reviews.Content: Ideal location and excellent facilties. Very friendly people (staff and locals!). Special thanks to Jonathan and Abby. Hope to return there soon!

Reviews.Title: “Not very good”
Reviews.Author: AnneBernie
Reviews.Content: The only good things I can say about this hotel is it has a nice lobby, is close to the city centre and the bar staff are very helpful. The room we got was described as European - what it really should have said was sub-standard European - it was really small, stank of smoke and the bathroom was the size of a wardrobe. You had to be careful not to bang your leg off the toilet as you got out of the very old shower. Probably the worst thing about it was the smell of stale smoke - heighened by the extreme heat in the room.. this was like the smoke had seeped into everything. Very disappointing and would not stay there again unless my room was upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved the Boston Park Plaza”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a four night stay at The Boston Park Plaza Hotel. I was a little bit apprehensive about the hotel before travelling due to some of the mixed reviews i had read on the hotel. But i had nothing to worry about. We got the T (Subway) from the airport to the hotel which required just one change of lines. We came up from the subway at Arlington Station and there was the Hotel facing us. When we entered the Lobby i was so taken with all the christmas decorations. The Lobby is amazing and was decorated so beautifully. We checked in straight away, there was no queue and the staff at the desk were very helpful. They provided us with a map of Boston and marked out some places to visit on it for us. We had a Queen room on the 5th floor. The room was really nice, spotlessly clean and a very good size for 2 people. The bathroom was also a very good size with a bath and a double showerhead which was really powerful. There was plently of storage space in the room for all the shopping that we bought! The room was cleaned thoroughly everyday and was very well maintained. We drank in the hotel bar at night and found the bar staff to be very friendly. The location of the hotel was superb and with the T stop outside of the hotel you are within minutes of anywhere in Boston. There are 3 restaurants to choose from in the hotel and plently in the surrounding area also. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Boston. Everything about our stay there was excellent and i would definitely stay there again on a return trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: welshjonah
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely period hotel, I found it to be clean and the beds very comfortable. Will agree that the bathroom is small, but still loved the room. Will agree that the lobby gets to full and the staff are not very helpful. I'm returning here on the 24th December for 5 nights over Xmas, will update after that.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is a JOKE!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found it amazing that my company set me up in the Park Plaza hotel while being at a conference in Boston. I normally am placed in the Westin Copley, but they were booked up. I arrived at the hotel late on a Sunday night and the front desk was nothing but helpful. The lobby of the hotel was AMAZING! Looks like it has not changed since the hotel opened in the 1920s. I was shown to the beautiful brass elvators. I got a room on the 14th floor (love a room with a view) I was given room 1481. I entered into the room and my suitcase just about made it through the small hallway into my room. I entered into my room which was about the size of my bathroom at home. The room was roughly 90 degrees because someone had left the heater on. I shut the heater off and went to work. I came back and the room was freezing, it had gone from 90 degrees to about 40 degree so I started up the heater again. I sat on my bed (which was like sitting on cardboard) I am almost 6'3 and my feet were hanging off the side of the bed all night. The pillows were the type of pillows you find on your couch. I asked the front desk for new pillows and I was told that those are the only pillows they had. In the morning I took a shower. The shower was nice (it had two shower heads) but stepping out of the shower, you almost step into the toilet. The bathroom was VERY small. I had a glass of soda the night before and I left the glass on my nightstand for them to take it, they never did the four nights I was there. I also found that they do not vacuum the carpets either. All the furniture that my parents threw out from the 80s wound up at this hotel. Very very tacky I had called the front desk to find out when the gift shop would be closing and I called the front desk. I left the phone ring 15 times and no one picked up the phone. When I hung up, they called back and told me, we picked up and you hung up on me. I told them that the phone rang 15 times and they said "well we are a busy hotel you know" I slammed the phone down on them again. The night light in the bathroom is blinding and will keep you up until you get up and close the door. There are two shades on the window, but they are cut so poorly that the light still comes through. Also there are alot of people going through the halls at all hours of the night and they are very very loud. For the money that you will spend at this hotel, go to the Westin instead.

Reviews.Title: “Is this a Hotel? Less than 1 star in european standards”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not a good experience. Bad service, very bad rooms and a lot of people in the hall (like being in a mall). Is a ggod experience if you want to know what bad means.

Reviews.Title: “Service is slipping”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the Park Plaza because we had stayed there in 2001 and had been very satisfied. It is in an excellent location, right in the center of Boston, ideal for all the sights and amenities. We had booked and paid through our local travel agent before we left. We stayed there at the beginning of our holiday and had to queue for ages to check in, then were told that there was a message for us which we had to collect from the concierge, where there was another enormous queue. The check in staff would not get it for us so we had to wait even longer! Our second stay was on our way home, they claimed to have no record of our reservation but gave us a room and we gave them our pre paid voucher confirmation of booking. The room was basic, the bathroom minute and the fixtures were hanging off the wall. Next morning we had a bill pushed under the door. We explained the situation at the desk and were told not to worry, they would sort it out and took no payment for the room. On arriving home a charge of $291 appeared on our credit card statement. We did not appreciate the extra hassle we had, to get our refund, not to mention being out of pocket temporarily. We will not be returning to the Park Plaza again!

Reviews.Title: “Park Plaza a gorgeous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MrsBond923
Reviews.Content: Some reviewers complained about this being an old and shabby hotel - where were they staying?? The Park Plaza is beautiful and very well-kept. The room we stayed in was clean, modern, spacious, and extremely comfortable. I especially loved the all-marble bathroom and cushy, king-size bed with plenty of pillows! We stayed during a cold-snap in January, and there was a problem with the fire alarms being set off by the sub-zero temperatures (imagine being wakened to such a thing!), but I can't fault the hotel for that. It was remedied relatively quickly. I really enjoyed staying at the Park Plaza, and if given the chance, would absolutely stay there again. It was easily one of the nicest hotels I've ever patronized.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eileen026
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a holiday trip to Boston. Stayed at this hotel, I too was a little worried having read a couple of negative reviews, however the hotel is brill, walking through the doors into a very grand reception area!! (having had the door opened for me first!!) The staff were always very friendly and there appeared to be nothing that was too much trouble. Rooms a good size, very clean and more than comfortable, I loved the walk in shower. The hotel sits close to the common and is ideally based for you to do the walking to all the sights in Boston I would recommend that you give this one a try. When we return to the lovely city again I would stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Low quality, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: khw225
Reviews.Content: This place is pretty typical of old, historic hotels: when you walk in, youâ€™re stunned by the gorgeous lobby, but then youâ€™re disappointed when you see your cramped and dusty old room. I was there for a conference, so there were a lot of people in and out at the same time. The elevators were hopelessly overloaded. The conference facilities were nice, but labyrinthine. Woe those attendees who forgot their maps upstairs. The room was really small â€“ you could barely pull the chair out enough to sit down. The windows were ancient and wouldnâ€™t close properly. No curtains, just some shades. The bathroom was tiny and the fixtures were old and worn, and not perfectly clean, either. Completely sub-standard. Internet access is not free, and they tried to charge me for an extra day. The extra charges on phone calls are outrageous. If Iâ€™m already paying a Corporate rate, I donâ€™t appreciate being nickeled and dimed to death! On the plus side, I got good food from room service, although it was also expensive. No breakfast included here! And service was generally snooty. Location is about the only thing this place has going for itself. Overall, this hotel was a disappointment, not just in price-service relationship, but also in quality. I wonâ€™t be back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value, Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: karma17
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a week in Boston and stayed the entire week at this hotel. As other reviewers have noted, I was a little apprehensive about staying here given some of the negative reviews that have been written. However, soon after arriving, my fears were quickly put to rest. This is a grand, classic hotel and if anything, I felt humbled in its grandeur and opulence. Our room did have some wear here and there, but everything was clean and nothing was obviously in disrepair. We stayed on the 15th floor, which cost a little more, but enjoyed the daily and complimentary breakfast buffet and hor'dourves. Our concierges were friendly and helpful, and the maid service was thorough. After a week there, there were a couple of suggestions I would make, but these are minor in my opinion. One is the gym---it has a lot of treadmills, but not much else in terms of work-out equipment. The other was the breakfast buffet, which while decent, could use a little more variety. The hor'dourves items varied, but not the breakfast ones. Overall, this is decent place to stay. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it and would be quite likely to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location Only Plus”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The pluses - 1. This is a historic hotel, 2. The location of this hotel is about as central as you could want in Boston. That having been said, the hotel is shabby (carpet stains, very scuffed furniture, dirty upholstory, etc.).The service is atrocious (ie. calls to the front desk to fix air cond. resulted in once being put on hold for 20-yes 20 mins before being disconnected-I was actually curious to see how long it would take them to field the call- also, we never got to speak to alive person on the phone, the air was never looked at and after a couple of moves we did find a room where the air cooled. They were quick about moving us. We've been to Boston many times and usually stay on Newbury St.at a little B&B about two blocks away from this place. Wanted to try something different - boy, was it ever but not for the better! This hotel reminded us of the certain kind of place that big tour companies book for large groups -those of you who've toured like this will know exactly what I'm saying -that's the best description I can give it.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Park Plaza”
Reviews.Author: PankajAgarwal
Reviews.Content: The service was good for a big city hotel - half the staff was nice and only half was O.K. All the rooms have by now been renovated. The Air conditioning was extremely noisy, but the engineer came 5 minutes after we called and quieted it down completely. I don't know what all the fuss is about, but my wife and I like the Park Plaza - and I stay in hotels 150 nights a year!

Reviews.Title: “Close to downtown and near the Boston Common”
Reviews.Author: alita
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the lukewarm reviews, I was a little wary about staying at the Park Plaza. However, after arriving, I was pleasantly surprised by how friendly everyone was and how nice the room looked. It isn't the largest room I've stayed in, but I would say that for the price (went through Priceline) I was happy with what I got. It was clean, the room service is 24 hrs and there is a very nice bar (whiskey park) downstairs. The airconditioning was very weak but considering the fact that I got a view of the city from my room (I was on the 14th floor) I was satisfied. The shower is very nice and if you ask for a queen, they are very accomodating. I would recommend anyone staying there (esp. if you get it for a pretty good price...)

Reviews.Title: “It's fine for a night, not a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: Smoothtraveller
Reviews.Content: I too was very concerned about the Park Plaza after reading the reviews. I stayed 9/30 for one nite, and got the room thru Hotwire for $185- an astounding amount, but still cheaper than the other 3 star hotels offerred at regular price. I did call the hotel in advance, and found out that the room Hotwire booked was an 'economy' room- after reading the reviews I knew that meant a closet, so I very nicely asked if I could have a room with two double beds, knowing that room would be somewhat larger. I also added it was my birthday. Checking in was easy, but finding a place to pull the car up was difficult, at best. Again, I was very nice to the front desk clerk, and again asked him to 'work his magic' so we could have 2 dbl beds. The room, to my relief, was fine. Not great, not large, but having 2 beds made a difference. There was hair on the toilet seat, but I was so ecstatic not to be in an economy room, I didn't care. There was a coffee maker in the room and a hair dryer. No counter space in the bathroom to speak of. We slept like rocks, but also brought a small portable fan for 'white' noise because I had read how thin the walls are-- which is true. The hotel has the original Legal Seafoods across the street, and a McCormick and Schmick and Au Bon Pain right in it. Location was fine. We enjoyed the fancy lobby, but obviously the hotel is old. One night, was fine; however, I would'nt want to stay any longer. In sum, it's 3 star, but I think you could do better with a newer 3 star hotel. Based on the other reviews, we got lucky with the room, and being overly nice really does help with the front desk. The other reviews are right- I wouldn't stay here again. Too many other choices.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 510Jay
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Great location. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was large with two double beds. Water pressure was fine. Bathroom was on the small side, but still ok. No hidden charges. We paid exactly what priceline stated we would. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this hotel because of its location. I would be on my own during the day while my husband was at a conference at the convention center. After making our reservations, I was reading reviews online and became a little concerned because so many of them were negative. However, with the exception of two minor problems, our stay was quite enjoyable and we found the hotel staff to be very helpful and quite friendly. One problem occurred when we checked in: having made reservations for a non-smoking room and 2 double beds, we were told there were no non-smoking rooms available. We were offered an upgrade - yes, at our cost - to a non-smoking king on the 15th concierge floor. It was well worth the cost since the rate included continental breakfasts each of our 5 days, as well as snacks during the day and evening hours, free bottled water, and the services of extremely helpful concierge staff. The other problem was that we, being from hot and humid Texas, could not seem to get the room cool enough. The engineer was dispatched immediately after we called to work on the A/C unit. However, we found that by simply opening the windows at night - actually a treat, since we have very little opportunity to do so at home, we were even more comfortable. While this is not a new and "glitzy" hotel, it is comfortable, with a taste of the past elegance afforded such an old and historic building -and the history of the hotel is quite interesting. We would chose the Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably BAD!!!”
Reviews.Author: BandN
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Plaza Hotel in Boston Sept. 20-23 on business. When we arrived at the hotel, My colleagues and I got a big "Welcome to Boston" greeting when the bell-hop wouldn't take our bags out of the taxi and into the hotel. He said it was the cabbie's responsibility and the cabbie said it was the bell-hop's responsibility and so we just grabbed our bags and took them in ourselves. Once checked in, we went to our rooms and found the the queen size bed is actually a SMALL full size bed. The bathrooms are really small and in the corner rooms the toilet is so close to the tub that you have to sit sideways. The rooms appeared to be relatively clean although my room always had a Taco Bell smell when I returned after maid service. By the way...I don't eat Taco Bell! Last but not least, I definitely want to gripe about the customer service at the hotel. It was really poor considering the costly rooms and grand decor of the hotel. When my colleague found a mouse in her room (YES A MOUSE!), they did not respond to her request to be moved or to have someone take a look at her room to see where the critter got in. There was no apology nor discount offered. Needless to say, this hotel will never be on my list for a return visit (business or pleasure). We heard from others that the Radisson across the street is much better. I'll stay there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Park Plaza? The Worst stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: tjanusky
Reviews.Content: Here is my letter of complaint I wrote to the management: Our stay at your hotel could possibly have been one of the WORST hotel experiences I have had - and I stay in a LOT of hotels in my line of work. I'd thought your hotel was an upscale hotel, and one that my wife, 5 yr old daughter and myself would enjoy on our weekend in Boston August 19th & 20th. Clearly it seemed a more upscale hotel than others, and in a good location. The problem began shortly after our arrival at 2pm when, after having booked a Junior Suite with a pullout sofa (for my daughter to sleep on), we checked into our room (with Bellman in tow) only to find that it didn't have a sofa, nor was it a suite. I went back down to the front desk. The Bellman seemed to be getting annoyed - for having to follow us, for some reason. The gentleman at the front desk said it showed as such on the computer, but would put us into another room. We went back up to the new room on the 11th floor only to find that this also did not have a sofa, nor was it a suite. We all had to go back down again. Now the Bellman was so annoyed he was saying nothing to us at all. So, back down to the front desk again, and assigned yet another room on the 6th or 7th floor. This one also did not have a sofa, and had 2 very small strange bathrooms (also still not a suite) I informed the Bellman that we had to go back down once more. He just dumped our luggage & belongings in a pile in the room and left without a word!! I left my wife & daughter in the room with our stuff & headed back down once again. This time I spoke with the desk manager. After a lengthy time checking and double-checking, she was able to find us a regular (non-suite) room with a pull-out sofa. In addition she provided a discount on the room. We of course now insisted on having a different Bellman help us this time. To note - we arrived at the hotel at 2 pm - it was 5:30 pm by the time we got checked into our last room! A paramount and unnecessary waste of time! Discounts aside, we were quite taken aback by the lack of helpfulness from your front desk staff (with the exception of the desk manager). Moreover, your Bellman was downright rude, and made my wife and daughter feel rather uncomfortable. Overall, I would characterize the staff as being "less than willing to help". We found this to be the case with the restaurant staff (which we chose to use for breakfasts only), the room service staff, etc... We were seated for breakfast and told our server we'd be having the buffet. Upon arriving back from the buffet, we found that someone else had been seated at our assigned table! Neither the maitre'd or the server seemed equipped to make a decision & resolve their mistake - rather, leaving it to us to sort out using another vacant table. We were always made to feel as though these inconveniences laid upon us were "our problem". Not exactly the best service philosophy.

Reviews.Title: “Had a GREAT GREAT experience Loved It.”
Reviews.Author: gemini
Reviews.Content: Everyone very helpful and friendly, room #944 nice and large and very comfortable (not a good view). Completely refurbished floor. Clean clean clean. Super water pressure and nice soft fluffy towels. The other 2 past reviews tell of the other reasons to stay here because of it's location & history. Also I got a Price line deal for 70 a nite for 3 nites (wed thru fri.) I would imagine if I paid the hotels full rate for the room I would of expected a larger room but we only used it to sleep and change and it was very adequate. In addition we had no problem with any noises or disturbances from others because the room was an interior not exterior there was no street noises. I wish everyone's experience could have been so plesant. I would definately stay again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Down Please”
Reviews.Author: kiahbear
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Park Plaza to take in a show and stay in Boston before leaving on a cruise the next day, so we were only there one night. I was a little nervous because my Aunt had told me that it wasn't what it was cracked up to be on their website. I was so relieved when I walked in and saw their gorgeous lobby. My husband and I travel approximatly 4 times a year and the Park Plaza is one of the most beautiful hotels I've ever stayed in. The only problem was when the bars let out. At about 3 AM a group of kids about 21 years old, were staying in adjacent rooms. They were SO loud, laughing, screaming etc. I listened to it for approx. 45 minutes before deciding they had no intentions of calling it a night. I called down to the front desk and they assured me someone would take care of it. No one asked them to quiet down. Finally at about 4:30 AM they did settle in for the night. So while the Park Plaza is beautiful, the walls are VERY thin and I'm not so sure that the staff really cares about the concerns of it's guests.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 2 children (ages 7 and 9) stayed here in August. I was very apprehensive to stay after reading some of the reviews on this website, however, I was very pleasantly surprised by the look of the room, the comfort of the beds and friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. My family was treated very well here. When we called room service to ask for more towels, they arrived quickly in less than 10 minutes. We had no problems at all whatsoever from check in to check out. We were even able to check in earlier than our scheduled time, which was very helpful. I would definitely come back again. Boston is a great city and my family really enjoyed our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Park Plaza - Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised at my current stay at the Park Plaza hotel. With all of the not so good reviews of this hotel, I was really expecting the worse upon arrival. We arrived prior to check in and had no problems getting into our room ... and were also given maps and several recommendations/directions by the gentleman who delivered our luggage. I would agree that the rooms are probably on the small side, but given the price we paid (through Priceline) I wasn't expecting anything more than that. My only slight complaint would be the air conditioning. As most reviews have written, it was never cold in the room ... the AC definitely kept most of the humidity out, but just never got it as cool as I would have expected. Again, given the age of the hotel ... what can you expect? We were never uncomfortable ... just a little warmer than we would have preferred. As we were traveling on vacation, the location of this hotel was ideal for our stay. It's about a block away from the nearest T station and within walking distance of many tourist locations. Overall, I was very pleased w/ our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone I know traveling to Boston (as well as stay there again myself). I just felt I needed to write a positive review, as I feel the Park Plaza has gotten some unfair negative reviews. I hope this puts any travelers w/ an upcoming stay at the Park Plaza at ease, as I know we were very concerned about this hotel based on other reviews we had read.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a Good price”
Reviews.Author: eggtmt
Reviews.Content: We had a Travel Zoo deal for $109. a night. We stay in Boston a lot and this was our first time at this hotel. Room & bed were comfy, smallish, window opened, which is a plus. We parked in the lot across the street for 24 hours for $24.00. Easy walk to Fenway Park about .5 mile. We went to the Rolling Stones and the location was fine. We'd stay there again if we could get that price. I don't think I'd [pay more than $150.) because there are alot of great hotels in the area and if you look around there are alot of deals, (weekends, anyway).

Reviews.Title: “Adequate; Don't expect Charm or Aesthetics”
Reviews.Author: bettyo70
Reviews.Content: This is the kind of place that is good enough...IF someone else is footing the bill. I was in town for business, so this was the choice that was made. I doubt I would have picked it myself! Don't come here expecting charm or nice decorative touches. It is simply a functional business hotel, nothing more. Oh, and they charged me $1.75 for each local call made from the room! Breakfast is not included in the hotel price...and rather expensive! No complimentary coffee or coffee pot in the room. No fridge. My hotel room was cold the night I stayed, and the heat was not easy to figure out how to adjust. To their credit, I arrived on a Tuesday night and found the staff to be friendly and efficient. (I did not encounter the Rudeness problem that others spoke of.) My friend raved about the mattress on her bed. I liked the soap, lotion and shampoo provided in the bathroom. The shower was fine. I found the chandeliers in the reception area very tacky. I was not at all into the overall "interior design" of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay there”
Reviews.Author: vacationistGermany
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel and we enjoyed our stay there (although I must say that I had been pretty concerned because of the bad postings in this forum). Our room was on the 12th floor and we had a beautiful view on the Public Garden. The room was definitely not as big as ones home but had a cosy atmosphere. The carpet looked used but the room (bedroom and bathroom) was clean. There was a TV, a hairdryer, 2 phones, an iron and an ironing board, a desk, several pieces of furniture to store oneâ€™s clothes, and 2 chairs. On the 12th floor near the 6 elevators was an ice machine and a snack vending machine. The staff was friendly and quickly responded to our demands. The location of this hotel is great: only one block away from the â€˜Tâ€™ (but you wonâ€™t need to use the subway if you donâ€™t like because you can reach pretty much everything on foot in no time). If we ever stayed in Boston again we would definitely go and stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mentaldiet
Reviews.Content: Stayed Friday and Saturday, for a convention. Yes it is an old hotel with charm and small rooms. Fine for two people. Bathroom fine for one at a time. All the amenities are there, two phones, internet, hair dryer, personal items, view, cable TV, clean. We got our room at 2 and left by noon. Ate several meals in the magnificient main conference room, chandeliers, carved portico balconys and they were all very good. As stated concierage was great. Great location. Hotel has club, chain upscale restaurants, Ben&Jerry's, Au Bau Pain, Negatives, no pool, no mini bar, room safe. Mini bus from airport $10-12 and they don't fill up. $129 was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Don't fret, Book it! It was Great!!”
Reviews.Author: RealMccoy
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a four night stay at the Boston Park Plaza Hotel and Towers and it was really a great trip. I have to say that after reading the reviews I was so skeptical and a little afraid about what we might find there that I really wanted to move the hotel. Since we were part of a convention we didn't have that option and still have the room be paid for. I am glad we stayed put and kept and open mind. We traveled with two kids 11 and 13 years old. A pool would have been great but the park doesn't have one. we simply found some other things to keep us busy. As far as Location the Park has it. It is located a few steps/yards from the Arlington T stop (subway). Is very close to the Boston Garden and Commons. For that matter most things are a short walk from the hotel. The Downtown Crossings (filenes basement, marshalls, tj maxx). The fashionable and oh so expensive Newbury street and the shops at the Pru(dential) and copley are all close by. Boston is a very walkable city you really don't need the subway but it is there anyway and is cheap (1.25 adult fare child to 11 1/2 fare) babies free. You can get anywhere using it. We only used it one time to get to the Science center for the duck tour as the ones leaving from the pru were full. If you choose to do this tour book online before you leave for the specific time. They sell out usually before noon. The freedom trail starts in the boston common so from this hotel you have perfect spot to explore. The overnight parking is $36 a night. We could have gotten it cheaper but it would not have been as safe in my opinion or convienient. We got our car within 10 min of asking for it although they told us to allow a half hour. a TIP if you are a AAA or CAA member you can get free parking if you used the AAA rate for the room. If you get a cut rate room from priceline or one of the other dot com places then don't complain about the parking price. If you have the AAA tour book for the new england area there is an ad for the hotel that has the blurb at the bottom regarding the free parking. The employees were friendly. When you check in stop at the concierge desk and ask for a free boston card. In it are discounts for area things. One of them is the duck tour. I think it is the only discount around. (they have a child and student fare too). The grand entrance is grand. I remember being a college student and walking by this place wishing someday I could afford to stay there. After reading the reviews I was dreading it but you can be assured you will like it there. There is an exercise room in the basement. They don't call it the basement but there isn't a better term for it. the steps to get to it are over by the gift shop. The fitness room is really nice. better than most. I was looking for info prior to going but didn't find it so I will put it here hoping some other folks that like to exercise during vacation or work will appreciate it. They have about 3 treadmills and 3 elipitical trainers as well as a lifecycle and a few recumbent bikes. There are also free weights and a weight bench. It has 2 tvs and free water from a water cooler with cups. It of course has AC. There is also a stair climber. Our room was on the 5th floor. We had a room with two double beds. That were tastefully made with a comfortor with a duvet cover. We had two windows that had a shade and another room darkening shade. The AC worked but wasn't freezing. We were comfortable. The bathroom was small but what can you possibly expect from an old historic hotel when folks were lucky to have a private bath in the room. It was well stocked with towels and tissues and extra t.p. There was a shelf above the sink that had enough space for 4 peoples major need items like toothpaste, shave stuff and contact lens needs. There was a stain on one of the shades and the carpet was worn pretty well but it was not discusting. There was a desk with ample light to work and connection to the internet which is a fee per day if you use it. We did not and it was pretty nice not to have to. There was a tv with extended cable and we didn't watch much of that either. They provided a hair dryer. The closet was small but had plenty of hangers. There was a chest of drawers that had enough space for 4 people to unpack and place clothing in the drawers provided. There were plenty of places to eat in the hotel. My husband had the breakfast buffet and it set him back $20! I didn't eat there with our kids. outside the hotel there is a au boin pain where you can get a reasonably priced breakfast and eat it there at an inside table or outside table or just take it with you. If you are into starbucks coffee you can find one almost anywhere because I think I saw more starbucks than mcdonalds. There is a ben and jerrys just outside the hotel. If you do the duck tour save the book they give you because there is a coupon inside for a buy one get one free item at ben and jerrys. There is also a cold stone creamery about a block away over by legal seafood. There are so many places to eat I don't think you would need to eat at the hotel at all. The Hard Rock cafe is just a few blocks down near the john hancock building and a cheesecake factory is in the prudential center shops just by the T stop. The flagship Legal Seafood is just a block away from the hotel. We ate there and the cheesecake factory and it was great at both places. We also went over to cheers which was just okay. We ate a few places at Quincey market and that was good fast and cheap. Plus you could sit outside and people watch. All in all don't pass by this hotel for the reviews because it is a nice place to stay with all the amenities except a pool. The location is great. PS. Didn't see any bugs and the elevators were fast and quiet and plentyful.

Reviews.Title: “basement apartment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Park Plaza is located at an excellent location in the heart of downtown Boston. Unfortunately from my room I could not see any of it. My 9th floor room was dark, small, and felt like I was stuck in a tiny, basement apartment. The view was facing towards an inside courtyard which features a full view of many rooms 20 feet across. The room received minimal light, even by mid-day. Also, the parking was $36 for the night which seemed outrageous. The week before I was in LA and they only charged $15 night for valet parking. If you stay here make sure they put in one of their decent rooms.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a very well placed hotel for both the shopping areas and the historic areas of Boston. The lobby is impressive and we were welcomed by a nice staff especially the gentleman on reception. The room however was small and although it was adequate, it wasn't anything special. It was clean and the house keeping staff were very good. The concierge was too busy to help us and when we checked out, the bell staff and doormen were very unhelpful.I would like to go back to Boston sometime, but I don't think we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Plaza and were very disappointed in the service at the hotel. *The concierge was unable to find the full itinerary for the group we were with, and we missed a scheduled breakfast because they were unable to tell us where it was located. *Our bathtub backed-up, and did not drain itself for hours, which made it extremely difficult for more than 1 person to shower. *The valet service "lost" my car for almost a 1/2 hour because the head valet had given my keys to someone, but didn't recall who. Overall, it was very disappointing. I have stayed at the Radisson in the past (located across the street) and it was cheaper, the plumbing worked, and the service was 100% better. I will stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but not the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: cmacginnis
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Park Plaza in June for four nights. When you first walk in, the place is absolutely stunning. The check in staff were cold and mechanical. Our room was a queen, the bed was made nicely and the sheets were clean. The bathroom was tiny, but again, clean. Overall, the room was a good size, had a closet and room for two suitcases. The only problems with the room were: the airconditioning (worked occasionally-- and loudly), towels (super-hard and crusty), and the maids (walked in on us every morning at 8AM even with the "do not disturb" sign up! Had to chain the door to keep them out!). However, the location is worth it and there is no other hotel downtown in Boston that offers such a good price. And at $70 a night, what more can you expect. If you want perfection, pay $400 to stay at the Four Seasons across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than previous reviews give it credit for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was some what concerned upon reading previous reviews of this hotel that i had wrongly spent my money, but after staying there for 4 nights with my family of four i am glad i stuck with my reservation. We took advantage of a great value deal on expedia of Â£80 per night for us all to be fitted in one room. Initial impressions werent good though, expensive car parking ($36 a day) and we were given a room which hadnt been cleaned since the previous occupiers had checked out. However we went down to the front desk and were fortunate to be served by a manager who upgraded us into a larger deluxe room with 2 bathrooms at no extra charge and was very sorry. The hotel itself is extremely grand and historic with a lovely reception area and ball room if you are fortunate to sneak a look into it (as we did). Also the hotel offers a wide variety of food but i do recommend the Italian restaurant directly across the road from the hotel, or, for a slightly cheaper option, the irish bar just along the street. The location couldnt be better, right in the centre of Boston and within walking distance of most attractions. The beautiful Boston Common is only a 5 minute walk away. This hotel is not the most luxurious in Boston, but hey for the price we paid it was definitely great value for money, if you want more go to Jurys or the Copley. The hotel always seemed busy and the service was slow at times, we waited nearly 45 minutes for some towels. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is in the middle of Boston. Its right across from the beautiful Boston Commons and a half mile walk in any direction takes you to shops, sidewalk cafes and the beautiful culture and architecture of the city. The hotel is very well known among the residence and is very nice but does have a few issues you'll need to know about. The air conditioning posed a problem right away. It's honestly hit or miss with this. We asked to move rooms twice before being satisfied with the room temperature. The rooms are tastefully decorated and a decent size. Some rooms have huge walk-in closets and some rooms have marble bathrooms. The bathroom is very small, but functional all the same. The room we decided to keep had an exercise bike and two bathrooms. Rooms with two double beds were very narrow, not having stayed in them thats all I can really say. The fitness center contains treadmills, bikes and elypical machines as well as a few strength machines and a set of freeweights. There is no pool. All in all we had a good stay. No problems other than the initial air conditioning concern. I would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't understand what the fuss is all about”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the plaza park hotel on July 21-24th. We thought that the hotel was wonderful and unlike the reviews that have been posted on this site. Staff: The staff was wonderful, We checked in at noon and our room was already for us. We had questions throughout our stay and were always greeted by the concierge and the staff. They answered our questions and were very prompt. Our Room: Our room was wonderful. Very nice decor, newly remodelled and VERY clean. We never saw any bugs/insects of any kind nor did we see any mice. Our bathroom was huge, probably as big or bigger than our home shower. Location: wonderful. We walked practically everywhere, the hotel was in the middle of everything which was great and very very close to the T (Subway)

Reviews.Title: “We didn't have any problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have read the other reviews and we didn't experience the problems the other travelers had. The hotel is in a good location, walking distance to many Boston attractions. The Concierge was very helpful giving us tips on when to avoid certain locations. Thy strongly suggested the Duck tour, which my husband, 2 children (ages 10 and 12) took. The hotel rooms are very small. The only inconvience was the size of the bathroom. Very small with no countertop space. For the price (we received a AAA discount), I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Pass on the Park Plaza”
Reviews.Author: meh7976
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 day stay at the Boston Park Plaza as a part of a national convention of 1000 people. The Park Plaza was the convention hotel and therefore I went ahead and booked at $160 a night plus 12% tax. The plaza is a historical hotel and I knew it would have some quirks, but the hotel and staff did not live up to their 3 1/2 star rating. Check-in at the Park Plaza was the worst. Yes, we were there early for convention check-in, however, staff was rude and unconcerned that we had to be checked in changed for an evening dinner cruise. Check-in was supposed to be at 3 p.m. however, we did not receive our room keys until 4:45 p.m while we were sitting on the bus to go to our dinner cruise. (We checked at 11:30a, 1:15p, 3:15p, 4p prior to getting a room.) AT least my check-in experience went better than the business traveler ahead of me whose company had made reservations but due to computer problems the hotel did not have the gentlemans reservation so he didn't have a room. Parking had been quoted as a convention rate of $24 self-park or $27 valet-parking. Upon arrival we found valet-parking to be $36 per night. Front desk was rude at attempted check-in and at check-out they were just happy to be getting rid of the convention guests. The manager who brought us our room keys gave us a $50 gift certificate for all the trouble. However, this gift was a coupon that all the people at convention received and it was $50 off of a purchase of $60 or more. Once we got into the room which was one of the smaller rooms I have ever stayed in and definately the most expensive for the size. We found that the doors to the rooms were very difficult to open and usally required at least 3 attempts to open the door. Due to the age of the hotel and having stayed in another historic hotel in LA I was expecting a small room, closet and bathroom however, the Park Plaza doesn't overcome the feeling of being a small room. The air conditioning was not working well anywhere in the hotel except on the 4th floor were a majority of the business offices were located and we had a workshop in this area. The hotel did provide fans for several guests who complained and continued to complain until something was done. It didn't help to even open the windows since Boston was in the high 80's to low 90's with 92-95 % humidity. The room supplies such as towels, washcloths, handtowels, soap, shampoo, and coffee making supplies were not always restocked everyday. We had to call 4 times before finally giving up on the coffee the one day. The hotel room was clean and smelled nice thankgoodness we didn't have a problem there. In the banquet room however, there was a mouse trap in the balcony area near a window that was set and ready to go. We checked it every time we were up there to make sure we didn't have any extra friends for meal functions. (Both myself and another gentleman took pictures.) Concierge was helpful at giving directions to nearby attractions and was able to sell us tickets for the trolley tour. The hotel is nearby Public Gardens, Boston Commons, Beacon Hill, Cheers Bar and about a 10-15 minute walk from Prudential Center. Overall if you don't care about the price or the service but want to be close to some of the attractions go ahead and stay at the Park Plaza but as for me no thanks one stay was enough.

Reviews.Title: “The worst experience I have ever had!”
Reviews.Author: SweetPea
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation to stay one night at the Boston Park Plaza Hotel. Upon my arrival, I was informed by the front desk that the hotel was overbooked and that even though I had a confirmation, there was no room for me. In addition to that, all of the hotels in Boston were sold out due to several conventions taking place. The front desk manager was less than apologetic about THEIR error. They offered to put me in a lower quality hotel - 40 minutes outside of Boston - period. Take it or leave it attitude. In addition to the poor experience with the front desk, the bell staff was also very rude. Unbelievable! I will never return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and location.”
Reviews.Author: AlexOasis
Reviews.Content: I have read several of the other reviews of this hotel. Wow, people certianly are picky! We paid about $90 a night for this hotel and were completely pleased with what we got for the price. The location cannot be beat. The most central we have stayed while in Boston. We arrived at around 10 am on a Friday and were immediately checked into our room. The room was clean and updated. By no means was it big, but hello...this is a $90 room in the heart of Boston. We found the air conditioner to be more than adequate and this is coming from a Floridian who constantly has the air on full blast. Overall no complaints. If you want the Ritz this ain't it, but the price of a room is also about $200 less.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Awful”
Reviews.Author: CharlieBoy33
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two nights 16th and 17th. Checked in late- no welcome or hello, just a simple list of everything I would be charged for as an extra. Prerequested a non-smoking King, but received a smoking double. On querying was told the only other option was a fold out bed??? ( for 249 bucks a night!!) This was the smallest bathroom I have ever seen. Getting to sit on the bowl required being double jointed. Gave up on room service after 1 hour wait. Told guest services to cancel the order, but then got a knock on my door, 2 1/2 hours later with the food. I kept taking an elevator that refused to stop on 6th floor but deposited me on the 5th or 7th. On check out, the computers were down, so they could not tel me my final charges. When I asked them to email me the folio, they claimed they had no means to do so, so I requested a fax. I'm still waiting for it... This is hotel way past its prime, charging top dollar for tired service and facilities. Ther must be better, less expensive places in Chicago. Oh.....steer clear of the breakfast. Overpriced, congealed, long service delays at atrocious prices.

Reviews.Title: “About the bathrooms....and other things....”
Reviews.Author: arucker1980
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this historic gem of a hotel, and the lobby was beautiful, however, it was quite crowded. I arrived 10 mintues before check-in time, which may have been a bad idea. I waited in line for 26 minutes only for the man at the desk to tell me my room wouldn't be ready for an hour or so. According to the grumbles I heard as I made my way to the bar, this was happening to just about everyone floating in the lobby. People were waiting with unhappy faces all over the place, on the floor, on the stairs, outside in the front. I decided to wait in the bar. The bartender was a wonderful, cheery man with a great sense of humor. He even called over to the front desk to check if my room was ready without me even asking. An hour and a half and two beers later I was in my "suite". Don't let that word trick you. When they advertise 2 bathrooms, don't get excited. The bathrooms were the smallest I have seen in the country, and not all that clean (the toilets are actually like the ones in gas stations, the big handle you flush with your foot). I was practically showering with the toilet, and the shower curtain was "mildewy" and seemed to be attacking me as I showered. Cheap shampoo and coarse towels weren't the best either. The other bathroom was identical. The room itself had some old world charm, but nothing to write home about. The view was nil, and the carpet was pretty dirty, and the bedding had some stains. It was only a one night stay, and that was just about enough for me. One more thing, the bar attatched to the hotel "Whiskey Park", we were told by hotel staff we could enter without a cover, but the bouncers would not let us in without the $20 cover, and it was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Ummm... Fuhgeddaboutit, y'all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were here for three days on a convention. We stay in hotels appx 75-100 nights/yr all over the country and it has been a while since we've been to one like this. The downstairs looks nice, a bit rough around the edges if you look closely. Location is great (1 block from the T), nearby restaurants are great (Legal Seafood, Smith & Wollensky), elevators were generally prompt, ballroom looked nice (but had a rough area or two). Then you get upstairs. The hallways had these odd concrete blocks jutting out (where room service dishes would stay for hours). The doors had these odd curved door-in-door openings (?) that looked 50 years old. The room was rather small, and stayed somewhat clammy (the air conditioner never really cooled much). The furniture was economy and old. The bathroom was small and part old, part redone -- an old industrial toilet (loud) and new shower with plastic false tiles (like you might see at a Days Inn). Oh yes, and hair (not ours). No counter space, the hairdryer was stuck in the top drawer of the dresser in the room. The plastic Kleenex box cover had its bar-code sticker still on it. Classy. The room was a religious experience -- the sheets and towels were holey (towels were threadbare). Even if a place is undergoing renovations, there's no excuse for that. At least the beds were moderately comfortable. Oh yeah, and twice I saw a gnat or somesuch flying thing in the room. No roaches (glad we didn't see *those* reviews beforehand). Small closet. Internet was cabled-Ethernet (in downtown Boston, while we get free wireless in the boonies of Mississippi???) and $10/day. And while we're on the subject of downtown hotels with business clientele, no daily newspaper? Faxes aren't delivered to the room (first time we've had that happen at a convention). They advise 1/2 hr lead time to retrieve your car from valet parking ($36/day). And housekeeping wandered in once without knocking. We asked others in the conference if their rooms were worse than ours and they said yes before we even related our stories. We thought we were going to an upscale property, it wound up being a rather blah economy hotel at a upscale price. Don't judge this book by its cover. Boston was great, though.

Reviews.Title: “The park plaza was great”
Reviews.Author: Chewbacca21
Reviews.Content: I have to say we had a great experience at the Boston Park plaza. When we arrived we were advised the the economy room we had booked was only suitable for one person this is despite the fact that expedia had let me book the room for 2. We were upgraded at no extra charge and with the minimum of fuss. The queen room we were allocated was great and v spacious. The hotel has good facilities including a number of bars restaurants / bars. We used the bars which were fine but not the restaurants as the location is so good for Back Bay, Beacon Hill and Downtown. In these areas there is lots of good restaurants. For great pizza visit the Upper Crust on Charles Street. The hotel is also well situated for seeing the sites of Boston. Beware though the internet charges as the hotel want $10 dollars for a 24 hour period. This is ok if you want to surf, all I wanted to do was quickly check email. Anyway the hotel was great, and good value for Boston, however if there are 2 of you book a queen room as the economy rooms are only for 1 person

Reviews.Title: “a little warm at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: mooney8204
Reviews.Content: We used the Priceline and I called to make sure we got a king size bed non smoking. They were extremely nice and accomodating to confirm my wishes without any problems. The room was nice big the double head showers were a plus. the only problem is there was no ac. They gave us a fan to hold us over. Other then that the staff was great and we had a nice time. The Bar is pricey. A coors light and corona was 10.00 but we went to Fenway and Paid 6.00 each so I guess it Boston. But I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not know what everyone is complaining about.”
Reviews.Author: traveller915
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I arrived at the hotel after a $30 cab ride from the airport (this included a tip) and had no problem with check-in whatsoever. I go up in one of the six elevators (which run quickly and smoothly) to my room (541), and the doors look like a 50's fridge. I really don't know why everyone was complaining about having a small room. It was spacious enough for both of us to move freely in the room without bumping into each other, I had a big walk in closet, the bed was queen size, the pillows were the worst, the view was of a courtyard and all that could be seen was the other side of the building. On the second day my girl saw a roach in the bathroom, mind you it seems like it was about to die because it had been poisoned, I just scooped it up and flushed it down the toilet. My girl wanted me to complain (which I should have) but I want to know what building doesn't have insects in them, and it was JUST one roach. The dual shower heads were a great touch, A/C really didn't cool down the room, and key cards were never a problem to open the door. The hotel is in a great location (within a 15 minute walk to everything) and the transit system is a block away which only costs $1.25 pp each way to ride and it is easily accessable to everything else. We NY'ers are spoiled, our transit system is 24hrs a day (not this one) it ends at 1am. We took the Duck Tour, well worth it, if you are going to go to the top of the Prudential Building I suggest doing that during the day, you can't see anything the "tour guide" is talking about. If you are going to dine do it at about 8pm because NO LATE DINING, restaurants seem to close their kitchens at about 10pm. In all I would not mind visiting the city of Boston and staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth $200 Per Night... But OK For What I Paid.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went on a long weekend to this hotel with my boyfriend who booked it at a travel agent rate, being a travel agent, for a steal at $59 per night. (They didn't even ask to see his travel agent card!) We were impressed with the hotel's location and the lavish lobby inside. I was excited to see that the hotel so far was nicer than expected. Upon entering our room, although it had a pretty decor as the pictures and was a decent size, there was a slight funky old smell and the carpet was pretty worn and stained. But, for $59 per night, who would complain? The first morning we woke up we noticed was that the walls are paper thin (There as a small child crying and throwing a tantrum at about 8am, urgh). Later that night when we arrived, we were stopped by security to show our keys because there was a High School Prom held in one of the ball rooms and there were a bunch of teens all dress up hanging out in the lobby. If thats' not your cup of tea don't go during prom season. After that, we reach the room and I went into the bathroom and saw a dead bug on the self in front of the mirror!!!! I was really grossed out but, my boyfriend told me to let it slide and if it happens again we'll complain. I reluctantly agreed and had my eye out the rest of our stay. We didn't spend much time in the room being that we were all over Boston all weekend. It has a T-stop station a block away, which takes you quickly anywhere from Fenway Park to North Boston. Also,hotel is located right near the BEAUTIFUL park , The Boston Common. There are some nice casual restaurants with pretty good food like the Rattlesnake but, make sure you get there early enough for the kitchen to be open in any reataurant in Boston as these close by 10pm. I'm from NY, so i'm not used to that. The lounge in the hotel looked like it was a hot spot but it didn't peak our interest becuase it was too dark and small. You are also only a few blocks away from the Prudential Building where there are a lot of cafes and restaurants to choose from. Over all, for the price we were offered it was OK. The pictures besides the one of the lobby do the rooms too much justice as they are not as spic n' span. But, we got lucky and paid a Ramada Inn rate as opposed to an outrageous $200 plus rate that was worth well under that. So, folks, this was my experience, it may not be yours if you decide on this hotel but, my advice... unless you are the one getting a rate that is a steal, they will be robbing you. Good Luck.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual upgrade”
Reviews.Author: DrJ6
Reviews.Content: We booked online and reserved a double room with an extra roll away bed for $71 per night. When we confirmed the reservation just before the trip the hotel advised that only smoking rooms were available.
