Upon arrival the front desk offered us the option of moving into the living room/dining room of a non-smoking suite. The catch was that we would be on two sofa beds and a roll away. We agreed to this as it was at no extra charge, it would be a change from the ordinary and the room was non-smoking. The main door opened into a small foyer revealing two separate rooms with key card access. Our room was roughly 40'x25' and even with both sofa beds extended, we still had plenty of room to manuever despite the existence of the roll away, six-chair dining table, armoire, writing desk, end tables and two sitting chairs. The big problem though was the quality of the bedding. No matter how you dress it up, a sofa bed is an uncomfortable night's sleep and mine seemed to have an especially thin mattress. More dissapointing was the bathroom. The tile was old and cracking. The toilet seemed to be an afterthought. It was wedged flush (excuse the pun) with the tub and mere inches from the vanity. It made for some rather awkward positioning when one needed a few minutes of quiet contemplation. As a minor point, the bell captain and the too-numerous-to-count bell hops were more interested in standing around outside than helping people with their bags. On the plus side, the bartenders were genuine in their banter and the whole first floor area had a great old world hotel feel to it. The location to the Arlington T stop is very handy and the faux Irish pub around the corner serves a quality pint of Guinness. If you like chain eateries, there is a Legal Sea Food nearby as well as a couple of other places.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: pinesdriver
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Boston over Memorial Day weekend (May 28-30). We were booked at the Park Plaza through an airfare/hotel package deal through Delta. Like some others, I was a little uneasy based on the mixed nature of the reviews here. However, we had very little to complain about during our stay. Check-in was quick and efficient despite the fact that we arrived before noon. The room was a little on the small side, but that's to be expected in a city like Boston. The bed was advertised as a queen size and it seemed a little smaller than that but it was sufficient...glad we didn't get a double bed. The bathroom was spotless. The location couldn't be beat -- easy walking distance to nearly everything and the T stop was a block away. There was a high school prom on one of the nights we were there, but other than a lot of activity in the lobby area it was not a problem. All-in-all, an enjoyable stay and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not much else”
Reviews.Author: satelite
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotwire so I got an ok rate on it. When I looked at it on the web I was quite excited until I started to read the reviews here then I was concerned. When my cab pulled up to the hotel the cabby put my three bags on the curb. I waited a few minutes for a someone from the bell staff to help me with my bags. I was traveling alone and on the second week of a two week stay in the area. When I realized no one was coming to get my bags I picked them up and hauled them into the lobby. I stood in front of the main desk waiting for someone to help me check in but they all seemed too busy with whatever they were doing on the computer. Eventually I went up to one of them and asked nicely if this was where I check in she said yes but she was busy and would be with me in a minute. After getting my room key I headed up to my room. This is where the real fun begins. I put my key in the door and it made a chime noise but when I turned the handle the door would not open. I trekked back down to the front desk leaving my bags in the hallway. They reactivated my key and then sent me back up to try again. Same problem couldn't open the door. I went down a third time and they said they would send security to open my door. So I trekked back upstairs and waited outside the door for security. Eventually a fairly large security guy showed up. He opened the door but it did take him a decent amount of force. I asked him if anything could be done about my door and he said he would put in a maintenance request. I checked in on a Saturday so I guessed it would probably be Monday before I saw maintenance. I put my bags in the room and rested for a minute. I tried to open the door now that someone else had opened it but to no avail I couldn't get the door open. I then went down to the desk and asked for the manager. I told him the story and that I still could not open the door. I asked for a new room and he was very nice and gave me not only a new room but an upgrade. The photo attached to this review was the view from my window over the common. The concierge staff was not that great and usually swamped. The hotel lobby was very pretty and there were a few good places to eat on the exterior of the hotel. Location wise it was a block from a T station and a block from the common. It was also very close to the theater district and Chinatown. The phone charges are also outrageous as well as the charge for internet access. If my check in experience would have been better, staff more helpful and the miscellaneous charges lower I would have probably really liked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was initially worried about how our stay would turn out considering all of the bad reviews I had read. However, we ended up having a great stay, and both my husband and I agreed that we would definitely consider staying here again the next time we come to Boston. We arrived on a Tuesday and were supposed to get a deluxe room with a king sized bed. However, they didn't have any of those rooms clean yet, so they upgraded us to a room with 2 beds. We were slightly dissapointed that the beds were only double (the lady at the front desk did tell me they were queen beds--they weren't). But--we had one of the renovated rooms that looked like it had originally been 3 separate rooms that were now combined into 1. We had 2 bathrooms (yes, they are small). We had a large sitting area with a couch, table, etc. and a desk to work at. We loved the fact that we could both get ready at the same time since we had 2 full bathrooms! We were visiting Boston with friends, and they said that our room was nicer than their room at the Sheraton! We were also slightly dissappointed with the business center. My husband needed to use it for some work, and it didn't have anything---pens, paperclips, paper, etc. that you would expect to see in a business center. My husband had to go to the front desk to grab a pen. Despite these small dissapointments, we had a very nice time at the Park Plaza. It was definitely much better than I had been led to believe on these reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Tired old lady dressed up in her best frock”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel likes to give the impression of a grand first rate hotel, the entrance is impressive and the staff are all dressed accordingly to fit the surroundings. All is good until you get into your room, they are small, dirty and noisy. Our bathroom was a disgrace we complained twice, on the first occasion nothing was done, the room was appantly cleaned but the coffee making facilities were left half empty as we had left them in the morning and the bathroom was still dirty, I will not go into details but it was not pleasant, again we complained and eventually a surly maid came and wafted her cloth around all to little effect. The carpets are old torn and filthy. Great central location and grand frontage but don't be fooled this place is a bit of a dump on the inside. Don't book theatre tickets through the concierge, they ask you for your preferences and then get you what is available regardless of your price limit, plus you pay for a courier to do the deal for you. Go direct or use one of the many ticket booths available around the city.

Reviews.Title: “What was everyone complaining about??”
Reviews.Author: jL637
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to expect after I booked 2 nights through priceline. It seemed like a Loved it or hated it hotel. First of all, the escalator on the arlington exit broke, so we had to lug 2 50-lb suitcases up a couple flights of stairs...not fun =| The Park Plaza has 2 exits, and the hotel was very easy to find (signs posted everywhere at the exit of the subway). We were able to check in early (at 1pm) and although priceline booked us for a full-size room, they were able to change it to a queen. (the 2 doubles and kings were all booked because of a cheerleading competition..>(..) That upgrade was done w/o a hassle. Our room was on the 9th floor (one of their newly remodeled floors) and the elevators were very fast (there were 6) and the place was polished, clean and very nice. Our doors were a little weird (kind of reminded me of a fridge), but the room was clean, the bed comfy, the sheets clean and the smell was pleasant. Our bathroom was definitely remodeled because the tile was white and the tub new. I LOVED the twin shower sprays! Anyway, I had no complaints whatsoever! When we checked out, we were able to leave our luggage w/ the hotel while we continued to sight-see before our flight. The staff was friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: U2fan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a short break at the Boston Park Plaza Hotel. I must say that after reading the mixed reviews on this site, I was apprehensive about stopping here. However, we were very pleasantly surprised. The plus sides of the hotel were: - the main areas of the hotel are beautifully decorated; very ornate - price; very good value - location; it's very central and close to brilliant shops / restaurants / Boston Common / Cheers, etc - our room was comfortable (the bed was great) and large (room 1009) - MJ O'Connors Irish Bar; well, we were there over Paddy's Day! The downsides to the hotel were: - it's very busy (it appears to host lots of conferences); check-in took a whole and the general phone numbers weren't answered quickly - it was noisy first thing in the morning; we were at the back of the hotel right above the loading bays - the staff weren't particularly friendly - they didn't have a UK - US adapter (despite telling us that they had), and we were unable to locate one in town. Lesson learnt - if you're planning to use UK electrical equipment, don't forget to bring an adapter with you!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Disappointing -”
Reviews.Author: nicoleclive
Reviews.Content: We drove up to the doors of the Plaza and were greated by the Valet that charged 36.00 US for parking. The lobby is impressive - but then there is the 1 star motel room. This place is a dump. Very dirty rooms. Our floor was supposed to be non-smoking but smelled like a cigar bar, You can bearly fit your suitcases in the rooms they are so small. The walls are thin and you can hear everything in the next room. The hotel is in a good location but not worth staying at. I wouldnt even get under the comforter as the room was that dirty. If you travel often as I do I would warn you against this hotel. The rooms are really that bad. Stay somewhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Katherine1968
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the poor reviews on the Boston Park Plaza Hotel, I was very leary about what to expect upon arrival. We were pleasantly surprised by the accommodating staff, cleanliness, and comfort of the hotel. Our room was tidy, in good repair, and had all amenities you would expect of a 3-star hotel. The location is excellent--very convenient to all Boston attractions and transportation. The historic ambiance of the hotel is very inviting and charming. The fitness center was better than average, and unlike many older hotels, we didn't spend too much time waiting on the elevators. I would definitely return. A good value for the price paid using Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Taffeta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Boston Park Plaza for four nights during a professional conference in January 2005. I got a cheaper than normal rate ($129 a night for a single) through the conference organization's travel agency. I must have gotten one of the good rooms. From reading reviews on this site it sounds like this is a Jeckyll and Hyde hotel. First, there are apparently a lot of really small rooms in this hotel. I did not have one of them. Mine had obviously been created by merging two smaller rooms. The room had one queen-sized bed, and was very spacious for one person. Everything was clean, and there were no bad smells. The quirky thing about this room is that it had two bathrooms! They were each small, but I've seen smaller. When they merged the rooms they did not knock down the walls between the bathrooms. This would be a good room for a couple to stay in. Second, the TV worked well, and had about 30-40 cable channels. There were two upholstered chairs for sitting with a small end table between them. There was also a desk with a straight chair. There was ample lighting in the room (inadequate hotel room lighting is one of my pet peeves). There wasn't really a view out the window. I could only see across to rooms in another wing of the hotel. I thought the staff were generally very good, and the concierge staff were especially helpful. My only problem with the hotel came after I got home and realized that I had left one item of clothing in the room. I called to see whether it could be located. I talked with someone from security who was not very friendly. He did inquire and said that nothing had been found in the room. I assume that it had already been used by others since I left.

Reviews.Title: “Resting on its Laurels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like to stay at historic hotels (Mayflower, Grove park Inn, St. Francis), but in this case "historic" meant last renovated in 1970...reserved in August for this trip, got a small room with non-working thermostat facing an airshaft (#969), was moved to smaller room when I complained (#998), was told it would cost $100/night more for a "better" room (I was already paying $199/night)...called around to book ANYWHERE else, unfortunately downtown was subsequently booked because of the World Series...nice public rooms, bedroom was the worst I've had in over 15 years of international travel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Boston Park Plaza for one night and had a wonderful experience. The staff was friendly and helpful. I had a cold and needed more kleenex so I called house keeping and not even five minutes later, someone brought me two boxes. The hotel is beautiful, especially the lobby. Our room was small, but still very nice. The bed was very comfortable. I slept better then I have during stays at other hotels. There are many great restaurants, either in the hotel or a short walk away. I visit Boston for pleasure often and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Park Plaza”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room at the Park Plaza through priceline for $60 a night (our stay was in early Jan.) and I was thrilled until I read the reviews on this site and others. I called and requested a king non-smoking room before we left but being the pessimist I am, I knew we were going to be in for a terrible three nights. Upon arrival we were thoroughly impressed by the lobby and the manners of the staff, and after seeing our room we were impressed with it also. We must have had a remodeled room because it was extremely nicely decorated and the bed was comfortable and yes, a king. Very nice linens. No offensive odors or stains at all. Fresh paint and new carpet. The room and the bathroom were both on the smaller side but by no means intolerable. The shower had been recently remodeled and it was clean and there were two showerheads with great pressure. There was a digital thermostat in the room and you could open our window with no problems at all. Also - we had two phones - a cordless and one with a cord, and high speed internet connection. Large tv too. The closet was a normal sized closet - not a walk in or anything but more than enough for our needs. Oh and I loved the free shampoo and soap - the smell was wonderful. We had no complaints the entire time. Upon returning to our room every afternoon it had been cleaned and re-stocked. They also have a free business center open 24 hours which is nice. By the way we were on the 21st floor - and the halls were wide, clean, recently remodeled, and well lit. I looked on a few other floors just to see if any of those were different and they all looked the same. I would recommend, even at a higher price than we paid, and I would stay there again. Oh and I forgot - the location only added to the Park Plaza. We didn't have a car in Boston and the nearest T station is about a block away, so that was very convenient. It is also surrounded by restaurants and shops and Boston Common and the public gardens are right around the corner. I can't think of anything else, I just know that I was very pleasantly surprised that no part of the hotel that I saw was dark or dingy or stinky, and everyone was very polite and helpful. My only regret is that I never ate at Finale, though we did eat at the Irish pub one night (can't remember the name) and the food was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel then rates went up”
Reviews.Author: CT-Travler
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the hotel about 5 or 6 times in the past 10 years and have to say for a historical hotel I was quite satisfied, the hotel wasnt perfect, there were some quirks (things that didnt work) The hotel though all of a sudden increased rates drastically (by booking through the hotel) and this was just to much to pay for the hotel, and so my family figured that since there are so many good Boston hotels we found hotels for the same price in the heart of the city. The location is great for this hotel (There is a Radisson around the corner that is much cheaper also)

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Boston Park Plaza”
Reviews.Author: LeGaffer
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on trip advisor and elsewhere I was very nervous about staying here. All I can say is that my experience and stay there was FANTASTIC. We got an amazing rate for 2 rooms. The staff could not have been any nicer. The rooms were spotless, and made up on time everyday. Yes the bathrooms are small, but they were clean. Yes the parking is $36/day, but that is a Reasonable rate for 24hrs with in/out privileges in Boston. This is a solid 3+ star hotel. We had adjoining rooms, one on the small side and one rather spacious. Our kids loved the hotel. We stayed on the 11th floor and the rooms were tastefully decorated. TV worked perfect in both rooms. The location of the Hotel is wonderful, close to the T (subway), shopping, dining and the Boston Commons. I would stay at the Boston Park Plaza again without hesitation. This is coming from someone who has traveled all over the world, staying in every type of Hotel, from 5 star to youth Hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Living on past grandeur”
Reviews.Author: Philomela
Reviews.Content: what with two doors in my room failing to close properly and a window stuck open about eight inches, it was obvious that this busy old, lady of Arlington Street was in need of a new corset, to say the least. the hotel management needs to completely do over large parts of this hotel, especially the individual rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Last week I had a very pleasant stay in the Park Plaza Hotel, in a beautiful room with a queen bed, for $85 dollar a night, by booking the hotel via -----------------------. The atmosphere in the hotel was very friendly, and I felt welcome. I can recommand this hotel to all of you, with this rate it's really a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but...make sure you get remodeled room”
Reviews.Author: AdeNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Plaza for a corporate event. The rooms are NYC/Boston size...meaning small. I was in a (relatively) recently remodeled room and it was fine as I spent most time outside of the hotel. The water pressure was great in my shower. That said, a few collegues of mine were put in non-renovated rooms (mostly smoking rooms) and they were HORRID. Bare bulbs in the bathroom, even a mouse running out of the closet. Also-if you are sensitive to dust or overly floral disinfectant, do not stay here. It is an assult on your sense of smell.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Boston”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Got a room at the Park Plaza on priceline for a very low rate in comparison, and immediately regretted it after reading all the bad reviews. We were staying for 8 days and I was really concerned. But the place is great. We had a decently sized, well appointed room with 2 bathrooms. I did contact them and request 2 beds. It was extremely quiet. The paint and wallpaper in the room and hallway were flawless. We had a thermostatically controlled heater, which was a pleasant surprise from the typical "High, Medium, Low" you see at most hotels, and each bathroom had radiant heat. The carpet was an ugly brown, but in acceptable repair. The bathrooms did have really tiny showers (maybe 16-18 inches deep and about 40 inches wide or so) - If you are a large person - you will have trouble fitting in the shower! but each shower had 2 shower heads with plenty of pressure and hot water. The tile floors in the bathrooms could use a regrouting, but were not falling apart or anything. The staff was courteous, the lobby and ballroom beautiful. Make sure you use your "Do Not Disturb" sign though because they start cleaning rooms at 0800 - early for vactioners from the west coast! This was our third trip to Boston. We stayed previously in a B&B and the Hilton. This was the best place and the best rate yet, and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Boston”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Park Plaza, having paid $80.00 per night for a room with two double beds (reserved via priceline.com) and were very pleased with the room and service at the hotel for what we paid. It's an historic hotel - it's a little faded,has smallish bathrooms, but has charm and isn't as sterile as its Boston Starwood sisters (and we've stayed in them). The room was quiet, the service discreet (e.g. noone bothered us) and the location is great. Luxury is available in Boston (across the street at the Four Seasons) but for the money the Park Plaza was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: let's begin by saying they have a great facade. we were pleasantly surprised to finally arrive the same hotel that we had heard such mixed reviews about. it's located just blocks from newbury st. and the lobby looked amazing. we arrived a little early but were able to get our room key right away. at first we couldn't open the door, then once we did, we wished we hadn't. exactly like you may have read-old carpet, cobwebs on the ceiling, tv placed on a night stand, no space to walk around,ridiculously small bathroom-my boyfriend could only fit hlf of his body in, etc. anyway, it was a cold, snowy day and we had just driven about 6 hours so we weren't about to put up a fight. we decided to try and take a quick nap but were quickly reminded that ours was the room right next to the elevaors. so loud and obnoxious. i hated to be a pain but we called downstairs to kindly ask to be switched to a room away from the elevator shaft. they were very understanding and switched us to a room at least twice the size! now this seemed a little more along the lines of what we had paid for but i was a little annoyed at the same time given the fact that i had made reservations a whole month prior. it's not tourist season in mid november, so i was unclear as to why we were placed in such a dump initially. in preparation for such a disater, i had emailed customer service as i had read on another review, which said that that party had done so and recieved phenomenal service. yeah, well i didnt recieve feedback until i got home. overall it was a pretty miserable experience. did i mention we got some crazy phone charge that i had to fight to the death to get knocked off? and also, on the night before our departure, we had gotten lost and called the hotel for 2 hours looking for directions-no luck! BEWARE

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rachaelwaddon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was easily located thanks to the wonderful directions on the website. The car was parked easily by the valet parkers (although we have absolutely no idea where the car park was), just be aware that it says $26-35 valet parking which we read as $26.35c, but it was $36 to keep it in there all day. Reception was extremely efficient and we were checked in immediately. Roooms were a nice size and bathroom wasn't a bad size. Walls were very thin though and we were woken up both nights we stayed there by flushing toilets next door. Bar area was very warm and welcoming, there were lots of restaurants located around the hotel itself which meant you didn't have to walk far but the hotel was within easy walking distance of the shopping area, cheers bar, common, and the tube was a block away which took you whereever you wanted for $1.25 which was amazing value. Also within a 5 minute drive of the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: groovywilma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 10/24- 10/27. I tried to confirm a non-smoking room with two double beds a few days in advance but was told I could make my request upon check in. Upon check in we were given a non-smoking room with two double beds on the 11th floor. Our room was very nice and very spacious. It was well decorated and luxurious! The bathroom was small but that was not a problem. We had no problems with the tv or cable. The location of the hotel is great: the T is nearby and Boston Common is a short walk away. There are different restaurants nearby including a delicious desert place around the way. YUM! I booked this hotel on Priceline for $130 per night. The only problem I had was when I left a written request for extra towels next to a monetary tip my request was not granted. I had to call housekeeping that night for extra towels but after that night I did receive extra towels. The staff I encountered was nice and pleasant. I did pass by other hotel rooms on my floor that had only 1 bed and they did seem very small. I'm glad I did not end up in one of the small rooms! I would stay at the Park Plaza Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: amodle
Reviews.Content: I am not going to say that this hotel is horrible-it is not. My husband and I lived there in Boston for a few years and we are used to the "quaint" style of furnishings that Boston has to offer. You know, slanted floors and unstable steps! When we checked in, we were met with a very friendly reservation clerk and sent on our way. Believe me, I was very nervous about staying here because I had read some very bad reviews on this website. I had only found this wonderful website after I had booked our trip. We walked through a gorgeous front lobby and up very efficient elevators, but I had only to laugh when we opened up the door. (ps, what is with those panels on the doors? I felt like I was onboard ship) Yes, the room was tiny and impersonal and a little rough around the edges. But, what really got me was that the bed in the room was a twin bed!! The person at the Front Desk saw that we were two people, and not only that, my husband is 6'4", 220 lbs. When I went downstairs to ask if there was a different room I was told that because I had booked through discount booking (Expedia) that our room (twin bed) was what I had to get. I don't know if that is true, because I have had good luck with Expedia and always had at least a Queen sized bed. So, be sure to ask what the sleeping accomodations will be. The only other rooms available were smoking rooms and I felt that sleeping on a cot-which I ended up doing- was the lesser of two evils. Honestly, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone or even think about staying there again. But, if you are willing to fork over some big bucks and stay in a suite then by all means do. My husband and I made the mistake of peeking in a room across from ours and it was awesome! Bummer!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from the Park Plaza. We tried to ensure a refurbiushed room in advance but were told allocations were done on checking in. We asked and got two refurbished rooms on the 12th floor. The rooms are European size as is the bathroom. However everything was clean and new. No holes in the carpet! The Hertz office is across the street. We ate in two of the Hotel's restaurants and had great meals with enormous portions. We had breakfast at Au Bon Pain round the corner. I would recommend the Park Plaza to others

Reviews.Title: “You pays your money.......and?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I saw all the bad reviews and contemplated changing to another hotel, didn't and now wish I had! I even took the precaution of emailing with my concerns which was impressively met with a phone call to me here in the UK with assurances that I would be given a 'very nice room' I mentioned this at check in only to be told that couldn't be guarenteed so I ended up in a pokey little room, albeit on the supposed renovated 15th floor. I wouldn't mind but I didn't book through priceline and paid the full price for a king size bed (aren't they suposed to be BIG ). Well it must have shrunk in the wash! Yes the lobby is nice but I wasn't planning on spending too much time there! As for the staff, well the only decent person I had any contact with was the concierge. I almost got the impression that if they had the equipment they would have photographed and fingerprinted me before they cashed my travellers check. NEVER AGAIN. I paid half what I paid here to stay in a hotel just off Times Square and got a vastly better room.

Reviews.Title: “Quit Worrying!”
Reviews.Author: earing
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Park Plaza! I would urge readers to do their own research. I wonder about some of the comments I read. First, the lobby is beautiful. It is a busy hotel, we had nice people helping us, no rudeness here. The elevators are just fine, I had some image of creaking closets being pulled up by fraying rope. They are modern and are well...like elevators. The room was clean, not huge but decent. The bathroom is small, but clean. The hotel is old and the wear and tear is apparent here and there, but its a cool old hotel. Can't say enough about the location, we walked all over Boston, ate in China Town and walked back to the hotel. So really fear not. This is a nice hotel. We did not stay in a suite, but we weren't in Boston to stay in the hotel, we wanted to explore. The only suggestion I have (other than not spending your vacation looking for loose tiles)...is to try to not book your room directly facing Arlington, there is a fire station somewhere near there and quite a few sirens. Have Fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and even better location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dont' listen to the bad reviews on this page. I did and almost cancelled my reservations. The hotel is really very charming and has a lot of character. The location couldn't be better. I had a deluxe room which was bigger than some of the suites I've stayed in. And yes.. It has two bathrooms. Rooms are very clean and they have really great service.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: patravelor
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Priceline $125 (my first Priceline experience). The reviews sounded awful so I contacted the Plaza's corporate e-mail address with my requests (two double beds and non-smoking). My requests were acknowledged and I enjoyed my stay. The hotel is historic which adds to the "quaintness". I stayed on the 12th floor but I believe there must be floors that are not recently renovated. I asked to stay another night but they were booked so I stayed at the Radisson which was nice but expensive. The location is incredible which is the best feature. Yes, the bathrooms are small but it IS an old hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate for this hotel on Priceline, read the reviews and then we worried. I called 2 weeks before to ensure we had 2 double beds for my daughter and I and they assured us we would. When we arrived late at night, after having our luggage lost by the airline, bedraggled and with no dinner, the hotel desk clerk initially wanted to give us a room with 1 double bed. I protested because I had done the leg work to ensure a decent room. She relented and offered us an executive conference suite for all 4 nights of our stay. Granted there were 2 queen size sofa beds, but they were extremely comfortable and the room was HUGE. There was a table with 6 chairs, it was a corner room, nicely furnished and very clean. Across the street from the Green Line subway which goes everywhere. The hotel concierge staff were fabulous in assiting with dinner reservations, tour recommendations, directions, etc. The seafood restaurant in the hotel was great for dinner. The breakfast was a little pricey but there is an Au Bon Pain nearby for bagels, croissants, fruit and coffee. Would recommend to all and hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the bad reviews on here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline. After booking it, I found this site, read the bad reviews and I was a little worried about staying there. There was nothing to be worried about. The staff was very friendly, the room was nice and clean... yes, the bathroom is small but I've stayed in other 3-star hotels (wyndham, hilton, etc) where the rooms and bathrooms were the SAME size. It is an older hotel, but it's beautiful. It's in an excellent location, room service was very good, cable worked just fine, beds were comfortable... what else do you really need? I'll be staying there again... no doubt. Don't listen to those other hotel snobs that gave it a bad review.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was at the Park Plaza from Sept. 23-28, 2004 and thought the hotel and location excellent. I did find that the bathroom was tiny and the carpet needed replacing. The rooms were rather pricey, however, the staff was very helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: steemer1
Reviews.Content: Came into town to see a Sox game. I thought this would be a nice place based on the name & the description on Expedia. Not at all. Old hotel the rooms aren't nearly as nice as the common areas. When reserving my room on line I had selected the rate w/ a king sized bed, at check in I was told they were overbooked for kings & doubles was stuck w/ 1 queen. The elevators are old & shaky. The room was very small & plain. No pictures, nice drapes or bed linens. The cable wasn't working so we couldn't watch tv. Bathroom was old & TINY. Old fixtures. Bed was very uncomfortable. A/C didn't work it just made a clicking noise it sounded like a train was in our room. Our room was located above the popular bar in the hotel Whiskey Park. At 2:30 in the morning the street below was full of loud people leaving the bar. Cars beeping, people laughing & screaming. The windows were so thin it seemed as though they were wide open...you could hear everything. The same applies for conversations in the hall outside your room. You could here all activity out there including the housekeeping staff & loud walkie talkies. I will never stay here again nor will I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend, rooms TINY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights in June 2004. The only positive things I have to say about it were that it is in a good location, decorated nicely, and it is clean. The rooms are VERY small. It really is hard to describe how small they are but there was about 2 feet of space surrounding our full-size bed (not even Q or K size). If you are planning on spending any time at all in your room, this is NOT the place for you. The staff was rude. It took several hours and several not-so-friendly (on their end) phone calls to the front desk to get the cot in our room that we had reserved months in advance (for a friend traveling with us). Needless to say, once the cot was brought to our room, it would not fit. No wonder they didn't want to bring it! There was barely enough room for it to stand on its end and for us to walk by it. A very expensive room that really isn't worth it. You can definitely do better in Boston (as we found out)!

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: cmtorre2
Reviews.Content: I just arrived from my very first trip to Boston. My husband and I stayed at the Boston Park Plaza from September 11th-September 17th. I must admit that after I booked the vacation package through hotwire and read the negative reviews about this hotel, I was very concerned. I expected the worst. What I did to ease my fears was to email the hotel and I explained how I read negative comments about this establishment and I even copied and pasted some of the reviews. Someone did get back to me and assured me that I wouldn't have a problem and that she would accomodate my needs. I was very pleased with what I got. I got a non-smoking room with a king sized bed. Usually with hotwire, you're guaranteed a double bed. I checked in on September 11th and an employee by the name of Naomi (who happened to be in training) assisted me. She was very polite and engaged in conversation. She was very customer friendly. I had no problems with the check in process. It was smooth. When I went to my room, I did a complete inspection. Everything was clean, towels and bed linens changed. The carpet definitely needs to be replaced. It is worn, looks dirty and I saw a few holes. The bathroom is very small and the counter space is very narrow. There is hardly no space to put your toiletries. The bathroom was clean. The tiles were new. The bathtub is small and narrow. I'm not kidding when I say that I couldn't stand under the shower with my feet together because of the size of the bathtub. The room itself was a good size. There was plenty of space to walk around. The closet is a decent size but just in case take a couple of hangers. There was some but not enough for both of us. I brought a few hangers from home which helped alot. There is a coffee maker which is definitely a plus if you're a coffeeholic like my husband. The only problem I had with the coffee service is that they were not leaving the coffee filters everday. We stayed 6 nights and 3 of them we didn't get any. The first time I went to the concierge to complain and in about 20 minutes someone showed up with the coffee. The other problem is that they only leave 2 coffee filters and 2 packets that contain a napkin, 2 packs of 2 sugar, 1 packet of non-dairy creamer and a napkin. Everybody knows that you need at least 4-6 packs of sugar to sweeten American coffee. My suggestion is when you go to a restaurant, take a few of their sugar packets. That's what we did. Other than that, we enjoyed our stay at the Boston Park Plaza. The employees that I dealt with were really friendly. The location is awesome. The nearest train station is half a block away. The Boston Common and Boston Public Garden is 1 block away. There are plenty of restaurants nearby. About 2-3 blocks away, there's a Burger King and a Wendy's right next to each other for those who are fast food junkies. Really, everything is nearby. My suggestion is to email the hotel before your arrival and express your concerns.

Reviews.Title: “a ridiculously good deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through Priceline ($100 per night) and were a little worried after reading the reviews. We checked in early, hoping to request a good room. When we got there the place was pitch black (I'm not kidding). Employees were walking around with lanterns. A utility crew had cut through a power line and the whole block was dark. Knowing that the 15th floor (the tower floor) was supposed to house luxury rooms, and since the elevators were out, we volunteered to take a room up there. A manager said no problem. Before we could get to the stairs, the lights came back on. Our room was enormous, with a desk, computer hookups, a big TV, bathrobes, and even an exercise bicycle. On top of that, there is a small cafe on the tower floor- continental breakfast and delicious pre-dinner snacks were included. The staff was friendly and efficient. Everything was clean. The location is tremendous--walked to everything. I guess we got lucky!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a business trip and stayed at the Park Plaza. I travel often for business and have received better service from far less fancy places. Problems: - got to the hotel late after flying from the West Coast. No one at the front desk. Waited. Waited. Someone finally showed up. - Get up to my room, it's late and I'm starving. Call down to room service. Phone rings...and rings...and rings...and no one picks up. - Say OK, I'll wait till breakfast. Go into the bathroom -- about the size of a closet. - Lay down, turn on the TV -- can't get any channels (full of fuzz) -- mess with the wires in back to try to fix nothing helps. Then, after 5 mintues of barely watching the Olympics thru the fuzz, it cuts out completely. - Go down to the concierge desk in the morning to report the TV problem. Leave for the day on meetings. - Get back to my room at 8pm. Try the TV -- still doesn't work. I call the front desk...phone rings...and rings...and rings...and no one picks up. Never again. I paid over $280 for that room and will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “"It's like camping - Without a View!"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As I looked at the cobwebs hanging in the corners of my room and the gray corners of my carpeting in need of a vacuum, I decided to see if the nearby Radison had any space left. When they didn't, I sat on my bed and cried. I even asked the management if I could borrow a few cleaning supplies but none appeared. There is no climate control for each room (that is run centrally), as I pushed the mattress back on my box springs each night, I sighed and reminded myself that my business conference would only last a week.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Plaza”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Plaza on the 16 Aug 04 till the 23 Aug 04 and after reading various reviews was somewhat concerned, but our fears were all laid to rest as our room was lovely, large, clean and fresh. All the staff were very helpful and we would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great a hotel”
Reviews.Author: menemsha23
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel once on Hotwire. I had read bad reviews but I'm an optimist so I had an open mind about it. But it turned out to be not that great at all. The rooms are EXTREMELY small, meaning you can barely walk around in them. Also, the bathrooms were showing their age and weren't very clean. The lobby is impressive but don't be fooled. If you can stay somewhere else, then do it.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Hotel, but needs work”
Reviews.Author: soupy9
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here despite the negative reviews because the hotel sounded quirky and different and was in an excellent location. The hotel definitely needs some work. The floor we were on as well as our room smelled strongly of old cigarette smoke. We tried to air out our room by propping the window open with a phonebook (they don't stay open on thier own even though they are supposed to). I think the smell came from the ancient stained rug in our room and no amount of airing out would get rid of the smell. The rooms are furnished exactly as you see them on the website, but they do look a bit more shabby in person. The bedding was new and clean. The bathroom was really small and cramped. The floor tiles were cracked, but they are likely original to the hotel and worth preserving. The toilet was cracked and the sink was ancient. There is no counter space, just a skinny shelf above the toilet. The bath amenities were good quality, but they only left us one very small bar of soap (and an empty wrapper in the tub). The air conditioning was loud, but it worked. They have a cool interactive entertainment system connected to the TV which included internet access. The doors to the rooms are really interesting. They weigh a ton and look like cabin doors you would find on a cruise ship. This hotel must have been really fantastic in its day. You can read about everything it used to offer. Its very sad that the hotel hasn't been kept up.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have never had worse hotel customer service than received from the Boston Park Plaza. After following their instructions, upon check-out, to get a copy of my bill, it has now taken me five long-distance phone calls and a fax to get this sent to me, and I still wait. This should be a routine 1-call procedure that the desk can handle, but not here. Throughout my stay the staff seemed, frankly, overwhelmed. The rooms are very small for the price (perhaps to be expected from an historic building), and varied in quality. Mine was small but recently renovated. Some of my colleagues had rooms they described as â€œpitsâ€�. I had to refuse one room myself that had not had a remodel in many years, had stained carpets, and reeked of smoke.

Reviews.Title: “You are paying for the location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I want to echo other reviewers that this is an OLD hotel with its century-old elevators, 30's-style decor, and small rooms. The bathroom is very basic and not too different from a $40-a-night motel. The air-conditioner was noisy. We did not bother to order any food service. I paid about $120 per night from priceline in mid-June. What you are paying for it is its location, which is unbeatable. Close to the Commons, Theater district, restaurants, and shopping areas. The subway station is also nearby and only one block away. Try to avoid the more expensive valet and park your car at the nearby public garage ($16 per day). Overall, I would say go for it if location is important to you. Otherwise avoid it if you can find hotels with better quality.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than the reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on priceline and was concerned about the reviews which I read here. Emailed the hotel and was told that there would be no problem. We were pleasantly surprised! The room was small but clean and towels were changed every day. Coffee maker in room was also a bonus. Location of this hotel could not be better and is an ideal place from which to explore Boston. Would stay again if in that city but book it at the discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from an overnight trip to Boston & had booked a room through Priceline. It wasn't until after our bid of $100 had been accepted that we read user reviews of the Park Plaza & since so many had negative comments, we were a little worried as to what to expect. Upon arrival & check-in, we were very pleased with the appearance of the hotel, beautiful lobby & great location. Our room was in fact very small in comparison to newer hotels today, with again a small bathroom, but was clean & pleasant. We were even close to the dreaded elevators that someone had mentioned and it did not bother us in the least, very convenient in fact. Our room was located on the 5th floor, so perhaps had already had some updating. The staff we dealt with at check-in was very pleasant. As I stated, the location is fantastic, right down in the Theatre District and close to the swan boats & Boston Common parks. Lots of restaurants from upscale to Ben & Jerry's for a late night ice cream to my beloved Dunkin' Donuts for a.m. coffee in close proximity. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant ourselves & used a cell phone for calls, so cannot speak about extra charges at the hotel. We would definately stay at the Boston Park Plaza again!

Reviews.Title: “A Huge Disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaD53
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Park Plaza from Priceline. We paid $185.oo (Plus $36.oo more for one night parking). We were so disappointed. This was an anniversary trip and we wish we had shopped around more. Our room (#1099) was the smallest, shabbiest room we have ever seen! The bathroom was dirty and creepy. The carpeting was dirty and the bed linens were very worn. The worst part was our location behind the elevators. There was a loud thumping and rumbing noise going on all night. Avoid the "elevator rooms" at all costs! The location was good. We walked everywhere. MJ O'Connor's Irish Pub was fun. I suppose there must be other rooms that are nice, but I never saw any. The beautiful lobby leads one to believe that the hotel is a luxury location, not so! I love Boston, but I will never stay at the Park Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “Unique old gem”
Reviews.Author: Red_Jade
Reviews.Content: I love the Park Plaza- it's not another cookie-cutter hotel. I have stayed there several times. As others have said, it is an older hotel. It has fabulous details like doors with laundry compartments so that the maid didn't have to come in the room to give you fresh linens. Yes, there are broken tiles in the bathroom, but they're real tiles! The whole hotel has character and charm that you just won't get in the Doubletree, from the soaring lobby to the twisty corridors. I have always found the staff friendly and my towels clean. The location is great. The beds are comfy, with fabulous fluffy bedding. Now, it's not perfect. I have had doors that didn't open unless I threw my whole body against them. The bathrooms are tiny and there is no counter in them, just a tiny shelf. The rooms are small (unless you spring for a suite- the suites are HUGE). The restaurants in the hotel are overpriced- you're in the middle of Boston, go out to the theatre district or Chinatown and eat! If you don't plan to spend your vacation in the bathroom, and can handle hip-checking a door, the Park Plaza comes with the highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “does not get worse than this”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small, old and dirty. Towels were changed infrequently. Staff were very rude and arrogant. This place needs to be shut down.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel location but rooms are child-size and old”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for two weeks. The Hotel is located in the Back Bay / South end. Excellent location for shopping, dining, bars. I was generally pleased. However, my room was totally inadequate, the cable TV signal kept fading out. Air Conditioning was awful, bathroom was very small. Plumbing was from the 1920's. Restaurants in the hotel were too expensive. Elevators were slow. Valet parking was too expensive at $36 / day plus tips. Business center was expensive to use - computers are $3 per minute. Fitness equipment is from the 1940's. Local phone calls cost up to $2.00 a minute! Room lighting was poor, carpet was old and dirty. Summary: Hotel is OK for one or two nights, but no longer, especially if you are an average size adult because you will become clausterphobic very quickly. Also, the hotel seems to book conventions as its main source of patrons so there are a ton of rowdy, obnoxious, inconsiderate people who clog the elevators, hallways, and entryways. Room service is also not that great. Alarm clark is iffy at best, so bring your own.

Reviews.Title: “Faded Glory, but still reasonable today.”
Reviews.Author: JSurace
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Park Plaza about a dozen times for business travel. It is shockingly cheap for Boston, and one of the only hotels that can actually offer a real government rate (I think I pay about $80, vs. >$250 in Cambridge). It is less than 1 block from the T (green line), right next to the park, and near a lot of good food. In other words, location is terrific. The hotel _is_ very old and worn (circa 20's). That's part of it's charm - it has lots of "character". If you read the literature they provide there is a detailed history of the hotel. This is not a luxury hotel by modern standards, but was in the past. Today it is clinging to the remains of that, like an old man. And the rooms are all very different. I have often been in the original rooms for tradesmen and I will agree, they are quite small. I have also been in other rooms that had separate sitting rooms and bedrooms, exercise gear, etc. I have no idea how they decide what rooms to put people in. All in all, an excellent deal, but worn and a bit spotty.

Reviews.Title: “nice room mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Plaza for two nights for a conference being held there. I was put on the 15th floor which must have been recently renovated. The room was good sized, plenty nice with a nice bathroom. The hotel, however, did not honor the conference rate on both nights so I paid different amounts each night. This caused all kinds of problems. I was checked out after my first night, called down to have it corrected - was told it was all fixed by a surly employee. Later on that morning as I was heading out the door to go to the all day conference I was called and told I had to switch rooms because of the different rate. This would have required missing some of the conference and I said no. Again a surly employee told me they would straighten things out. When I tried to come back to my room at the end of the day my key no longer worked. A third surly employee downstairs fixed it with a grudging apology. The next moring when I was supposed to check out they had me as still staying. The problem with this is it required yet another long wait in line to check out. The lines to check in and out were long, the wait for room service about 1 hour (although they would always say it was coming in 1/2 an hour), the bellmen hard to find and they had a charge for holding bags for an hour. The service was poor, the building fine. The conference also had poor service with too few chairs for the number of attendees and spoiled fruit at the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A unique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: duckcity50
Reviews.Content: After reading the many rewiews on this Hotel I was dreading my stay and expected the worst. What a surprise I got! . The Park Plaza is a beautiful Hotel, with an excellent location. The staff were very helpful and polite. I booked with Priceline and got a good deal, so I therefore requested a room with two beds which was allocated without any hesitation.The room was large and very comfortable. The bathroom was on the small size, but clean and perfectly adequate. Room service was first class. The public areas and ballrooms are wonderful. This is a lovely old hotel with such a lot of character. Give this Hotel a break! Without any doubt I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent down-town choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We go to boston for our summer vacation every year, to see a red sox game. It always seems that through some unmentioned services over the internet, we can get great deals on great hotels. This would be one of them. The Boston Park Plaza Hotel is a rich historical facility with many of the conveniences of a modern hotel. Upon entering the park plaza, one is greeting by the luxurious decorations (paintings, chandeliers, etc.) and comforted by the warm tunes coming from the piano at the back of the large hall; something to take pictures of, really. But I digress. Needless to say, our stay at the park plaza was excellent. We have infact stayed at the hotel on many ocassions. The location must be one of the best parts, though. Right in park plaza, close to many MBTA resources, centered in down town boston and close to the common the Park Plaza is planted in the right spot! Then there is the service. The staff of this hotel was friendly and accomodating. I do, however, have one small complaint. Hard to beleieve, if you have gotten this far in my review! That is the rooms. Not to contracdict what I said earlier, but other then the TV and a couple small, modern appliances, the rooms were a bit on the antiquated side. That said, the room that we got was clean and comfortable and the beds in our room were excellent, I had no trouble getting to sleep. Personally, I don't mind the antiquated look, as long as there are the needed, as before mentioned, modern appliances. But, if you don't care for the old style room, I reccomend upgrading to a suite. These, I would imagine are far more in touch with the period. =)

Reviews.Title: “Park Plaza nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've visited Boston several times and have stayed at a few of its hotels, but I recently stayed at the Boston Park Plaza and, after my experience, would hate it if anyone suffered the same fate. Firstly, I had to change my room as soon as I arrived: it was small, dark, cramped and, worst of all, filthy. I changed rooms pretty quickly. The next room was bigger and more airy, unfortunately it was still pretty filthy: paint chipping off the wall and collecting on the floor, stains around the sink etc. It wasn't until the music from downstairs kept me awake till 12:30 that I decided I should move rooms again. The person I spoke to on the phone was lovely and said I could change rooms in the morning. I packed all my things again in the morning and went downstairs, only to be greeted by one of the rudest people I have ever had the misfortune to encounter. He was totally unhelpful, seeming to think I wanted a free upgrade rather than a quieter room. He offered me a much smaller room, and when I said I wouldn't be happy with that he said he wasn't prepared to offer me anything else. He refused any further assistance so I was left with the only option of accepting that smaller room. When I finally agreed I was told that I'd have to take everything back to my original room as the room wasn't ready yet - he didn't bother to offer to store it. I only found out when I returned that he hadn't bothered to reserve me this room, but luckily another person on the front desk said it was no problem and actually managed to find me a similar sized room with ease (thank you to them). When I finally got in the room it was fine: old fashioned, dark, small - but quiet. This must be the worst hotel in Boston. I will NEVER stay here again - and until their staff learn some manners and they redecorate properly, I don't think anyone else should either.

Reviews.Title: “Had a terriffic time!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have read the previously posted reviews regarding the Boston Park Plaza Hotel and completely disagree!! My husband and I stayed on the 15th floor (the Concierge floor) at no additional charge and were given free breakfast and snacks in the afternoon. The room was modest, however, clean and tidy. It had a wonderful location across from the Arlington T station which made sightseeing in Boston a breeze. I cannot imagine that the rest of the hotel is not comparable to the 15th floor. The staff was helpful and pleasant, the concierge even surfed the web for me to find Alison Krause tickets!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: smu84
Reviews.Content: Hotel was old, and we booked through Priceline.com so were happy what we recieved for the price we paid. However we have booked through priceline before and this is by far the worse hotel we have stayed at. The room was very small, lucky to fit a double bed in so if it was a queen the room would of been full, so now you know how big the room is. The staff at the hotel where fairly friendly and we didn't seem to have any problems. Our toilet was blogged and the staff where there within 5 minutes. The location of the hotel is great right in the center of Boston and you can walk easily to anywhere. Would we stay there again, No if I had to pay full price, if I book through Priceline, sure, it was a great deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: MsLaurie
Reviews.Content: Oh, where to start! The heat didn't work. This is very serious for spring in Boston, where the weather is changeable. The first night I couldn't get any heat at all. Once the heat came on, no one could turn it off! The room was so hot that the souvenier chocolates I bought melted. (I'm not kidding.) Not only did the hotel not offer me a break on the high price, the concierge was rude. I called one morning to see when the sight seeing trolley ran on Saturdays. Because of a change in plans, sight seeing was moved to Sunday. When I called the concierge the next day to confirm the times, he actually said, "Aren't you the one who called yesterday?" and he ended his answer with a snide, "Just like I told you yesterday." The best thing I can say about this hotel is that security was good and I felt safe. Also the location is convenient. If you are willing to pay these prices for such faint praise, be my guest. But not me. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “tolerable if you get a good deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is an old, historical hotel and the rooms reflect that. Old and small. We arrived late and the staff had no idea where we could get something to eat because, despite the many bars and restraunts housed in the hotel, none of them had food service! It was only like 10pm. The bars were noisy and there were lots of partyers overflowing from the bar into the hotel, which is cool if that's your thing. I was just hungry and tired. Also, our heat didn't work so we froze and ate some bar peanuts for dinner until eventually a very kind serviceman showed up and fixed it. I wouldn't stay there again. It wasn't awful but there are much nice hotels with better service to be had for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Marathon Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Gross bathrooms, stained carpets, chipped paint, moulding falling off of walls, radiatior falling off of wall. Our room was the size of a dorm room. The location was great. The remodel they talk about must have only applied to the lobby. We paid about $190.00 a night - Not worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “In need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Feb 2003 on our way to a ski trip in Vermont. We booked through Expedia and paid the extra to stay in a Deluxe room.On arrival the hotel is impressive with ornate moldings and high ceilings. We checked in only to be told that they do not have deluxe rooms all rooms were the same. (Why do expedia charge extra then?) We made our way to room allocated only to find this hadn't been cleaned, the window faced a brick wall and was tiny. I wasn't happy and went back down to reception to demand what I had paid for. I was told that Expedia always do this but I got what I had paid for. I was finally offered the keys to another room which on inspection was larger. The bed and bedding were fine all clean and comfortable. The carpets were stained and in need of replacement. The bathroom was tiny, (only one of us could go in at once) and was in need of renovation. The sink was cracked and the tiling badly patched. The restaurant offered a good full breakfast although a little pricy. I wouldn't stay there again although the location was good and our stay otherwise problem free.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at the Boston Park Plaza”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Boston Park Plaza. We got the room on Hotwire, and after reading the reviews I was a bit nervous about the hotel. As many reviewers noted, the lobby is very attractive. All six of the elevators were working, and we never had to wait more than a minute to catch one. We were on the 6th floor. The hallways were wide. The carpeting and wall paper looked new. Altogether, it looked very elegant. We had a double room (one queen bed). It was not a huge room, but larger than I expected given the past reviews. The room was clean, there were both light filtering and blackout shades on the windows, and we had a coffee maker, an iron, and an ironing board. I loved the high ceilings, crown mouldings, and the wall panels. The bathroom was ok. Clean, had a deep tub, and no plumbing problems. I would stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Has no equal!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Boston Park Plaza Hotel and had what was in all likelihood about as fine an experience as can be had. We found the hotel to be terrific in every way, from the high ceilings to the location, from the friendly and knowledgeable staff to the fact that this is a hotel with some history. There's no way I'll ever stay at another hotel in Beantown, and I would highly recommend this fine hotel to anyone whose travels take them to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Poor experience, Not recomended to book into”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We thought we had selected a great value in Boston for our trip and we arrived at the hotel with no service help and the rooms were dated, drafty, cold and over the top prices on the menus. Traveling all over the world this had to be the worst trip to the US with over twenty trips here in the last few years. Our accomodations were dirty and small and we had asked for a Deluxe room and payed for it. The staff said nothing could be done that we had booked on the internet, informed no refund could be given. The staff was not polite and we didnt complain enough as they didnt even feel concerned. Cheers and good luck checking in to this hotel. We will not return but will try another lodging option before we book a vacation to Boston. Reading the ledger of experience we agree the hotel is horrible. Only thing good was it was close to Boston Commom but we realized there are other hotels right nearby like Parker House and Holiday Inn too.

Reviews.Title: “Be afraid!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't find a lot of these reviews comforting??? You shouldn't! This place is Nasty with a capital N! The location is nice and the outside is very pretty, but step inside and welcome to mildew-ville. There was a wad of chewing gum stuck to our door that had clearly been there for years and the few bathroom tiles that were affixed to the floor and walls were only done so by a layer of crud. The rugs are stained as were the linens and everything is baby pink!! We paid $75 in the Priceline scam and got hosed (especially after seeing some got it for $29). If you don't mind filth and want a roof over your head for minimal $$$, go for it - otherwise, cough up the money for a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reception area O K”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have travelled all over the world, and paid dearly for it as I usually travel alone. But thus was the smallest single room I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, great location, friendly competent staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a conference and business meeting in Boston recently and I stayed at the Boston Park Plaza because of the location. It is an old hotel, but very quaint and I had a refurbished room, which was very nice. The food at the BonFire Restaurant was very good, but I was most impressed with the young woman, Kris, who coordinated my group's event for dinner. She was friendly, efficient and went out of her way to assist us. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh! Park Plaza? Try Park BLAHZA.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for myself and my boyfriend for his birthday...booking a "DELUXE" room with a king size bed, non-smoking. I booked through Expedia and will never do that again either. I arrived to the VERY CROWDED hotel around 6 p.m. and went straight to the reservation desk. The man says, "ok, queen size bed." I replied, that no, I requested a king size bed. He said that they were very busy and there were none left, but the room was still a "deluxe" room. Ok. Fine, I need a place to stay right? So, we head off to the elevator where we had to wait 10 minutes for one to come and be shoved in like sardines...with people very provacatively dressed. (By the way, un-beknown to me, there was a leather/fetish conference going on - being a "distinguished" hotel, don't you think you'd weed out conferences of this type?? Anyway, we make it up to the 12th floor and go over to our room. There was a tray of leftover room service outside the room, which remained there the rest of the evening into the morning. We open the door and are shocked. The "deluxe" room is a box. No joke, it was a 10x12 room. You could hardly walk by the dresser to get to the bed or to the window. The view from the 12th floor was of a brick building...oh wait, the hotel! The bathroom was no better than a public restroom with a toilet as old as sin. Oh and so much for a non-smoking room...even if it was non-smoking, we could've smoked a pack of cigarettes and the smell would be no better. We're tough, so we spent the night there. I get home and find two charges on my credit card bill for the hotel. One from Expedia, which I expected and the other...from the damn hotel. So, now, I am fighting Expedia about the charges, whose Problem management group works bankers hours of 9-3. This whole thing has been a nightmare; take it from me, and stay away from the Park Plaza in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the hotel for a conference. I can't say enough about the location and the concierge! By the way, may I add that the concierge was impressive? I am not easily won over, but the only mediocre meal we had during our stay was the one time we didn't consult the concierge. He truly knows the area! The room, although somewhat small (but we knew we had booked a smaller room) was neatly updated. The bathroom was quite cramped for space, but it is an historic hotel. The doors reminded me of a safe, but these details aside, the hotel was a wonderful bargain in an excellent area of Boston. Our only complaint was the service at the lobby restaurant. In fact, I'm not sure we even had service. Perhaps this is why the concierge never seemed to recommend the hotel restaurants......

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice place, clean, renovated king room, nice marble bath, good service levels...I was there for a 4 day conference. Is it the Four Seasons?, ofcourse not, but the property is still undergoing renovation and if you pay a market rate, you get more updated, renovated rooms, if you book on PriceLine, HotWire, etc, you are going to get what you pay $50-$60 dollars for, an older room that is not renovated. Quit wining, if you can't afford more than $50 or $60 for a room, perhaps you should not travel... or go to the Holiday Inn Express...

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, if you can setttle for an aged beauty.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i made a reservation for the Boston Park Plaza through hotwire, but was a bit concerned once i read the reviews here. I was actually surprised by the Park Plaza! It is a very large, stately hotel, that is rich in history and charm ( A radio station once broadcast from the penthouse, and servant/ valet doors within doors) . The rooms are very small...particularly with the kingsized bed...they are adequate, however, and while not top notch, it was clean enough to make up for the places it was showing its age. The location is amazing, and all the restaurants within the hotel make even lazing around the building more interesting than the holiday inn. Bottom line, probably not worth full price, but a marvelous steal on priceline or hotwire-- great for the young set.

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Property”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You will read many reviews regarding the Boston Park Plaza property. I want to say first hand the King Room, service, location & ammenities were fantasic. BPP delivered what was promised. You get what you pay for and more. I believe if you pay for a high level experience you get one. Many negative reviews are from guests using hotel online services (I have in the past also) however, God Bless if you get a room for $60-$80 I did not and had no issues paying 3 times that amount. I planned for a special weekend and called the hotel reservations directly for recommendations, prices and special request which were all met. The location alone is fabulous and worth the money. I have stayed at other properties within the Copley area and for the price it was incredible. Housekeeping came everyday and had a clean room upon my return. I spent 3 days here and had left the room early afternoon each time and still when I return the room was cleaned. The Lobby was abuzz and nicely decorated for the Christmas season. Great photo opportunities! Please bear in mind the property is a historic site which comes with radiator heat which at times fluctuated to high or to low. Tell mgmt if needed. I will stay here again when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fabulous reception area, however rooms are shabby and in need of updating and redecorating. We booked through Expedia and did not get the room we requested. The bedrooms in this hotel are definately not 4 star! Would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “1927 Hotel still has charm !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We sayed at the BPP on Friday November 28, 2004. The room was small but had nice furniture and a comfortable bed and nice TV. Bathroom was clean with a deep tub. Lobby is interesting as it dates to 1927. Carpet is a little worn. Location is great as it is only 1 block from the Boston Common. I must say that for the price it was a great value and I would stay there again. Many people I see are disappointed and for them I would say that the Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton Hotels are only 1 block away and for another $300 a night one could stay there. Basically for Boston the hotel is a deal for the thrifty traveller. Give it a try !

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In short summary, the lobby was nice, friendly check-in, common areas nice (but a bit dusty) the room was a good size (a little worn) and the bathroom was small. But in the city who is going to stay in their hotel room the whole time. Excellent location, prompt valet service. Prefer other Boston Hotels, but would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel ever !!”
Reviews.Author: Anon.London
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe room at this hotel through Expedia back in October 2003. On check-in, which had massive queues and unhelpful check-in staff, were told that we could not have a king bed as per the reservation but was forced to take a room with 2 queen beds and no appology. The room was in no way a deluxe as per the photo on Expedia but a standard Economy room. We telephone reception and were told that our room was a deluxe - they lied !! The room was small, shabby, paint peeling off the doors and walls - downright awful !!I strongly recommed that you choose alternative accomodation to the Boston Park Plaza, and would prefer to stay in a hostel rather than this dump !

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Nothing Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: marc1976
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel in the winter time. We only paid $52.00 through Priceline (most others paid double). The price was very acceptable for what we got. The lobby is very nice and large, and there were enough staff on hand to check us in quickly. The door to our room and all the other rooms had a weird half-cylinder like shape to them. Maybe that was for security precautions. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. The bathroom clearly needed renovation, but were nonetheless accptable. The staff was friendly and we had no problems when we were there. The room service food was great. The location is excellent, just a one minute walk to Boston Common. I would stay there again, but if your looking for more upscale accomodations, try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not too Bad !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very concerned almost sick about coming here with all the poor reviews and we booked through Priceline therefore there was no looking back... We were also pleasantly surprised at what we found. The lobby is beautiful, Excellent location and tons to do in the area (ww walked everywhere or the T is at the door step). the rooms are very average, but clean... YOU WANT TO TRY AND GET A RENOVATED ROOM ~ I think this is the trick at this hotel based on the reviews I've been reading. Also, the price was right for what we got! Boston is a great city and I would reco this hotel for it's location, value and overal average quality....

Reviews.Title: “Be Afraid...Be Very Afraid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in May for a business conference and was appalled at the condition of this hotel. I entered my room to find it completely filthy with no linens on the bed and dirty towels in the bathtub. Our trip coordinator called the front desk to rectify the problem and it was fixed but I noticed that the yellowed window shade was hiding the chipped paint around the window and the dead insects on that sill! I went to plug in my laptop and noticed also that the outlet was literally hanging out of the wall. When I complained to the meeting coordinator she tried to get me another room but to our astonishment they were booked solid. I felt embarrassed for the person who booked the hotel and many in our party shared similar experiences. I would rather sleep on the street!

Reviews.Title: “arrival nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
