Reviews.Content: having booked months in advance and confirmed at least 5 times, including on the day of planned arrival, we found that our bookings had been bumped to the next day, and i had to bunk in with a friend who is severely allergic to the stuff i had in my hair!!!!! it was the last room in the hotel, 6th floor smelled bad, nothing worked.... even had doubts about the smoke alarm!!!! at least there were 2 beds.....many other guests had that problem on that night.....took almost 20 hours to sort out the problem, and only about half of the staff was helpful. the other half need to go!!!! 2nd room a little better, but the mould in the roof, and the peeling paint, and the room service trays inthe hallway for hours...... At least i'm not there anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Loose this Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Boston Park Plaza is awful. Curbside luggage assistance was non existant. Check in was rude and dismissive. Self check (at $1 per bag) was the only service available in the lobby. Room was filthy, staff indifferent, acomodations valueless, and service a non entity. This is a place to avoid, AT ANY PRICE.

Reviews.Title: “Worst room in 18-years in Boston in over 10 Hotels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked through Expedia, no one no where warned us about their "European Economy Class". We've stayed at both Ritz Carlton's, Boston in the past as well as four or five other hotels; and we've booked through Expedia before for rooms at Le Meridien and at the Lenox, and were never treated like this before. Accomadtions is a joke; service at check-in or the Front Desk is ridiculous and borderline rude. It's a dieing Hotel and some people there already know it. STAY AWAY. I'll pay 179/189 a night, and would certainly pay 225/375 too but I'll never step foot in that place again.Go across the street; the Four Seasons has an excellant bar!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away..Far away!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This "four star" hotel was not nearly as good as the oldest 39.95/night Super 8 that I have stayed in. The rooms were inadequate and underfurnished. The only good thing about it was a fairly new (less than 50 yrs.) bathtub. During our stay we were involved in a fire evacuation at 3:30 AM. Fire procedures are a danger to anyone that stays there. Quickly, go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Not Luxury, But Certainly Not a Disaster”
Reviews.Author: Allergytraveler
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here, we expected the worst, but found instead a somewhat quirky old city hotel, a little worse for the wear and not up to luxury standards, but far more interestingr than a non-descript chain hotel next to the airport or in the suburbs. The lobby for some reason has almost no seating and is a bit dreary looking, and yet impressive and grand at the same time. We had no problems with check-in, and found the room to be very small, but clean. The TV and computer access cable snaked around the baseboard, which needed some paint, and the room was not large enough for an easy chair to read in, but we found no housekeeping problems. Our bathroom was tiny, but had a brand new shower/tub, and again was clean. You will not get luxury service and decor here, but we felt that for what we paid on Priceline, the deal was fair

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, beautiful hotel! Ate at McCormick's and Schmitt's. Absolutely delicious! I was pleasantly surprised after reading reviews. Service was great. Staff friendly and helpful. Remodeling looks great. View from higher floors absolutely gorgeous. Would definitely recommend to others. Best high class, high quality hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but....................”
Reviews.Author: pearl*o*the*sea
Reviews.Content: My husband and I attended a convention at this hotel and although the lobby and convention rooms were quite beautiful the hotel rooms were in a bad state. The bathroom especially was so old and probably hasn't been updated in the last 50 yrs. The room was quite small and very plain with white walls and what looked like plain white bed sheets for curtains! Needless to say for the price we paid it was very disappointing for a hotel of this caliber. On the plus side we did stay on one of the higher floors and the view of Boston was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for its location and the history of a grand hotel. What ever you do, stay away from the Boston Park Plaza. My room was small with also no room for moving about. The paint was chipping, the carpet was dirty, hardware were missing in the bathroom. The general condition is just sub-sub standard for a hotel of this class. I even had to pay to have my lauggage stored for a few hours because we were there too early. I had hotels in Asia that will keep my lauggage for days when I went on a side trip at no costs to me. Unless you are paying $35 per night, this is a poor poor value.I have to say that the front line employee were all very professional and were doing their best to make a poor situation seems better. There are many good hotels in Boston in this price range; my advise is to stay away from the Park Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Old Hotel at a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I grew up in Boston, then moved away about 30 years ago. (In my 50's now). Going to the Statler Hilton, now the Park Plaza, was a great experience then. Staying there now, too, is a wonderful experience. This is a hotel with a fantastic lobby and first class on-site restaurants and bars. The seafood at McCormick & Shmick's is wonderful. For a business conference, the meeting rooms are excellent. The guest rooms are fine. They are updated and freshly painted. Hey, this is an old downtown hotel, in an old and expensive city. If you want a new Weston or Marriott, stay there. If you want the charm of an urban legend, plus a great location, plus a great price, stay at the Boston Park Plaza. You will like it.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from staying at the Park Plaza for 2 days. It was the most disgusting place!! The hotel itself is nice but our room was so gross. We were on the 5th floor and the walls were dirty and needed a new paint job. When we got into our room, the carpet was extremly dirty. There was a musty smell. There were 2 bathrooms in our room but they looked like they had not been cleaned in years. One of the bathrooms had mice droppings on the counters along with dead spiders on the walls. The showers had mildew all piled up on the walls. Then to top it off a cockroach came running across the room. I thought was going to vomit. I have never stayed in such a filthy place. I will never stay there again. The managers were rude and told us we were seeing things. Right!! I do not recommend this place. I would have rather slept in the park then in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: attractiveprof
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the place. The room was found cheaply on priceline. The hotel is in an unbeatable location. Historic, beautiful. People seem to be complaining about the rooms. Remember that this is not a 4-star place and historically was serving the middle-class. My room was not overly big (but not small), very clean, nicely renovated with respect for the old features. I tried the Bonfire grill on the premises, an excellent restaurant. Note that there is a free health club on the ground level (although hotel info talks only of the YMCA). Nice variety of somewhat older equipment.

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My visit to the the Boston Park Plaza was a disappointment. I read the reviews prior to my visit on Aug 11, 2003. I doubted if it were all true. But to my dismay it was right on target. Apparently the money spent on renovations was spent on the lobby. When the elevator doors opened to the floor to where my guest room was located, it was liked I stepped into the "Twilent Zone". It was a bezare feeling because it was such a sharp contrast from the lobby. The hallways was in need of new paint. The guest rooms were small because its an old hotel. But it is still not an excuse for dirty walls and sparce decorating. There is insufficient storage for clothing and toiletries. The bathroom was antiquated and hair found on the bath towels. The air conditioning was very inadiquate.and did cool the room. In fact it was leaking water that made the carpet wet all the way to the bed. As a result, it caused a musty order in the room. The only positive experience was that the housekeeper called the problem in, and to our surprise the front desk called with another room assignment. Of course, the bellhop never showed up as promised to help us to the new room. We moved ourselves. Beside this, my husband was annoyed about the $34.00 fee per day to park our car at the hotel. Otherwise, the hotel is in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Park Plaza - not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very old. Fist of all, when we arrived there, no one wanted to help us with our bags. When walking to our room, I was already getting bad vibes, doors to room looked ancient & old. When you arrived in the room . . . OH NO! It was very small in there. We had to order a small fridgerator that was supposed to come with the room. They finally came around about a hour later. When we had to go to the bathroom - oh no - it was of European style, about a 3 feel wide shower. It was very difficult to take a nice shower there. There was absolutely nothing nice about the room, it had the basics: beds, tv, phone - that's it, not even a picture frame. Rugs were stained & FREEZING COLD throughout our whole stay. I definately would NOT recommend this place for the price. I have been to much nicer places, for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “My experience not as bad as others”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After buying my nonrefundable vacation package I was horrified to see some of the reviews of the Park Plaza. My experience wasn't terrible at all. Staff seemed polite, the room was on the small side but quite clean. As far as I could tell, it had a standard sized bathtub/shower. The bed was VERY comfortable! Our only disappointment was the obviously worn condition of the carpeting and most of the common areas. Little things, like the glass entry doors had fingerprints all over them, and paint was chipped. This is definitely an older hotel and upkeep is not what it should be, but by no means was this a bad experience. I would stay there again, at the bargain price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “A real value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel (the old Statler) is beautifully located. Our room was clean and well-appointed. A/C worked very well. Bathroom old but clean and good-sized. Service excellent! Several excellent restaurants. The prices are right. We'd certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A terrible disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a two-day stay in Boston. We simply had to comment on how terribly disappointed we were in our choice of hotel - the Boston Park Plaza. Mind you, we booked through Expedia and relied on the photos on the website. We reserved a 'Deluxe' room specifically because we understood that it would have a king-sized bed. Once we got to our room we were shocked to find a dingy, dirty room with a queen-sized bed. The carpets were filthy, the bedspreads stained, the walls marred and scuffed, and the bathrooms antiquated. We went to the desk and complained which resulted in our being moved to a room with a king-sized bed - a SMOKING room. The room reeked of cigarette smoke. The rugs had innumerable cigarette burns and was in the same sorry state. In addition, the liner of the bathtub was peeling up from the tub, the air-conditioning didn't work and did I mention that the halls were filthy? Going back to the front desk we were told that we'd be re-accomodated in a non-smoking room the next day. Resigned to our fate, and tired of moving, we bought a scented candle and tried to make the best of it. However, I felt compelled to make a statement here in the hopes that it would save someone the trouble of booking at this hotel. For the money (approx. $150/night after tax) it was very much not worth it. I stayed at the Best Western at Longwood Medical Center a few months back and the rooms were spacious and immaculate - for $100/night. Save your money - avoid the Park Plaza - shop around. It'll be worth you while.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Rooms Undesirable”
Reviews.Author: StelAngBocaRaton
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Boston Park Plaza. The hotel looks very beautiful from the outside and takes up an entire city block. The lobby is very nice, with old architecture that beautiful. The staff is not very welcoming, we were not greeted even when we checked in. The concierge was great, he was a young man & looked irish(Red hair/Green eyes). He was very helpful and provided us with a map on which he drew out a walking tour of Boston. When you make your way from the lobby to the rooms, you will probably be disappointed. We stayed on the 8th floor. The rooms were old & were in desperate need of a paint job. The bathroom sinks were very old & the bathrooms were not clean. We found long pieces of hair all over. We are not very picky people, but, were really disgusted by it. Our room had already been serviced according to the maid in the hallway. If you are on a budget, then this hotel is fine & has an excellent location. But, just up the street is the Ritz Carlton, were the doormen happily greets you as you pass them on the street. The location of the Boston Park Plaza is perfect, but, the rooms are old and dirty. Definitely bring a pair of slippers to walk around in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Park Plaza”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent the 4th of July, 2003 weekend at the Park Plaza in a package purchased through Hotwire. A lot of the reviews on this web site were not good, but some were good so we went with this site. We were very pleased with the hotel and the service, the location to downtown Boston and the adjacent resturants. We enjoy historical sites and this was a good one. The rooms are small by today standard but they wer very nice and comfortable, We had a queen sized bed and this is probably better than the standard double bed arrangement. A lot of history in this hotel and the recent remodeling seamed to cure all of the problems with contition of walls and floors reported in other reviews. We ejjoyed our stay and the rates were very afforable.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent public areas, shabby rooms, but cheap”
Reviews.Author: mfhstid
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't really be much better, and the public areas are stunning. However, the rooms themselves are pretty shabby. That said, the prices tend to be competitive for a downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dawns206
Reviews.Content: I read some of the other reviews and was very pleasantly surprised by my experience. I booked the hotel through hotwire for $80 a night. The hotel is old and the rooms are small and well used, but very clean. The maid stuff is wonderful and polite and friendly. I spend so little time in the room usually that it doesn't matter that it is small. My daughter and I both stayed in the same room and it was fine. The lobby is really beautiful. I love the old classy hotels. The stuff was very friendly and courteous. We went to the concierge desk several time for help with tours, car rental and directions. The staff there was very informative and friendly every time. They went out of their way with information. The hotel is in a perfect area, with in walking distance of the Common Garden and subway. I would definitely stay there again. And have to say thanks to the hotel for the wonderful vacation. I have 2 small requests; coffee makers in the room and better water pressure.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2001. We arrived in Boston after a flight from the UK on Labour Day weekend and were staying for a week. When we arrrived, having booked and paid for a double room with Virgin Holidays, we were given a single room with a sink that did not hold any water, next to the air conditioning unit and facing a brick wall. This was at 6pm on the Saturday night of Labour Day. They had given all of the double rooms to people staying just for the weekend - it seems that staying for a week meant nothing to them! Went to reception to be told that we would have to stay there until Monday when more rooms became available, even though people were still checking in and getting double rooms! Started off polite, reception staff were unprofessional and totally useless. Took threatening and public humiliation on the Sunday morning to get the room changed - along with 20 other people at reception changing. Food trays stayed outside doors for days, cockroaches in the halls and some rooms apparently! I would not put my worst enemy in this hotel and would certainly wish to discourage anybody else to stay there! I am well travelled and would expect much better service and maintenance from such a hotel, especially in the USA, but have to say that their customer service stinks! Just hope that they read this one day and realise how many holidays they have ruined! Hardly the thing you want to deal with after a trans-atlantic flight!

Reviews.Title: “not horrible, but not that great either...”
Reviews.Author: No_pacifier_required
Reviews.Content: We booked our room on priceline so that's always a big surprise ($75). This hotel is completely decieving..the lobby appears impressive but after you get off the elevator on your floor - its like a third world country. the walls are in need of a good paint job and its just pretty dingy. the rooms have these funky doors. we, like everyone else, had a room mix up. they accidently assigned us the same room as another couple. the room we got was OK, but it was so humid. the a/c didn't really work and they had left the window open to cool things off, and its too noisy in boston to sleep with the window open. the furnishings and bathroom we weren't were decent and tasteful, except for dirty spots on the walls. in the end, we wish we had driven back to burlington to stay at the their very nice marriot - which we paid $40!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: The Boston Park Plaza Hotel & Towers
HotelInfo.Address: 50 Park Plaza at Arlington Street, Boston, MA 02116
